review_body: The location is nearly perfect, right on Waikiki beach and within walking distance of an array of great restaurants. However, the hotel, especially the pool, is extremely overcrowded. Additionally, the breakfast is nearly inedible every morning, likely because they are serving such a large group.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites for 5 nights in July. The great 1 BR suite was perfect for our family of 5, with 2 Queen beds in a bedroom and a pull-out sofa bed in the main area. The room was clean and was stocked daily with ample towels and toiletries. The location is great with a short and easy walk to the beach on one side, and to the commercial strip on the other. There are tons of selection in terms of restaurants withing 5 minutes walk, which is key having to feed 3 teenagers... The hotel's amenities we liked include a pool, valet parking ($40 per day), daily happy hour with free drinks and snacks, coin laundry services and in room dining. The only con was the breakfast. We felt that the selection was limited and if you stay there for more than 3 night you will have to eat the same food over and over again. The lineups are long and tedious and there aren't enough tables, especially for large famalies. Sitting outside in the sun while birds are trying to share your breakfast isn't our first choice. Throughout our stay we found the staff to be helpful and friendly. For large families, Embassy Suites is a great choice - well located, well appointed and provide great value.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We couldn't have asked for a better place to stay for our first time in Honolulu. The service was great from beginning to end. Rooms were comfy and spacious, breakfast was robust and filling, manager's happy hour was a nice bonus. The valet parking was a little steep but worth it if you have a car and don't want to deal with parking. We will definitely be back and highly recommend!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel location is very convenieint for shopping at the malls in Honolulu, visiting the Waikiki beach and also taking long walks along. This is not an oceanfront property but, our room was overlooking the Waikiki beach area very clearly.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Traveling with a family of 5 can be difficult as it is, but finding a Waikiki hotel that comfortably sleeps all 5 is even harder. We are so thankful to have found the Embassy Suites By Hilton Waikiki Beach Walk.The location is great. Though not directly on the beach, the walk is short and easy, even with small kids in tow. It was nice to be able to head out to the Beachwalk from the lobby area.From the minute we arrived, Cindy at Reception welcomed us with a smile and complimentary juice which was a yummy treat in the afternoon heat. She was very helpful and let us know when we could head up to our room. The room was perfect for our family. We had plenty of space to put away our kids' clothing and have the suitcases out of the way. We had 2 Queen beds in a bedroom and a sofa bed in the main area. The small kitchenette area was a bonus, with a large countertop area, small sink, microwave and mini fridge. The view out of our 14th floor windows was beautiful. We looked out over the pool area and could see the ocean in between the Halekulani and Outrigger hotels directly in front. The amenities offered at the Embassy Suites are superb! The morning breakfast had something for everyone. Definitely better than your typical continental breakfast. In addition to fruit, yogurts, breads, and an oatmeal and cereal bar, they offered a lovely green salad and made to order omelettes and eggs. This was our family favorite. The lines tended to be a little long, but worth the wait. Dominic was always so friendly to our family, smiling, joking, even getting our teenager to smile in the morning! And his omelettes were the best. He also made the best over medium eggs that I had during our stay. Thank you Dominic! Another awesome amenity is their evening Happy Hour down by the pool. They always had a fresh veggie option as well as crackers, chips, and occasionally nachos. The bartender happily made our family Virgin Mai Tais and Shirley Temples. This was the best way to wind down after a day of sightseeing, or visiting the beach, the kids would swim, grab a snack and be ready to rest. The pool area was small, but very enjoyable. Our kids loved swimming and would spend hours playing together. If I had to find a con I would say the elevators could be a little tricky at certain times. There were many times we would have to pass up 3 or 4 elevators that were full before we could get into one. We were never in a hurry so this didn't dampen our stay at all. I cannot say enough positive things about our stay at the Embassy Suites. The staff was helpful and friendly at every turn. They even gave our daughter a coloring book that she enjoyed throughout our stay. If you have a large family, or just want a little extra space on your Hawaii vacation, look no further. Thank you Embassy Suites for exceeding our expectations and helping to make our Hawaii vacation relaxing and fun! We cannot wait to come back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Perfect location especailly with small kids. Eat breakfast early for the best service. Hotel staff are all wonderful and super friendly. Compared to other hotels nearby the price is great. We only had time for the evening receiption once and it was ok. Roy's is a must have for dinner!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were on the second floor which had no views much however the room was spacious with three balconies. Staff were very professional and knew their stuff. We loved the breakfasts and the free drinks. It was all very seamless. The rooms were possibly a bit tired but that seems to be Hawaii. The pool was small and full of splashing kids but that is the demographic. We always got a deckchair and a place to sit and eat. A bit further back from the beach but we clocked up our walking miles and great restaurants were very close. To top it all off we got a stretch limo ride to the airport when we left for the price of a cab as our cab was late. Overall a great spot and I would stay there again. It kind of had a bit of cruise feel about it but with the benefits of being in a fantastic holiday destination all of the time. Really good to save money on food, drinks and service charges.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Shoutout to the amazing Sir Otto! I washed my pants and put them out in the balcony to dry. To my dismay, I discovered the next day that it got blown away by the wind. I reported it to the housekeeping department, having small hopes that it was in the lost and found. When it wasn’t there, they sent Sir Otto to inspect the balcony and to look out for potential places where the pants may have landed. After only 15 minutes, Sir Otto miraculously found them in another room’s balcony! Again, thank you!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy suites Waikiki is surrounded by more expensive but less satisfying hotels like Trump Tower and Halekulani. The staff at Embassy suites Waikiki, they are the real gems of the property; the friendly personalize service that they provide, that’s what keeps my family and friends continuously returning to this property. From your starting point at check in with a stand out star like Jaymar; to the breakfast buffet seating area with the incredibly helpful Aldrin and Carrie, you just can’t go wrong at this property - there are so many great people, but not enough time to list them all.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Service in all areas of this hotel was exceptional! The rooms were clean and had lots of space, and service in the buffet and pool side was quick and friendly! The hotel is located in a great area with lots of shops and restaurants in walking distance. The beach is just a few minutes away!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed in a double suite with an oceanview. The room was great, we had a nice lounge area and a large bedroom and bathroom, with a balcony. The ocean-views were not unobstructed like shown in the pictures, but it was still nice. Personally, I wouldn't pay the extra for an ocean view as it is not right on the ocean front, and costs a lot more. The location of this place is GREAT! Right in the centre of Waikiki, and a short walk to the beach. The pool was not the biggest, and was full on splashing children, which we personally didn't mind too much, but good to note if you are not looking for a family place. The buffet breakfast was average and very crowded everyday (however I think this is typical American food - more average for those not used to American food). The staff were all super friendly and helpful here too - the only thing wrong was that we had a room that smelt of smoke slightly which is not very nice if you are a non smoker. Comfortable bedding and couches, and a TV in both the lounge and the bedroom which was nice also. One more thing was that we had a kitchen area but not cutlery - only two glasses to use and disposable cups for coffee (I HATE disposable - so wasteful).

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Conveniently located in the middle of Waikiki , you can walk either way and in less than 10 minutes you’ll reach the touristic point you’ll want to be at: 3 minutes to the beach, 10 minutes to the Atlantis Submarines Waikiki tour, 8 minute to Top of Waikiki restaurant, 10 minute to Duke’s statue, etc.With enough children to fill one double-bed room anywhere, Embassy Suites was our best choice: The suite provided two double beds , a pull-out bed, two TVs , a microwave oven, a small fridge, one bathroom , a view to the city with two balconies, a working desk, and plenty of space for the children to play around... even in the bathtub! .The FREE amenities were the kicker, starting with everyday BREAKFAST (6:30am-10am) with all the nice things kids (and parents) would like, from different types of cereal, Dole pineapple and other fruit , bacon , potatoes , cooked to order omelettes and eggs to pancakes , oatmeal, sweet bread and bagels ... This was made special by the employees, like Michael and Dominic preparing omelettes or Rose distributing kids books with crayons .Ending the day with the Manager’s Hosted Reception (5:30pm-7:30pm) with FREE DRINKS and snacks, from beer to delicious Mai-Tais or Blue Hawaii ... While the children play in a shallow pool (4 ft on the deeper side) Mommy and Daddy get their drinks and chips and talk whatever they want, just watching the kids swimming. AWESOME DESIGN! You could tell so by the parents walking around with their BIG SMILES in the morning and in the afternoon. Worth the rate of $329 per night!  TIPS:- Bathroom got clogged about 3 times, I think it’s because everyone brings sand from the beach . TIP: Wash as much as you can in the public beach. - Wi-Fi is bad. Internet is much slower in Hawai’i as well. TIP: Pre-load what you need in your device or print if needed.- ️ Public Parking around Waikiki is EXPENSIVE. TIP: You’re better off with the Valet service ($40 per day), you’ll notice when you leave your car in the capable hands of Calvin or Abre.- TIP: Refill your water bottles in the only filtered water machine there is, in the Aloha tower, right behind the reception.- TIP: Somehow Tuesday seemed very slow and Friday very busy.- The pool and breakfast area are on the 4th floor and you’ll want to get to them quickly. TIP: Register with Hilton Honors (their loyalty program) and download their App to choose your room as close as possible to the 4th floor and if possible in the Hula Tower (Close access to Big Wave Dave Surf & Coffee, Poké Bar, Ruth Chris and many more stores!)The only issue we had is that the A/C unit ❄️ thermostat didn’t work in one of the rooms but the temperature was SO COMFORTABLE that we didn’t bother to report it.#ruizmedina⭐️

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our 5th stay here at this hotel and it didn't disappoint again. Our room was nothing short of fantastic 2 bedroom 2 bathroom , and the lady that cleans the 20th floor was exceptional and went out of her way everyday. The breakfast was also enjoyable and the afternoon cocktail drinks were the the best mixed with the live band. A big plus was the fact that we arrived at 7am and were able to check in to our room right away. Once again Mahalo

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We will be leaving in a few days and after having been here a month, I just wanted to say how much I appreciate Daniel in housekeeping. I always know when he's cleaned my room because he always puts just a little extra care in his work to make us feel comfortable during our stay. He always greets us with a smile and has his offered a few tips about getting around town. Truly deserves the recognition. Thank you all for making this stay a pleasure. We will miss our home away from home :)

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a great time staying at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki Beach. The hotel was very nice and clean. The rooms were large and suited us a family of 6. The complimentary breakfast was so nice to have along with the evening complimentary reception. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel has everything. Check in was quick and easy. Our room was well-equipped, clean and beautifully furnished. Although we had a city view, we could see the ocean and mountains from our balcony. The breakfast is delicious and has a varied menu- something for everyone. The pool is a bit small but the area is pretty. The snack and drink service between 5:30 and 7:30 is a real treat. Every staff member we have encountered has been helpful and friendly. It may be a bit expensive but it was worth every penny!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location and very friendly staff. The air-conditioning didn't work for half the day but the front-desk manager made it right by waiving our late check-out fee for the inconvenience. We were treated so great by everyone we encountered. This was our second time at this property and I would stay again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This worked on many levels. The complimentary breakfast was great. The kids loved the options and I loved not having to pay for that meal.The pool was a little small with no deep end but was great for my little one. It was definitely family friendly. The adults and kids loved the entertainment and snacks at the manager's reception and the adults thought the cocktails were fantastic! Great location. Everything is in walking distance. We also had a car to explore the island and that we did a lot of! We had a 2 bed/2 bath suite with sofabed and that was plenty of space for my family of five. It isn't the newest furniture but awesome nonetheless. I don't have a complaint. I was surprised by how much my family loved this hotel. It was a fantastic experience.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great experience for my family. Great location, good breakfast, close to most things, Ross from the concierge desk was extremely helpful with recommendations and booking our activities. Ross even booked our Jeep rental and activities for our excursion to Maui. Staff was very friendly. Great experience and would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband, 3 children, and I stayed at the Embassy Suites for eight nights from June 2 - 10, 2019. We really enjoyed the breakfasts, the pool area and the band during the evening reception. The one bedroom suite on the 16th floor was nice but seemed a little smaller than Embassy Suites on the mainland. Although we had a street view room, the rooms were very quiet except for during the drum performances during a festival in the plaza and the fireworks. We were not able to hear any of our neighbors or the elevator which we were near. The hotel was close to many restaurants, shopping and the beach. It was also nice that you had to use your room key to use the elevator so they were a bit quicker.The breakfasts were good and they had a good variety of foods such as made to order omelettes, pancakes, breakfast meats, fruit, oatmeal, cold cereal, rice, miso soup with fixings, and pastries. There was also a variety of juices, flavored 0 calorie water, coffees and teas. Although the breakfast was good, it did get a little boring by about the sixth day and I was disappointed waffles were not offered. They did offer french toast one day which was good and biscuits and gravy on another day that I don't eat. I hadn't been to Oahu since the 1980's so a lot has changed. One thing I don't remember is the tropical island feel because of the open air dining area near the pool. I didn't even get that feel when I went to Maui a few years ago. We will stay there again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our suite was fairly full of oversized furniture, especially the cabinet in the lounge which meant that you couldn't use table easily. The unit was tidy but a bit drab. We purchased the room because it advertised a King Bed but when we measured it, it was only 150cms wide (so only a queen).The air conditioning worked well and there was a nice shower. We could hear the lift during the night so if you are a light sleeper then don't order a one-bedroom with city views (as these are next to the lift).Very basic complimentary breakfast which was a bit like a foodcourt quality. There is also a nice pool area but very little free sun umbrellas. If you want to be in the center of everything, then this is a great place to stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel has a fabulous location. The pool is the best and largest in Waikiki. It's great for kids because it's only 4 feet deep. The breakfast buffet is also a plus. There are many restaurants and shopping in walking distance.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Third year in a row staying at Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walkand yet again, nothing short of amazing! The entire staff is always so welcoming and provide us the utmost professional care. I have and will continue to refer my friends and family to stay here because I can assure they will not be disappointed.
user_name:
Susan C
san diego, United States

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: From check-in to check-out, we had a great experience. The hotel is walking distance to several restaurants and the beach. The breakfast is plentiful and the happy hour is a great perk. Don't expect much for the happy hour snacks, but the drinks make up for it. We enjoyed the band they had there on select nights and relaxed while the kids played in the pool. We were a group of 10 and always had room to sit with each other or near each other. The rooms were nice, comfortable, and spacious. My only complaint is that I asked to stay longer at the same rate and wasn't granted that request... So checked into another hotel nearby for half the price. The elevators get very busy during breakfast and happy hour time so plan accordingly.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Very nice rooms, free drinks during happy hour next to the pool was great. They had a live band that played on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday, that was also great. Valley was quick to get your car when you needed it and the location of the hotel is good.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stay at Embassy Suites a few times a year from work and this property was similar to others. Not much of a lobby space but they make up for it with their pool deck. Good location. Rooms are spacious and our corner room had a big wrap around lanai.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: What a great hotel! In the heart of Waikiki, tucked away near restaurants, and a short walk to the beach. Lovely pool and bar with free drinks and snacks. Fabulous staff and lovely rooms. Really good!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Broken ice machineBroken ACBroken tv’sBroken elevatorsFront desk staff said no one reported the broken ice machine, but there was a hotel sign and I told the check out girl of the ice machine and all the other broken things in hope your staff will fix everything. For the dollar amount I paid all the broken items should not be happening.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Super.clean. great staff. Great breakfast and evening reception. We will only stay at this hotel in the future. Really loved the welcome.drink. such a surprise. Valet was always fast and easy in and out.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This place is just perfect. When you check in you are given drinks which are perfect after a long flight, and the warm tropical weather of Hawaii. When we got there we were given a room 2 floors above the other half of our group, but after a call to the reception we were given a room next to our family members after the first night of our stay. The rooms were clean, a good size, and well decorated. The cribs we were given were clean... but I can't say if they were comfortable because I wasn't the one sleeping on them, but the babies in our group had a good nights' sleep on them. All views are amazing, and this hotel is quiet on both towers. The breakfast buffet was delicious and since it is on the same floor as the pool, it's perfect for the adults to sun bathe while watching the children swimming in the pool after a delicious breakfast. The pool was a good size as well as the hot tub. Both were very clean during our stay, we swam at the pool everyday of our stay. This hotel's central location is convenient because it is walking distance to the famous Waikiki beach, ABC stores, The Honolulu Cookie Company, and is near plenty of other fun family-friendly attractions. The valet parking service was convenient since we had young children traveling with us and they were very quick at retrieving our rental. Our first stay in Hawaii was perfect and we will definitely stay here again when we are back in Oahu.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The location of this hotel is fantastic, very close to main strip and key attractions in Waikiki and a short stroll to some of the beaches. The rooms were generally good, although it was annoying that air conditioning could not run when doors were open. This was challenging on the hot days when we wanted fresh air but needed the AC to cool us down. Service was good, although we didn’t realize that housekeeping and room service charges beyond base fee are charged progressively, not at the end. I hadn’t prepared my account so we were locked out of our room (with two babies) until we paid- although we didn’t realize what was going on! Very bad practice. Pool was great. Breakfast good. The happy hour drinks are pretty basic and food is very very average- I would recommend any of the lunch or dinner menu. Pool is good. Overall, a good family spot due to location, proximity to key attractions. WiFi is very slow and on-again-off-again so don’t rely on this!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We enjoy everything at the embassy suites hotel in Waikiki. The rooms were so comfortable and very clean. The valet parking service made it so convenient for us to get in and out. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The best part was taking a nice swim at the pool on that hot sunny weekend, so refreshing. We would definitely be returning. Much Mahalo to the Embassy Suites Ohana.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Everyone we came in contact with were all so nice!! in the halls, in the restroom, while eating breakfast. The housekeeper was especially kind. They were very genuine in their questions. I could feel the Aloha spirit from them.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This location is PERFECT!! 5 minute walk to the beach and right on the Waikiki Walk shops and restaurants. We loved our Suite bc it was large, pretty and very clean with very comfortable beds. The included Breakfast was AMAZING!! With all kinds of hot and cold foods- including an omelette station and gluten free breads. The Happy Hour was fun with a live band and very good drinks and snacks. The staff was amazing as well and were always volunteering to be helpful to guests - in the Breakfast and in the hallways. Most unbelievable to us - was the room steward who cleans the suites-Laura Li - found my earrings and jacket that I forgot in the room and turned them in so they could be mailed back to me! I have never had this level of Customer Service. Thank you staff, Laura and Carol Lopes at Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here for several reasons. Close to the beach, price, walking distance to shops and restaurants. The suite had a separate sitting area with kitchenette, tons of storage, separate a/c thermostat in each room. Staff was great. Happy hour every day with free drinks and food. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel was recommended by friends and we were not disappointed. Room was a great size for a family of 5, breakfast provided plenty of variety and the complimentary managers reception was a great way to relax at the end of the day. Staff were friendly and helpful. The location is perfect. I recommend this hotel to all families looking for value and comfort. My family have already planned our next stay here.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel was perfectly located only minutes from the beach. Our room was large, clean and comfortable. The large breakfast buffet was always good with my personal highlights; made to order omelets, alternating pancakes and French toast and endless bacon. The pool and eating area services were always second to none. Justyn Wee made our stay memorable. He was very professional, friendly and helpful. We looked forward to our time at the breakfast buffet, poolside and the evening happy hour. The evening happy hour entertainment was exceptional and a must see. Kanilau, a Hawaiian family band, provided an excellent mix of local, classic and modern hit music.All an all an awesome vacation experience and we look forward to returning in the near future.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Both balconies we're closed due to cement construction during our stay. They put us on a smaller room after a couple of days. Didn't have fun shutting the black out curtains for privacy from two construction workers during the day in Hawaii. Being a gold member didn't help get a good room. 5 star hotel, 1 star experience.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This place has a very special place in our hearts. It's the place of a very significant moment in our lives, marriage, and ministry (work). In addition to this, the layout is wonderful; it's very much pro-family and community. Ample space for the family to gather together and connect. Plus the location is perfect: Close to Ala Moana SC, favorite surf spots, shops, and eateries. The rooms are well designed that honors the host culture with great amenities. the breakfast is dynamite.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Disappointed in the comfort of the beds. Husband even tried sleeping on the floor because the bed was causing so much back pain. If they are charging $300-400 /night, we would like comfortable beds to sleep on.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We always stay at Embassy Suites when we can. This hotel was in a perfect place on Waikiki. Very easy to get around. The free breakfast was very good also. We would stay here again if we go back to Oahu.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family and I had an amazing stay at Embassy Suites and everybody there was so friendly and helpful. Especially Justyn and Cary. They made the trip so much better by providing us with what we needed.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here for 2 nights and it was fantastic! We had an oceanview suite and it was perfect. Very spacious room with 2 nice balconies. It is not that far from the airport but with traffic, it probably takes 20-25 minutes depending on the time of day. As with all Embassy suites, it has a fantastic breakfast which is served outside and makes it taste even better! The happy hour was the best I have been to. On one night, they had a band playing which was very nice. There is a wide variety of tropical drinks. They have 7 a.m. yoga by the pool which was awesome. This hotel is close to many shops and restaurants. The only complaint, if I had to find something, is that they only have valet parking and it is $40 but I think this is pretty typical for the area. Would most definitely stay here when I am in the area again,

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Love this hotel and location. Breakfast is the best we’ve ever had at any Embassy Suites. I’d have to say the only complaint is the guests that are rude. Please don’t cut in line. Please don’t leave your wet, used towels on chairs (turn them in to towel bin) and throw away your garbage! The staff is top notch and not your mother. You get free breakfast and cocktails, best deal in Hawaii. Just my 2 cents. Enjoy your stay!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family of 5 stayed in an ocean view suite for 6 nights. The room was comfortable and spacious with stunning views of the ocean and surrounds. We had arranged an early check in which was easy and hassle free (which was great after a long trip from Australia with a 3 year old). Everything we needed was at our doorstep. There was a great selection at breakfast, and the managers reception was a lovely touch of an afternoon around the Grand Lanai. The facilities were very clean and comfortable with free WiFi a hit with the kids. Overall a lovely and relaxing holiday at Embassy Suites and I’m sure we will be back soon!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites on our first leg of Hawaii trip, spending the weekend in Honolulu. This hotel is very convenient location, central to everything on the main strip. The room was perfect for our family and the breakfast and nightly cocktails included were a definite plus. If you can get a deal on the nightly rate and staying for a short stay you really can’t beat the entire package. The only negative I could find was the lengthy wait for elevators, but again you’re on Hawaiian time, so no big deal for us. If you’re staying longer and want to be right on the beach you may want to opt for a different location. For us it was perfect.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: WE stayed here for a week in october 2018. It was a family trip that consisted of 13 people. My family of 6 was initially checked into a 2 double bed suite room 1408 in the Aloha Tower. It had a nice view of pool and you could see ocean from balcony. The air went out so they moved us to room 1623 in the Hula Tower. We were the first to stay in the newly renovated room. It was a 2 bedroom suite with one king bed and 2 double beds as well as the sofa sleeper. Plenty of room for me, wife, and my 4 boys. It also had a nice view. (will upload pics later). The breakfast buffet was very satisfying each morning and the food service supervisor by the name of Cary heard that i didnt eat pork and made sure i had a plate of chicken sausage to my table every morning. Kudos to Cary. Cary was also very helpful in giving us tips to plan our day. This location was a short walk to two beaches and several eateries and shops were right at the hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Outstanding location and exceptional value. The breakfast alone makes this very affordable lodging, and the manager’s reception is always a good time. Location is perfect for Waikiki and very convenient for the beaches and golf. Dining and entertainment venues in the area are limitless and diverse enough to satisfy any desire. Embassy Suites is always my recommendation for lodging in Waikiki!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Love staying at Embassy Suites hotels for their fantastic size of rooms, breakfast and managers reception. The location of this hotel is fantastic as it’s close to dining options, shopping and most importantly the beach. Staff are always friendly and accommodating.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We Really had a Great Stay at the Embassy Suites, Wakiki Beach Walk, HI Right in the Middle of What's Going on in Wakiki !Shops, Resturants and a Short Walk to the Beach. Kid's had a Blast, Music at Night was "Over the Top" !!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Arrived early no problem early checkin not available. Waited in lobby wasn’t provided with any updates. Regular checkin is a 3pm and my room wasn’t available until almost 4pm. Staff didn’t care they offer me at 3:30 we offer you another room. So now it’s my fault I waited until 4pm. Valet/Bell desk is good although not allow to “call down for call”. Next morning went to make coffee and previous guest used coffee pods were still present in machine! Wondering now about sheets & towels if they are cleaned.Lanai was dirty especially the chairs gross! Always had to ask for towels, coffee,...suite had 3 beds/2 bathrooms. NO would not recommend. Elevators are a problems three for 20 floors so always waiting then when it arrives another issue getting to lobby, A/C worked great.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have just returned from a 10 night stay. We were a family of 8. All the staff were amazing. Nothing was a problem. The staff went over and beyond to make our stay excellent. We were upgraded to the 18th floor after a minor issue. The view was spectacular. The breakfast, snacks and cocktails provided were up to satisfaction. Our children made many friends and now have great memories. The hotel was clean and safe. Will definitely return to this hotel. Thank you.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Concierge was very helpful in arranging for surfing, snorkeling, parasailing and island touring. We were very pleased with all the companies she chose for us. The concierges also made great recommendations for restaurants.The food on the breakfast buffet was very good. It would have been nice if there had been a wider selection of fruits each day.Our housekeeper was excellent - very friendly and kept our rooms in great shape!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I thought I had found one of the best hotels in Waikiki based on the reviews I found on TripAdvisor and other review sites. The price was well over $300 per night, but I decided it would be worth it. IT WAS NOT!The reception area is big, but not really welcoming. The front desk, while they offer a welcome fruit juice, don’t help you get a good layout of what the hotel has and where those things are. The room was clean, but absolutely a standard basic room that you can find at the cheapest motels.I did have a view of the pool and the ocean, which was nice. However it also looks out to the adjacent hotel and their rooms and balconies.Do not be lured by the free breakfast and free happy hour unless you are with young children and/ or on a serious budget. First these both take place in an area next to the pool. It’s feels like a cafeteria from elementary school, not only because of the trays and the lines, but the amount of screaming children. It was incredibly loud and the opposite of the intent of my relaxing vacation. There is a omelet station, but it took forever and there was no flavor to any of it. The rest is just industrial food from a convenience store. Oh and don’t forget all of the birds that are looking to eat off the floor and your table!The happy hour is free and includes well drinks that I think they are watering down with below well alcohol. My drink was both very strong and terrible. The booze was disgusting. If you just want t get drunk, this is the place. If you want a good drink, go elsewhere.The pool is small and overrun with screaming children.The gym is very small with a handful of treadmill items, a pulley weight set, a few benches, a few dumbbells, a couple of medicine balls and a couple of mats. There is no view. I would not recommend this hotel at all. It’s far to expensive for a basic hotel. If you have kids and you all can handle the noise, the birds, the bad food and bad drinks in order to save you from finding food elsewhere...maybe.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We cruised to Honolulu and stayed at Embassy Suites for 4 days. Embassy was recommended by a friend and we loved every minute of it!! The staff were lovely, very clean rooms and we were upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite, 10 floors up. We were so happy!! The beds are extremely comfy, awesome view, great location and the pool was fantastic. So pretty at night. We loved happy hour which includes free drinks and light snacks, the live entertainment was unreal... The breakfast which was included was really good.... No resort fees either. Parking was $40 per day via vallet service and they were very prompt with fetching the car. We will definetly be back in the near future!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The location, staff and facilities were great! The staff, especially Cindy and Jaymar went above and beyond the call of duty to provide outstanding customer service. Thanks to excellent standards throughout the hotel we had a wonderful stay at Embassy Suites, Waikiki, Beach Walk R. Hill

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites for 8 nights at the beginning of May and we really enjoyed our stay. The location was perfect for us, away from the main crowds but close enough to be able to walk to anything we wanted to do. The beach was also a lot quieter and easy to walk to in a few minutes and the pool was great to spend an hour or two in the afternoon following a morning at the beach. We enjoyed the morning breakfast and nightly reception and also the activities in the lawn of an afternoon / evening which was great for our 3 year old daughter to get involved in when she wanted a break from swimming. I also wanted to make a special mention of one of your cleaning ladies (I think her name was Shayla (she was cleaning level 9)?). She was always so friendly and helpful and went out of her way every time to chat to our 3 year old daughter. It was always lovely to bump into her in the lift or in the hallway as she always made us smile.We would definitely stay here again and recommend to families thinking of staying here.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Was happy to see that there was an Embassy Suites now available. You are never disappointed with an ES property and this was no exception. Great service, beach was less than a block away, many excellent restaurants.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have just stayed here for 7 nights with a group of 5 other girls.The Embassy Suites is in a perfect position. The breakfast was fantastic and the managers reception was the best ever. The apartment was the best one I have stayed at in Hawaii.Thank you for making this trip very memorable will definitely stay with you again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Very good location for our family of four. The combination of inclusive breakfast to start your day and the Manager's Reception to unwind from your day was really excellent - this will see me return for sure.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My wife and I stayed in an ocean view suite for several days prior to a cruise. We found th hotel to be clean, convenient, and comfortable. Check in and out ran smoothly They went out of their way to accommodate. The breakfast was varied and fresh. Sorry no Spam. The pool area was crowded since the property appeals to families. The manager's reception was good but they could use an extra bartender. We have seen better snacks at their ES. It is near to everything you want to see on Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel itself is centrally located and very nice. Staff are very helpful. Appreciate the security measures. Complimentary breakfast and evening manager reception are the BEST! Wait until the construction is complete.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Just finished a stay at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki. While there were a lot of positives like the breakfast and evening reception. Also no resort fee is a huge plus. There were a couple things that they could improve on.We have been to Maui many times and this vacation decided to stay in Oahu. This hotel was great for our time there. The pool is nice not to big but decent for our pool days. It would be nice if there were more seats with umbrellas to get some shade.The room was nice we had a separate seating area. We stayed in room 532 and it had a great view of the pool and the Friday night fireworks. The a/c in the sitting area was really good and kept the room cool. The one in the bedroom stopped working so maintenance came up and fixed it.Check in was good. It was nice they brought out juice for us. And we got there early so they were very kind to find us a room. but we feel like they could pump some Hawaiian fragrance into their lobby and hallways because of the area you can smell food all the time. We really enjoyed the beach walk area. It was so convenient to go out for food and shopping. The ABC store at the back of the hotel is one of the biggest we have ever seen. If Embassy Suites just improves on these small areas we will be back for sure.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here at the end of our Hawaii trip after staying on the North Shore for a week. The hotel is in a great spot, close to the beach and close to the shops and restaurants. Having breakfast and cocktails inclusive was an added bonus and we made the most of this. The room we stayed in was a king room right next to the lift and this was problematic as it was noisy through the night. I tried to change rooms but busy time of year and none available. Apparently the room type we booked (king size with one bed) are all next to the lift so I would avoid booking this type in future. The room was well equipped if a little dated. The hotel looks like it is going through a refurbishment at the moment.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I had a wonderful stay here.I would highly recommend staying here! Its a little hard to find from the airport since it is on a one way street and towards the back of downtown Waikiki. The lobby is outside which odd but beautifully decorated and always clean and all of the staff I encountered were super friendly. The rooms were very nice with two queen size beds nice big bathroom with plenty of towels and soaps and plenty of storage for hanging clothes and drawers for folded clothes! My view from my balcony was gorgeous no matter what time of day. I really did enjoy the hotel being in downtown Waikiki. Plenty of stores and restaurants to walk to even a poke bar and nail salon! Even just a quick walk to Waikiki beach and the US Army Museum! If I ever come back I would definitely stay here again

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hotel was great, roomy apartment, comfy bed. Staff were helpful and friendly. Bonus was buffet breaky and 2 hour happy hour with nibbles all free! Location to beach, shops and restaurants great. Monday to Thursday cheaper than Friday to Sunday’s.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This property is tired and is not the standard of a Hilton. The room was small and cramped. To be fair we looked around and a lot of accommodation venues are tired and overly expensive. There must be a high demand as the number of Japanese is huge.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have been there 2 time previously and each time we had the best time ever. The staff were the best and the staff doing the breakfast were awesome always asking us if we need anything or just asking how we are doing. If we had any question they would answer them or fine out for us. Embassy suite class act and that's why we are going back in May and October of 2019. Thank you

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Filthy! Carpet stains, dirty light fixtures, sticky stains on walls, dirty fridge, some kind of cruise number stickers on the furniture, tv in bedroom lost channel signals constantly air conditioning couldn’t keep the room at 72 degrees. We had to go to the local store to buy clean wipes and clean walls and fixtures on our own. This place is NOT up to what we believe to be Hilton/Embassy Suites standards. We both also got food poisoning from the awful filthy breakfast Buffet. The “bacon” was sitting in a metal serving tray with at least 1/4” of bacon grease. The birds inside the food area would peck at our food if we would look away from the table. A huge loud party in the room next to us one night. I banged on their door at 4am and then silence. Saw their room the next day after they vacated. Trashed. I’m sure ES sold that room the next night. We were in room 408.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Booked 7 nights for a family of 4 in a premium corner suite, mid April 2019.The Good Points ...1.This hotel is situated just one row back from the beautiful beachfront and within very easy walking distance of a huge choice of restaurants, fast food places and shops.2.Check in was quick and easy and we were given a complimentary refreshing drink on arrival.3.The hotel rooms and communal areas are exceptionally clean and to a very high standard and the rooms and bathroom are well appointed with good toiletries provided.4.The pool area is clean and well maintained although there can be a bit of a shortage of sunbeds at busier times as some of the deck area is taken up by rental cabanas which are hardly ever used.5.The Managers Reception, which takes place on the pool deck on the 4th floor every evening from 5pm-730pm is a real treat with free flowing alcoholic and non alcoholic drinks and a limited range of tasty snacks. On several nights of the week there is also a fabulous band with a chap who I am quite sure could be the best ukulele player in the world! The crowd stood up and cheered each time he played!6.There is a huge choice at the complimentary breakfast with something to satisfy even the fussiest members of the family. The omelettes are cooked to order and are really delicious. Breakfast can be busy though and I could see that at peak times some families struggled to find an empty table.7.Every single member of staff we encountered was polite, helpful, welcoming and smiling!The Bad Points...1. Do not bother with a corner suite. We paid extra for one but soon discovered by looking at the hotel floor plan on the back of the room door that three out of the four corner suites on the floor are smaller than normal suites as they have a big chunk taken out of the room to accommodate the hotel fire escape. Am pretty sure that this would be the case on all floors. As a result, our family of 4 felt a little squashed, as once the sofa was made into a bed for the children there was very little space left. We had to ask for some of the other furniture in the room (coffee tables and chairs) to be removed and even then it was impossible to walk all the way around the sofa bed. This was such a shame and did spoil our enjoyment of the room. It was however, very nice to have different views from different balconies but definitely not worth the extra cost.2. The kitchen in the suite was really useless. There was no cutlery or plates provided, just a corkscrew. The fridge was good for cooling drinks but we never used the microwave and there was not enough worktop space to even prepare a sandwich. We had planned to prepare food and eat in the room some nights but this was impossible.3. We made the mistake of booking the 'premium' option which I had assumed was for a larger or better suite but it turned out was just for a daily supply of fizzy drinks and snacks. I paid well over the odds for this and really regret it.4. Most nights we slept well but on a couple of the nights we could hear traffic noise from the street below, even though we were on the 17th floor. It must have been much worse for guests staying on lower floors.5. There is quite alot of building work going on in the area and this is noisy. it didn't keep us awake but we could hear it from the pool deck and if we chose to sit on the balcony during the day.All in all, we had a good stay, enjoyed our time at the Embassy Suites and would choose to return but we would not rebook a corner suite or the premium option again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: 3rd stay at the Embassy Suites and apart from some confusion at check in as to what room was booked the stay was as always special.The check in issue was sorted out after one night which many thanks to the ladies at the front desk and the Hotel management.Again many thanks.From Aldrin to Rose and the other staff who again helped throughout the stay to make this memorable many, many thanks.Must be a pretty good place to work and staff are taken care of if you still have many familiar faces making us welcome from our first stay some 6 years ago.(Same chefs serving those great breakfast omelettes, Rose and Aldrin helping out with coffees, the barmen serving those free happy hour drinks and the same band providing good tunes.)Again thanks all we will be back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We recently celebrated my moms birthday in Hawaii at Embasdy Suites. The concierge Ross A. was terrific. He really worked to ensure we were set up to have the right experience. Whenever I e-nailed him with a question he got back to me quickly- even when he wasn’t working he let me know he would address my question/ issue as soon as he returned. When we arrived he though fully arranged our pre purchased excursions with a msp to pick up/ drop off etc. He really was great! I also have to say thank you to Dean at the bell desk. He continued to check on us whenever he saw us to make sure we were enjoying our stay and answer any questions we had.This was ou first trip to Oahu - but we will definitely be back and look forward to staying at the Embassy Suites! You have a great team!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Really pleased we chose this hotel for the location close to the beach and lovely shopping areas around. The room was really spacious. Breakfast buffet was excellent and we enjoyed the cocktails and snacks at the manager’s evening reception. Lovely atmosphere with live music. Good local band.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family and I enjoyed the Embassy Suites. There were welcome “drinks” at check-in. Our room 2128 had a great view of landscape and the ocean. Every staff member, even the chef making omelets, is happy to serve you. We had a late flight and even though we were checked out, Embassy Suites still accommodated us. Breakfast is great; the pool is fun with something for everyone; don’t miss the evening reception! You won’t be disappointed.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed 8 nights at the Embassy: couldn’t be happier with the stay. Rooms were clean and well appointed. Buffet breakfast was awesome with plenty of choice and variation between days. The 2 hour happy hour was fantastic, again plenty of variety and staff also had fun (special mention to bar tender Keo). The hotel is right in the heart of Waikiki, small walk to everything and plenty of restaurants nearby. Great choice for families. Can’t wait to get back there!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites near Waikiki Beach in March 2019 as a family of four for two nights. Staff was friendly and valet parking, while expensive, was very fast. The suite was very spacious and clean. More than enough room for two adults and two teenagers. The highlight was definitely the great view of the beach and ocean from the double balcony that spanned both the living area and the bedroom. The only challenge we had was finding the valet parking entrance - GPS took us to the other side and we had to circle back. Make sure you use the correct address if you rely on e-maps of any kind to get you there.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay here for the most part!Very centrally located, with an amazing lobby. They allowed us to check in early which was much appreciated as we had come off a long flight.Free breakfast and Managers reception was great and we ended up being by the pool most nights which the kids loved!The staff at the pool and room service were AMAZING! Made our trip.If I had some improvements is that the rooms could be better equiped with some utensils and plates etc.The front of house/concierge staff are completley different - rude and unhelpful. They make you feel like you were being an inconvenience to them on numerous occasions so that needs improvement.But overall a great stay!
user_name:
Alaina P
Nelson-Tasman Region, New Zealand

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Almost centrally located in Waikiki . Very close to beach and shops. The great things about this place are the complimentary breakfast and evening reception. They even had live music. Only small complaint is the cost of the room and parking but almost understandable because of what you receive.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed for 4 nights. The location is great, short walk to the beach. Everything is close by. The Managers reception is great with live entertainment on some nights. Lots of fun. I would stay here again for sure.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel was nice, clean rooms, good evening reception, awesome breakfast. Location is not bad, close to walking distance to shops and restaurants and one block away from the beach area. Quiet rooms, and staff is very friendly.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family of five stayed comfortably in a two queen/one bedroom suite. All parts of the hotel were clean, the staff was friendly and efficient, and the location was an easy walk to all parts of the Waikiki area. The free breakfast and evening reception are nice extras.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is our second stay at embassy suites Waikiki and it does not disappoint. We have previously stayed at Hyatt, Hilton, and Sheraton waikiki but embassy suites remains our favorite hands down. At the front desk you are greeted with a guava juice, and check in is flawless (we love the hula tower). rooms are al spacious suites. Breakfast is always has a great variety of option and a made to order omelette station. Service is hands down the best on the island, notably CARY at breakfast is so great! He stopped to ask us what we were here for and even remembered us a few days later and gifted our bride and groom with such a thoughtful gift!!! Also, every night there is a happy hour out by the pool and there is live music, snack and drinks. Concierge and bellmen are always so great. I honestly can not recommend this place more.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel was in the perfect location. Step out to shopping & restaurants. The beach was a very short walk (though when I went, the beach frontage was very small). The pool was wonderful & warm. The nightly free drinks & nibbles delicious & a great bonus. The free breakfast was also a great treat, with lots of choices. The rooms were spacious & comfortable. Would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We’ve just spent a week here with 3 other families. We all agreed that we had definitely made the right choice for our accommodation.The rooms are suites so you have space outside of a bedroom. This is a must if travelling with children - IMOThe location is good, just a quick stroll to the beach or downtown to Dukes or the International Shopping.The reason I dropped a star was I think it is time to update the rooms. They are just a bit tired, the furniture not matching, needs a repaint. That sort of thing. It certainly wouldn’t stop me staying there again, but I feel it needs to be mentioned.As a last note - 3 major advantages of staying here are:1. Breakfast included in your price. This includes custom made omelette. 2. NO resort fee!! When I heard some other places are charging $45 a night as the resort fee I nearly fell over!!3. Evening Reception of Cocktails and Beer and small nibbles. This saved us hundreds of $$$ as we all met there every night to plan our dinner, talk about our day etc over FREE drinks!! Awesome job guys!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel was a very pleasant surprise and a welcome place to stay after a long travel day. Very spacious land accommodating and a lot of room for this part of Honolulu. The breakfast provided was nicely executed as well. Great property.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Spent 8 nights at this hotel in April. Overall very nice. Quality of the food and drinks were very good. Very helpful service staff, polite and friendly. Pool was crowded with children most of the time, so did not really enjoy swimming to much, same for the hot tub, but i guess that is to be expected staying in a family friendly hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We reserved a 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom unit which was perfect for our group of six because we could all stay in one unit and be together, and because the cost to share was reasonable too. As a result though, the good and bad is that this hotel caters particularly to groups of friends and to families with small children. I enjoyed the pool area that had enough lounge-chairs for everybody. The all-inclusive breakfast and happy-hour drinks were good additions to start and end the day, respectively, not requiring us to go out. However, the breakfast food and happy-hour drinks were practically the same every day. That aside, as one of six travelers, I was pleased to eat breakfast inside the hotel and have drinks right next to the pool area in the late afternoon. The only downside to the happy hour was the music that was TOO loud, so loud that we had difficulty talking together at our table. I suggest the music be turned town to make the happy hour more enjoyable. We sat the furthest away from the band but the music still overpowered our conversations. I highly recommend the Embassy Suites to travelers in groups of 4, 5 or 6 who want to share one room and be together. On the other hand, because of the style of this hotel, i.e., catering to families and groups of friends and offering the same breakfast and happy hour fare, I won't stay at the Embassy Suites when I am traveling as a couple of just two travelers.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The location is great for dining, but the beach near by is not very good. too much dead coral on the beach. Stick to the hotel pool. Over priced with very dated rooms. The accounts department never paid the agents commission either . I emailed and called and even stopped at the hotel and got the run around. By very wary if you are an agent you may also get ripped off. I now book and sell other hotels and recommend for the extra go to the Hyatt Regency opposite the beach. Very large rooms. My stay was a few years ago. Still leaves me bitter when it comes to this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent all around! When researching places to stay on our trip I was taking into consideration customer reviews for each place. After my 9 day stay at the Embassy Suites I can confidently say this place rocks and they definitely don't get enough credit online. Will be recommending to others!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My wife and I visited the city and stayed in this lovely hotel for a week.The one bedroom suite was great, the staff helpful.The laundry facilities for guests is very good.The inclusive breakfast and afternoon gatherings with nibbles and free drinks is a bonus!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family experience at Embassy Suites Waikiki Beachwalk was perfect. The complimentary breakfast and evening reception are such a bonus and every staff member we encountered was so friendly and helpful. Beds were comfortable, location is very close to the beach and a very lively area with the Beachwalk shops and restaurants. We were upgraded to a larger room upon our arrival which was very helpful with 2 teenage boys. The hotel was very nice to do this since I had called in a few days earlier to see if this was possible but did not really expect it to happen. Would stay here again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is in the heart of Waikiki Beach. Great staff. Valet parking is only option but there is NO free parking in Waikiki. The valet staff is very friendly and helpful. The Embassy has a great free breakfast for its HH members and a managers reception each night. Beach is directly across the street with close and easy access. Beach has a boardwalk too. Lots of shopping and restaurants adjacent to the hotel. Very nice hotel and location.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel and site is great for a family vacation in the Waikiki area. Easy walk to beach, shopping, entertainment and restaurants. Should we come back to the island, we would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a room with 2 bedroom/2 bath, a kitchenette and a common area...amazing...!! Free happy hour, in the pool area, every evening from 5:30-7:30p...including alcohol and snacks.... also a free breakfast 7-10a(?) with incredible choices... their omelets were 'out of this world'..!!! They also have a regular menu...with more yummy options... for room service and/or you can eat by the pool..or in the resturant....The beach is a block away... but an easy walk and easy access... They have a guest laundry...double check the washers before you use... some were filled with sand... [wonder where that came from..???] The washers and dryers take coins or credit cards. They also have a 24 hour fitness...with a great variety of extremely modern machines...!! Ground level hallways will take you straight out to local stores and other restaurants... Waikiki Beach set off fireworks every Friday... it was fun to watch from our balcony...

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Second time for a stay. Friendly staff. Nice pool area. The laundry room has ability to pay with credit cards. Breakfast is very nice with many options. Breakfast is very, very crowded so don’t be in a rush. Iron was broken but called down and quickly a replacement was brought up. Didn’t get much upgrade for gold status HH level. Managers special is also a nice way to end the day with complementary drinks and snacks. I like the hotel but it’s very popular and sometimes very crowded. Location is perfect for easy beach access.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family of 6 loved our stay here during our Spring Break. The hotel location is perfect, the breakfast-best I’ve had at a hotel, and the evening drinks/snacks/music was icing on the cake. The hotel staff was so helpful and friendly. The valet greeted us with a smile and asked us everyday what our plans for the day were. I would definitely stay here again. Thank you Embassy Suites! We were very impressed and had an amazing vacation! Thank you for sharing the spirit of Aloha with our family. Mahalo from Utah

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have stayed here twice now and would definitely stay again if we ever stay in Waikiki. With a family of 5 we like the extra space the rooms here provided. Also going out to eat in the area is spendy, so the huge breakfast spread they have definitely helps save some coin. This is the same for the 2hrs of free drinks and snacks you are provided all while your kids are playing in the pool within eyesight.
user_name:
adrienne z
South Saint Paul, Minnesota

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Overall stay was nice, we arrived late and they had our room ready. Rooms were comfortable and clean, staff was nice, morning breakfast is good but very busy, the location of the hotel is great with many options for activities and food

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is my first option when staying in Waikiki but only stay there when I can get a room rate under $275 a night. The location is perfect and the staff is very helpful. If the evening reception had a better selection and the room rates had better value, I would give this hotel a 5 instead of a 4.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites sits in a great location – 3-min walk to the beach and in and amongst some great places to eat and shop. Starbucks across the street and opens up at 4am for those (like me) who have time challenges on the 1st couple of days. Service is exceptional and as a Diamond member, I have always been upgraded to a room with a better view and space to hold my meetings as I am on-island monthly for business meetings – and from check-in, to breakfast to keeping the rooms clean the hotel staff exceeds in every area. One benefit is there is no resort fee and if you have a car, getting yours from the valet is fast and easy. Rooms comfortable and large, clean and bathrooms good size – wifi fast and even the gym is nice size to get a workout in. I’ve attended the evening social and the bartenders (make sure you tip) do a nice job in serving a wide-range of drinks. As one who travels for business and please to Hawaii – the Embassy Suites checks all the blocks. Will be back.Tip: Uber is available so you can get around town and don’t need a car unless you plan to travel to the Windward side; make sure to grab food at the Yard House (especially during Happy Hour) and also try the Happy Hour/Dinner at Tommy Bahama’s rooftop bar which is a 3-min walk from the hotel. It is an early Happy Hour but some of the best drinks/and pu-pu’s on the island.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I took the family to brave the spring break crowds in Honolulu. We chose the Embassy Suites for its location and amenities and it definitely did not disappoint! Although there was some construction/renovations going on during our stay, all of the facilities were available and the staff tried to keep any disruptions to a minimum.We got our suite in the Hulu tower which is the tower closest to the beach. Our spacious room was more than enough for 4 with adequate space to put down the extra cot. Everything was clean and well kept.The buffet breakfast got rather busy in the morning serving both of the towers, but the food selection was extraordinary ranging from western food to Japanese staples. Evening reception was also quite popular with live band on some nights.With just a quick 5 min walk to the beach and a 15 minute walk to the Duke statue, we were able to get to most locations by foot plus an occasional Lyft to the farther locations.The hotel blended the relaxation of Hawaii and the proximity to some of the more bustling streets and activities found on Waikiki beach. We were even surprised by the fireworks one night which we enjoyed from our balcony. Next time in Waikiki, we will look up this hotel again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have stayed at many hotels worldwide, but this one stood out especially because of its staff. From reception, to maid service, bell desk, tour desk, omelette cookers, bar staff etc. Everyone was friendly, cheerful and professional. Hats off to those who employ and train these wonderful people.We had a suite overlooking Beach Walk on the 6th floor. It was very quiet at night time and very spacious. The complimentary breakfast was a bonus, with a variety of things to eat. In the evenings we enjoyed the band - what energy and talent! the free drinks and nibbles during the two hour happy hour were really great as well.The hotel is only a short walk from the beach at Fort de Russy park - much quieter and more sand than central Waikiki.The only thing we would have liked would have been basic items in the kitchen like cutlery and crockery. Just enough to enjoy a meal without having to use plastic containers all the time. Would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We enjoyed every second at this hotel! The rooms were great and very spacious and were cleaned and restocked with toiletries everyday which was a plus!! The breakfast was amazing (many thanks to the chefs who cook the eggs) and the happy hour cocktails were great, it was even better when the band was there! We thoroughly enjoyed it!! We can’t wait to come back and recommend anyone to come stay here!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great stay...short walk to beach, close to several shops and restaurants! Staff very helpful and friendly spreading the Aloha spirit. Huge free breakfast and super Manager’s Reception in the evening. Already planning our next trip...Mahalo!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is pricey but worth it! Breakfast is huge. Rooms are spacious. Evening social is great. We filled our water bottles, got sodas, and hardly had to buy food during our stay. The coupon book they give you is worth going through! Walking distance from the beach. Views are priceless! I won't bother staying anywhere else-

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel has many positive features including friendly staff, complimentary buffet and evening snacks and drinks. The evening snacks are minimal but the drink selection is pretty good. The buffet selection is excellent. My favourite interactions were with the extremely friendly housekeeping and breakfast buffet staff. Thank you! The only downside to this hotel is that it is dated for the price. Although the rooms are a good size they could benefit from updates and some areas have a musky odour. If you have children with allergies, consider asking for a room without musky odour or find another hotel. There was also some construction in the area (not in the hotel specifically). If still ongoing, I recommend a room on a higher floor and away from the main street, if possible. The location is excellent and within walking distance to shopping, restaurants and beach. I selected the hotel rating as very good given the friendly staff but the overall rating in my opinion is closer to good/average. Happy travels to you!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The staff was all so friendly and helpful. The complimentary breakfast was awesome. It exceeded my expectations. We will definitely be staying here again. Perfect location. Everyone in my family enjoyed themselves

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: What a great stay we had at the Embassy Suites. The staff definitely had the aloha spirit, very friendly. The beach is a short walk and the evening reception was awesome. Can't wait to go back. Thanks to all!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have stayed at this Embassy twice now on Oahu. On both occassions we used it as our overnight just as we arrived or before we left. The price is high, but that is to be expected. The service and cleanliness are wonderful though and exactly what I expect from an Embassy.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a fantastic stay here! We arrived to discover that we had been upgraded from a 1 bedroom suite to a 2 bed/ 2 bath for free. A great surprise for a pair of jet lagged sisters after arriving from New York! We were already getting a great deal for our money, and this just made it even better. The service was great, the rooms modern and very comfortable, and breakfast was great. The evening reception was wonderful, strong drinks, and the live music was surprisingly good! My only 2 tiny suggestions are to have better signage for the valet entrance driving up (we missed it the first time) and iced coffee at breakfast- hot was just a little hard to drink after my morning workout. Thanks for a great stay!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The buffet breakfast every morning and free alcoholic cocktails every afternoon with free snacks has sold me!! Best hotel is Waikiki by far!!Rooms are spacious and plenty of categories to choose from

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Beautiful. Friendly staff always helpful. Friendly Bellmen. Helpful getting a ride to the airport for flight out. Housekeeping is always nice and helpful. The ocean side is spectacular! You can watch the fireworks on Friday nights right from the comfort of your balcony! Breakfast is outstanding and the happy hour is *Awesome*. Service here is wonderful. Also, it is above Ruth’s Chris steakhouse and Roy’s. And a short walk to PF Chang. The malls are right there as well as the ocean for surfing or snorkeling. Top notch service. Perfect end to Hawiian lifestyle!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Everything about this hotel was perfect for us. We'd selected a "city view" room and were pleasantly surprised to get a pool-level patio. Everyone was friendly and courteous. The breakfasts were fresh and delicious as always, and it's so nice to be able to order eggs our own way. The Manager's Reception is always a pleasant way to wind down after a fun day, and the entertainment was REALLY a surprise - head and shoulders above most "happy hour bands"!When we ordered a taxi to get to the cruise port, we got our biggest surprise of all - a STRETCH LIMO ... and at the same cost as a normal taxi. Yes. We felt very special!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: A great location for tourists, near restaurants and shopping galore. The breakfasts are absolutely wonderful. Pineapple to die for (I'm originally from Hawaii, so, I know of what I speak). Free drinks and pupus at night. Entertainment features excellent musicians--much better than at some of the highly priced hotels on Kalakaua. The employees are professional and friendly. Lots of Chinese and Japanese tourists, most low-key as regards noise. I say that because many travel with their child. And those kids are spoiled! Some great bartenders, Frank and Shane come to mind...

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have been staying at embassy suites waikiki beach walk for the last two weeks and am very happy with my stay here. I can recommend it and would stay here again. I thought I would provide a review of the evening reception as I did not find very clear information on it when I checked earlier reviews.The evening reception is from 5:30-7:30 and is free for everyone staying in the hotel. During the reception certain drinks are free. These include 8 specific cocktails, several spirits and simple mix drinks such as gin and tonic, and beer and wine. There are also free drinks for kids such as cola and sprite, as well as snacks. The snack rotate each night. Chips and pretzels, and a veggie one night and nuts, corn chips, and veggies the other. In terms of what is provided, it is very nice and in a great location near the pool.The highlight of the evening reception though is the band, which is excellent. They play four days a week, Mon, Wed, Fri, and Saturday, and always put on a good show. They play classic pop songs but with unique arrangements and with ukelele as the lead instrument. They have really strong vocals and play tight sets. They are very professional, very engaging, and I found were perhaps the best reason to come to the reception. I have seen them play 6 times now, and my family still wants to come and see them play, as do I. Having stayed in Hawaii five times now, I can say that they are by far the best band that I have seen play. This is reflected by the audience appreciation. The embassy is lucky to have them.Overall the evening reception is a nice time and a great way to start the evening. It is very family friendly, and a nice perk to staying at the Embassy Suites.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Recently spent 7 nights at this hotel and it was great! Very helpful and friendly staff! The breakfast buffet is wonderful. Fruits, breads, omelet bar, eggs and breakfast meats. Great choices for everyone! The manager reception is awesome! Open bar with snacks (nachos, pretzels etc). Location is downtown Waikiki so close to walk to restaurants and shopping.
