My only small complaint is you are required to valet if you stay there at $40 a day. Sometimes there is a back up and a little bit of a wait, so be prepared for that. I would definitely stay here again next time in Honolulu and highly recommend!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy, as always was a great place to stay. No resort fees here. However there is a $40 parking fee each night if you have a car. We didn't. We walked and used uber. Everything is in walking distance. Great happy hour and cooked to order breakfast. Very nice staff.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Have now stayed at all Waikiki Hilton properties, with exception of the Doubletree. This is our favorite based on room size and location. Room was spacious and quiet, even being next to elevators. Except for one staff member, everyone was friendly and welcoming. Being a Diamond member not as acknowledged as other properties so not a huge benefit. Complimentary breakfast is very nice with huge variety of choices/items. As with any family oriented property, some of the buffet can be off putting when you see non-supervised children, and even adults touching food with hands instead of using serving utensils.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Loved this place with it's buffet breakfast, nightly reception, pool, large rooms and beautiful accommodating staff. Thanks so much for making our holiday very memorable! We will continue to travel with Embassy suites each time!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our second trip to Hawaii and after a referral from family we chose to stay at Embassy Suites on Beach Walk. So glad we did, excellent hotel, staff so happy and inviting. Very comfortable two bedroom apartment, nice view of the ocean, and walk out one side to a short walk to the beach or out the other side of building and your in downtown Waikiki. Loved the free breakfast each morning especially the two guys cooking the fresh omelettes (breakfast and a show). Free cocktails in the evening and most nights a very good local band.A good hotel is one that does that bit extra, we turned up 9 hours early and were kindly given a room and invited to try the free breakfast. When the TV was playing up in the bedroom, it was fixed that day with an apology.We will definitely be return visitors. Thankyou to everyone for making our holiday enjoyable.
user_name:
Wayne N Judy J
Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: After some initial scepticism during the booking process, I must say we were thoroughly impressed with this hotel.The size of our room was fantastic especially with a rambunctious 16mth old and our view of the pool and ocean was second to none.This hotel is perfectly situated, right in the middle of all the shops, restaurants and main attractions and walking distance to the lagoon at Hilton Hawaiian Village.NO RESORT FEES!Free breakfast every morning and cocktails every night was the icing on the cake.We will most certainly be back in the near future!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our second visit (nine nights this time) to the Embassy Suites Beach Walk Waikiki was great. Super friendly staff; particularly the housekeeping and breakfast folks. As mentioned in our previous review, the breakfast and evening happy hour was a wonderful experience (the band who played every other night was incredibly good; we would have paid a cover charge just to hear them!)This time we booked a city view (picture attached) which was nice. Our only complaint and disappointment was the king bed suites surround the elevators and the noise was quite bothersome. As the hotel was at capacity, they were unable to accommodate us in another room. We finally paid a $300 supplement to move to an ocean-view suite for the last three nights. (No Hilton Honors Gold benefits were available.)That aside, we would definitely recommend this hotel to our friends and especially those families with children.Mahalo to Marsha and Aldren who made our breakfast experience thoroughly enjoyable.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Terrific location on Waikiki and what’s not to like with Embassy Suite’s full breakfast and evening manager’s reception. Marsha, an “aloha ambassador” for the hotel made the visit especially memorable when she stopped to chat at breakfast one morning. She offered to get me coffee, and then offered other amenities to welcome me to the property. Despite location on first floor of Hula Tower and fairly near the elevator, the room was quiet for the most part. I think next time I would upgrade to higher floor with a balcony. Welcoming and warmly efficient staff.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: It was a great holiday. We spent 12 nights there. The hotel staff were friendly and most helpful especially Daniel. He was our housekeeper for the entire time. Rooms were clean, neat and tidy. Great for a family. Our view was awesome too. Free breakfast and free cocktails and nibbles every night. Highly recommend it.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The staff is so nice here. The location is awesome and breakfast is delicious . Only five min to the beach and so close to all kinds of shops. Would highly recommend it. Front desk staff is very nice.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have been to a variety of Hilton locations all over the world. This has been the most fun. Rooms and accommodations are what to be expected. The lobby on ground floor is unusual. But the best thing about this hotel is the 4th floor. The Managers Reception is 17.30 to 19 with live music every other day. The band was wonderful so we rescheduled our arrangements to be able to listen, dance and have fun.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Value with great quality at this Waikiki hotel. Evening Reception was our favorite with live music by very talented musicians. Our experience at this Embassy Suites from previous visits exceeded our expectation!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great Location! The rooms are spacious and were clean. The room we had was a city view but we could still see the ocean off to the left. We didn't spend a lot of time on the balcony because it was small and very noisy with street traffic. The breakfast they offer is probably one of the best I've ever seen! The Happy Hour snacks were exactly that - just a snack. Goldfish, chips, pretzals, vegtable and dip, nacho chips, salsa and nacho cheese. The bar offers a large selection of happy hour drinks! The pool is nice, it felt somewhat heated. The hot tub was probably my only complaint - it was usually filled with kids and it is not large. I would definitley stay there again when visiting Honolulu!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Upon arrival, the wonderful experience began. Valet parking and check in was a breeze with included comp beverage at check in desk, the unexpected room upgrade to a partial ocean view suite, what could be better. The Aloha Spirit at the Embassy Suites Waikiki is at its best. Excellent location for shopping, Royal Hawaiian Center food court has many unique eateries that are not found in malls.Meet Eldrin at the breakfast buffet, he is a great example of Mr Aloha.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: February 14-16, 2019 We stayed at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki Beach for two nights. We arrived via Lyft and were greeted with tropical drinks in the open air lobby. We stayed in the hula tower in a one bedroom suite with two balconies.. Our suite had two double beds in the bedroom and a pull out couch in the living room area. We are a family of 5 and this gave our family ample space. The pool area is also where the manager's cocktail party and morning breakfasts were held. The nightly manager's cocktail party was very generous with their bar service. The bartender is very friendly and pours a strong Mai Tai. He also made our kids happy with fun kid cocktails. There are lots of light snacks to enjoy during this manager's party, but you'll want to get a real dinner in addition to it. We ordered Giovanni's pizza delivered to our room. The next morning we were blown away by the huge breakfast selection. It starts at 6:30am and since we came from the east coast, we were awake and ready to eat. Even at that early hour, the hotel service staff were cheerful. One staff member gave my children carved coconut banks. Another staff member took the time at breakfast to help me plan our family's drive around the island. The location of this hotel is close to everthing. We will definetly stay here again

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My friend and I stayed here for a week. The room was a very nice suite with partial water view. They serve a wonder breakfast with omelettes made to order, as well as a the usual bacon, sausage, eggs, toast, bagels, sweet rolls, cereal, fruit, yogurt as well as other international favorites such as misso soup, rice, salad and a wide array of coffee and other drinks. The staff was friendly and wonderful to work with. Each night there is a happy hour with free drinks from 5:30 to 7:30 with a live band. There is a wide array of shops and restaurants just outside the door. The one drawback was that tour buses don't stop there and we had to walk a couple of blocks to catch the tour buses. The bus from the airport does drop you in front.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This Embassy Suites is one of the best in the Embassy Suites family. Location is terrific. Personnel are top notch - friendly, professional and helpful. This hotel provides everything they promise and then some. Thank you for a wonderful vacation in the heart of Waikiki. Tom and Carol.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The nice thing about this property is there is no resort fees like so many other properties in the area. This hotel is in a great location as the beach is a short walk along with a nice park. There’s also lots of good restaurants and shops close by.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The highlight of the hotel is the pool and spa area, which we visited at least twice daily for our entire stay. The breakfast, which is included with the room, is rotated daily and delicious. The free happy hour drinks and snacks are perfect to enjoy while the kids play in the super kid-friendly pool (no more than 4 ft deep). Great stay!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Got top floor room with nice view. Room was clean and good size. Sofa bed in living room is ok for kids, not so good for adults sleepOverall good stay for family with 3 kids.Breakfast included in the price is a bonus but we found it receptive and a bit boring.Parking fee is ridiculous ! 40$ day ! We have to park in a different hotel where you can get Weekly pass for 100$

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We’ve been coming back to this hotel every year for the last 12 years. We come back for the great location, nice spacious rooms, excellent breakfast and staff who we’ve come to know over the last decade. We’ll keep coming back. We remember the awesome view from the 4th floor lanai before that Trump tower was built beside it and basically stole the view. Still, you can see the ocean from some rooms and floors. Doesn’t matter, short walk to the beach and the best stores and restaurants in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites location is 1 block to the beach and an easy walk to all Waikiki hot spots. The car service was fantastic. I loved the live band at the managers receptions. All service people were very friendly and on top of things. I love this property.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Staff is amazing always offering assistance whether its additional towels shampoo, drinks, or clearing plates. Manager's reception is fantastic with free alcoholic drinks, snacks, and live music we always ensured we made it back for this time. The included breakfast alone saved our family money each day with the large selection of items to the made to order egg station. The rooms are spacious and contain all amenities, however as of Feb 2019 are somewhat dated but easily resolved with new doors, paint, and trim.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: What an amazing stay! We frequently visit Honolulu for work. This hotel is the best in Waikiki. Beautiful pool, manager reception (with a band), views and breakfast. We will definitely be back for all of our future stays.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had our rooms made and neither the bins were replaced nor the dirty cups we had used were replaced.The rooms although dated were nice but the bathtub was extremely small and shallow, I'm not sure how they expect people to be warm in them.I'm currently still staying at the hotel if management would like to contact me.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Fabulous staff, spacious 2 bedroom unit with 2 bathrooms. Clean and comfortable with a daily service. Located in the heart of Waikiki, a 2 minute walk to the beach. Buffet breakfast, Great omelettes. Happy hour for 2 hours each night with free cocktails and nibbles and great entertainment. Highly recommended and would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Don’t get a king room as they are all beside the elevator.Room 1711 has a loud creaking and banging elevator beside it and all the noise is in the bedroom.This is not normal.We changed rooms once because of noise and they put us in 1711 in a worse situation. In hindsight I should have checked out and stayed somewhere else.Also there is a car park alarm that goes off every time someone exits the car park. It goes constantly so you won’t enjoy sitting on the nice balcony in the day.There are good things about the hotel however when guests don’t sleep everything else really doesn’t matter does it.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our first trip to Hawaii. Our flight with Alaska Airlines was very enjoy. We always stay in a Hilton facility and try to get the Embassy Suites each time . Waikiki Embassy Suites was the best ever. The staff were always courteous and knowledgeable. Rooms were very clean and nice. The cleaning lady was always helpful.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Have stayed here for five years now and it’s a great location, big rooms and great staff. The only downside is the WiFi is spotty (you have to pay more for Premium service which is too bad). Free breakfast and nightly reception are great!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My wife and I try to go to Hawaii each year and each time we stay at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk. We do so for a number of reasons. It is conveniently located near the beach, restaurants and shopping and everything we need is within walking distance. The suites are clean and comfortable. The staff are always very friendly and make us feel very welcome and try to ensure that our stay is comfortable and our needs are met. The complimentary breakfast buffet is excellent and the staff are outstanding. The evening manager's reception is also excellent with the complimentary drinks and snacks and the bartender, Keola, is the best in his interactions with guests and he keeps the line moving. The family band which plays at the reception four nights a week is also outstanding and is a large part of why we keep returning to this hotel. We will be back!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I absolutely love this hotel! The location cannot be beat. Theres a starbucks downstairs, the beach is just a mere short walk in one direction and the touristy shops of waikiki is a short walk in the other direction. The first time we stayed here was with a hiltons honors member so they upgraded us to a room on one of the top floors. the view was absolutely amazing!! Could not get enough of those ocean views. The room was large and spacious, very clean and although not brand new was new and clean enough for me. Housekeeping did a great job getting rid of all the sand in the room at the end of the day and we always came back to a nice tidy room. The complimentary breakfast is a really good solid meal! Not your avg cheap free meal. The fruit is abundant and fresh, the make your own omelette station is very filling. The pool is kind of small, but then with the beach such a short walk away I could see why they didnt waste money on the pool area (although its still a very nice and well maintained area). The workers are very nice, especially the valet people. valet only is a pain in the butt at times but the workers are fast, efficient and very nice so its hard to complain. I loved my stay so much the following year when I came back to hawaii for another vacation I had to choose the same hotel again! We didnt get the complimentary upgrade this time since we were not travelling with any honors member (too bad) but the room was still nice, although i must admit the rooms on the higher levels boast a better view and are much more quiet. Our room this time was a little loud due to higher traffic from other people. Its more pricey than other hotels but its certainly my favorite and I wouldnt hesitate to book another stay!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: If you can, avoid rooms numbered 10 or 01 in Aloha tower as they are right next to not one, but two very noisy elevators! When we called to request a room change, we were advised that all rooms with king beds are next to the elevators. They offered to try and move some things around to find another room for us but that would require us checking out and then checking back in, which with 3 kids was not ideal whatsoever. So we sucked it up and stayed in our room. I ended up playing some white noise on my phone all night to drown out the elevator noise. The positives: the included breakfast and managers reception were nice. Check in was quick. We would stay here again and likely give it a higher rating if our room was not next to 2 elevators.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a king bed in the bedroom and sofa bed for kids in the living room. Another room booked for grandparents. The breakfast normally had rice, potatoes, bacon/sausage, fruit, cereal, oatmeal, various bread/continental stuff and cooked to order eggs. The evening reception included snacks (chips/veggies) and alcoholic drinks. Live music on mon wed and fri should not be missed - Hawaiian family band who were really good. Staff were friendly. 5 min walk to beach, restaurants and park (Fort DeRussy). 20 min walk to Ala Moana mall. Mistake on billing which they corrected but it really shouldn’t happen. We have been to Waikiki annually for many years now and this has become one of our favourite.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We recently stayed at the embassy suites and couldn’t say a bad thing about our stay. We had 10 nights in this amazing hotel and took advantage of all it had to offer. The breakfast was delicious and the daily 2 hour managers cocktail reception suited our family as my hubby and I would often enjoy a sit in the spa while the girls had endless soda and snacks and we’d finish off with a few beverages ourselves before either settling in the for the night or taking advantage of the fantastic location and enjoy an evening stroll. The view from our room was amazing and I definitely suggest if you can to book an ocean or pool view room!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Larger rooms than most Waikiki hotels and can get a good price if your schedule is flexible. Complimentary breakfast great for Asians and westerner's pallettes alike. Also open bar for 2 hours a night. The internet was super slow but I have stayed here other times and it was fine. We discovered the ISP was having trouble at this hotel but it never got resolved during my stay . Overall you'll be satisfied with this location and amenities .

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Had the pleasure to talking to Cary Murayang in the dining hall this morning. He took time to make some recommendations of things to do around the island and he did not disappoint! He even sent a courtesy snack with a handwritten note. What a wonderful person that puts the guest first. Please keep him in mind for upcoming promotions! Would stay again just because of his hospitality.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel is centrally located to restaurants, shops, and the beach. The free breakfast is delicious with many choices. The evening entertainment is very good with excellent band. The hotel’s swimming pool is very nice. If want just a sandwich or snack, there is an ABC store across the street featuring freshly made sandwiches plus a 24 hr. Denny’s. Their apple crisp dessert is fantastic!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Throughly enjoyed my stay at Embassy Suites Honolulu! Great rooms, nice views, Great staff and conveniently located to beaches & shopping!!! A great time was had by all! A top choice for the budget conscious!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location. Heated pool, great facilities, band at reception was awesome, drinks were great, bartenders friendly, staff friendly. If you get a chance, tip as often as you can, the staff there works hard to maintain the place for the guests.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I spent a four day/three night getaway from the rainy Pacific Northwest @ Embassy Suites/Beachwalk . . . on my own (my wife and dog gave me permission!). Certainly the amenities are excellent for families (included breakfasts/large pool/afternoon reception with snacks and open bar(!) ), but this Embassy Suites worked for me, solo, also in that the staff was plentiful and available to talk with about what I was thinking of doing and where that could be realized. Plus, the free beach (and cement sidewalk beachwalk) is literally one block away, and the Waikiki Beach Post Office is the next street over (I sent home a couple packages of surprise gifts; I was not alone doing this ;-) ). As a single traveler I felt genuinely valued over 4 days of staff interactions. So yes for a family destination (it was common to see 3 generations), and also a yes as a good choice for the independent traveler who likes to come home to a 2-room suite with views and creature-comforts.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here for 2 nights prior to a cruise. It is a clean, comfortable, pretty hotel which has 2 towers. We had a quiet one bedroom suite near the elevator on the 16th floor in the Hula Tower. It had a separate bedroom and living area, with a door between and included a pull-out sofa, mini-kitchen, safe, and flat-screen TVs. The views were beautiful. The bed was extremely comfortable, and the bathroom included toiletries and a large walk in shower. An excellent hot/cold daily breakfast was included. The pineapple was so sweet and delicious. There was also an Evening Poolside Reception with complimentary drinks and snacks, Waikiki Beach is across the street. There is an ABC store across the street which sells alcohol, food and reasonable beachwear, souvenirs etc. The International Marketplace and numerous restaurants are within walking distance. We did not have a car so I can’t comment on parking. There is no shuttle to the airport, cruiseport or within the city. The bellmen were able to get a taxi right away for us. Our only suggestion for improvement is that the maid did not come until 2:30 to clean our room and we were out all morning, and the next day when we were checking out she tried to get in at 11 am. We would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at Embassy Suites. Kids had a good time as well. Breakfast and Managers Drinks were excellent. Pool is safe for kids. Staffs were very polite and helpful. Overall experience was exceptional highly recommended for family holiday and we surely be back

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here for 2 nights on return from trip to Maui before leaving for home. It was just the two of us, and I chose the Embassy Suites as we are Diamond level and we wanted to spend time at the beach for a few hours. We were placed in the Aloha Tower, which was the tower furthest back. We were on floor 12, did not have an ocean view but could see Diamond Head and the Royal Hawaiian Hotel from our balcony. We were told we were "upgraded" only to find ourselves in a 2 bedroom handicapt suite. The room was quiet and clean. Bathroom in King room was very small. Handicapt bathroom had roll in shower which we did not use, but is decent and roomy if you had need to use it. The Manager Reception is held on level 4 - pool level and was extremely crowded. As some have said, nice for families who are still winding down their day. Elevators are extremely crowded - be sure to add more time into your schedule for coming and going. Breakfast was a zoo, food was just okay. Lines were very long. We chose not to eat breakfast here on the second day. There is a Starbucks across the way at the Outrigger Reef and also Cafe Glace on Lewers Street has breakfast items - but limited table space. The pool was lovely but extremely crowded except at breakfast. Cabannas are available for rent in additon to the free regular loungers. This might be a good choice if you want to stay by the pool.We were able to go to the beach and rent beach loungers in front of the Outrigger Reef Hotel. The beach front at that section is somewhat tricky for swimming as it has more coral and several cut downs. If you are coming with a family, the Embassy Suites might be a great value, but as a couple I would suggest choosing another property.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The location was perfect. Nice pool yet close to the beach too. It was relaxing and the staff was very friendly. The complimentary amenities were great. It was our first time staying at this hotel and we would do it again in a heartbeat.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family of 5 (husband, kids 18, 15 & 12 and I) stayed at the Embassy Suites Waikiki during the first week of January. It was our first time to Hawaii, and we were so glad we chose this hotel. The location was excellent - one block back from the beach but with easy access via public walkway across the street, and one block away from the main street via the lively, well-lit Waikiki Beachwalk. First impressions at check in were great, as it was quick and efficient with a delicious welcome drink. Our room was a one-bedroom suite with two balconies and a partial ocean view, and we utilised all the beds including the comfortable pull-out sofa. Our housekeeper, Yuet Chun, kept our room sparkling and made an effort to communicate with us every day, making sure we had everything we needed and giving us tips. We really enjoyed both the complimentary breakfast and the evening reception - perfect for our hungry teens. We could relax with an early evening swim and snack before deciding what to have for dinner, or just get some bar food by the pool. Although there were a lot of people at times, it never felt crowded while we were there, partly due to the smiling nature and efficiency of the staff. I have already recommended Embassy Suites to my friends at home and would be happy to answer any questions. Thank you to the staff for a fantastic stay!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We did our research and this hotel did not disappoint. We are a small family of 3 with a 5 year old in tow - we enjoyed the pool/spa - yes it's busy with children but that's what makes this a great place to stay for families. Plenty of sun loungers so no scrambling for one first thing. The included breakfast is absolutely wonderful - buffet style with everything available. The Manager's free happy hour each night for 2 hours is brilliant - and the drinks are not watered down as you might expect. Free snacks also available (and for the kids) during happy hour.The ukelele band who plays here every 2nd night are SO brilliant - there is one guy who even plays the ukelele 'Jimi Hendrix' style behind his head (if you are lucky to see this) - this band was a real highlight for us. All TV channels available which is great. Right on the doorstep of the Waikiki action - beach/restaurants/shopping. Also only a couple of stops to Ala Moana shopping centre on the trolley bus (unlike other hotels in Waikiki which can take a while to get to on this bus). Great services available, good service everywhere here too. We will definitely be back to stay here.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel was recommended by my sister in law, it did not disappoint. The staff was very friendly and helpful with all of my questions and requests. The location was perfect for me and my husband. We were close to restaurants, shopping and the beach. We never heard any outside noise once we were back in our room. We stayed on the 9th floor. Possibly my only complaint would be how slow the elevators are.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 7 nights at the end of October/beginning of November 2018. This hotel is centrally located near many stores and restaurants and is very close to Waikiki Beach. The hotel provided towels for the beach/pool which was so helpful. Our room was fine – no complaints at all. The breakfast buffet included was great. There was a good selection of hot and cold items such as eggs, potatoes, bacon, sausage, fruit, cereals, bagels, etc. and a cook to order omelet station. The free happy hour in the evening was great as well – nice selection of tropical drinks, beer, wine & sangria. Three nights a week a band plays during the happy hour and they are really good. The bar tenders were very friendly. Overall, it was a great stay and I would recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Right in the heart of Waikiki. Rooms are spacious. Happy hour sees free drinks for 2 hrs every day from 5.30-7.30pm. A stones throw from pretty much any restaurant and shops. Great bar downstairs called the Yard house. Have 1/2 price food during happy hour every day. Plenty of TV’ to watch sport.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed with family (3 teenagers) at the end of December in a two bedroom suit. Room clean and well set out. Location was short walking distance to beach, Ala Moana shopping centre and down town Waikiki. Trolley stop a short stroll away too. Breakfast while plentiful, it was a little crazy being the last week of December and into the new year. Happy Hour (lets just say watch those drinks, found them to be very strong). If you are arriving from airport take Charley's taxi who offer a flat rate of $35US. Pool area was nicely set out and never overly busy. Plenty of restaurants within short walking distance and a large variety. When we stayed here we caught a taxi to Diamond Head to do the walk and the local bus to Hanauma Bay (stops outside of the Apple Store). There is a large ABC Shop directly across the road. While we loved our stay, 4 nights for our family was enough in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Lovely breakfast at the Embassy with a good variety of food. Big shout out to staff member Aldrin, he is always there with a smile and to help out if needed offering coffee or to clear the dishes. He is a great start to the day...Thank you Aldrin ☺

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent location. Very expensive for the value of food at brunch. As the years go on, the selection has diminished at brunch and no tables to sit as it was busy. Excellent rooms and view. Comfortable beds, great service this time.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: As a Hilton Diamond member, i stay at a lot of Embassy Suites - this property is hands down the best Embassy Suites experience I have had. I have probably experienced about 20 stays here since this property opened. Rooms: Spacious, clean and well maintained. Nearly all the rooms offer a nice view - most of the rooms offer some glimpse of the ocean. This property has held up really well over the years. They stock the rooms with beach towels, which is great.Service: Outstanding - everyone from the Bellman, to the desk staff, to the cleaning people are full of aloha and tremendously friendly and helpful.Food: Best Embassy suites breakfast offering both standard American Embassy Suites breakfast, but always with local/Japanese options as well. They also regularly have terrific local fruit offerings like pinapple and on occassion, papaya. Breakfast is really crowded so pay attention to the literature in your room on peak periods for breakfast. Even during peak times though, the staff do a decent job of keeping things moving. The service staff are tremendously efficient and courteous in constantly clearing plates and making space. Beverage station has a great selection of tropical juices. Location: This property is 1 block from the beach, and away from the craziness of Kalakaua St. It is fairly serene by Waikiki standards. Lots of really great dining options nearby on both the Waikiki Beachwalk and Royal Hawaii Shopping Center, both of which are a block away. There is an extra large ABC store across the street that has great hot food service and a deli, along with the usual ABC store souvenirs and sundry items. Amenities: Average fitness center with a dumbell rack and lots of cardio machines. Extra large outdoor pool which has a lot of kids. Getting poolside lounge chairs can be a challenge during peak periods. I generally do not partake in Embassy Suites cocktail hours but it is really popular and they seemed to have a good snack selection.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is off the busy Waikiki beach and main drag but is within walking distance of it. Rooms and beds are comfortable. Breakfast buffet was decent but next time I will book without breakfast access because the other local breakfast options are really good.Manager's reception in evening is great, especially the band they have each evening. Drinks are strong and snacks are great. I'd like them to add popcorn to their snack list, Pool is small for the size of the hotel but it was still fun. Nothing they can do about the size, I'm sure. Would stay here again..

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great hotel and great staff.Just came back and plan to return there in the future.Have kids with allergies - everything was done to help us have a great time (super clean room for a kid with asthma & personal phone call from the restaurant main chef to insure there is no pine nuts in any of the food served).This is our second visit to Honolulu and Embassy Suites.9 years ago we came on Feb 26th and on Feb 27th we were woken up by a tsunami warning. We were impressed with front desk staff and how well they managed hundreds of stressed and scared people...we were panicking ourselves (especially our 5 years old) but Tammy Arakaki was there, she convinced us that staying at hotel (moving to a higher floor) is the safest way (better then going to the hills as many people were doing).Now 9 years late we found this hotel just as great. Its a good location, no resort fee, good breakfast and afternoon snacks - still its their staff at the restaurant (especially omelet makers) and front desk hospitality which makes this hotel stand out. Its not too big. Gives you a feel of been taking care off. Live music by the pool at night is a great plus!Again - special thank you to Tammy Arakaki who yet again made our trip even more memorable. Its great to be treated as family.Thank you,

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our second year staying at the hotel. Another fabulous trip. The staff is so helpful and welcoming. The location is prime for shopping and restaurants. The pool is heated which is rare in Waikiki. The complimentary breakfast buffet is a nice touch.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Location of this property is excellent! As an Embassy Suites I have higher expectations. The rooms are very outdated and cleanliness was an issue in our bathroom. As well as the shower head completely broken and hanging in our bathroom. They did come and fix it within a reasonable time frame. They definitely need an update to the rooms! Not what I expected from an Embassy.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I hope people take the time to read reviews, I always go on trip advisor, to find out about hotels, as its a great way, to see what suits you,thats why i take time to do a review, This Trip was a surprise, as I had no idea we were going, thanks to the family, I would also go on to advise, most hotels, now are a joke, in Honolulu,as they are charging resort fee,s and they are not a Resort, what price you get with The Embassy suite, is the price you pay> (pls check in case they change, sure they won,t) Its been our 6/7 stay here, so that must explain matter, Why the Embassy, well apart from the brilliant staff, many thanks to you all yet again, for making the stay brilliant, and special thx to bar staff, for happy hour,The Hotel is situated in a great place/loction, 2 mins from beach,but in the heart of the shopping,They also have great music on, a few times a week, great bands/singer, Outside hotel, The Hulu girls put on a great free show, from time to time, you can see from hotel , looking over, The main points are rooms great, big family rooms,you havkids, great breakfast, and its brilliant, is included, Omlette staion, well worth a few mins wait, best to get up early, they do show busy times, also the managers cocktail hour, and the service, and drinks second to none,In fact the bar guys ,asked when I was back again(Feb or march) they asked so they could book time off, Ha Ha, This is the best value Hotel on The Island,Pls check out 3 or 4 days deals,and join HHonons, as they really look after you, I don,t work for Hilton, but i,m a HH Member, Saunders Family

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Checked in for a weeklong visit to family over Christmas, greeted by friendly staff and a refreshing mocktail after a very long day of flying. Escorted to our room to find a small but adequate suite, but no balcony. Being gold members it would have been nice to have such access. The location is great, very central, and since we didn't rent a car, uber was very accessible. Breakfast was included, and was tasty once you could access it (I understand Christmas is a busy time). The pool was nice, just a lot of children who splashed water in our drinks as we tried to enjoy the afternoon reception. Not blaming the hotel, more lack of parental supervision (again, busy Christmas week). Biggest issue with this hotel is lack of elevators. Only 2 elevators in main building for 22 floors of guest rooms, several times we had to wait after the elevator reached our floor but was too full to use. We will probably stay here again due to such a desirable location, but not during any school holiday.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The breakfast area and pool were on a restricted, guest-only floor that looked like an outdoor atrium. This made for a wonderfully warm and exclusive area. It was the closest I came to feeling like I was on a cruise without being on a ship!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We recently stayed as family of 3 for 5 nights. As my wife is sensitive to noise she booked a room on the Aloha Tower which was set back from the pool area,but we found the soundproofing to be excellent in any case. From the 17th floor we had ocean views as well as glimpse of Diamond Head. Conveniently located between Beach Walk and Lewers Streets, yet set back from the main promenade that is Kalākaua meant is was very close to all the shops without being right in the midst of it. The Managers Reception each night at 5:30 pm was very generous, with complimentary alcohol/drinks and light snacks. Would definitely come back here for next visit.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great hotel-fabulous location-delicious free breakfast and happy hour with free drinks, hors d'oevres and live music every night! Excellent location in the middle of everything, but surprisingly quiet-what a trip we had!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I booked this hotel for our family of six after reading many positive reviews. I may be spoiled, but I give this property a C-. I list our pros and cons below:Pros: They did have a suite available that fit our family of 6 (albeit tightly). We didn't want to split up into separate rooms, and suites are not easy to find in the heart of Waikiki.We could see the ocean from our room, but our view was partially obstructed by buildings (in spite of paying for a full ocean view room)Location - this property is in the heart of the action, walking distance to the beach, Starbucks, and the Waikiki Beach Walk Shops and Restaurants. This is the hotel's best feature.Generous breakfast buffet (with cooked to order omelets) and happy hour reception nightly at the pool at 5:30-7:30 is included and offers good value for filling up your family without additional expense. Cons:Check in was chaotic and staff seemed frazzled but they did their best. We were offered fresh juice at check in, but the staff was less warm than we expected for our first taste of Waikiki. The best staff members were the bell captain and valet guys. This place was is LOUD - it was packed with families with little kids (maybe not so much if you don't come during Christmas like we did). If you like the hustle and bustle of Times Square or Disney Cruises, you will probably love it but I found the pool and common areas less than peaceful. I escaped to the Outrigger's Starbucks each morning at 5am for some peace and quiet. People are everywhere.Someone pulled an alarm in the middle of the night! That's not the management's fault, necessarily, but they made loud announcements in multiple languages to let guests know there was no fire. Each room received an apology letter the next day. I know they did their best, but I couldn't wait to leave that place.Small pool and fitness center for the number of guests using it. Maybe that's the norm in Waikiki?Maybe it's me, but this place just did not wow me - especially at more than $900 a night! It was a rough start to our Hawaiian vacation. I wouldn't stay there again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Every morning stroll down for a great breakfast including omelette station. Ideally located in the heart and steps from the beach as well. Evening reception and band gave our kids great entertainment. Finally a door between the bedroom and living room gave us a comfortable sleep.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family spent 5 nights at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki and loved it. We have three kids--10, 8 and 5. The two-room suite layout was perfect for us with plenty of room to spread out and not feel cramped like most other small rooms in Waikiki. The free breakfast buffet exceeded our expectations. It was a huge selection with hot and cold items, made to order omelets, pancakes/waffles, bacon/sausage, etc. The location at the heart of Waikiki is a short 3 min walk from the beach and tons of restaurants are nearby. We thought being off-beach might be a hassle but quite the contrary! The value was outstanding for what we got here--big room, free hot breakfast, free evening cocktail reception, great pool/hot tub, nice gym, etc. The hotel charges a high (but normal for the area) $40/night for parking (valet only, no self parking available). However, that is easily offset by the fact that they don't charge the typical $25-50/night "resort fees" like all the other full-service properties around Waikiki, We would definitely stay here again in the future.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our second time staying at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki and they did not disappoint! The location is wonderful, a block from the beach and right in the middle of everything. It's one of the VERY rare hotels that offers a full buffet breakfast every morning and with our boys, any free food is always welcome. And again, their free, all you can drink happy hour with snacks is unbelievable and much appreciated at the end of a long day in the sun. The service is amazing. A special shout out to Resty, Rodrigo and Aldrin who always welcomed us with a smile and, even though it's a self-serve buffet, always came around to see if we needed anything and if there was anything they could bring us. They made the stay all that much more enjoyable. This time we lucked out with a room overlooking the pool and we also had a view of the ocean, the beach and Fort DeRussey park. The room was great, we went with my parents and the four of us so they had the room with the king bed, one of our sons slept on the hide-a-bed in the living room and my husband and I and our other son shared the 2 queen bed room. Two bathrooms were very welcome. This time round our cleaning staff wasn't quite as thorough as the ones we had last time as sand was still left in the bathroom and other small things like that, nothing that ruined our trip. We rented a vehicle this time and kept it at the hotel and the valet service was great. The ONLY big complaint we had was that the wifi is horrible. I was trying to check our email and send pictures which proved to be quite a chore but again, nothing that would ruin our trip. All in all another great stay. Would definitely come back. Thank you for making our Christmas a memorable one. :)

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location just across the road from the beach, really nice rooms, service is exceptional, good breakfast options and free nightly drinks and canapés! Everything is at your doorstep. What more could you want!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Valet is very goodBell man is very goodFront desk is very goodSuppose to be 2 bedroom, got 2 beds, one bath not enough. Suppose to be ocean view got pool view. Room was dirty. Gym open 24 hrsMy rate was suppose to be lowered to their lowered advertised rate, but they didn’t. And then they filled up and refused. So we paid about 185 extra each night for a week! That’s something you won’t forget when making reservations in the future,and we travel frequently.Good location, not as many amenities as others in area.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed during the very busy Christmas week. We found clothing from a previous guest in room.which made me question how thorough the room had been cleaned. I reported it to the front desk and they said the room would be cleaned again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at Embassy Suites for a fortnight in December (my wife and I and 3 kids). We had a one bedroom suite which was plenty of room for everyone although you spend most of your time outside anyway. The mini kitchen was also good for having an occasional night in.When we come back to Hawaii, we will stay here again. Great location, the breakfasts included and happy hours were an absolute bonus (loved the band) and the service from all fantastic.Would highly recommend to anyone travelling with family.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: 1 Bedroom Suites are located on the 1st to 4th floors. If you are going to be lodged on the 1st floor, dont even bother staying here as it is super noisy! The happy hour free food is mainly greasy food. The only healthy food was humus and sticks of zucchini. Open bar for those who like drinking. Good AC, but vents are dirty.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Beautiful suite. Upgraded from one bedroom to two bedroom just for asking not to be near elevator. Very comfortable, modern accomadations. Friendly staff. Evening reception with free drinks and snacks. Bartender did not short pour! House band was great. Breakfast was included and more than basic. Offerings for American & Japanese visitors. Wonderful pool area. No time for fitness center, but there if you are so inclined.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The location was great. There was easy access to the beach and restaurants and shopping. Service was excellent. Check in and check was easy. The complimentary breakfast was a a good start to each day. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Nice property. Separate bedroom makes for perfect blend of the condo & hotel experience! Complimentary breakfast was usual fare, but appreciated that there was no mad dash to grab a table because there were plenty. Nice friendly staff.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My friends and I had two rooms at the Embassy Suites and cannot rate the place highly enough. Room size was excellent with a seperate living space. Cleanliness was 5 Star. Breakfast was plentiful. The Happy Hour brilliant. Location spot on. The service of Lewis and Dennis at the poolside bar was second to none. I will definitely return to Embassy Suites.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The staff went above & beyond everyday to insure our comfort & were just generally so friendly, kind. We were made to feel like family everyday that we stayed there. Would definitely recommend this property!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The breakfast and evening reception were amazing! So many options for the breakfast buffet and the evening reception had a live band 4 nights out of the week. They were amazing! And you can't beat the free drinks! I would highly recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We usually stay at the Outrigger Reef but this time we had a group of 14. I was sceptical at first because this isn’t a beachside property but I was pleasantly surprised. The lobby is much quieter than I expected but the location is very central. The rooms are spacious and well equipped and the staff are friendly and very professional. The free buffet breakfast and the managers reception saved me upwards of $1000 over the duration of our 10 night stay. The highlight of our time at the Embassy Suites though was the level of service by the Barmen at the Panini Bar Dennis and Shane. Their local knowledge, professional manner and level of service are indeed a credit to their employer and made our stay a memorable one.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was my first vacation to Hawaii and I booked the hotel through Delta Airlines vacation package. The staff at the hotel made me feel welcome from the time I arrived until my departure. The location is convenient to restaurants, shopping and beaches. The breakfast which is included was very good with many choices.I enjoyed my stay here and would stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Everything at this hotel is what you would expect from an Embassy Suites except for the internet. There is no offering of premium internet here which is ridiculous considering what they charge per night.
user_name:
John F
Greensboro, North Carolina, United States

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hotel is very clean, and staff is very friendly and helpful. Conveniently located, you could walk to many restaurants, the beach, and some malls.Could see the Hilton village fireworks from the one side of rooms in Aloha tour. Pool was nice, but a bit over crowded with young children splashing and throwing balls around but it is a vacation so no issue. Evening reception could use more variety in the food served but they open the bar up to most drinks for free and freely pour. Hot water took a while to warm up no matter what time of day but was good once it got hot. Hospitality suite was nice to use after we checked out to grab a quick shower before catching our transfer back to the airport. Live music 3-4 times a week during reception and the band was pretty good. Easily recommend this hotel for the price and no resort fees.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here awhile ago but never wrote a review, so just wanted to get in a quick recap. Decided to switch from Hilton Hawaiian Village as we had 3 kids and were able to secure a 1 bedroom here. Emailed hotel beforehand and they upgraded us to a 2 bedroom, which was amazing as 2 of our kids are under 3 years old. The rooms weren't that big, but more than adequate. Free breakfast was a huge plus, and the pool has a small little kid's section where my 2 year olds could stand, which was great for them. Loved the free happy hour each night as well. It was a lot of Hilton Points at 70K a night (I believe it's even higher now at 75K), but in the end we definitely got our moneys worth. No resort fee either which was nice. 1 block from the beach, so very close walk. Also close to shops, pharmacy, etc. Would definitely return. Be warned, parking is expensive here (as is everywhere in Waikiki) - I think it was $38 or $40/night, and I'm sure it's only gone up since then.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family recently stayed at the hotel for 11 nights and our experience was wonderful and when we come back to Hawaii we will look to stay here again. Every aspect about the hotel is great. Starting with the location, centrally located shops, restaurants, beach, everything you need is literally just outside, the main part of Waikiki beach is about a 6-7 minute walk enough of a distance to walk off your morning breakfast. Speaking of breakfast, a vast selection of food available including a made to order omelette bar which we had most days.The pool area is great and if we weren't at the beach we were in the pool. Of an evening the hotel puts on a Manager's reception where entertainment, complimentary drinks and nibbles are served. The hotel is very clean and well maintained. Facilities also include a well fitted gym. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful. Would strongly recommend this place and I would also stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I really enjoyed my recent stay at Embassy suites. The rooms were spacious and would be good for families I believe. The hotel itself offers breakfast and happy hour included which was a nice surprise. The location is close to the major attractions/ restaurants in Waikiki. I loved my stay and can not wait to bring my family back!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had our second stay here this year, and we were delighted by the work the team has done to improve the seating around the pool area, particularly since we mentioned this to them the last time we stayed. They were actually installing everything when we arrived. There’s now much more shade and seating options and it’s much more comfortable. Well done Embassy Suites for doing what so few hotels do, actually listening to your customers and taking action.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Staff are not very helpful and rude. The lady by the name Suzana was very rude seemed not happy with her job, not even smiling and the way she sounds like she does not to assist me at all. She asked my ID and credit card did not say or explain anything. When I checked my card there was a pending charges and when I asked her she rudely responsed “Oh I did not charged you card it was pending deposit” with an arrogant face... I don’t mind being charged but atleast inform the guest because not all customer are aware of the charges and the fact the she looks irritated when I asked her felt that I got discriminated. She was not friendly at all and me and my family really felt disappointed for unwelcomed environment experienced.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I picked this hotel after canceling out two previous bookings at other hotels, as we planned this trip long before. It’s a very nice hotel, especially for families. We booked the two queen bed suite, which actually comes with an additional sofa bed in the hall. This allows for some privacy and space for a larger group of people. Most hotels in Honolulu do not include breakfast when you book the rooms. This hotel does. It’s said to be a “made to order” breakfast. What is actually made here is your eggs, whether it’s the sunny side up or omelette. The rest (yogurt, fruits, soup, coffee and juices) are available buffet style. The crowd in the breakfast area can be overwhelming, and guests are notified about this in the room. A rough “traffic” guide is mentioned based on the time of the day.There is an additional meal with the room, which is the daily manager’s reception between 6.30 to 8.30 pm. This is a poolside reception with cocktails and light bites. On certain days, there is a band that plays good music. This is a good way to wind down after an outing and then have dinner later, if needed. The reception counter is good, and check-in smooth. However, as in most 5-star hotels, it’s a bit impersonal. Nobody really notes your movements in and out. Laundry service is available at the 3rd floor with dryer services as well, all at a good rate. The beach is about a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Guests are allowed to borrow towels from the pool area and return it later. The pool is not very big, but adequate. It has a wading pool and a jacuzzi. There is a “travel” counter at the entrance. I would like to mention that this “travel” counter isn’t very good. Sorry guys, but I have to say this. When I asked for shuttle services to Waikele, they were not very helpful. This when actually, there is a shuttle service at the Royal Hawaiian Avenue, which I noted a few days later. When I asked about car rental, the person in-charge was trying to sell me a whole day tour.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed for a family member's 60th birthday in November 2018. We arrived from Sydney, Australia around midday and our room was not quite ready. We waited by the pool with some other family who had arrived in the days prior but our room was ready within half an hour. Our room was on the 19th floor in the Hula tower and had great views out over the other buildings towards Diamond Head. We thoroughly enjoyed the Manager's Cocktail Reception each night (sometimes we just had the nibbles for dinner so we could put our toddler to bed by 7!)The pool was perfect for us. Never too busy and the shallow part was great for our toddler who is still learning to swim.We loved the location of this hotel. Close enough to the action without needing to hear it! We used the valet service for 3 days for our hire car and it was a great service. Overall we had a great time at Embassy Suites Waikiki and would love to return some time soon!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is our 2nd time staying at the Embassy. Last time we had a 1 bedroom suite overlooking the pool & beach area. We had a queen bed & then a sofa bed for the kids in the loungeroom, but was a little squishy when the sofa bed was down at night, but staff folded it up during the day which was great. This time we had 2 x 2 bedroom Modern Suites on the 19th & 21st floors overlooking the pool & glorious beach & Waikiki.We had an early flight so were there very early in the morning with fresh juice awaiting us. Our suites were both ready so the porters had our bags taken up & they told us to go & enjoy the buffet breakfast (6.30-10.30) with alot of variety & where you could have your own omelette made in front of you. Both suites were spacious, clean & amazing views. Staff are so friendly & the location is great as in walking distance to everything.Pool area on the 4th floor was very clean & inviting & pool towels are there for your use. Managers reception was free for drinks & nibbles (5.30-7.30) which was a great way to relax after a busy day & enjoy the live music. We found by having the buffet breakfast early in the morning approx 6.30 to beat the busy time, but some mornings they did open up the room off the covered area if there were a lot of people to help out. We then had an early tea approx. 4.30 (as some restaurants were very busy, so the earlier the better), we didn't even feel like lunch in between & just had nibbles by the pool.Our suites both had a bar fridge to store your drinks & also tea & coffee facilities.Both suites were very quiet but only negative this time was the wait for the lifts but due to how busy it was, was understandable & if we had to be somewhere by a certain time we just left a couple of minutes earlier.We definitely will be back again & highly recommend

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy suites for 9 nights and absolutely loved it. The location is great - it's roughly a 5 min walk to the beach, and roughly about 8-10 min walk if you want to go towards the Hilton Hawaiian village (For the Friday night fireworks, and just a good area to watch sunset). Definitely noticed the beach around there was a little less crowded than around Kuhio beach or near the other hotels like the Royal Hawaiian. It's also close to the main strip of shops & restaurants on Kalakaua avenue and near convenience stores like ABC and long drugs. The room is really spacious, we were able to get a room with two queen beds and it was really comfortable. However, the walls are a little thin and on some nights we could hear people's conversations, and some really loud teenagers. The hotel breakfast is quite decent and very handy to have! The happy hour from 5:30-7:30PM is also great and the band plays on Mon, Wed and Fri. The people at the Expedia desk & Hilton grand vacations club desk were also extremely helpful and friendly with recommending restaurants & things to do and also helping us book activities like parasailing. All the staff at breakfast and at the bell desk always had a smile. Overall a really great stay, would definitely return!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Made reservations 10 months in advance on the internet for 5 suites. Check in was fine and polynesian punch was served to all 20 of our party. Our rooms were on the 15th floor; rooms with 2 queen beds, living area with queen sofa bed, table, chairs, frig. and microwave. Arm bands are given to adults for breakfast(6:30am to 10:30am) and for Managers afternoon snacks including alcoholic drinks from 5-7PM. There is also live entertainement in the evening. This is all on the 4th floor where pool is located. Pool towels are always available. You can also order food for purchase at poolside. The elevators are slow during peak times. We had a Wonderful time. There is no resort fee and you are only one block from the beach. There is Valet parking. This hotel is located walkable distances to numerous restaurants, shopping, and entertainement. You can rent a car for a day at nearby locations and not have to pay for parking at hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have just returned from an 8 night stay at Embassy Suites. The location of this hotel can not be faulted within an easy walk of beach, shops, and plenty of dining options.Check in was easy although flying in from New Zealand arrival was early morning so our room was not ready. They stored our luggage and took our phone details and texted us about 2 hours later to let us know we had access to our room. I was very disappointed to find our room was the one behind the lifts (632) but don't like complaining so stuck it out.The first night was fine as we were very tired but after that most nights were a constant rumble of lift noise - kind of like a distant thunder storm. Maybe I should have requested a move?The room was very clean and we had a great view over the pool deck. It was a little disappointing to find no kitchen utensils except 2 glasses and 2 cups. With the small kitchen in the room it would have been nice to have some cutlery and plates. I may have missed information that said we could request these. The breakfast provided was fine although very busy and difficult to get a table some mornings so after a couple of days we didn't go back. The omelet station is a great idea but the lengthy queues were discouraging. The drinks and music at night were enjoyable the night we went and the band was great. I would suggest this hotel is better suited to families than couples and if I return when we have grandchildren will definitely stay here again.We really enjoyed our holiday and highly recommend Waikiki as a great destination.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites Waikiki for one week recently.It was our first time staying there, and had been recommended by an acquaintance.We knew about the breakfast buffet and manager's reception, and based on reviews here and elsewhere we decided to take the plunge.It was well worth it, and we luckily got a pool view room in the Hula tower which was very spacious compared to what we usually stay in while in Waikiki.As stated by others, the breakfast buffet is fantastic, and you can always find something that will keep you happy in the morning. We saved so much money and time from having this. Even better was the manager's reception with delicious cocktails served by the excellent barman along with light snacks. The biggest surprise was the excellent band that played Mon., Wed., Fri. and Saturday. They are so talented especially the lady singer in the band.The location is right on Lewers st. so there is alway something going on. The ABC store across the road is one of the best in Waikiki.The swimming pool and deck were beautiful, and you could always get a lounger even in the middle of the day.This comes to my only negative about the Embassy, the pool is taken over during the day by kids, with no separation and monitoring to give the adults a chance to cool down and relax. In the evening there are less kids, and you can enjoy the pool since it stays open pretty late. It there was some solution to this I would give the Embassy perfect marks.One other thing, the beach in this area though close by, is not as wide and is quite rocky compared to the area further up across from the Hyatt Regency.All in all, we had a wonderful time, and would return for sure.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Thank you Embassy Suites for another great stay.Our room was comfortable,clean and with beautiful view.Breakfast is excellent with lot of choices for everybody.Nightly reception with drinks and live band music is a must. Location is great too.Easy access to beach and all great restaurants.We are returning customers and we can see good changes :WI-FI is working much faster without everyday sign in,better organization at breakfast,everything was clean and everybody was extremely helpful.Embassy Suites Waikiki have great location and mostly their employees are the best . Thank you again and see you next year.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Location location location... walk through the lobby of a hotel across the road you are at the beach. Downstairs on Lewers St you have the beginning of the shopping and restaurant's of Waikiki. Wake up each day to a fully cooked made to order breakfast with all your favourite items. This is a first class breakfast that means you should not have to eat again for hours. The afternoon managers reception has two hours of very light appetizers and free alcoholic drinks. Who doesn't see the appeal. Finally the pool is great and tacos at the Yard house bar and restaurant are cheap and fantastic! It's not cheap but the rooms are big and all the extras make it a definite for the family

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I can't say enough good about this hotel. We stayed there for 9 nights in November and everyone from the front desk staff to housekeeping was very friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful. We had a slight bump on the eve of our arrival as I had booked a king bed away from the elevators. In an attempt to fulfill that request, we were sent to a room (away from the elevators) that had 2 queen beds. I called the desk and they apologized and offered to move us on day 3 to a corner room with a view. When that day arrived, my husband did not want to pack up and move so we declined and stayed in our original room. The staff was very accommodating in trying to get us into a room of our choice. We had a very restful and spacious suite with a partial ocean view. Breakfast was amazing as was the Manager's Reception, held nightly at no charge, offering drinks and snacks on the Grand Lanai. The band was fabulous and the setting very festive with tiki torches around the pool. The location of this hotel is just a short walk to the beach where we went for many sunset walks. Restaurants and shopping are all in close proximity to the hotel. We rented a car across the street in the Outrigger Hotel but soon realized we didn't need it as much as we thought we would. Easy turn in to the valet desk at Embassy Suites. I"m so glad we stayed at this hotel and not a Marriott managed property as the union led strikes were in full swing in front of their properties. Very noisy and disruptive! We could barely hear it inside our room! Embassy Suites, you rock!
user_name:
HapiTraveler
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Lovely property, great pool, good breakfast, but no mention of the striking workers. We couldn’t use one of our balconies as the striking workers were so loud. There was no mention of any sort of compensation for the disruption.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We spent 5 nights here in a 2 room suite with our family of 5.Location: the location of the hotel is great with lots to do, dining and shopping nearby and a short walk to the beach.Pool: The pool on the 4th floor is on the smaller size for a hotel this size. But I guess most guests they get are not interested in the pool as we only saw a few people there at any time.Room: this is an older hotel so the rooms are pretty tight. The fridge and microwave we had did not work and had to be swapped out. The microwave we got worked but made loud sound.The beds were good but the pull out sofa bed was very bad. It had no support and sagged even when a 5 year old slept on it. It made loud squeaky sounds all the time. We asked the hotel staff and they provided extra padding to make it better bit that made it impossible to close the bed back and severely restricted the usable space we had in the day time.Breakfast/happy hour:The hotel had a great breakfast buffet for all with a selection of pastries, custom omlet/egg and fresh fruit. They also have rice and miso for japanese style breakfast. All inclusive in your stay.They also gave kids little gifts like coloring books and keepsakes.There is also a happy hour reception every evening with snacks and free drinks. Vacalocious!!Concierge: the concierge desk seemed more interested in getting us to go on the timeshare presentation than actually helping us find stuff to do that we wanted. Had to resort to online research to find the tours etc.Summary: great location, awesome breakfast and happy hour. Passable room and other amenities.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Booked 8 nights from 18 October 2018. As usual ( our second visit) a friendly and helpful check in By Jenny but as we arrived from airport circa midday, had to wait until 3.00 pm for our room. since we are a bit choosy about a room Jenny bent over backwards and gave us a wonderful substitute room.Breakfast was reasonable with multiple choice self serve.Happy Hour FOC is marvellous and generous re choice over two hours and friendly barman "K" handles it single handed. AMAZING!!! After two stays at Embassy over many visits to HNL we would not stay anywhere else!A perfect Family Hotel professionaly run.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent! Digital key not so much. The room was amazing and the breakfast was out of this world. The cook to order breakfast was worth the wait. The options included rice, misu soup, and furukaki too!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Staff great. first room next to elevator shaft and not good if you are a light sleeper. Changed to an excellent room, on request.: spaciouse great views and quiet. very clean although a little old in appearance.breakfast good but could do with the odd change of choice. Loved the happy hours and the band at night.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Convenient to the airport, plenty of places to eat and shop, right next to the beach with great views. Great atmosphere and a ton of fun and where better to be than Hawaii! I would stay here again in the future

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Minnesota to Hawaii for a funeral...I have had decent experiences with the Hilton chain and love the amenities with the Embassys. This one in particular was beyond 10 stars. The staff was amazing, referred to us by by name, and made us feel at home. Housekeeping was on point! Room is probably the cleanest I have stayed in for a hotel. A short 5 minute walk to the beach, beautiful view, and an immaculate pool. Truly a heaven on earth experience.Breakfast was an excellent spread with many options from made to order omelets to miso soup!The managers reception was a wonderful highlight. Cocktails and a live music! I would go back in a heartbeat. Mahalo!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here for 5 nights in July ’18. We would definitely recommend Embassy Suites as an amazing place to stay in busy Waikiki.Pluses:- Fabulous location – you can walk everywhere, We also walked to Ala Moana along the beach front and got the trolley bus back.- Very spacious rooms. We had a 1 bdrm apartment. 2 Queen beds in bedroom plus fold out queen bed in lounge. Separate lounge room with kitchenette – mini fridge, sink, coffee etc.- Comfortable beds. Very clean & tidy.- Very friendly staff. Very efficient check in & check out.- Complimentary Happy hour & snacks for a couple of hours every afternoon. Breakfast buffet included – food is ok, not outstanding, but good.- Not one extra cost! No resort fees. Checkout extras were Zero.Minuses:- Pool is a bit small / shallow for older kids to enjoy. But we went to the beach instead.- In July, can’t get a sun lounger around the pool after about 4pm.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were served chilled juice upon our arrival at check-in and from that moment on, the stay was wonderful! I've stayed at other hotels in Oahu and it seems that neighboring room noise is unavoidable, even in high-end beachfront hotels but not so with Embassy. The evening reception and breakfast were standout events at this hotel as well. I loved the made-to-order omelet bar and different buffet options each day. Our room had a great view of the fireworks on Friday and ocean views as well. You will not regret staying at this hotel!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: It started with a brilliant check in, friendly & efficient. The room was nice big and roomy, bathroom a little dated but no issue. The pool is great if you have children maybe a bit noisy otherwise. The free drinks between 5.30 & 7.30pm was fantastic and had a nice atmosphere with band most nights. The hotel location in fantastic everything within 5 minutes including the beach. The staff especially cleaners super helpful & friendly. I rate this hotel 10/10 for families. I recommend the omelette station at breakfast. Lastly a higher floor the better, Hula tower was great. Thanks Embassy Suites you made our holiday.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Easily the best Embassy Suites that we've been to. The staff was amazing and helpful. We were greeted immediately at check in with a welcoming beverage. The rooms were luxurious and the managers reception was phenomenal.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hotel is centrally located to restaurants, shopping and of course the beach. Beach is less than 5 min walk from the hotel and there are tons of restaurants and shops you can walk to. There is even a "food truck" park that is literally across the street from the hotel.Customer service was excellent and the valets were always prompt to help retrieve our vehicle each day. The included buffet breakfast was decent and filling (great if you have small kids). The facilities were clean and housekeeping did an excellent job of tidying up every day.Would highly recommend this hotel if you want to be centrally located to all of the "action" in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have stayed at this property four times over the past 5 years and we have always enjoyed our stay. The location is great and the staff are very accommodating. The breakfast is great (and saves you time and money) and the evening reception is always fun! A good place for couples or families!
