hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: From check-in through check-out, this hotel ranks among the best I've experienced for a quick stay. Friendly and helpful staff and great very clean rooms (we occupied two). Would recommend this hotel to anyone, but get full ocean view for especially unique experience.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I highly recommend staying here. The property and rooms were clean and the staff were amazing. The complimentary breakfast is not just bagels and fruit. Wide variety of food and omelet bars. The service staff at breakfast was super friendly and attentive yet very professional.
user_name:
Sara Jane G
Santa Clara, California

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Enjoyed the Embassy Suites (again)! Last time 18 people, this time 4 + 2 local friends. We were treated well, had a great room and the beauty of this place (the hotel and the surroundings) is amazing! Love it, and recommend it highly! Only drawback, no birthday present or recognition from the hotel... :( - Next time!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Arrived from Australia in the am and found that the room was ready. The room was clean, spacious and we had a water view. Close to the beachfront, easy walking not only to the beach but shopping facilities. ABC shop opposite to get a variety of supplies such as food and drinks and some clothing. Their is a great band playing in and around the swimming pool on some evenings and combined with complimentary cocktails including beer and wine makes an excellent relaxing place to unwind after a days activities. Great breakfast excellent omelette served but plenty of other choices of food to satisfy all tastes. Given the recent storms in the area, I would recommend that you purchase a aqua shoe/sock prior to entering the surf.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: See my Tom Tom 2016 review which details why I think This Hotel is the best deal in town in terms of location, amenities, size and cleanliness of rooms and last but not least service. As a former personnel executive in the tourist industry I have high expectation of service and this branch of Embassy Suites excels thanks to their front desk manager Garrick. For the first time of my many stays at this ES I found the room assigned to us upon check in was sub par in terms of the air conditioning problem (was88 degrees in the room) tv problem and location and size of the room. Called front desk and advised Garrick of air conditioning problem. He immediately sent mechanic to fix the problem. Told Garrick we would go to lunch to see if air conditioning improved. Lo and behold when we returned from lunch Garrick had already made arrangements to change us to a much more suitable room that reflected the quality I had been accustomed to at ES. This is the kind of personal service that sets this Waikiki hotel apart from its surrounding competitors when you include their breakfasts and happy hours. Thank you Garrick.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The rooms were spacious and comfortable with the housekeeping very efficient. After leaving the room early morning we returned late morning and the room was already tidied up. The staff was very courteous and helpful. We enjoyed the breakfast with the fresh salad, miso soup, and the typical breakfast items, eggs, sausage, potatoes, fruit, and the omelette station. My son especially enjoyed the Natto (japanese fermented soybeans), although it was not to my taste. All the stores were within walking distance - very convenient. Overall, a great hotel to stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is very central, close to major shops, bus stops and beachfront. ABC shops all around to get supplies of food and drinks, milk, souvenirs, hats, clothes etc. Lots of nice restaurants close by too. Rooms are very spacious with a separate bedroom, lounge, kitchenette and bathroom. Very comfy and the only things missing are cutlery, plates and wine glasses but we soon acquired some. The breakfast is good with an omelette and egg station. The complimentary evening reception with cocktails, beer, wine and juices is great for 2 hours round the pool. Nibbles also supplied. Room was ready when we arrived early off the Pride of America cruise ship so were very happy with that.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Outstanding location, evening reception was outstanding especially with it being pool side, breakfast had a great selection, very good quality and friendly staff. Pool side service and quality of food was great. Entire stay was great, worth every penny.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a group of 10 coworkers. Everyone enjoyed the facilities and service. The breakfast and evening reception were a great touch. Everyone was so nice and helpful and treated us like we were family. I'd highly recommend!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed for 3 nights in Ocean View 1 bedroom Suite.Location is great, walk through Reef Hotel to beach.Spacious room, with good views.Comfy beds.Kitchenette, only has paper cups. No kitchen ware.Buffet breakfast is your choice of ommlete and a few other things.Free drinks by the pool in evening is a plus.A great stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Took my staff(9) to a conference in Hawaii for 2 weeks. I had stayed in this Hotel before. Everyone loved it! The central location is ideal. Walked everywhere. The breakfast buffet was extensive and always being refreshed. The rooms are clean and all the staff are so friendly. The highlight of the trip without a doubt was the band at Happy Hour. They played a wide selection of music. Being there for two weeks, we even got to know them a little and requested songs that they learned and played the following night. It was an amazing time.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: One-bedroom Suites have 2 Queen beds in bedroom, & 1 sofa bed in main lounge room, plus small 'kitchenette' with microwave, fridge & coffee maker, but no plates or cutlery. Good buffet breakfast, & 2-hour happy hour with huge selection of drinks, alcoholic & non-alcoholic, plus snacks, each afternoon. Beach very close, but main Waikiki beach about 5-10 mins easy walk away.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here for family holiday for one week in early October 2018 with a 5 year old and 6 month old from Melbourne, Australia. All rooms are suites. Our room on 27th floor wasn’t huge but great views with partial ocean views and well equipped to meet our needs. There is a kitchenette with kettle, microwave and sink but no oven and a small fridge. Separate living and sleeping areas. Bathroom is in the living room and would prefer ensuite but only minor criticism. Also our room wasn’t completely clean when we arrived with crumbs on floor. My daughter liked her sofa bed and our baby son slept well in his crib. Linen clean and room overall clean too. Delicious complimentary breakfasts every morning (coffee not great though) and every evening further complimentary cocktails and nibblies along with live music. Bar tender very friendly. Good cocktails. Very impressed. Mostly families at this hotel. Our daughter made some new friends. Brilliant position with ABC store across the road and shops nearby and great eateries. Waikiki Beach across the road. Not even a 2 minute walk. Quieter beach side of Waikiki Beach. Fireworks from Hawaiian Village visible from hotel. Friendly staff. Pool was a good size but very chlorinated. Kids pool and spa (extremely hot). Overall this was a fabulous hotel and our family will definitely be staying here again for our next Honolulu holiday. We loved it. Very relaxed by end of our trip and did not want to leave.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We thoroughly enjoyed the stay at the Embassy Suites - good clean rooms, awesome views and just the best location. A complimentary breakfast was great. Great concierge who helped plan some great activities. A great venue that helped make some great holiday memories.
user_location: Moss Vale, New South Wales, Australia
user_name:
Peter M
Moss Vale, New South Wales, Australia

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our first time in Hawaii, and we were so glad we stayed at Embassy Suites in Waikiki. The location was perfect! The hotel is clean, has great accommodations: breakfast, reception with drinks, wifi, laundry room, nice pool, and amazing staff. The rooms are nice, with very comfortable living and sleeping spaces. I would gladly come back the next time we're in Oahu!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Awesome experience, top to bottom. Great breakfast to start your day, and happy hour at the pool to cap it off. Great staff, clean rooms, close to everything. Fun, enthusiastic bar tenders. Large clean rooms.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: nice place.close to the beach and downtown. staff is friendly and the breakfast was of a great quality. parking is valet only, so be prepared to include that within your cost. everything is close by and I thought it a great place to stay for a hawaii first timer

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have travelled all over the world and stayed in many great hotels but none can compare with Embassy Suites Waikiki.I have just booked my third stay for 18 days for early next year and wouldn't think of staying anywhere else.Every time I've stayed there they exceed my expectations on every level. On my last visit I arrived around 9am and was told my room was ready and was welcome to have a complementary breakfast. I've never experenced that kind of service from any other hotel before, as you usually have to wait the customary 3pm checkin time, just what I needed after travelling for more than 24 hours.I can't rate highly enough all the staff who are very helpful, friendly and always ready to please.This hotel has so much to offer, the location is central, rooms are generous, smooth checkin, amazing breakfast and I should also mention happy hour with its real Hawaiian vibe, no reason to leave the hotel really.I recommend this hotel, not just for the hotel but for the total experience.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great setup - all suite hotel - good sized room with a separate bedroom and a small sink, microwave coffee maker, kettle and fridge for your own food storage. Includes a buffet breakfast and complimentary cocktails and snacks in the evening. The idea is great - and it's all based around the pool area in the middle of the two hotels towers. The staff were always polite, there was always enough food and the view from our rooms was great. Don't go expecting a quiet or romantic stay - it's a good destination for families - but the hotel handles the variety of guests well and competently. Positioned only one block back from the beach, it was a good spot to observe and get to everything in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Clean tidy hotel Great location within Waikiki Close to shops and beach Liked room had living space to separate bedroomBreakfast included everyday helps with expense while on holidays and 2 hour cocktails and nibbles every night was also great bonus Enjoyed the band which also played Would recommend to others

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: While the hotel is well located one block from the beach, the 'service' is appalling. The guy that checked us in was argumentative, and I had to ask for our room to be serviced one day because it looked like our whole floor haf been forgotten.The 'included' breakfast is abysmal and not worth eating.We paid top dollar to stay at this hotel due to it's location, but I've come to the conclusion that if thr property is 'by Hilton' then I won't stay there.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great rate on a huge room steps from Waikiki Beach. Awesome buffet breakfast, so dinner was the only daily meal cost. Drinks at the reception (free) were the BOMB. Always stay at Embassy Suites if available.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is our 6th visit to Embassy Suites, always the rooms are clean and staff always welcoming. Would highly recommend a higher floor and its it’s worth paying that bit extra for an ocean view room. Great position for getting around and rooms are reasonable large.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We loved Embassy suites. The location, rooms, breakfast and housekeeping were excellent.Very easy access to taxis as they were on the premises.Shops all around.Staff were very friendly, especially housekeeping staff.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We recently stayed at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beachwalk in early September for 8 nights. Everything was right outside the hotel! The beach, shopping centers, restaurants, bus stops, ABC stores, Longs Drugstore, etc. We walked everywhere, don't need a car. Believe it or not, we really enjoyed staying at this Embassy Suites. Just the 2 of us...our kids have grown. Even though there were alot of families staying there, we didn't mind. It was nice seeing everyone enjoying their time together at the Embassy Suites.The breakfast was so delicious every morning. Plenty of choices! We always enjoyed our cooked to order omelette, miso soup, white rice and fresh fruits. We ate so much pineapple during our stay ( very sweet) and miss it so much already.When possible, we also returned for the evening Reception for drinks, snacks and nice entertainment ( 3-4 person ensemble). They played familiar songs and sometimes a few Hawaiian selections.We really felt comfortable doing our entire stay.It's true that the hotel is a little outdated but everything is clean and well maintained. It's probably one of the nicer Embassy Suites we've stayed in. The staff is always helpful and accomodating to your needs and sincerely want you to have a memorable time. Staying in Waikiki is very expensive but we feel the Embassy Suites is a great value for the money.We saved so much money having breakfast included every morning, evening reception, larger Accommodations and NO RESORT FEES! If you calculate your daily savings and multiply the number of days staying, you'll be really amazed! We miss being there already and can't wait to go back soon!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed here in September 2018 with our two daughters (aged 5 and 8) for 11 nights. This hotel is located in a great spot, really close to the beach, trolley stop, and all major attractions. Also only a 3 minute walk to watch the Friday night fireworks. We had an ocean view room and the sunsets from our lanai were spectacular.The breakfast buffet is a bonus - it saves you from walking around trying to find somewhere to eat. The omelette stations were also a nice touch if you wanted something cooked fresh.The rooms itself are quite good - I wouldn't go so far as to say they are 'massive' but it's certainly handy to have the separation between the adults and the children. The cleaners did a great job of daily servicing. Afternoon drinks at the pool are also a good family bonus, particularly if you are on the way home from the beach. The pool does get very crowded, particularly with unsupervised kids - I'm surprised there are not more injuries! The 'all inclusive' price by the hotel is great, no extra costs for towels etc. if you want to go to the beach. I probably wouldn't bother with the tour desk, it's just an agency booking station (same as anywhere else in Waikiki). You will find better (and less expensive) tours with a 5 minute Google search from your hotel room. Same applies for car hire.All up, we really enjoyed this place as a family location, but if I was staying in Waikiki as a couple I'd probably look at other options.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Really nice hotel, loved the breakfast buffet, location was great easy access to trolley and short walk to the beach. Hotel room was nice and bed was very comfortable. Nice view from the balcony. Expedia travel was located in the hotel and you could schedule tours, etc. Lana was very nice and helpful. Pool was small and crowded with kids so would not recommend for single adults. At 5:30 everyday by the pool they free drinks and music most days and some snacks. Staff was nice except for the check in staff was hit and miss some were nice and helpful some not. Breakfast saves you money.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: All areas of the hotel, rooms etc are looking a bit tired, although there seems to be renovations going on. Only did the free buffet breakfast once - a bit of a bun fight with lots of greedy people, but food was OK. Staff are very friendly and obliging.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: we recently stayed at the Embassy early this month and can i just say that we were very impressed. Firstly the location is ideal - many restaurants for all budgets, shopping,coffee and abc shops. Myself and family were very lucky to get a spacious 1 bed part ocean view on the 21 st floor. the views were incredible and the room/bathroom was absolutely spotless, one of the cleanest hotels ive ever stayed in definitely 5 star standard in that category. Also the staff were lovely and best value for money in Waikiki in regards to breakfast included and afternoon drinks and how wonderful no pesky resort fees either. We loved our stay and when we return again to Hawaii we will definitely include a stay back at the Embassy. Thank you for a wonderful stay :)

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We are on our last day at this hotel and it’s been definitely worth the money. Came with family for my birthday and have had a fantastic time. Breakfast is included each day. No hidden “extra” resort fees and 2 hours of “happy hour” included every night with nibbles and all drinks included. Kids were swimming every night whilst we enjoyed the sunset and cocktails. Lots of kids so kids made loads of new friends. Fantastic family holiday. We don’t want to leave.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel is located about 25 minutes from the airport. Check in went very smooth and quick.. The hotel is about a block-and-a-half from the beach and a short walk to Waikiki Beach as well... it's also centrally located around several stores and restaurants such as Roy's and Ruth Chris and ABC convenience stores... Loved the free breakfast buffet from 6:30 a.m. to 10 a.m. everyday which included warm breakfast food such as eggs, bacon, sausage, an omelet station, pancakes, and fruitThey also had a complimentary happy hour every night which served variety of alcoholic beverages within the pool locationThe room was very clean ... We had 2 double queen beds and also a kitchenette, with a sink and refrigerator , in-room, and separate safe living area and a nice big balcony..The pool was pretty busy each day but their lawn chairs were very comfortable.. the whirlpool was a nice amenity... but the pool is on the smaller side and had lots of kids ....that was the only downside but we always were able to find an open chair in the back...there are two poolside bars to choose from and a walk around serverOverall the trip was amazing except for the crowds... people are everywhere... lines are everywhere kids are everywhere so just expect to be patient... Room Tip: I would suggest getting a room on a higher floor since there's a lot of the tall Hotel buildings blocking the Views - since a lot of the other hotels are blocking the ocean, not sure if it would be worth getting a partial ocean view room unless it's on a higher floor

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Only a four night stay, but wished it was longer. An amazing corner suite, ocean view at front and pool view to the side with a balcony for each. Good sized lounge area and huge bedroom, large bathroom, with fridge, sink and coffee machine at the room entry. Free drinks and nibbles every afternoon for two hours and live music every second day. Breakfast was included and was more than adequate. Short walk to the beach or the main street and many nearby restaurants.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy suites Waikiki beach walk is in a fantastic location. Although not right on the beach it's less than 100 metres and your in the water.Breakfast is great and included as is the evening reception. Snacks and drinks included. Only hic cup was Internet was slow at times.Rooms are spacious and comfortable. Have a living and sleep areas seperate. Both rooms have balconys with occean views. Pool is nice but far too shallow for my liking. Hot tub is very hot. All staff here are happy and helpful. Go out of there way to assist your every needs. Highly recommend embassy suites. Local bus is very cheap and the stop is 40 metres from hotel. Trolley is about 50.metres away. Lots of restaurants at door step. ABC convenience store across the road and one in complex. Pool towels provided unlimited. Pool area is very nice and pool chairs etc very comfortable. Spotlessly clean hotel. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites is situated at the center of Waikiki and very accessible to all especially the beach, shopping centers, restaurants, etc. Our suite were being cleaned everyday. The daily breakfast was always excellent and the evening receptions were awesome.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here 8 days, great & helpful staff all round. The “local help” desk helped us book tours and give directions. The view from the room we had was awesome. We could see the water, city, park, and mountains.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Spent 6 nights there. The furniture in the room was old and not in good shape. The couch had little support left and very uncomfortable. Beds were not firm at all. Had problems getting hot water out the sink in bathroom.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Enjoyed our family time here. Location was excellent with quick and easy access to the beach, many eating places near by and a short walk to lots of stores. Free hot breakfast buffet in the mornings for our entire family and free evening reception times was a bonus! My husband loved that!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We recently stayed at this hotel (Aloha tower, 17th floor) and found it to be a nice hotel in a great location. Friendly staff and spacious suites, which is great when you have kids and appreciate the extra room a suite provides. Not so great is access to the balconies. I was a bit worried about the kids (4 and 6) opening the door and going out there, in my opinion, the child safety latches are good but not high enough, the kids could reach them, no problem. Also, we had a balcony, but you couldn’t really sit out there, they were so tiny you could not comfortably sit out there without contorting your body on a weird angle!The pool/pool area is nice but it gets full on crazy busy with the kids everywhere, especially in the afternoon. This is fine if you have kids (and even then it can be annoying having kids squirting you in the face with various pool toys), but some kid free adults might find this annoying, especially trying to relax in the spa, which is right next to the pool. Not sure if it’s possible for an adults only pool/spa area?Buffet breakfast was nice, although some variety would have been good. You can order eggs cooked to your liking (not just omelettes), which I didn’t realise until the second last day of our stay, much better than eating those disgusting scrambled, over cooked eggs provided.Managers special happy hour was great, they sure don’t scrimp on the alcohol! The queues can get quite long, although we didn’t seem to have a problem as we went to the other bar, in the corner, which not many people realised, was a lot quieter, with hardly anyone there. The band was just awesome and got the crowd fired up most nights.We stayed here during Hurricane Lane and were always kept informed of the situation by hotel management, which was reassuring.A couple of things to note, which did not impress me, overcharging on some basic services. I realise you are a business and need to make a profit but overcharging on international calls is just ridiculous and left me a bit annoyed. Over $30 US for an international call (which cost me less than $10 US in Maui the previous week) and $38 US for one night’s parking ($14 US in Maui) is just a little too steep and difficult to stomach. When questioning staff member upon checkout, shrugs her shoulders and replies “I don’t know” and in the same sentence proceeds to ask me “charge it to the credit card on file?”. Yeah, thanks, but no thanks.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The best family staycation location for us on Oʻahu. The complimentary buffet breakfast is quite filling. Our kids thoroughly enjoy spending the entire day in the pool making new friends each time we stay. Managers Reception is the best with the services of Keola.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: As return guests to Embassy Suites, we were definitely not disappointed. The hotel rooms are very good for what is listed as a 3.5 / 4 star hotel. Quite spacious, very clean, great amenities and very comfy bed. Location is excellent. Very short stroll to the beach, shops and many food and restaurant options. Pool area very good and never a problem finding a lounge to relax in. Great breakfast included and managers reception fantastic! Don’t miss either. But seriously it stands out from all others for the amazing staff. From reception, housekeeping, breakfast, bar staff, security or the other wonderful service staff that deliver pool side snacks or room service and tidy up around the pool area...I couldn’t fault them. Definitely rate the staff 5 star! Will hopefully return again sometime soon.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have stayed over half a dozen time at this hotel when visiting Waikiki area. The staff is extremely friendly and will do what it takes to ensure that you are happy, within their abilities. The breakfast area staff is probably the best of all Hilton hotels that we have encountered. They make you feel as this is your second home!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: So impressed by helpful everyone was from check-in drinks were brought to my family before we sat down, to parking and my door always being opened, the bell-hops made sure we never carried our own bags, and maid service was amazing. Everyone was extremely helpful over and above!! The food delicious!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: A lovely hotel with good complimentary offerings and a nice large pool deck. They had a very good covers band playing three nights a week with free drinks and the free breakfasts and in room snacks set us up well for the day. We did feel that the pool area needed more umbrellas, particularly over the loungers as there is little shade otherwise. All in all though the staff and hotel were excellent and we will be coming back soon.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites is in a great location; one block from the beach and close, but not too close, to the busy part of Waikiki. The hotel offers spacious rooms, a complimentary breakfast with made to order omelettes and a wide variety of side dishes and drinks, and a happy hour with complimentary appetizers, beer, wine, and cocktails. In addition, the happy hour had live music four times a week. All of the Embassy Suite staff members were friendly, professional, and helpful.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great family hotel. Our suite has a sofa bed in the living room and two queen beds in the bedroom. It has a kitchenette as well. The daily breakfast buffet was great, lots of food catered to both North American guests and Asian guests (miso soup, Kimchi, rice etc). The hotel location was good, beach access is about 5 mins walk away and about 15 mins walk to International Market Place.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our first stay at the Embassy Suites by Hilton Waikiki Beach Walk and all I can say is we can't wait to return. On arrival we were greeted with a genuine Aloha, provided with refreshing glasses of fruit juice and checked in efficiently. Our room was spacious and clean, and the furnishings had a Hawaiian/tropical theme which was a nice. The included breakfast was buffet style plus an omlette/egg cooked to order station. There was plenty of choice to suit everyone with even choices well beyond just orange and apple juice in terms of drinks. The included manager's reception is very generous with nibbles such as nachos fixings, pretzels and vegies and dip, and the free drink choices included cocktails like Blue Hawaii and Mai Tai which really made out first trip to Oahu special. While the hotel was clearly pretty full, we could always find a table or sun lounge within a few minutes with plenty of friendly, happy staff clearing things quickly. The location is a great spot for both the beach and shopping. Can't fault our stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Every single person we came in contact with who works at Embassy Suites Beachwalk during our entire stay was absolutely above and beyond friendly and extremely helpful! It was by far the best part of our vacation! We were threatened by Hurricane Lane during our stay but the staff all made us feel very safe and kept us thoroughly informed of the situation and what precautionary steps we needed to take. They were all thoroughly trained for a situation like this and I felt like my family and I were in extremely good hands! I have stayed at this particular hotel 4 times over the last 10 years and I am equally as certain that this will be the hotel I stay at next time we vacation in Waikiki! A big THANK YOU to ALL of the staff at Embassy Suites Beachwalk Waikiki!! A special shout out to the omelet chefs, the entire breakfast bussing crew and to the housekeeping staff!! They all work so hard and with such great smiles!! Massive high fives to you all!! Thank you!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Arrived at this hotel prior to checkin and were allocated a room straight away, but unfortunately it was room 1701 which was next to the lift and that kept us awake along with noisey people talking outside waiting. Went to reception the following morning and they were very helpful and pleasant and said if we could be ready soon they had another room away from the lifts. We moved to 730 which was in a different tower. Fantastic views of the ocean and the pool area. Loved it.This hotel has everything, the price you see is what you pay, many hotels here have a resort fee payable when stay from US$10 per day. This hotel has a cooked breakfast which has a minimal choice but certainly the basics. In the afternoon they hold a Managers Reception around the pool area between 5:30 and 7:30, a very very generous selection of free spirits,cocktails wines and beers along with nibbles. Some nights a talented group of musicians entertain with an array of popular music.Would I stay here again........you bet !!!!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Location was awesome, a 5 minute walk to the beach, lots of ABC stores and restaurants within walking distance. Very clean room and cleaned on a daily basis. I wish I had an ocean view but was all booked up. Staff was friendly. Pool area is a decent size and gets lots of sun. Pool always had clean towels and chairs were very comfortable. I found the pool has a lot of small children every day so it was not quiet. Complimentary breakfast is very good with awesome eggs cooked to order but it can get very crowded. Valet parking is $38 a day but they bring you your car within 3-5 minutes every time. They were excellent. Highly recommended in all areas!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel would be great if you had young children but as a group of 4 adults we were not able to access the swimming pool as it was full of children - there is no adults only poolAlso there are sun loungers but NO UMBRELLAS so not able to lie on the lounger without being sunburnt - a minor solution by the very wealthy Hilton group would be to provide sun umbrellas I would have thought - these are only available and attached to dining tables so not able to be moved near the pool which was full of children!! The buffet is very basic with a choice of 2 fruits and stodgy fried food with a very long wait for an omelette - no idea what the bread choice was as not labelled with ingredients - would help if we knew what was in the purple bread rolls - staff didn't know any of the bread types - food provided mainly for Japanese not WesternersEvening happy times were a chopped up raw vegetable and chips with orange cheese sauce - this was the same every day so need to buy your own nibbles/dinner

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We absolutely loved the atmosphere, added features and customer service at Embassy, and will definitely return again. Firstly the cocktail reception - sensational service, drinks and food. We did not miss any of these cocktail receptions while staying there and it was a great way to unwind before going out for dinner or at the end of a swim in the pool. The breakfast was simple but good, and despite lines most mornings, we were still able to move quickly through including at the omelette station. The pool was a good temperature, although the spa was probably a bit too hot. If you are there without children, just be aware that the pool is a child's playground all afternoon and into the evening. We otherwise loved the pool area and will enjoy bringing our kids back with us next time.The room itself was clean and it was handy to have a living area. The king bed was comfortable. We had a partial ocean view, and at the end of our corridor there was an open door and balcony with an ocean view. All in all - a great place to stay and it is amazing value considering the inclusions and the lack of resort fees that other hotels now impose.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Room was spacious with a nice view. Continental breakfast is always a plus, especially the omelettes. The front desk staff was able to point me in the direction of Starbucks when I woke up at 4:30 AM still on NY time!
user_name:
samnyc237
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We traveled there in August 2018. Having previously stayed at other hotels in Waikiki (Marriott Courtyard, Queen Kapiolani and Outrigger Waikiki) this place is our favourite! We will definitely be coming back.The breakfast buffet is a real bonus, saving our family $100's on the overall cost of the trip. The morning breakfast and the evening reception really gives you a sense of community. If you are interested in meeting other families it's a great place to start. They give all adults a yellow band as proof you are a hotel guest, don't lose it! I heard someone asking to get another one and they were told it's a $70 replacement fee. I think if you know that ahead of time you're more careful with it. The rooms were really nice, having two rooms and two TV's was a bonus as we were travelling with 3 teenage kids (2 boys 1 girl). We thought the fold out couch would be uncomfortable, as ours is at home, but it was surprisingly comfortable. The beds were delightful, so comfortable.We were located on the 2nd floor just outside of the elevators (hey we didn't pay for a view so we didn't get one :) ) There was no noise issues whatsoever! I was surprised and pleased. Of course if you open the doors to the lanai you're going to get street noise.The hotel is located close to the beach with beautiful turtles off the breakwater. I would recommend the Hale Kona snack shack. For us it was great, we sat in a comfy chair having cocktails (both virgin and alcoholic) watching the kids in the beach. If you're a patron of the shack the chairs and shade are free! There was a hire place next door to the snack shack that you could rent floating islands (like a big thick yoga mat that floats) for $10 an hour or water bikes $25 for 1/2 an our (trust me after peddling one of these things 1/2 an hour is enough!). If you don't want to rent, go to the ABC store and buy a floating ring for $2.50 they have just as much fun with that too!When travelling around the island I would recommend taking the bus, we've been there heaps of times and have never hired a car. Our only luxury for this trip was to get a limo from the airport to the hotel. We went to Top Limousine Services, the price for a limo was comparable to a shuttle and or taxi for the 5 of us. We figured it was a nice touch, our kids were impressed as it was a surprise for them! There are plenty of restaurants nearby and you don't have to walk far to get good food or to access Ross Dress for Less (a must for families on a budget with teenagers that like name brands like Nike, Adidas and Under Armour). I would recommend that when you arrive, go to Longs Drugs and the other end of the block and get your snacks and drinks for the kids. It's cheaper there and you have more variety. The ABC store is fine too, I just preferred Longs.We didn't interact with the staff very much but ensured that we did tip, especially in the free events like breakfast and the evening reception, always take a few dollars down with you - it doesn't hurt. We never had any issues with housekeeping either. We ensured we tipped $5 every day. That ensured we had LOTS of shampoo, towels and coffee. We even got a lovely note from the housekeeper thanking us which was a nice touch.If you are considering staying at this hotel do it! We found it exception value for money with our family of 5, good rooms, good service and great location.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Worthwhile hotel in the action area of Waikiki beachGreat breakfast and evening drinks included with stay is A very nice plus! Staff was very friendly and helpful. Easy walk to shopping, beach and many parks such as ala Moana.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Absolutely loved our 12 nights at the Embassy. We love that the all rooms have a sleeping area and living area which give us space to stretch out. We loved that the kitchen had a microwave enabling us to heat up left over food from the previous nights dining for the kids when they were ‘starving’. Clean and comfortable, the room service is top notch and the amenities are of a good quality. Staff are friendly and eager to please across the board.The complimentary breakfast was a bonus. Buffet food, is buffet food and you can choose to eat the whole mass cooked variety or eat toast/bagel and fruit. I never complain about buffet breakfasts as no one ever said you had to load your plate with bacon, hash browns, scrambled ‘eggs’ and little sausages. They do have an omelette station which is a good option for fresh cooked.The evening managers reception was also a bonus. It lacks the atmosphere of a beach front bar but you’re not paying $15 a cocktail....it’s on the house. Snacks are provided. Again, nothing hugely special but you’re not paying for it. You have choices. It’s a bonus, you don’t have to partake.We ordered room service and ate in one night (pizza) which was really nice and the price was on par with going down the road to get a take away pizza.I would recommend this place to families. I don’t think it would be a place that a couple wanting romance would go. It’s a family place.We would certainly return to Embassy Waikiki. Location, location, large rooms and wonderful staff.Thanks for having us, Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk:)

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I will start with the good... the location is fantastic. Most of the staff are lovely (with the exception of the guy looking for wrist bands at the reception). The rooms are spacious and our view from the Hula Tower was fantastic. Comfortable beds. The rooms are getting a little tired though. This is our second stay at this hotel and it is showing its age.The breakfast was good. It got a bit repetitive though as there was not a huge variety. Omelettes were great. Just get there early to avoid the big crowds.The pool is way too small for a resort this big. It was full of kids and not what I would call super relaxing. There were kids all over the place (and I have no issue with kids... I was travelling with my kids... it was just super crowded). It is a very family oriented hotel so if you are looking for a quiet romantic adult type place to stay this is not it. Great for families though. But it’s busy. Housekeeping was ok. Not stellar. I paid extra for a “premium suite” (don’t bother, it is not worth it). I was constantly having to call to get things like our coffee refreshed because it was not done. So this was an irritant. One day our room did not get serviced at all. So we had to call and have I done while we were out for dinner. Again, not the end of the world but when you are staying somewhere this expensive you do not want to have to ask for things you paid for multiple times.Check out and check in was great. Fast and no issues.I don’t know that I will be rushing back though (unless I got a crazy good deal).

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a wonderful hotel for families since there are 2 rooms and it is close to Waikiki Beach where all of the action is. The free breakfast is the best I've ever had! The omelet bar is amazing. I also liked the cocktail hour with yummy Blue Hawaii's and a great live band, along with munchies. The rooms are quiet, the beds are soft, and bathroom is spacious. I would recommend a room on a higher level. We stayed on the 19th floor. If you can get an ocean view, this would also be good. We stayed in the Aloha Tower and loved it. I highly recommend this place.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here recently on business. This is Waikiki so primarily a tourist hotel but had no problems with business needs. They welcomed me with a small glass of ice cold pineapple/fruit juice. A nice local touch. Loved the Grand Lanai with live music and appetizers and drinks in the evening on the 4th floor. Free breakfast was also at the Grand Lanai each morning (make sure you get there between 6:30 and 7:15 to beat the masses). It's Hawaii so taking advantage of relaxing outside in the beautiful weather was perfect, even taking my laptop to do some work on the Grand Lanai. This is a very solid, nice hotel but not necessarily luxurious if that's your thing. I personally have no desire to pay a few couple extra hundred $$ for luxury. It is clean and has everything you would need. Rate was pretty good compared to other hotels - a little less than $300 per night before tax. Typical Embassy Suite setup with living area and separate bedroom. If you've never stayed at an Embassy Suites, this is a great hotel for families since alll rooms are set up this way where kids and parents have their own space however small. Staff was all friendly and helpful. I used the workout room once and it was above average size (not a "closet" workout room like some smaller hotels) and had most equipment including several treadmills, elliptical, basic weights, etc.Tip: Ask for a room on 4th floor. This is same floor as Grand Lanai so only took me about 60 seconds from my room to breakfast or evening reception plus it was easy to take the stairs down to the street as there can be longer waits for the elevators at peak times. Location was good with easy walk to all the main shopping and restaurants in Waikiki Beach. I never had to leave in the evening to eat a nice dinner or check out the activity in Waikiki. If you do need to go some where, Uber cars are plentiful and you'll have no trouble getting one here.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I travelled to the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk two years in a row, once in March 2017 and again in March 2018, and this hotel is the best, and probably the best hotel in Waikiki for SO many reasons. We loved each of our stays and love to call this hotel our second home. Breakfast: From families to couples to solo travel, this hotel is for everyone. It's especially great for families looking for a more budget-friendly option in Waikiki Beach in the way that the hotel provides a complimentary breakfast buffet where you can order eggs in any style you'd prefer. This occurs daily and it's the best amenity the hotel provides. For families, Hawaii can be an expensive destination if one eats out every single day, but due to the free breakfast included in your room rate, you do not have to worry about spending $100 USD on breakfast, which can easily be spent in the tourist hub of Waikiki. The breakfast is fantastic, and is the best breakfast we have had in all of the Embassy Suites hotels we have been to (we have visited many). The breakfast staff is also very friendly, and I would like to say a big thank you to Rose, who is so friendly and made both of our stays extra special. There are so many choices of breakfast foods that will leave you full for the majority of the day until dinnertime.The hotel also has a nightly Manager's Reception, which is basically a happy hour with free drinks and snacks by the pool on the fourth floor (the pool area is also gorgeous with many lounge chairs to relax on). Make use of this and try a Mai Tai.Check-In: The check-in process at this hotel has always been so fast and friendly. The hotel's lobby is located right beside where you can park your vehicle via valet (costs $36 nightly but is so worth it; the staff is so friendly and brings out your car so quickly). When you check-in, you and your family receive a nice glass of guava juice which shows that you're starting your stay right.Rooms: The rooms at the Embassy Suites are lovely, and perfect for a longer stay on the Hawaiian island of Oahu. The rooms are decorated Hawaiian style, and the two-room one bedroom suite with two queen beds is where we have stayed in our last two visits. The best part of the room are the two lanais (balconies), which allow you to relax after a nice day at the beach or out exploring. City views are the best as you're able to see what is going on below you on Waikiki's Beachwalk, the nicest area of Waikiki Beach. Each room provides you with bath towels, of course, in addition to beach towels which you can use throughout your stay (new ones are added daily). The rooms are large and perfect for a Hawaiian stay.The cleaning services are amazing at this hotel; our room was always perfectly clean. I would like to mention Nu Yang, who cleaned our room for the duration of our stay. She was awesome and went above and beyond to make our stay more enjoyable.Location: This hotel is located in THE BEST PART OF OAHU: Waikiki Beach. It is less than a five-minute walk to bustling Kalakaua Ave, which is a street full of shops, restaurants and entertainment such as the Royal Hawaiian Center's frequent concerts. My family always enjoyed strolling along the street in the evening and nighttime after a lovely day at the beach or hiking. Waikiki Beach is about a ten-minute walk from the hotel, and it is such a gorgeous beach. However, I do not recommend spending your entire trip in Waikiki Beach or else you cannot say you experienced Hawaii or even the island of Oahu. The hotel's prime location, being only 20 minutes from Honolulu's International Airport and less than an hour's drive to anywhere on the island allows you to explore all that the island has to offer. Eat a hearty breakfast in the morning and head off and see the entire island. It's paradise.Without a doubt, you must visit this hotel if you are planning a trip to Oahu and the Waikiki Beach area. After an excellent two stays in the past, we know we will be back to this amazing hotel in the near future. It is one of the best hotels we've stayed at.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: At the beginning, this hotel felt further from Kalakaua avenue than I thought. Kalakaua to me IS Waikiki Beach. The shops, restaurants and beach on that stretch is what I know and love. But then I discovered that I was just a short 10 min walk to the center of Kalakaua ave where the Market is (more on the market later, so much has changed) and was relieved. BUT THEN (yes, again) I discovered the beach access point directly across the street from this hotel and was VERY happy with the view of MY Diamond Head from the beach! You can see more of it than you can from the other part of the beach which is accessed via Kalakaua! AND it felt private!! The hotel is GREAT. Rooms are cozy (if you care for views, I'd spring for a room with a nice view). We had a 1 bedroom king suite and it was very nice! The showers are gooood. Daily breakfast buffet was delish, some of the options changed daily and was a nice surprise! And who doesn't love an omelette station? 2 stations and the lines moved fast (I would go between 8 and 9 am). Also the FREE happy hour nightly reception with the live band is a very nice touch. This hotel definitely makes you feel like you are appreciated, welcome and provides that vacation feel. Here, you'll be close to everything and the grounds are beautiful! They did take a while one day to get to our room to clean it. But we didn't care about that. We ran into one of the housekeepers in the hall, she was super apologetic about not getting to our room yet, but we just grabbed some fresh towels and toiletries and told her not to worry! The rest of our days, they were on point and we had a clean room every time we came back to it.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The staff is friendly and helpful. Upon check in we were greeted with guava juice that was refreshing after a long flight. Carrie was an awesome manager at the front desk who took good care of us and even texted each day to ask if we need anything. You’ll usually get that kind of service in hotels if you are a high roller our platinum club member. Not at Embassy Suites Beachwalk in Waikiki; everyone is greeted that way. After a few days there they remember you by name and it’s like passing by friends on your way out. Our maid Nena was awesome! Anything we requested on our notepad she fulfilled; extra towels, shampoos, lotions. Even the cooks and busboys at our free full breakfast and waitresses are pleasantly friendly and hospitable. The bell and especially the valet guys and gals were all awesome! I cannot find any flaws at this hotel other than our stay was too short. And my family all know me to be very picky! Because of this we are planning on coming back again and again! Maybe even holding our family reunion there. Thank You Embassy Suites for a wonderful Hawaiian experience for me and my family! Keep up that great work! And just a side note: please people, tip your waiters, waitresses, valets, etc. Hawaii is expensive to live in, These wonderful people don’t get paid enough for their hard work to make you happy. A dollar or two per customer would be a nice way to say aloha and mahalo for your service.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Staff at breakfast very nice. Housekeeping sweet. With a baby need more trash cans. Happy hour busy but go to the panini bar not the front bar. Pool nice and great view. Registration staff quick and pleasant.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed for 5 people from 9th to 15th August. There is a pool on the 4th floor, with late afternoon snacks and free drink service (including alcohol including cocktail) and breakfast every morning took care of me everyday. It was easy to access 5 minutes to the beach and 5 minutes to the Kalakaua Avenue, so I had a dreamlike life every day. The children were also very satisfied with the pool, from the 4th floor poolside, the fireworks which can be launched from Hilton Rainbow Village on Friday 20: 00 could be seen well. The room was also suitable for families and was relaxingly comfortable not to be ashamed of the name of suites. The woman of the room service is also friendly and I want to make it a strong candidate when coming to Hawaii next time.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: A great hotel for families! The complementary breakfast was awesome and the evening reception was great! The pool is very kid friendly. It’s walkimg distance to everything and the suites are a MUST for kids
user_name:
Soraya S
Redondo Beach, United States

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hotel was close to everything, short walk to the beach. Rooms were spacious and clean, staff very friendly. Walls are thin as we could always hear our neighbour, ( could hear a cough through the walls) The only downside was the slow elevators. There were only two for the whole tower of 21 floors! Sometimes we had to wait in a line up that went down the main hallway for about two elevators before we got on. The complimentary breakfast and managers reception was nice to have available.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Really enjoyed the hotel. Location was great -in the middle of restaraunts, shops, close to the beach.Rooms big and clean, breakfast very tasty, staff friendly, nice saulty pool and jacuzzi and absolute fav was daily managers reception with free drinks and snacks.Live music was also great.Also enjoyed that beach towels were supplied to the room daily. Definitely recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Location was great service was nice but pricey parking and hungry birds during breakfast time. If you have the option request a room away from elevators. The noise woke me many times throughout the night.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: A lovely and relaxing business trip that I brought family along. Great Hawaiian, American, and Asian food and drinks. Clean and spacious rooms. Excellent pool and yoga classes. Steps away from excellent beach park and super dining and shopping.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Mahalo, Embassy Suites WBW, for a wonderful vacation! The suites are...sweet. Our family had the pleasure of having both suites facing the beach walk stage and we enjoyed the Tuesday live music and hula performance from our balconies. One suite overlooked the pool and views to the ocean with views of surfers each morning. The complementary breakfast was yummy, generous and great start to each day. And the location is perfect: just across the street from a nice stretch of beach (the little park behind the Army Museum is a bonus), just far enough off the main strip to be quieter than some other hotels, and an easy walk or drive to most activities.There are so many shops and restaurants to choose from nearby, but don't overlook the little places like the Beachwalk Cafe downstairs (Lychee gelato is amazing!) or the Steak Shack on the beach.The staff is so friendly and nice. A special mahalo nui to manager Sandra K., who went above and beyond to help us with suites the day before our vacation.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had breakfast at the hotel every morning for 11 days. Cary Murayama (breakfast supervisor) and his staff of Jay, Ryan, Resty and Kendra were the dream team for starting the day at breakfast. Cary was especially helpful because I had gotten sick from an allergic reaction to insect repellant and was under doctor’s care and could only eat miso soup and rice for a few days. Cary made sure that my family had a bowl of miso soup and rice to help me get well. I can’t praise Cary and his crew enough.....they are friendly, hardworking and always available to help hotel guests with a smile. Excellent customer service!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Let me start off by saying, this is a nice property very convenient, staff super nice, very clean.However this place can improve with some small changes. The manager reception , free drinks are nice ,however we were getting really tired of the same snacks every night, The cheese and chips got old and stale by the third day, why not try some bite size appetizers ,or fresh fruit something. The pool situation crazy They need to make it bigger or add an adult pool ,always crowded with to many kids.We didn't use it once. The front desk staff not accommodate at all. When we checked in they never told us about the Hotel,it was very rushed, this hotel was just ok ,it could use a more tropical Hawaiian feel they catered to certain people and this was very noticeable. There are nicer Hotels around

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have stayed here twice before over the years and always loved it, it seems things have changed since then. We had been traveling around Canada and looking forward to the last leg of the trip, that changed on arrival. I had requested a floor higher up well they directed us to a room on the bottom floor that looked out to the back lane with all the food trucks on top of that the room smelt mouldy had a small window I couldn't even believe it was a guest room and we where staying nine nights. Within minutes I contacted reception asking to be changed which they did to another room that was on the other side looking out to the abc store. This was a huge improvement although not great. The catch was we could stay in here for a night then they would change us to a better room again on the third night. Apparently this room the abc room was booked out the next night. So we moved twice in two nights couldn't unpack moved our own suit cases it could only get better and thank god the third room was what we wanted. The rooms are now dated and need an upgrade they haven't really changed in years. The breakfast was so so the chef is the only thing that saves it. The place was packed I am sure people come in that are not guests, eg guests friends nobody checks this at breakfast and free cocktail time at night. They always used to check guests passes on previous stays. The cleaning staff are great as are the wait staff at breakfast. Reception staff are average at best. Overall wouldn't recommend for the money we will be trying somewhere new next time. Very disappointed things have gone down hill

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: What an amazing place! Friendly staff, fun happy hour, live music, beautiful views. Plus the breakfasts in the morning are great! My mom and I have been coming here for three years in a row, and we are continually impressed and delighted by this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed at this hotel for 14 nights in a 1 bedroom twin bed suite with my husband and 2 young children. From the minute we arrived the hospitality from the staff was fantastic. We were greeted with a guava juice and our bags taken care of until we were able to check in. The hotel and rooms are clean and staff are more than accommodating always willing to help. We were even loaned a beach umbrella and boogie boards for the kids the whole time we were there. The breakfast and welcome reception are a great commodity. The only criticism I would have is that given the length of time we were there the breakfast selection became repetitive and so resorted to going out a few times. The pool is great, but was a bit crowded the times we were there. The location of this property is great, walking distance to everything: beach, shops, restaurants and convenience stores. Mahalo to all staff!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Evening reception and morning full breakfast were great! Staff is helpful and friendly. Rooms were clean and valet parking, while pricey was normally fast and issue free. Complimentary WiFi worked fine.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: From the cleaning staff, kitchen staff, management team, concierge staff, evening entertainment team and the overall layout of the hotel including it's location I was very pleased! I would recommend this hotel and look forward to going back!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I loved the service at this hotel, and especially that the staff clearly worked hard to get me a room with an ocean view as a Diamond member. The first night they had a pool view only, but then were able to switch me to the 19th floor with a clear view of the Pacific Ocean from the lanai and part of the bedroom and the living room. The upgrade, with my Diamond status, was at no extra cost.I really like having the extra room that comes with an all-suite hotel.They give you a wrist band that provides access to breakfast (fairly standard for a Hilton property, although with lots of Japanese items given the source of many tourists), But the evening reception was my favorite. There were snacks (so-so) but also fancy fruity cocktails included at no extra charge. I enjoyed the Mai Tais and something they called "Hawaiian Punch" that was definitely what I remember from childhood!A really good choice for visitors to Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites - Waikiki was the perfect stay for our family (with 3 young children). It had all we needed in a holiday - close walking proximity to beaches, restaurants, shops and transport. Room was clean, good size, well accommodated with beautiful partial ocean views. Breakfast was convenient, easy & delicious! The pool very handy & gymnasium was great. We would definitely stay here again & highly recommend!!! A********

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here at the end of June and met up with extended family at the start of our Hawaii holiday.Our check-in process was easy, and although our rooms were not ready till after 3pm, they looked after our bags while we explored the local area.There was a food truck park right across the road, as well as an oath directly to the beach (5 mins to Waikiki!) we loved the walkway that takes you round the beach and pretty much everything you need is within walking distance!The hotel is great, staff very accommodating and we loved the managers drinks (which we unfortunately did not make it to until our last night)! Complimentary cocktails and nibbles for 2 hours each evening - well worth the effort!The pool area is great to cool off and relax but is fairly small and was busy!! The gym is very small and extremely stuffy - so if you want to use it I would suggest going outside of peak morning hours. We stayed in their 2 bedroom suites which were basically adjoining rooms - but perfect for what we needed. They also extended the check out time which was great. I would definitely recommend joining their Loyalty scheme prior and you can get early check-in and late check-out on request.A great stay, perfect location and we will return when we holiday again in Hawaii!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Recently, my family stayed at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk. The overall property is very nice and is in a great location in Waikiki. I did notice that the staff at the reservation desks, while friendly, were also hurried and stressed. I did not get a warm, island-welcome feeling that you expect from a trip to Hawaii, but rather felt more like I was staying in downtown Manhattan. It felt more like we entered a big assembly line. On checkout day, we truly needed a late checkout time due to our flight schedule, but after repeated requests - and even as a Hilton Honors member - they repeatedly said no and made no effort to accommodate the requests. I recommend that they increase their staff and show a bit more flexibility. One exception is with the housekeeping and breakfast-buffet staff, who were extremely friendly and accommodating. Again, their location is great and the overall property is nice, but a more friendly, humble, and human approach with guests would make a big difference.
user_name:
MaxwellBart
St. Louis, Missouri, United States

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We, 6 of us stayed here for four nights in a two bedrooms hotel suite on 20th floor in Hula Tower. Our booking included four buffet breakfast and four evening reception. First of all I must interpolate here to say that the receptionist was really friendly and helpful. She was Lorena. We went very early in order to leave our luggage with the bell boy before we could check in at 3 pm. It was then just at about 8 am. Lorena checked us in and informed me she would try to give us the rooms as soon as possible. She also allowed us to have free buffet breakfast. At about 11.12 am,Oren’s texted to inform me our suite was ready for us. The suite consisted of one two queen sized beds bedroom, one super king size bed bedroom, one lounge, one kitchenette and two toilets and two entrance doors. The rooms were spacious, clean and cosy. There were three balconies with ocean view. The house keepers were very good. We never ran short of amenities like toilets paper hand tissues and tooth paste as there was abundant reserve. Honestly I never experienced this albeit I’m a frequent picky traveler. The location of the hotel was very good. It is almost in the central Waikiki. However the quality and variety of food for breakfast were not acceptable to me. It was very basic consisting of steamed rice, bacons, sausages, chips, salads, two egg stations for omelettes and fried eggs, basic cereals, basic local fruits and basic toast and muffins. There was no cappuccino or flat white but just normal coffee and tea. The food for breakfast were exactly same during our four nights’ stay. The plates were not dry with water still in them. We had to wipe them on dry tissues. The two egg stations were too busy all the time. The wait was at least 15 minutes. The eating area was fairly big but very congested as there were too many people. There were lots of birds there. They would eat your breakfast before you if you left it unattended on the table. You should fully cover it up with a piece of tissue paper. I personally was very disgusted by the birds as they might spread disease if we ate the food contaminated by them. The evening complimentary reception was crap, just chips, raw red carrots and cauliflowers and cheap drink. They served alcoholic drink on plastic cups. I would prefer not to have a glass of complimentary beer or wine than to give a dollar tip! The swimming pool was small, only good for children.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have stayed in Embassy Suites across the USA, this is by far the best of the Embassy Suites! The staff from the bell desk to the buffet are attentive and caring. The hotel is a short walk from the beach and in the heart of amazing shopping, dining and entertainment. I took my first YOGA class and the instructor was knowledgeable and even did the class in both English and Japanese. All in the peaceful setting of the hotel pool and cabanas!! I travel for work often, this is a place that I keep coming back too, because it's like home! Enjoy your travels

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family of 11 stayed here for 3 nights in May 2012 was a beautiful hotel great food and awesome location close to everything we had a wonderful time staff were lovely and service was exceptional thank you

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The amazing breakfasts and happy hours kept our family full. In between, breakfast and happy hour, we visited various attractions near the hotel, including surfing on Waikiki, window shopping at the various high end stores, going to the beach to watch fireworks. We had an amazing view of the ocean!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is our second visit almost a year apart, we decided to come back because the hotel is so well located in the middle of Waikiki.After booking but before arriving, I phoned the hotel and requested a larger room which the hotel kindly honoured. When you’ve got one child in the sofa bed and one in a portacot you need all the space you can get!Having the breakfast buffet also makes it a lot easier with two kids. You’re straight down in the lift and not having a lengthy wait at a restaurant to get a table.The pool is on the small side but having researched many of Waikiki’s hotels many of the hotel pools are small. Take a walk down to the lagoon by the Hilton, it’s massive with lots of space.All in all a great place to stay, very friendly staff and a great location...

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel was in a great location. We were able to walk to a lot of places. The beach was close. There were a lot of places to eat in the surrounding area. The room was nice. Having a seperate living room helps when someone is still trying to sleep in the bedroom.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I wanted to say, we had an excellent stay there, we are extremely satisfied.I must recommend Victor, when we first came there around 7am from Australia, he was so nice, he said our room wasn’t ready, however he gave us a card to go to the fourth floor and have some breakfast. Then we went for a walk, and came back. Victor came over to us and said our room was ready by 10.30am. Wow, we were so happy as my hubby and son were tired.Please thank Victor, he went out of his way. Great customer service.Loved how we had complimentary newspapers.The fully cooked breakfast everyday was an absolute bonus. The food was amazing. We tried the nightly cocktails, I must admit I had two sips of the cocktail, and it was too strong , but everyone else seem to like themWe absolutely loved how the bedrooms were separated from the living room.Everything was fantastic.The only thing I can think of that you do need is a clothes line that runs across the shower, just to hang your smalls there.Thank you for a great stay. Highly recommend the Embassy.Definately stay here againMahalo

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites itself is a great facility - spacious, decent price, nice location. But the concierge service told us that if we take a tour of the newly renovated Hilton Waikiki we will get $150 activity credit. We turned up to find it wasn't a tour at all: it was a full-on timeshare sales presentation. I think this is poor form from Hilton. We had great service from all staff at Embassy Suites but being flat out lied to is not OK. It spoiled our stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Yes I stayed here again. What is wrong with me?There are several people at the pool who are extremely friendly. They appreciate and recognize customers who frequent the hotel. Dennis, Keolu, Shane, Daniel, and PeLani (I’m sorry- I know I spelled some names wrong) and a couple others that I don’t know their names, are amazing and great examples of customer service. The hotel management needs to focus on hiring more employees like them. Now they have arm bands they make you wear to happy hour and breakfast. I have two issues with this. 1) they advertise where you are staying - I’m not interested in giving free advertising to them - but really it is a safety issue. I’m female. Anyone sees it on my arm outside the hotel and they know where I am staying. Yes I know I can take it off. But that leads to issue two. 2). They do not have multiple sizes and it was tight on my husbands arm. He took it off and forgot it in the car. The front desk wouldn’t give him another one and made him get it out of the car which was valet parked! This was hugely inconvenient. There is a woman who stands at the pool and she questions everyone. She is super rude about it and acts like everyone is trying to sneak in to the pool. The first night I was already at the pool with my arm band and I had my husbands in my purse waiting for him. She escorted him over to me to make sure he had an armband. She makes me uncomfortable and she is the main reason I probably won’t stay there again. I appreciate not allowing non guests to use the facility but it is a problem when the person doing that makes guests feel unwelcome.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the hotel from June 23 -28th. Great hotel, very clean, comfy beds. Breakfast was great, great quality of food and Happy hour in the evening was great. Nice pool and Breakfast area. One place to consider.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Let me start off by expressing my displeasure with trip advisor. When they were simply a reviewing tool, it was great....but now they are trying the market with booking, and it is just like any other booking tool....no longer a good service....a huge disappointment. This hotel is great, but the internet is like something you would expect from a super 8...keeps kicking me off. I had to go to a coffee shop when I needed the internet it was so bad. Very disappointed. Like I said, the rest of it was great.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is located in a perfect location. Evenly spaced between the beach and a plethora of dining and shopping options! If you have kids keep in mind hotel pool is rather small and is fairly crowded. But with the complimentary hot ready to order breakfast and complimentary evening reception it's easy to overlook the small pool! Definitely worth the money!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have stayed at this hotel every year since 2010. This resort continues to be a fantastic location to enjoy our vacation. We have just returned from another two week stay. The best thing about this resort? The staff! Everyone from the front desk to housekeeping to the food beverage staff are so helpful and welcoming. Special thanks to Carey, Resty, Keola and Aldin for always making our vacation so enjoyable. We will be back next year!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here for several nights with our infant daughter in February. As Hilton gold members, we were upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite which was amazing. We had a view of Diamond Head and the Royal Hawaiian “pink palace.” The rooms were spacious and clean- furniture seemed a bit older and had a campy old school Hawaiian vibe going on. The location can’t be beat- right in the heart of Waikiki within walking distance of the beach, restaurants, shops etc. Breakfast and happy hour were crowded and nothing to write home about- but would definitely stay here again for the location and spacious rooms.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We are a family of 2 Adults and 3 Children and we all thoroughly loved our recent stay at this property. The one bedroom was just big enough to accommodate all of us for 6 nights, although the sofa bed was slightly uncomfortable. The room was clean and well maintained and always well stocked with enough toiletries and towels for all of us. The breakfast and nightly Managers Reception were a great inclusion. The property is in a great location, close to shopping, restaurants the bus and the beach. The majority of staff we encountered were very friendly and did an exceptional job. The one sour note for us was my son lost his favourite teddy bear in the room (we believe it must have been bundled up in the bedding by mistake) and when we informed the woman at reception upon check out she couldn't have been less interested if she's tried.We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Had a great time! Embassy suites had a great staff, willing to go the extra mile. The breakfast was good ,cook to order eggs,a great way to start the day. Location was outstanding, 2 minute walk to the beach and 5 minutes from the shopping area

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family of 5 (including 3 teenage children) had a fabulous stay at Embassy Suites. We had a 1 bedroom suite which had 2 queen beds and a sofa bed in the lounge area. It was a little crowded but it was the best value family accommodation we could find in super expensive Waikiki.Pros - The staff are very friendly, complimentary breakfast, fabulous happy hour with music and drinks and in a good location, great pool which is possibly one of the largest in Waikiki.Cons - the priceSummary - would definitely recommend staying here for a family holiday.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family stayed at the Embassy Suites Waikiki for a week and it was great. The hotel's location was perfect - walkable to almost everything, and near shuttle/bus routes when needed. The staff were uniformly great - they obviously have a strong sense of hospitality. Having the suite with a sofa bed made it comfortable for 2 adults and a teenager. Plenty of room for all of us. Daily breakfast was good with lots of choices. We'll definitely be back when we return to Honolulu!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location, great breakfast, great evening reception, good room & friendly staff. But let down a bit by terrible WiFi, not good TV reception where a bunch of the stations didn’t work properly (signal dropout) and no cutlery or crockery in room. All of these are easily fixed. I would recommend this hotel to families with young kids as the pool is really for them as is basically a kiddie wading pool and not suitable for adult enjoyment.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
