review_body: We stayed here for a few nights before a cruise. Hotel is in a good location - close to the beach and walking distance to many restaurants. The rooms are spacious and the included breakfast was nice. Everyone at the hotel was very nice and friendly. Even though this hotel was not beachfront, it was only a 5 minute walk to the beach.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I've stayed at the Embassy Suites Waikiki many times, and this trip did not disappoint. We had a beautiful view of the Halekulani and the ocean beyond. The evening reception entertainers were fabulous--a father with his three sons and sister, each of whom is incredibly talented. Breakfast was superb every day, although no papaya was provided--just pineapple and melon. Every staff member was helpful and courteous. Nightly rates are not the best, but the rooms are nicely furnished, clean, roomy and comfortable.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great experience overall. The house keeping staff extremely friendly and helpful and always at your service. In particular Yuet chun, she was friendly, courteous, and extremely welcoming. If I ever return I would return to the same hotel due to people like her, your wonderful bartender Keua, and parking attendant Gabriel. The band that plays on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday, Kanilau, was also amazing and extremely entertaining during the happy hour. They should play daily, way too quiet on Tuesdays and Thursdays. The daily breakfast and happy hour experience were great and extremely enjoyable. I would definitely return to this hotel, great experience, and great for large families.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We arrived in Honolulu and came straight to the hotel. They have an open reception area and provided some cold fruit juice for us as we waited. We were a party of 7 so we had two two-bedroom suites. The rooms had everything we needed. Ours had a view of the pool. It was quiet, cool, plenty of room. I always wish hotels provided more than one luggage rack, but I ended up using a table. Neutrogena toiletries, beach towels, everything you could want at breakfast. We went to the reception in the evening and enjoyed drinks and snacks (nachos, veggies, goldfish crackers). All staff we encountered were helpful. We had 6 hours from checkout to when a shuttle came to pick us up and were able to use the hospitality room for 30 minutes. Access to the beach is right across the street. Check out the information in the room and the coupon book. Some nice amenities are offered. Only great things to say about this hotel!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Check-in was pain-less. Our room was easy to find and clean. Housekeeping was SUPER friendly and accommodating. Dennis the pool bartender is a grumpy bunny...seriously. I would go buy a drink from him just to see how incredibly grumpy he is. Somehow it was still very entertaining. Valets were always quick and friendly. You can see the ocean even though it isn't oceanfront and the beach is very easy to access from this location.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Perfect place to stay! We are a family of 5 and 2 grandparents that shared a 2 bedroom suite (one king, 2 queen beds and the sofa couch - suite 823)We had such a great time we are coming back again February 2019! Every single staff member we encountered was friendly and had amazing service! Breakfast was everything we could want! The adults ate sensibly and the kids indulged in donuts and danishes (hey, we’re on holidays!). Happy hour was great! The kids loved being able to fill up their own drinks at the pop and juice machines while we had some of the nibbles. You could also bring food in from the food trucks across the street or order some of their appetizers (we didn’t try the latter. Maybe next time).It is very close to the beach and we rented beach chairs and umbrella from castle shore beach services for the best deal in Waikiki! ($35 all day). Super easy access to the trolleys and easy walk to everywhere! One afternoon we spent by the pool and ordered lunch and it was amazing food. We enjoyed a croissant sandwich with ham fries and Kalua pig nachos! Amazing!!Can’t wait to be back!! Thanks for such a memorable holiday, Embassy Suites!! Can’t wait to be back!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Overall, a very nice hotel with easy access to shopping, nightlife, and the beach. The staff were very kind and courteous and the evening reception was great each night. The rooms were comfortable and clean, as well. Very pleased with our stay and would likely return.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Would have preferred a hotel on the beach. If you like a busier area, accessible to many shops and restaurants, this is a perfect fit. The breakfast buffet was greatly appreciated, the rooms spacious for our family of four (traveled with our college aged kids), and the hotel clean. The courtesy room at the end of our stay was a pleasant surprise, allowing us with a place to shower before our flight took off. We were able to store our luggage safely as well. The valet parking and charges to park were almost like being back in Boston. We had amazing views of the ocean from our lanai. The refrig and microwave were nice plusses as well. Worth a stay!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Arrived early from cruise ship and had to wait for a room, but that was pleasant enough and the room was large, clean, quiet, and comfortable. Unless you arrive early, the breakfast buffet is crowded. A little odd that the bathroom does not have a vent or lock on the sliding door, but otherwise acceptable.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent hotel in the heart on Waikiki. Great buffet breakfast every morning & happy hour in the evening awesome! Would definately stay here again. ABC store just across the road & fabulous restaurants all at your doorstep.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here before departing on our cruise around the islands. Upon arrival we were provided Hawaiian drinks, as we checked in. Rooms were really nice and evenings offered poolside music and drinks. Restaurant was excellent for breakfast, did not eat any other time there.We also enjoyed visiting Waikiki Beach just a short distance away, as well nice local shops behind the hotel. Highly recommended!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We just stayed 7 nights in a one bedroom suite with our 3 kids. We had a great view of diamond head and the ocean (partial) from the 20th floor. Hula tower.We were really impressed with the facilities. Rooms were fresh, clean and a good size. The whole place looked better in person than any pics I’ve seen online.Breakfast was awesome. Great selection. It got busy but it was always well managed. We loved the managers reception. Great drinks & snacks. The breakfast and reception made this hotel great value for money. Location is ideal. Can walk to all the best shops and restaurants in 5-10 minutes. Beach was only 5 mins. Pink line trolley stop is a two minute walk.We loved this place. Kids were so sad to leave. We would recommend this hotel to families with kids.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The location is very close to everything in Waikiki. We walked to all the shopping so we did not need to rent a car. Hotel staffs are friendly and helpful, check in and out are so fast, they even gave us free drinks. They also offered free breakfast with plenty of foods choices, we had a wonderful time on vacation in Hawaii.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: What a great hotel. We stayed here for two nights prior to our Hawaiian cruise. We arrived at 9 p.m. and were greeted with a beautiful yummy mango drink. I have stayed at ten plus Embassy Suites in my life and this was HANDS DOWN the most beautiful. We were in a two bedroom suite which worked fantastic for our family of five. Adults in one room; boys in another and our daughter in the living room. Our view was nothing great but such an easy walk to the beach to breathe in the beautiful Pacific. We loved the breakfast in the morning although we never made it to the Managers Reception at night.We swam for hours each night. The pool is sooooo beautiful. We were in the heart of Waikiki with fantastic shopping near by. We loved the fourth floor with the gym one floor below and the pool & breakfast on the same floor. Oh yea - check out the food trucks across from the hotel. So yum!I loved this hotel!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here the first week of June for our honeymoon and could not have had a better experience! The rooms were spacious and we had a great view of both the pool and the ocean. The breakfast was good and we had a good variety of options. We didn't get a chance to attend the nightly manager reception, but it appeared to be well attended. We had a blast and would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a wonderful time at this centrally located hotel. The breakfast was wonderful and the manager's reception was great with the live entertainment and free drinks with snacks. The staff was tops in my book. Walking distance to the beach, dining and shopping. You really don't have to go anywhere because everything is right there. We will definitely be returning.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: It was a nice place to stay but the streets we're difficult to navigate and the entrance was hidden in the streets. They absolutely charge for parking per night ($38) so not to take a vehicle but it was clean and the breakfast buffet was incredible. Beautiful and directly across the street from a convenience store.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This property is located in the heart of Waikiki. Many rooms have ocean views. The ocean view is also available on the rooftop terrace. We had two of our three children with us, so the upgrade to the 2 bedroom suite was very nice. Pool and spa on terrace level. Cooked to order breakfast omelet and fresh fruits, hot coffee for breakfast. Also includes a guest laundry which is important when traveling and going to beach. Guest service professionals are the hallmark of this property. Every possible courtesy is extended.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here for 2 nights before moving to another hotel. I must say this hotel is awesome. When we checked in, they gave us a box of macadamia nut chocolates and POG juice. The front desk staff were so friendly and accommodating. Our room was amazing. We got a suite with an ocean view, which came with 2 balconies. Our room was clean and spacious. The pool was really nice and we loved the free drinks and snacks during happy hour. The location was perfect. Around so many restaurants and shopping where you can just walk. The beach isnt a far walk either. Its just about a 5 min walk. I was kinda sad that we only stayed for 2 days but we booked a week at Aulani resort. Next time we stay at Waikiki, we will definitely stay here again. We did have a problem of not having hot water for the evening and a false fire alarm in the EARLY morning but its ok. We enjoyed our stay!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at Embassy Suites for the second time in 2 years, for 14 nights. We had a 2 bedroom apartment as we holiday with another couple and it was fantastic. In the middle of the 2 king bedrooms is a lounge area and kitchenette, perfect for togetherness or privacy if you choose. The staff are friendly and helpful, the complimentary breakfast and 'happy hour' are a great addition easing the overall cost of the holiday. The staff at the events desk guided us through booking car hire, several tours and recommended a luau of which was an amazing evening. The location is great, walking distance to Waikiki and also Ala Moana Shopping Centre. Can't wait to go back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites for 5 nights and loved our stay. Hotel staff were all amazing. Complimentary breakfast and Managers evenings were great and added a lot of value to our stay. The band on the Wednesday and Friday night were phenomenal! Stayed in a 1 bedroom suite which was nice to have a separate living and sleeping area especially with the kids. Great location close to everything including beach, restaraunt, shops, trolley stop etc. Would definitely recommend and stay again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Room exceptionally clean and spacious. Beds ultra comfortable. Friendly service. Complimentary breakfast was great. Evening reception varied between chips, veggies and dip. We especially enjoyed the family band that played every other evening during the reception. Valet only parking but was quick and friendly.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We truly enjoyed our stay! Staff was very welcoming and friendly. Valet service was convenient and fast. We were able to walk to Waikiki Beach and surrounding restaurants easily. The Manager’s Reception is a very nice touch!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The embassy suites include a lot of extras. Firstly, you don't just get a room, you get a suite, so a seperate area for socialising. I really liked this, particularly as we did a 12 night stay here during April, 2017. The hotel is very close to everything, walking distance to beach, shops, dining and also to access the little buses that take you everywhere. As breakfast is included it really makes for a great way to save money. On a couple of mornings we decided to eat out and the minimum cost for a sit down, cooked breakfast for two at venues nearby was around $100 - so it really pays to eat your breakfast at the hotel. Breakfast if buffet style with plenty of options to choose from. The Happy Hour (which is actually 2 hours) is very generous. And when they say happy hour, they mean you don't pay anything. Having said that, I felt it was only right to tip the bartender. They also mix the drinks pretty strong! There is a street food van area that opens up in the evening across the road which is a fun way to dine out. The famous Waikiki Beach is a short walk away so no transport required.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We recently stayed a couple of nights prior to taking a cruise in Honolulu and were very impressed with this hotel. It is only a short walk to Waikiki Beach (they provide beach towels to use) and is conveniently located to shopping and restaurants (there are actually some cool food trucks right next to the hotel). They have a good breakfast buffet and an evening complimentary happy hour, which was totally unexpected. Staff was friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed for a week with two of our adult children. While we researched many things to do in Waikiki the free cocktails from 5.30 were the most enticing thing for them. Loved the central location, the lack of ‘resort fee’, and breakfast inclusion. From Australia these things meant no surprises. Rooms were lovely and spacious too. Highly recommended for families with adult children. Or any children! Concierge, reception and bell desk were exemplary with service. Loved the water bottle filling station but odd that plastic straws and polystyrene cups still used - my only criticism.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent location, bigger than most hotel rooms so it was comfy with kids. The concierge desk was phenomenal—— before we went, we spoke to Ross and planned out all of the excursions. He was super helpful and the best part is, since we live in Florida and have a 5 hour time difference, we emailed him back and forth and chose what we wanted—- including a circle island tour, bike and hike, and helicopter tour. He called them and made all of the arrangements during Hawaii time. He even got us in at a restaurant that was not available when I was trying to book it online! The prices were the same as if I did it on my own. This really was a huge help in planning our vacation. My only regret was that we never got to meet Ross in person while we were there because we were so busy! Oh, and the breakfast here... totally worth the extra dollars especially if you have a family with young children. They had a great selection! The pool here is fantastic with the little ones... the kiddie pool is nicely separated from the deeper areas and compared to the other hotel where we stayed during our convention.... it was heated! Glad we stayed here and I highly recommend it for families!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Definitely not a five star hotel but great location, spotlessly clean and comfortable for a longer stay. We stayed a week and were moved from a one bedroom (very nice) to a two bedroom suite as our internet just wouldn't work. We had to be quite assertive in getting it fixed and this required speaking to ATT ourselves which was not really how I wanted to spend my time. But Tammy the afternoon manager was delightfully helpful and understanding of our issue and speedily sorted us out. The pool area was nice and a great place to relax after pounding through Ala Moana and the streets of Waikiki. The evening drinks were surprisingly good and as well as a selection of lurid cocktails there were reasonable wines and a gin and tonic (and other spirits) available. The breakfast unfortunately was an evil selection of plastic wrapped apples (why?), white bread of the cheapest variety, sugary cereal, sugary drinks, hot but not boiling water for tea and syrup and oatmeal that Goldilocks would declare- too tasteless and too much like warm wallpaper paste. The egg station was good- nice omelettes. I got decent food from Whole Foods and mainly avoided the awful breakfast.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here in May 2018. Reasonable rate for Waikiki. Room was really small. Pool was really small, but there was a lot of activity. Manager's free booze and appetizers for happy hour was nice. Waikiki beach is about a 10 min walk through busy streets. Lots of restaurants and shopping around. I'd probably stay of Waikiki beach next time, but it'll cost me.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We checked into the property to send a wonderful winter break and we loved every moment. It was the best balance of service and attention but allow you to explore on your own. When we need answers to questions or assistance with photos, the staff was beyond helpful. The location was perfect with a block away from the beach. That is wonderful for rest but a quick walk to the beautiful beaches. Location was central to retail district however again away from the noise. It was a joyous balance for tourism and recharging. We loved it and you will too!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Generally, we love staying at Embassy Suites properties. While this particular property is beautiful, the rooms we booked were old and dated. The elevators were slow in the Aloha tower. We enjoyed the breakfasts and the evening happy hours, especially the live entertainment that occurs on Monday, Wednesday and Friday. The hotel is walking distance to the beach and great restaurants and high end shopping is nearby.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We just returned from an 11 night stay here and we loved it! We’d come off a 24 hour journey and they allowed us to check in early so that we could get some rest. The hotel room was perfect for us as we have small children and the bedroom was separate to the living area which meant we didn’t have to put the kids to bed and either go to bed ourselves or sit in the dark! This is really hard to find in Waikiki. Beds were really comfortable and bathroom and the room in general a really good size. The free breakfast was amazing with heaps of variety and you really can’t go past the two hour free happy hour by the pool complete with snacks and live music 3 days a week. Location was great with restaurants and shops nearby and only a short walk to the beach. If/when we return to Waikiki we would more than likely book here again, can’t recommend it enough!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Definitely will be planning to return to this location! Great area and convenient to food and shopping. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Fourth floor room by the pool was terrific location. Local band at evening reception was also very good and played variety of music.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our room had a living room area, a wet bar, a large bathroom and a large bedroom with two queen beds. The mattresses are wonderful! It includes a full buffet breakfast each day. The breakfast area is large and airy, but very, very crowded. The buffet was kept clean. Pool is very nice and the afternoon cocktail hour is great. The housekeeping staff is wonderful as well as the front desk. Located is good central location. Note, not on the beach.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: On arrival a quick friendly and efficient check in to a lovely presented 1 Bedroom Suite with Ocean View. The Hotel situated between Beach Walk and Lewers Streets is well positioned for beach or shopping.Breakfast in our tariff was substantial and accessible adjacent to the pool area, ground floor.The evening cocktail hour, complimentary by Embassy, is wonderful and an opportunity to chat with fellow guests around the pool. Thank you Embassy!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our second time in 2 years staying in a 1 bedroom villa with our 3 year old daughter. The location is great, very central. The pool area is excellent for little ones and the Manager's Reception is a great touch.We wont be staying here again, though, for the following reasons:1. The air conditioning units need a clean, or something. My partner and I were both completely congested after one night here and remained so for the duration of our stay. It eased in the fresh air.2. The breakfast options are very limited and we couldn't find anything we'd eat for ourselves or our daughter so it was a waste (I'm sure it hasn't changed since the 80s). We come from Melbourne, where there is an abundance of really fresh, healthy foods, and this was not that. Soy or almond milk was a non starter.3. Very noisy- the band play a few times a week and if you want to put little ones down and have a pool facing room it's just not possible. Granted they were done by 8pm the couple of nights they played when we were there, but speaking to other guests it didnt stop until 10pm the night before we arrived (perhaps ask for a room facing away from the pool to avoid this, but then you'll miss the view and seeing the Friday night fireworks).4. The lack of kitchen facilities- there is a microwave, bar fridge and kettle. No way to cook your own meals, which is hard when you're struggling to find fresh healthy food in the area.5. The sofa bed, which my partner and I slept on was horribly hard and squeaked every time we moved, waking us). So a one bedder does sleep 4 as advertised but only 2 comfortably.We'll be back to the area but looking at alternative accommodation.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: this hotel is well maintained and only a short walk to the beach. complimentary breakfast was excellent. plenty of seating and staff. in addition the rooms were not dated and were in good condition. As a Diamond member who travels a lot, I would highly recommend this property.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Will definitely recommend to friends and family this place is amazing with such friendly staff , we loved everything about our stay. Can’t wait to go again next year we will stay at the same hotel again definitely worth it

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Just returned from a 9 night stay at the Embassy Suites by Hilton. Nice all suite hotel but does has have some down points. Upon arrival, the check-in staff member that helped us could have been more welcoming, maybe he was having a bad day. Our room wasn't ready yet but the couple that we were travelling with who was attended by another staff member was allocated their suite so we left our luggage in their room until ours was ready, a few hours later. Suite was nice, fairly spacious. Beds were comfortable, shower lacked water pressure but adequate. We had a 1 bedroom suite with 2 double beds. Balcony was small but ok. It's not on the beach but it's only a 5 minute walk and Starbucks is on the way which is great. Pool is quite small and not very deep, more suited to children. It can get very busy in the afternoons so we didn't use very much, maybe a couple of times. Afternoon cocktails were a nice bonus and there is even entertainment. Breakfast for my liking was average and need to get there before 9:30 as they start to clear everything by about 9:45 or so as they close at 10:00. It is very close to all the shopping and some great restaurants. Lifts can be slow. Certainly not a bad place to stay, would probably stay there again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Aloha! We had such a great time at this hotel. This was our very first time in Honolulu. What made it beyond great was our go to guy, Ross, at the Concierge. We had planned some activities before our trip but didn’t quite know where to go or how to actually have a starting point. Ross emailed us when we had certain concerns and always answered our questions. We couldn’t have had the best time ever without him and his planning. He really knows his stuff! And we couldn’t have been happier with our vacation. I hope his manager is reading this because he is a very true and great asset to Hilton. Oh and the breakfast and staff were awesome. Thank you!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is in a great location. Breakfast was great. It is not on the beach, but very close to beach access. The balconies are huge! You can use your phone as a room key, and the hotel feels secure because you have to use your room key to use the elevator. The room itself is quite spacious. Great place to stay!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Location was great- close to the beach, surrounded by great restaurants & shopping.Rooms were comfortable & vey clean.Staff were also friendly, helpful & provided great service.Free buffet breakfast was great value and of a high quality as was the nightly inclusive Managers Reception/happy hour.Overall it was a great stay and I would stay in this hotel again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel is located about 1 block to Waikiki Beach and also about to same distance to all shopping and dining area in Waikiki. The staff is very friendly and willing to assist you when you need them. There is a Starbucks about 50 feet to Hotel and overall this hotel is clean and if it fits your budget - recommended.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: From the moment we arrived our experience exceeded our expectations. The suite was comfortable and clean, the managers reception was well run, the band was great and complimentary breakfast topped it off. We could walk anywhere we wanted to go in Waikiki Beach. Thanks for a great start to our trip.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel was perfect for our family. The one bedroom suite was big and provided us enough space. From our balcony we could see the ocean even though we booked the city view. The breakfast had a wide variety of options to choose from and the location of the hotel was a short walk to the beach, less than 5 mins with two kids. The hotel staff was super nice and we would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Recently returned from a 12 day stay at Embassy Suites after having this referred to us by a few people. im so glad we chose to stay here as it really is so close to the beach, shopping and restaurants. Our room which housed 2 adults and 3 kids during the stay was a decent size and consisted of 2 queen beds and a pull out sofa, the beds were super comfy and the fold out sofa was surprisingly comfortable too. The bathroom was a good size and great water pressure from the shower.The complimentary breakfast was a really valuable inclusion of our stay as food in Waikiki is very expensive if you choose to eat in most bar or restaurants, there was a decent selection of food and the made to order omelets were AMAZING!! The evening reception with free drinks and pre dinner nibbles was very enjoyable.The pool and surrounding area was a good size, although found the spa often too hot to enjoy.What really won me was the great laundry facilities.All staff at the hotel were so friendly and accommodating, a special mention to Shane and Lee who worked at the pool side bars for their wonderful customer service.We would definitely recommend this hotel to others.
user_name:
Amba M
New South Wales, Australia

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Love the Embassy suites Waikiki. I have never stayed somewhere that the staff is so helpful, friendly and full of Aloha!! Love the breakfast and the evening manager's reception. Rooms are always nice. If you can afford it stay here!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We landed early in the morning & they upgraded us straight away to a larger room with two balconies the lady at the front was so sweet! Free breakfast daily hit the omelette station totally worth it & make sure you tip free drinks between 5:30-7:30 daily on free pour winning!!! Fair warning they will knock your socks off! Super clean and tidy the bed was 8/10 & a 4min stroll to the beach or the centre of town. Staff are so friendly, helpful and even better approachable about anything!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Everything was perfect. Second time back in a year. High floor Hula tower with oceanview. Pilani the pool area server, and Daniel, also in the pool area, were fantastic, as were the bartenders Shane and

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: A little dated in the decor but very clean with fabulous views after we were upgraded to a partial Seaview room. Enough room for five of us in the one bedroom suit. Buffet breakfast was delicious, hot and well stocked so never ran out of any food especially during busy periods. Every night there is a two hour happy hour where management shout drinks and snacks for their customers and often have live entertainment at this time. The location is an easy walk to the beach (5 minutes) but will take another 5 minute walk to get to sandy, less rocky beach to swim. The staff are friendly and attentive.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Everyone at the Embassy Suites made our stay one to remember. Staff was so welcoming and polite especially upon arrival, and everyone was willing to give us a helping hand financially. So many good things to say about this hotel, but to sum it all up, I felt at home! Trying to locate the hotel was quite difficult, I wish they provided more clear instructions as to how guests can get to the hotel especially if they are driving themselves! Other than that, I was so pleased and will be returning. Thanks Embassy Suites, I'll be back!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Family trip to Hawaii. The location of this hotel is fantastic, there is a Denny's across the road, a convenience store and Waikiki Beach Walk just outside the hotel. The beach is only a couple of minutes walk as well. Amazing service, the buffet breakfast every morning was great. They have an omelette station where you can choose your fillings and the chefs make it right in front of you. My 4 year old son had one for breakfast every day. The managers reception every night was fantastic. My husband and I had free drinks every night (spirits and cocktails included, not just beer and wine) while our children spent hours in the pool. We could see the fireworks and beautiful sunsets from the rooftop pool area and this is also the area where they served breakfast. On some evenings they also had live entertainment. The staff were very friendly, rooms were clean and comfortable.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The rooms were quite comfortable and spacious with exceptionally comfortable bed and pillows.The complimentary beer, basic spirits, limited style of cocktails and nibbles, served from 5:30-7:30pm was most enjoyable and unexpected.The complimentary breakfast was also a welcome surprise with a good range of cereals, juices and breads, complimented with a selections of hot foods and eggs your way, made to order.The only slight concern was the amount of chlorine used in the pool in an enclosed environment, minor I know.Situated close to the airport, was a great way a spend a night before flying out.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a very nice 2 bedroom suite for a week in April 2018. Great location. Free breakfast was delicious. Free drinks and snacks at pool every evening a great bonus! Right on Beach Walk with restaurants and shops for any taste. Very comfortable beds and friendly staff. Surprisingly reasonable prices. Will definitely stay again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Absolutely beautiful and comfortable 2 bedroom suite! The beds were extremely comfortable. The General Manager and staff were very friendly and attentive, especially to my mother who uses a cane, offering to get a wheelchair for her as soon as they saw her using a cane. Would love to stay here again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great property in a great location. Staff is very friendly and helpful. The only bad thing was the bartender couldn't even make a simple drink like an old fashioned. That was disappointing. Breakfast was good every morning. Coffee was delicious. Would recommend

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This staff at this hotel has to be one of the most friendliest ones that my husband and I have encountered. From the moment we stepped onto the property until we left nine days later .... we experienced the services from wonderful staff that were friendly, efficient, and professional. Any questions we had, were always answered with the aloha spirit and in a prompt manner. The lcoation of the property is conveniently within steps of many restaurants and shops. We will certainly stay at this property again on our many future trips to Honolulu!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Having stayed previously at the Sheraton Waikiki, Ala Moana and the Royal Hawaiian, this time we decided as per recommendation from friends to try the Embassy Suites By Hilton at the Beach Walk.......What a great choice!!!!!The suite had a main bedroom with an extra large King Size Bed and a second bedroom with 2 Queen beds, 2 separate bathrooms and a large balcony with views to the city.Checking in was very professionally handled and quick.The swimming pool area is amazing.Full breakfast included in the package of the highest quality.Managers reception happy hour between 5 and 7 p.m. most enjoyable.Location is on the Beach Walk and Lewers... one block from Kalakaua.Without any doubt whenever we travel back to Honolulu, The Embassy Suites will be our first choice.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great value for the money we paid, clean large suite, good breakfast included, afternoon drinks and snacks included, walk was 6 min to Waikiki beach. This was our second stay here in two years. We'll be back soon.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is our second visit to the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk. This time we brought our friends along! We had great expectations for this hotel after our first visit here and we were not disappointed! Everything was great! The room, breakfast buffet and evening managers reception with complimentary drinks was exceptional!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Just spent a week at Embassy Suites with 2 kids (9 &10) and 3 adults. We had a great time and the hotel was perfect for our needs. The 1-bedroom suite was spacious enough for 5, though we didn't spend much time in there as we were out enjoying Waikiki! The complimentary breakfast meant we always started the day with full bellies and the food available was great, and the managers happy (2) hour was a great way to relax after a busy day and prepare for the evening. We enjoyed great service wherever in the hotel - the staff were always happy to help and made us feel welcome. The pool was fantastic for the kids and spa nice and hot for an evening soak. All-around, we had a great time, will be recommending to all and happily will return!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a 9 night stay at Embassy Suites and it was fantastic. We checked in and at first got a room with two beds in it (we are a couple) that were called Queen size but they were double beds. We went back down to reception and said we weren't happy with the bed configuration so the lovely guy on the front desk (Garrick) upgraded us to a room with sea-views and a king bed (which was so comfortable) with no quibbling - fantastic service.Embassy Suites are so centrally located (great nearby amenities) and its a quick walk everywhere in Waikiki. The free wifi and full complimentary breakfast every morning was great and made our stay even better.We only used the pool once (it was always full of small kids) but the local beaches are snazubg anyway so no problems there.We'll definitely be back!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family has stayed at this Hotel previously and returned because of how much we all enjoyed our last stay. I was helped a number of times prior to arrival and wish to thank Kay Lee for her amazing Customer Service. This Hotel is so well located in Waikiki. Close to all the shopping and the wonderful restaurants. We would also walk to the large shopping complex Ala Moana Shopping Centre which would take about 20 minutes. If you are not keen on walking, the trolley is just out front of the Hotel to take you to Ala Moana. We stay in a one bedroom Ocean View room located in the Hula Tower which provides a lovely view of the ocean. It isn't an uninterrupted view as there are hotels in front but on the high floor the view is fabulous. We also had a fabulous view from our room of the Friday Night Fireworks. Our room included two rooms with one being the bedroom with two queen size beds and the other the lounge room with a pull-out queen size sofa bed. In the corner is a small wet area including a sink, microwave, fridge and tea/coffee facilities. We would enjoy the Managers Reception each night enjoying complimentary drinks (the complimentary drinks menu is quite substantial) and the kids enjoyed complimentary soft drinks or Mocktails. The Managers Reception is for 2 hours every night. We had a small issue while staying at the Hotel with a truck every morning beeping their horn at 6:20am and then hearing their reversing signal for a few minutes. We didn't hear it our last couple of nights which was very nice. We highly recommend this Hotel as we have had such a wonderful time each time we have stayed. We look forwarding to our next stay!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel was where my family of 2 adults and 3 children stayed last time. The breakfast was great, the staff was friendly, and they even had complimentary drinks and snacks every evening. The room we stayed in was clean, spacious, and quiet. The valet service at the front door is nice, location of this hotel is close to so many great places. See you again soon, in 5 weeks actually! Mahalo

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed 5 nights. Check in was quick and easy, we were given a free upgrade over looking swimming pool little noisey but that didn't bother us. Breakfast every morning was wonderful free of charge oh and no resort fee. Location is perfect just back from the beach and right in the heart of the shopping area. We used valet parking for two nights very easy.The only issue was we were charged 3 nights not 2 night for parking but was fixed straight away. I would highly recommend this place to anyone. Thank you again Embassy Suites.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a great hotel for families in great location. It does lack some upper end amenities but most important things are offered to make the stay comfortable for a family with excellent hotel staff. If you have a baby that takes a lot of naps, music in the pool area during the afternoon and evening can a bit loud.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites as a family of four, We were going to stay at the Disney resort but our agent recommended this hotel and it couldn’t have been better! To be honest the breakfast inclusion was what did it for me, and then to find out about the managers reception every night where snacks and drinks are provided to finish off your day was amazing!The location is fantastic, the Waikiki trolley tram stop for the pink line is across the road at Trump tower, the beach is a block away and outside the hotel is Starbucks, Denny’s, The Yardhouse, the food truck area and many more shops and eateries all easily accessible.The rooms are spacious and more than comfortable, being serviced daily. We made use of the gym and the pool area daily and all services are well serviced and provided.The only feedback I could provide would be an earlier check in than 3pm, our flight arrived at 6am and although the hotel offered us breakfast and use of the sevices, by 11am we were all out on the pool deck chairs asleep waiting for our room, even if the check in was at 1pm it would save bleary eyed travellers hanging in the lobby and the pool, of which we saw daily - to be honest there is not a hotel in Hawaii that would not experience this and we were greateful at least to be able to use the hotel pool and restrooms while we waited- I have had friends fall asleep on Waikiki waiting to get into there room! We did run into a family who the day before had been offered a room on arrival early - so I guess it’s a luck of the drawer and how fulll the hotel is.This hotel is fantastic and we will be back ! Thankyou !

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We loved the Embassy Suites. The daily breakfast and Reception were great, saved us a lot of money. The kids loved the pool and were in it every day. Great location. Friendly helpful staff. We would stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: 10 yrs ago we stayed here for our wedding & 5 yr anniversary. The staff was wonderful to us. Half way home to NC, I discovered I was missing my hand made Hawaiian gold ring. I immediately called the hotel to notify them & asked them to check our room. The next day I received a call saying they found my ring in the safe & mailed it back to me. Who would do this? Thankfully there are still honest people around. I thought I would never see my ring again. This made me a fan for life until recently. I had issues with my booking for our 10 yr anniversary trip in September. I was very upset that we couldn't stay here but thanks to the Aloha Spirit of Gerrick (front desk mgr) he was able to rectify my issue and we will be back this yr in Sept. Looking forward to staying at our favorite hotel! THANK YOU GERRICK!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family has utilized this property for 8 straight years for vacation in Waikiki. We continue to return here because of the outstanding staff and the value received. Location of the facility is perfect - a short walk to beach and also very close to shopping and restaurants. The two room suites are large and well suited for families. The breakfast is great and the nightly manager's reception is a well appreciated perk. The pool area is well maintained, clean and very sunny. The only thing we noticed different was that there was no water dispenser available this year at the front desk area (ice,fruit infused, etc). It was nice to have that after our morning runs. We would like to thank Keola and Aldrin for making our time around the Grand Lanai for breakfast and the happy hour very pleasant. We also appreciate all the help from Lorena at the front desk for making our stay wonderful. See you next year - Mahalo!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I must say as a first time visitor to Hawaii I was a little disappointed. I was expecting a more tropical vibe with beautiful flowers and brightly colored homes I guess Maui would have been a better choice for that. As for our hotel choice Embassy Suites rocks. We arrived around 1pm and checked in with Cindy who was very friendly and helpful, she gave my daughter who was celebrating her bday the following day a box of chocolates and cookies and upgraded our room (thank you again). The first room we had (prior to the upgrade) was in the aloha tower on the 18th floor, the suite was comfortable but a little small. The upgraded room was a nice large suite in the hula tower with an ocean view from the Living area and a street view from the bedroom. I didn't notice much of a difference between the two towers just different views depending on the suite you get. The only negative was the bed pillows they were too soft for my taste, a pillow menu would have been nice or at least have firmer pillows available. The fact that there are no resort fees, free daily breakfast buffet and nightly managers reception with free drinks(awesome) this in my opinion gives you the best bang for the buck of the other hotels I considered. Even though I will probably not be returning to Hawaii I would definitely recommend this property to anyone who is planning a visit.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: One block off the beach, Embassy is central to Waikiki, has a variety of restaurants from quick service to fine dining and no resort fees. Breakfast and manager's reception are great, the hotel is in fantastic condition. The pool is a bit small, but was fine for our 7 year old. The rooms are quite large for Waikiki and we have stayed at most of the big resorts over the years. We would return here.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were in room 901 Aloha Tower. This is a king bed suite with city view. From the balcony you could just glimpse the ocean. Bed was comfortable. It had a small refrigerator and microwave. There was a kitchen style sink in the living room which my wife used to wash her hair due to high faucet. The breakfast was good. Japanese style breakfast as well as Western style. Fresh cook to order omelets. The omelet line was rather short with fast chefs. Donuts and cereal for the wee ones, bagels and cream cheese for adults, and oatmeal (with usual toppings plus shredded coconut) for us old guys. Afternoon manager treat included munchies (chips, melted cheese, salsa, veggies) and free drinks: Blue Hawaiian, Hawaiian punch with rum, beer, wine, etc. It is about a block to the beach which has good view for Friday night fireworks. Access to Waikiki trolley is easy: it stops in front of Trump tower about a block away. US Post Office is nearby if you have to send postcards. We will stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is wonderful! The staff are all very friendly and try to help in every way possible. The rooms are clean, spacious and quiet, even for a family of 6. 2 Adults and 4 kids ages 3,5, 9,11. Very short walk to beach. Note: ask at the front desk for sand toys and knee boards or other floating toys for the beach before buying them. People are always leaving and don't take them with. Also, walk the beach at night, one it is beautiful, and two, people also leave things behind because they are flying out the next day. Pool area is wonderful along with the happy hour. Note there are two bars. The far bar the fish pond usually doesn't have a long line. Drinks are wonderful along with the snacks each night. Great way to save money while in Hawaii. As for the breakfast, it is amazing! Great flow to move people through quickly. Made to order omelets/egg station is spectacular! Again there are two lines, go to the far side. Both sides are the same, just less people. Location is wonderful. Close to beach, shopping, and restaurants. Would definitely stay again! Note: Friday night fireworks are easily visualized in the pool area by the far bar. No need to leave and avoid the crowds while enjoying a drink.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Can't say enough positive things about this hotel! The location is 5 mins from the beach, the rooms are clean, comfortable and spacious. The beds are extremely comfortable and the bedding is superb. Every staff member, from check in to check out, was friendly and went out of their way to meet any request. The bellman brought up a scale at checkout so we could make sure our luggage was under the weight limit. Breakfast was very good every morning, especially the omelet bar and selection of fresh fruit. The pool looked very nice but we opted for the beach instead. Amazing experience!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is in an excellent location, very close to Beach, restaurants, shopping etc. The free breakfast is awesome and very good, something for everyone and being able to sit outside or inside is very nice. The nighttime reception was so much fun on the nights they had the Iive music. Such a great band and so talented, we really enjoyed listening to them and the kids got to swim at the same time, fun family event. Beds are not most comfortable but overall this was a fantastic hotel for our family.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Actually I went February 2017 but not a choice Great place my very favorite! Trip came from Portland Oregon great place to stay highly recommend will come back soon great breakfast so good food clean place

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Had an excellent vacation, rooms were spacious, clean, hotel staff amazing, very friendly and accommodating, Expedia agent went above and beyond to ensure we got not only what we wanted, he ensured that we were fully informed, best deals. My luggage was lost for several days and thankfully Ross directed me towards affordable stores where I could replace clothing and essentials required. This information was valuable in relieving some of the stress in making the best of an unfortunate situation.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: First time visit to Hawaii- family of four - 2 boys, 15 & 12.It’s a $50 usd cab ride from the airport to the hotel which lies to the top end of Waikiki beach.Check in was supposed be at 3:00pm but we had access to the room by 12:00- great after an 11.5 hour flight from Melbourne.We had a one bedroom apartment facing the pool- the bedroom had 2 queen sized beds and the lounge had a pull out sofa bed- so sleeps 6 but in my opinion 6 or 4 adults would find this a little claustrophobic. It is tastefully decorated, clean has 2 balconies to relax on.In the room it has a small kitchen with a coffee machine, kettle, sink and a microwave- no utensils or cups. The small fridge lacks a freezer compartment, so we had to eat a whole tub of ice cream in one fell swoop!There are not many hotels in Hawaii that offer free breakfast, so this was a bonus. The breakfast lasts for about 3 hours and caters for most tastes- Asian, western, yoghurt, fruit, eggs, pancakes, donuts, pastries cereals and you can have as much as you want.The pool - which includes a spa- is quite large which rarely gets crowded and is also the area where they have happy hour (5:30-7:30) where it gets very busy. Happy hour provides free drinks - beer, wine spirits , soft drinks and some snacks.Local buses are 100m away to take you to the ala Moana shopping centre or wiekele outlet stores - $5.50 for adults $2.50 children - all day or it’s a$10 Uber drive both ways.All in all great value for money - we paid $256usd per night and would highly recommend if you’re not looking for a self catering holiday in Waikiki.Off to Maui now! Hope you find this helpful.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Highly recommend this place. Was terrific. The breakfast was wonderful for adults and kids with a large variety of options from cereal to pancakes to omelets and everything in between. The evening happy hours were fun for all and the location is very close to the beach and shopping.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hotel was great value and overall experience. Staff were friendly and accommodating, suite was great and amenities were excellent. Victor at the check in desk was great notifying us that our suite was ready to check in via text and Jimmy at the bell desk was phenomenal.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the hotel for almost two weeks, the hotel is just one street up from the beach. The breakfast was really good with plenty of choices and fresh. The hotel also had a reception in the evenings in the pool area, the pool are was good. The room was clean and the beds were good, the sofa bed was ok. The staff in general was really nice and service minded. I can definitely recommend this if you are looking for a family friendly hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: It was our first time staying at the Embassy Suites, we have only ever stayed at all the other Hilton brands. Location is good, it’s a short 5min walk to the beach, DeRussy Park, Beachwalk is right in front with lots of shops, and dining options, Kalakaua Rd, International Market Place 10-15min walk. Roys and Denny’s is right downstairs. ABC Store across the road. It is however a very busy family hotel. At 6am, the excited kids are already up and screaming.The room options on the online check-in app was very average and all located at noisy busy areas, all by the elevator, by the ice and vending machines and on the corridor to the pool and breakfast area. Having no idea what our Lanai would be looking at, only choice was a room in the Hula tower (many reviewers recommended over the Aloha tower).The first room (4th floor) was dismal, view was to a neighboring hotel (their lanais looked into our lanais and room!), way too close to the street, no privacy. I took this up with the Registration desk (which is oddly located at the driveway of the hotel and did not feel welcoming), front desk staff were also not welcoming at all. Smiles were few and far between, nor was there any warmth nor friendliness. No acknowledgement of HH member. She did change the room for me to the 5th floor (this room did not come up as an option on the HH app). This room had a pool view but it also looked into the breakfast area, it was next to the elevator, vending and ice machine. I felt like we got given one of the worst rooms in the hotel. Pool being on the 4th floor, the 5th floor room was not much better. I just gave up. There was no offer for an upgrade (as HH Gold member) or even option to pay extra for a better room. She gave us our free bottles of water. Note: 2 x bottled water once only at check-in at this hotel. Many others like Hampton and Hilton we have stayed at give you free water every day.The first room on the 4th floor felt cramped and dark. The 5th floor room itself was clean but it is very dated and noisy but comfortable. Good size for 3 of us. Sofa bed was already made up with sheets, blankets and extra pillows in the cupboard. Beach towels and beach bag provided in the room. Neutrogena toiletries. Room was noisy next to the ice machine whirring and rumbling away, or maybe it was the AC or perhaps the elevator??. For a hotel where beach and pool are the main activities, puzzles me why these hotels do not provide drying racks to dry your swim gear, more so, when this hotel has lanais. I pre-requested extra towels and bathmat but none were provided. Only Valet parking available. I must say they were quick in getting your vehicle. Valet, Bell and breakfast staff were nice and friendly, not so much Front Desk. Disappointing as it is one of the first things a guest has to experience when checking in to a hotel, puzzling why hotels do not make the effort to make it a good experience for the guest.Buffet breakfast was included in the room rate. Selections were the usual fare, omelet station, bacon, sausages, etc. cereals (+gluten free), pancakes, toast, juices, coffee, no waffles. Busy hotel, breakfast is very busy, even at 7am! Breakfast staff were friendly and very helpful. One morning I was by myself, and it was busy, they helped reserve me a table.Pool is quite small, mainly for the kids. There is a spa also. There were some quieter lounge chairs. There is a bar by the pool. There is also happy hour with band music.  Having read so many good reviews about this hotel, I’m disappointed and unlikely to stay again. I’m also wondering if this rates highly, then are the other hotels in Waikiki worse?? I think we might stay away from Waikiki!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I saved up for a long time to take my entire family on this trip and it was just horrible. From the check in process to the check out. Check in staff were very unfriendly. They did not even tell us about their own evening events for guest at the hotel. The lobby/reception area was just so ugly and cheap lookink... They had a tiny little pool for so many quests - the pool was always packed from opening to closing - I got in the pool only once 30min before closing because that was the only time with less than 20 people - just horrible!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We travel allot and this Embassy Suites surpassed any Hilton stay we've ever had. The friendliness, attention to detail, room, food and desire to help was off the charts great! We had 2 rooms. Our coffee maker did not work and the other room has a TV issue. In both cases we hardly put down the phone and the issues were resolved by VERY positive people. Our room service staff was very friendly and helpful in every way!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I haven't written a review in a while, but I had to share how satisfied I was with the Embassy Suites Waikiki. The morning breakfasts had an expansive offering, and the manager's reception made for a great evening pool scene. Access to beach and shopping were just steps away and all the staff were so courteous. The gym had machines that were up-to-date. I would return!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent choice for families in Waikiki. Large suites, central location, great made-to-order breakfast included, and wonderful staff. Particular mention must be made to Tammy at the front desk, and Ross and Kela at the activity desk for their amazing customer service. Thank you so much for making our Hawaiian vacation even better!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Overall a very nice hotel in a good location near the beach and many shops in Honolulu. Problems were in not getting the king size bed as requested on both occasions and then getting placed into the 1st floor on both occasions giving us NO view of the city or beach. Also the second time we came our air conditioner didn't work and we had to go to two different rooms before we found the one with the correct bed. We wasted a lot of time going from one bedroom to the next.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: First time we have stayed here, stayed close but not here.The place is great. A big breakfast is available and ther is a happy two hours in the evening.The staff are awesome and very helpful and friendly.A nice pool and bar area next to pool make it a great place to relax.Close to beach and town it is very central.The Batman Dennis is great and very friendly.Will stay there next time for sure.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Had a two bedroom suite for my family which was perfect. My kids loved the pool area and our family really enjoyed the breakfast included with our stay. Located in a wonderful spot in Waikiki, surrounded by places to shop and eat, and there's even a food truck area across the street from the hotel. Beach is also very close, although my family stuck to the hotel pool area. A little pricier than other hotels in the area, but the amenities are worth the price!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location near beach and shopping. 5 minutes from H1. 5 minutes from beautiful diamond head. Walking distance from the beach. Yard house right downstairs. Good food. Nail salon and spa in plaza steps from the exit.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is centrally situated one block from Waikiki beach and close to many amenities and restaurants in the Waikiki area. Hotel was very well maintained and clean. Staff were very friendly and accommodating. We had an issue with noise from the elevator in our room (Room 801 Aloha Tower). We were approached at breakfast by “Marsha” who asked us if everything was ok with our stay. We mentioned about the elevator noise and she said that she’d be right back. After a few minutes she returned advising for us to see “Jay” at the desk. Jay was able to move us to another room, which made our stay more enjoyable. This is a great hotel for families with a great pool, hot tub and deck area with many lounge chairs. The breakfast was excellent and included with your stay. Lots of choices including an Omelet station, lots of fresh fruit, eggs, bacon, sausage, French toast, pancakes, etc. Breakfast runs from 0600-1000 daily. You have a choice of inside or outside seating. The evening reception was another fantastic perk to this hotel. Free alcoholic beverages and snacks daily from 1730-1930 hrs. Snacks inclided, nacho chips with salsa and hot melted cheese, potato chips, pretzels, broccoli and dip. Bartender “Keola” will look after you at one of the bars. Thanks for a wonderful Hawaiian vacation.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family had the pleasure of staying at the Embassy Suites and we absolutely loved it! The staff was incredible and they treated us like their ohana (family). The complimentary breakfast spread and daily happy hour and snacks was an awesome benefit. Plus, we were minutes from the beach and had easy access to shops and restaurants on the Beach Walk and Lewers Street below. We hope to return again soon!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had an ocean view room, which was very clean. Probably the only negative was we thought being an apartment we would have some cutlery and crockery. We had disposable coffee cups only but we did have a fridge and microwave. Coffee machine was great. The complimentary happy hour was also a great place to meet up with people. Free wifi was also a plus and was easy to use with good speed. There are lots of places to eat and the ABC shops are everywhere and they sell everything including ready to go meals. The trolly is just around the corner and will take you all around Waikiki including the Ala Moana shopping center for just $2. Loved it

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: What I liked the most about this place was the location, being close to the beach and close to Internationally renowned stores and FABULOUS restaurants, and receiving a great morning breakfast that was included with the room price. What I disliked was the lack of closet space and not having AC our first hot night - the hotel did a fast and excellent job fixing this. I would definitely look at staying here again. Aloha.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My girlfriend and I chose the Embassy Suites for our 3-day Honolulu vacation and were quite impressed with the property. Although it's not quite "beachfront"--nor a "resort"--we had a terrific partial ocean view from our very spacious King Suite in the Hula Tower, just minutes from the beach. I've always loved the room sizes and free breakfast at Embassy Suites, and would rate this hotel 4 stars. Here are my pros and cons:PROS:- BREAKFAST! The spread here is impressive indeed, with made-to-order omelettes, potatoes, tropical fruits, salad, miso soup, and a wide variety of beverages. There is something for everyone, and the lines were never too long.- Room size: Our King Suite was extremely spacious, with a large lanai (balcony) that went around the entire room.- Location: Although it's not technically "beachfront" property, it's about as close as one can get without abutting Waikiki. Great access to restaurants and other resorts, and a Roy's on site!CONS:- Parking is somewhat expensive and slow--and a bit of a hassle. We used the valet service, which cost almost $40/day. I'm not sure there were other options.- Housekeeping threw away a bag of groceries we had bought one night, which included some over-the-counter medicine. Although the front desk was apologetic, all they offered in return was one day's worth of parking fees. This mishap is what's stopping me from giving the hotel 5 stars, as I didn't feel like the front desk agent was particularly sympathetic.- Afternoon pupus were disappointing: We were expecting real, home-cooked finger foods--perhaps even some local grinds--but to our chagrin were greeted with nacho chips and goldfish. That said, they did have a live band one night during the Happy Hour.Overall, I would definitely stay here again. It's a family friendly hotel that's a bit smaller than some of the larger resorts nearby (Outrigger, Hilton Hawaiian Village, etc.), but it's newer--and the rooms more spacious--as well. Five stars for the room and location; four for the service (which was friendly but slow).

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Would definitely return to the Embassy Suites by Hilton Waikiki Beach Walk. The staff is excellent and the bartender is the greatest. Very short walk to the beach. The free breakfast was also great. The place is very clean. Beds are comfortable. We stayed on the 10th floor with beach view. The pool is very clean.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our stay at Embassy Suites got off to a bit of a rocky start when we encountered Susana at reception on check-in. She obviously wasn't having a good day, however every other staff member that we met, outside of the check-in area, was wonderful and welcoming, with a special mention of Alma, up at the nightly Managers reception. She was an absolute delight, as is the nightly reception, which brings everyone together in a really happy, positive atmosphere. The band is awesome and the free drinks are a real bonus, on top of the included breakfast, making this Hotel real value for money.Our rooms were spacious and comfortable with a nice city view and decent balcony and we appreciated having a separate living area from the bedroom.A special mention to Ida, who was kind enough to upgrade my 81 year old father and my Brother and Sister in Law to a 2 bedroom apartment for 4 of the 6 nights that we stayed at Embassy suites. This was greatly appreciated.Embassy Suites is in an ideal location just a short stroll to everything and really is a perfect place to stay for families.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: For Spring Break 2018 we stayed in a two bedroom on the 18th floor. Check-in was a breeze and the suite was immaculate. Generally, hotel rooms in Waikiki are small and that can take some adjustment for multi-generational families traveling together. Embassy Suites was a great solution that still fit the budget. Two bedrooms, two bathrooms, living room and a small double deck with partial beach views - pretty tough to complain about. The location on BeachWalk was absolutely ideal. Steps from the beach, great restaurants and shopping. The 4th floor pool and activities area pushed this hotel over the top. There is a daily breakfast buffet - fruit, cereal, omelettes, bacon etc. Start your day with this and you don’t feel hungry until 4. Every evening the manager’s reception takes place by the pool. Light snacks and complimentary drinks. Think about that. Free breakfast and free drinks - yep, that keeps a few dollars in your pocket for souvenirs. Like most trips, however, the stay is boom or bust as a result of the staff. Embassy Suites wins here. All of the staff are friendly and willing to help. I couldn’t find a grumpy employee in the dozens we had contact with. Great service, value, location and amenities = an awesome stay. We’ll be back!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Hilton Waikiki Village the night before and decided to check out this location our second night in Honolulu. Really loved it overall but it is expensive for sure. They upgraded our room upon arrival which was a nice surprise and even got some cold pog juice. A nice touch on a hot day! Check in was friendly and quick, valet the same. Clean simple suite option with a great location within walking distance to the beach and shopping.The room was spacious and had a great view. We really enjoyed having so much space, that can be hard to find in Waikiki. The comp drinks and snacks in the afternoon which was nice but nothing too amazing. Basic drinks, wine, draft beers, goldfish crackers, pretzels and some veggie sticks. But next to the pool and bartender gets points for being clever and good sense of humor. Also a comp breakfast in the morning which was good but again nothing out of the ordinary. Highly recommend this location for families staying in the area for at least a few days. We really enjoyed it and will be back for sure!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We arrived on island early. It was nice to have a room available for us to check in to. Our housekeeper was very friendly and made sure we had everything we needed to keep us all comfortable. The free morning breakfast and evening reception was great! We will definitely stay here again

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I were visiting Hawaii for a vacation and 35th wedding anniversary. We stayed at the hotel for 4 days and did not rent a car. The location is wonderful with a short walk to the beach, many shops, and a wide variety of restaurants. The concierge helped us book a number of tours and other activities with pick up locations near the hotel. The stay included a fabulous breakfast buffet which included a variety of pastries, potatoes, breakfast meats, made to order omelets, and fresh fruit. The cut pineapple was locally grown and amazing. The room was spacious, clean, and very comfortable. There was even an electric tea kettle for those of us who prefer coffee to tea. The hotel staff were all incredibly kind and helpful. We would stay there again anytime.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: First Time travelers in Oahu: this hotel has a good location for dining, shopping and the beach. Walking distance to Kalakaua Ave where high-end shopping is. Service staff were very accommodating. The breakfast choices are the same everyday. Wish there were a daily variety.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is centrally located in between shopping and beach access. Just stepping outside, you will have a great shopping (ton of shops and malls), and for about 5-min walk, you will get to Waikiki beach. Breakfast and during 4-7 PM, also light snack are served as well. Just for breakfast option, I think it is worth it, since other hotels charge $30-40/person. Both scramble and cook to order eggs are provided. They do change every other day, but additional variety would have been better. Staffs were extremely friendly, helpful, and go extra mile to ensure your pleasant stay. We had a minor pluming issue, and they fixed it right away!!! I would recommend this hotel to anyone!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We spent a few nights and really enjoyed this property and the location. The staff was outstanding. Valet parking attendants were very helpful and the front desk process was refreshing with nice touches like chairs, and they served fresh juice. Free breakfast was great with seating inside/outside. All the best shopping is very close, and a short walk to the beach.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I was surprised that this Hilton property was not that good.The room smelt like mildew and as if it was a party room for a college spring break. The most disturbing thing of all was I woke up with a piece of hair that some how got tangled and tied in a knot around my toe. I have short hair less than a half inch and this was at least a foot long. After ripping it off my toe I checked my bed and sure enough the bed looked like it had just been made and the sheets had not been changed.Checked out a day early and into another hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Having just spent 9 nights in a one bedroom suite, I can't speak highly enough of the Embassy Suites Beach Walk, Waikiki and their staff.We are a family of 4 and having 2 beds plus a sofa bed meant the kids didn't have to share. Definitely a plus for a great night's sleep! The full cooked breakfast kept is going until dinner time. Complimentary drinks and snacks daily was a great way to kick off the evening.Hotel facilities were spot on. We made daily use of the pool, use of the poolside bar and snack service, and even used the on site self-laundry. Prices were reasonable. All areas of the hotel were kept impeccably clean and we even had full daily servicing of our room which I didn't expect.Staff throughout the hotel were genuinely friendly and helpful.The location was perfect for us to walk to all the main spots along Waikiki or grab a short cab ride to the Ala Moana Center. There are plenty of restaurants, cafe's and foodcourts nearby to suit every budget. All within a 5 min walk of the hotel.I would go back in a heartbeat! And would definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We enjoyed the free breakfast and manager's reception. The staff was friendly and caring. This is a great place for a family holiday. The location to the beach is nice and the pool is family friendly.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family and I just returned from our trip. This is the first time I stayed at this hotel. Best accommodations I've ever had in my many trips to Waikiki! Such an awesome stay I feel a strong need to express how wonderful this hotel is!!! From the moment my family and I arrived we were treated with true 'Aloha Hospitality'. We were greeted with fresh juice while we were rapidly checked in. We stayed in the Aloha Tower rm. 1007. Our room was wonderful. It was spacious enough for all of us, spotlessly clean and well stocked with linens, towels and toiletries. The hotel is located close to the beach, shopping, and many fine restaurants. All the staff were all so friendly and always greeted us with a smile and a friendly word or two. The pool area was well enjoyed by the family. My granddaughter loved the kiddie pool. The free breakfast buffet was superb with so-o-o many wonderful choices. I've stayed at many other embassy suites in the past but never had such wonderful breakfast choices. The bar staff during the free happy hour were quick to mix and so friendly. I will definitely be staying here again! My only disappointment was... I didn't earn Hilton Honors points for our stay. Not realizing I had to book through Hilton to get my points, I booked the hotel on a travel package through Hawaiian airlines. :-( I'll remember next time....

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here in Feb/March 2018 for 13 nights with a 6 month old and 3.5 year old travelling from Sydney. We arrived and checked in whilst drinking lovely fruit juice. Room was ready despite it not being check in time yet (great when travelling with two kids). Each evening we went down for Happy Hour (between 5.30-7.30pm) for free drinks (Mai Tai's were amazing) and snacks which was perfect for us as we got to catch up on the days events with our friends who were also travelling with us. Breakfast was good each morning too and the 'egg men' did a super great job each morning providing the masses omelettes in a very quick and efficient manner. We used all the services from the travel booking people to the bell desks. Everyone was so helpful and really made us feel the spirit of Aloha. Location for tour pickups to convenience of ABC shops, restaurants and pubs was second to none. We have already discussed with friends coming back again in 2 years and staying again at Embassy Suites. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Yes , we have been five times, to this hotel before, so that tells you something, check in brilliant, rooms excellent, bar staff, fantastic, with the Happy Hour (two hours in fact) Breakfast , is the best you can get in Honolulu, with the Omelette bar, .
