Really good pool, and hot tub on the 4th floor,. Its best value for family of four,2 adults 2 kids,.It is a couple of blocks from the front, and near all the shops , entertainment, Sometimes downside, the rooms are too pricey , so you have to look for discounts, like 3 nights for price of 2, or 4 nights, one free,We love the place, love the servers at happy hour , martin, and the other two ? who's name shall never be mentioned, Ha Ha, there is entertainment on , with a fantastic band, and the Hotel seems to get great guests, The only problem i have, is the reviews bring more guests, and then its harder to get in the place, We did stay first night at Hilton hotel Kuhio street,, as brilliant ,and again, fantastic value.(we had discount coupon, thanks Brad and all their) anyway many thanks saunders family,

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here Feb. 25 through March 4th and really enjoyed it. Great staff with the good ES breakfast buffet, manager's reception with live entertainment and convenient location. Only one block to the beach and right in the middle of the "Beach Walk" shopping and nearby Waikiki major shopping! We prefer Embassy Suites no matter where we travel and this one was no exception. Clean, bright rooms and we had an ocean view corner room with great views of the Pacific Ocean. Other than that we loved it. Service was great from check-in to check-out and in between. Only complaint's I have is I wish the rooms had more sound deadening between them, and Hilton Honors reluctance to honor these stays if they are booked through another travel site. I find this unacceptable as they are being paid anyway. Besides... I tried numerous times to book the complete Vacation package through the hotel's website, but was constantly kicked out when I clicked on "Vacation Package". I wish they would change that...

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We love coming here for staycations. The managers drinks reception is the perfect start to a night out. Follow that with the larger and comfy room and the breakfast in the morning and we have found nothing which can match it in Waikiki. We have stayed three times already and will be back again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed at this property a few years ago and enjoyed it. Hotel check in was great. I love the welcome beverages and wish it was available for purchase. Room was noisy, near the elevator, but extremely clean. I would of asked for a room change, but the cleanliness stopped me. I wish they would have changed the bedding as I requested, but other than that everything was great. Staff were friendly and Evening Reception was great. If you want to stay in Waikiki and have access to everything/traveling with children, I would definitely recommend this place.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We spent almost two weeks here on vacation just recently and we loved it. The rooms were large, clean and quiet and the staff was very friendly. Breakfast each morning was amazing and the concierge and bell staff were always very helpful and had some great tips when we went somewhere. The stretch limousine cab (which is the same price as a regular one) was also kind of an unexpected but very cool experience.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Good hotel in good location. We arrived into honolulu at 6am and went ro check in and drop our bags off, the wonderful check in lady greeted us with a cold refreshing drink and let us have some breakfast upstairs even though our room wouldnt be ready til 3pm. At midday the app notified us our room was ready and after collecting our key we noticed she had upgraded us to a beach view room in the front tower. The room was fantastic, would of paid extra for one in that tower. Breakfast was fantastic with loads of options, the juice needs work though, was very watery cordial. Managers drinks were fantastic and snacks ranged from nuts and chips to corn chips and salsa.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: the best for families we stayed there for 5 nights the location was the best close to everything staff where so kind and helped us with everything we needed breakfast was filling the lifts didn't take long as others have stated .... we just got back 2 days ago and I cant wait to go back there thank you to all the staff at the embassy suites till we meet again :)

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here for 9 days in February. The person who checked us in was very professional and friendly. as a matter of fact, all of the personnel (including cleaning ladies, bellhops, etc) were fantastic. (They must have a training program because the level of customer service was beyond the ordinary.)-complimentary breakfast buffet (with everything - cereal, omelette stations, pancakes, french toast, yogurt, bacon, sausage, etc., etc., etc.)-very spacious clean suite - was quiet (corner unit)-city view with balconies (room 809)-microwave, very small mini-fridge-air-conditioning-superb location close to restaurants, beach, stores-very good value (but do research to get this)-guest laundry (reasonable)-gym-business center -wi-fi was sketchy though (otherwise everything was perfect)-highly recommend and would love to stay here againIf you have a question, email hotel. You will get a response within a day or two.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Location, Location, Location. This Embassy Suites in Waikiki is staffed with fantastic people who made our stay such a wonderful experience. Located right at the heart of shopping & restaurants...and an easy walk either East or West to the main beaches. Nice view from our ocean view room. Complimentary breakfast is a great start to the day. The Manager’s Reception every night is a fun way to get the night started with light fare food and potent cocktails! Would gladly stay here again on a future visit.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Had a 7 night business trip in February and stayed at the Embassy suites again. After a long flight from Virginia I was greeted by a cold glass of guava pineapple juice. Threw it back and the receptionist got me another one. As A Diamond member I can usually get a high floor in the Hula tower but it was very busy and could only score a 7th floor room in the Aloha tower. The receptionist advised to come back down in two days and they could relocate me but the room on the 7th floor was perfect. The morning breakfast is one of the best anywhere, standard omelette prep like all Embassy Suites but the fresh pineapple and the miso soup and taro english muffins made it better. The atmosphere doesn’t hurt sitting outside on the 4 th floor lanai. They have a two hour social every night with free well drinks and of course they make all the Hawaiian favorites. The snacks are ok with a mix of veggies and chips and chex mix. Some hot pupu’s would be nice. This place is a block off the beach but perfect for families who want a nice pool, good breakfast and a location near shopping in downtown Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: It was nice experience. Good location, great breakfast & food (value for money), cozy pool, and nice service. But the bed quality was not good. If you importantly consider bed quality, you may have disappointed of that.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed 6 nights and couldn't be happier. The hotel was a short walk to the beach and close to a lot of shopping. All the staff was great, especially the bartender at the evenings managers reception. We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our second stay at this property; we stayed here 3 years ago. I re-booked at this property because it was so much better than the Hilton Hawaiian Village stay we had previously, and I was again not disappointed.We were arriving very early in the morning (8AM) and had emailed the hotel in advance to request early check in if available. Imagine my surprise to be granted an upgraded room (partial ocean larger than usual; am an Hhonors Gold) which was totally unexpected and really made this second stay even more remarkable than the first; the room was ready on arrival. We were greeted with some complimentary beverages and provided breakfast coupons for that day and the remainder of our stay. The breakfasts have everything you could ever want, and the managers reception at night offers complimentary beverages (both adult and regular) . Everything is in walking distance. We were going to call an uber but the hotel had a limo parked in the reception area which took us for the same price as a cab - such a great perk!The pool is an excellent size with a spa/hot tub area - it's kept at a good temperature in both cases. The kids really enjoyed themselves here.This property is one of the few that does not have a resort fee as well; I never mind paying for a good hotel and this one was a little more than most, but I hate resort fees. Ancillary fees are ridiculous money grabs.The maintenance and room cleaning staff were always courteous and said hello when passing in the hall. A nice service touch.I can not say enough good things about this property. It is without a doubt one of my top two or maybe three hotels and resorts I've ever stayed in. We will be back on our next trip to Honolulu, whenever that may be.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We booked (using Hhonors points) 2/14/18 - 2/19/18. The only room we could book (using points) was an accessible room. We were on the 4th floor at the end by the pool (room 420 I believe), which is the end facing the ocean/beach (not the other pool end).Check-in was excellent and quick, we received our free Hilton gift (2 bottles of water--LOL). Staff was very friendly and courteous and our room was ready. Nice and clean. The bed was good (not too soft, although everyone is different) and the AC unit kept things nice and cool. We originally thought we might be in for some noise with the patio doors being right on the 4th floor to the pool, but did not have any issues with noise from that area. (Between rooms was a different story but mostly due to yelling/screaming children late at night and in the morning). Oh well, we should be up by 8:00 a.m. anyway I guess. hahaThe free breakfast was very good, I thought. They posted a little sign in the room telling you when "prime" hours were, although we didn't seem to notice an issue regardless of when we went (sometimes as late as 9:30). There was always a place to sit at. The only crowd was around the omelette station, but only when you had one person getting like 4 omelletes, othewise the lime moved pretty quickly. No mimosas, unfortunately (haha). But you could get juice and take it back to your room and have some (not sure if you could bring your bottle to the table or not).The pool was warm and the chairs comfortable. Lots of kids though (when we were there--your mileage may vary) so it was a little busy.The evening reception had a nice variety of snacks, usually a vegetable of some sort (broccoli, carrots, sliced zuchinni and dip) and then chips and pretzels and things. The one bartender (sorry I don't recall his name) is excellent. Strong pours/drinks and he was so fast it was like watching the Matrix. The pupu's/appetizer menu was decently priced and pretty decent as well.The location is quite nice as Roy's is on the 1st floor (had dinner and lunch there, it was so good). And the beach walk is right there as well.Walk across the street, turn right and walk a block or so and turn left and there's the start/end of Waikiki beach.I would definitely stay here again if I'm ever in Honolulu again (even though I own at Hilton Grand Vacation's Club). The free breakfast and drinks help defray costs, and we did use the little fridge and microwave to reheat some leftovers for lunches.Wi-Fi was fast (and I used my Hilton Honors "regular" WiFi, not the premium). TV selection was excellent also.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: It's unfortunate that I have to rate this as poor because it is a good hotel. We had a good experience with initial check in / valet and the ocean view 1 bedroom suite was good as expected. The problem is the bedroom of the suite (1721) is directly behind or adjoining the 3 elevators and the noise and vibrations from them made it very difficult to sleep, they were in full swing by 6am and in use till late. Sort of like a subway noise. I assume this problem exists in the same room on every floor. I went down to reception the next morning to explain our problem and ask for a room change. I was asked no questions about the issue nor offered any apology, which makes me think it's a common complaint. I was told we couldn't be moved till the following day and then would have to pack up and store our luggage by 11am then come back at 3pm to check into our new room. No offer of an early check in on the new room which is disappointing that it couldn't be a priority clean for an existing guest. This is quite inconvenient given we have a 2 year old that usually has a sleep at 1pm. Given we are here now and moving rooms today I hope to be able to review the new room positively.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed for a week here and had a two bedroom, partial ocean view. Check-in was easy and early, with a refreshing drink. The room was spotless and so comfy-although billed as a partial ocean view, we really had a full view from the balcony. Here is the best: complimentary breakfast and happy hour every day! Great buffet, eggs to order - and super good drinks and snacks for happy hour. You can walk, in like two minutes, to an excellent part of the beach in front of Ft Derussy (go to this beach not to the south area, it is calmer and less crowded). Tons of restaurants and shops in the area as well. I definitely recommend this hotel, I cannot think of a single negative.
user_name:
LSSC13
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel exceeded our expectations. I used to stay at this location when it used to be the Coral Seas (many, many years ago!) so location-wise it is perfect. It's right on Lewers Street so there are a lot of stores and restaurants right across the street and it's a half block walk to the beach. We were lucky and were on the 20th floor so we had a partial ocean view one way and a city view the other way. Awesome!We chose this hotel primarily for it's free breakfast as we have 2 very hungry boys and it did not disappoint. No, it wasn't a spectacular selection but there was good food and they switched it up every day and really, the convenience of it was worth every penny. It was so nice not to have to gather everyone up and head out to a restaurant every morning. The free manager's reception every night was just mind-boggling. All that free alcohol and snacks every night!! How can you beat that?!The room itself was amazing! So clean and had all the amenities you could ask for. It even comes with beach towels that were replaced every day! We had the 2-bedroom suite as my parents joined us and there was plenty of room for all 6 of us.We would stay here again, if for no other reason, than the service. Everyone working at the Embassy Suites was friendly, helpful and willing to bend over backwards to make our stay a good one (which they succeeded in doing). A big shout out to the bartenders, Keola, Dennis and Lewis who always made our boys laugh and to Pi'ilani who was just the nicest person I've ever met. To stay that happy and friendly while taking all the tourists' orders every night takes a very special person. The pool was rather large for a pool in Waikiki and we made good use of its hot tub. There was even poolside service if you wanted to eat or drink which was an added bonus. The food was a few dollars more than at a restaurant but the portions were huge and it was VERY good.The only two minor cons that we have was that we found the live music to be a bit too loud (only 3 nights a week though) and the wifi really is awful. But really, you're in Hawaii, who cares! :) We HIGHLY recommend this hotel.See you in December!!!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a great hotel, especially for families. The rooms are nice and very clean. The hotel is literally a 5 minute walk to the ocean. We stayed in room 1829 with an awesome ocean view. (Hula Tower). If you want a nice ocean view, ask for Hula Tower corner unit as high up as possible. Our housekeeping person was awesome, we stayed here 14 nights and she had the room clean every day.The breakfast every morning was outstanding! items changed every day and we saved alot of money by eating a nice big breakfast every day. (Shout out to Aldrin, he is one of the hosts/workers at the breakfast. He always greeted us with a big smile a Aloha.The evening managers reception was nice too. we weren't always back in time for it but we did go to it a few times. Free cocktails (we did tip the bartender) some nice snacks and live music Monday, Wednesday, Friday.This hotel is probably the best value on the island. I did alot of research for our trip and i'm so glad I decided on the Embassy Suites!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Lots of reasons why I chose this hotel - * all rooms are suites* free breakfast * no resort fees* free drinks every nightand it did not disappoint the rooms where big and lovely made such a difference having a separate lounge. A proper cooked breakfast sausages, bacon, omelettes made just for you, fresh fruit and lots of deferent breads every day. I don't need to say how nice it was having basically a free bar every evening for two hours ;-) . we had a great time every day for the week we where there and last thing to say is every member of staff was lovely and friendly you really got the feeling they wanted you to have a nice time at or away from the hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: When we were arrived we were greeted by friendly staff, and were given free juice which was delicious! The free breakfast was great. Awesome location, really close to shops and lots of food options. Beds were very comfy and room was quite spacious. Will recommend to friends and family in the future.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here for 6 nights in Feb 2018. Can't really complain about anything. Staff were friendly and accomodating to all our needs. Room was spacious and clean, location is good. Not beach front but we knew that when we booked. Nice breakfast included and happy hour (free drinks) every day from 5.30-7.30pm. Entertainment was good with a 4 piece band (father and 3 sons). Probably the only hotel with no Resort Fees, that is a big plus for me.Friends of mine stayed at the Hyatt Regency paying double my price and their accom was nowhere near as good as the Embassy.Would go back without hesitation.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Located only a few hundred yards from the beach and right in the centre of Waikiki. Surrounded by plenty of other hotels and an almost infinite number of shops and restaurants. There is a lot to like about the embassy suites and the near by area. I can’t recall the offical check in time but our room was available when we check ed in at around 13:00. The check in process was efficient and welcome drinks were provided which was very refreshing. In just a few minutes we were issued identification slips for every guest as well as a room key which is required for the elevator. This I’m afraid was probably the biggest problem of the entire hotel. Two elevators for 20+ floors is simply not enough and the wait times were a bit of a nuisance. While the speed of the elevator ride wasn’t slow it was the waiting time that frustrated myself and other guests I interacted with when waiting for an elevator. There was a positive side to the elevator however.I always like the idea of needing your room card for the elevator as it gives you an extra sense of security and I wish more places would implement this system.For people like me who like to walk the emergency exit stairs was definitely a better option but we were on the eighth floor so I’m not sure I’d say the same thing if we were on the twentieth floor. Once we got out of the lift I noticed an ice dispenser. Ice dispensers can be found on every floor with soda machines on alternate floors. This is useful as the tap water in the room wasn’t that cold. Once we got in the room my initial impression was that it’s quite small. This impression never changed which is strange as the name of the hotel suggested the rooms were all supposedly suites. Travelling all over the world I know what to expect from a standard room and a suite and this was barely the size of a standard room in a city hotel. I must say we were unfortunate to be at the end of the hallway by the emergency stairs which cut off some of the size of the room. Immediately on the right was your usual tea and coffee making facilities with a fridge underneath the bench.The room consisted of a lounge with a separate bedroom and bathroom. The lounge had a sofa bed which a five footer would have hardly fit into so being a six footer I slept diagonally across the bed and just managed to fit. There was a television that appeared to be about 30 inches which was identical to the television in the bedroom. There was plenty of seating in the lounge area but there was almost no room once the sofa bed is folded down. There was an air conditioning unit in both the lounge and bedroom which was convenient. Our room had a balcony that was of reasonable size but the view was nothing notable. In the bedroom there were two queen beds with plenty of pillows and a wardrobe. The bathroom consisted of a shower over the bath which was surprisingly small and appeared only to be about a foot high. I didn’t use it but could see that it probably wouldn’t be great due to its size. There were adequate amenities, shower and beach towels for each guest and a standard toilet of course. There was only one sink and plenty of hand soap and flannels provided.There was a desk which would be useful if you need to work along with complimentary unlimited Wi-Fi which is almost becoming standard worldwide but I’m still grateful for it. Small features such as a safe and luggage rack could also be found.While the room had everything you’d want it was quite small so we preferred to spend more time out of it and luckily embassy suites has the facilities to cater for this. On the fourth floor there is a dining area beside the pool and the bar. This of course was a very desirable place to spend time. The buffet breakfast is served here every morning and a decent spread but definitely fell short of European and Asian buffet breakfasts in my opinion. While it had your usual pastries, cooked food and cereal. The variety wasn’t great and the quality wasn’t that satisfying either. However there was still enough to choose from and the highlight was probably the made to order eggs which were of high quality. The breakfast was included in the room rate so I’d say it’s still worth it but I most certainly have had better buffet breakfast many times. The pool wasn’t that big and we didn’t use it due to the fact the beach is nearby. The pool was often over crowded and the deck chairs were often fully occupied especially around complimentary food and drink time. This occurred on a daily basis between 1730 and 1930 and included a whole range of alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks. Alcoholic drinks were available at the bar but there was usually a long queue while there were self serve soft drinks.The food included snacks such as pretzels and nachos so perfectly adequate for a pre-dinner snack.Obviously this is an opportunity not to be missed as could be seen by the crowd in the dining area at this time. Every alternate night there was also live music at this time. Other features of the embassy suites worth noting is the facilities on the third floor. This included a laundry room and a gym. The gym had a decent amount of equipment in a small area. This along with low ceilings made it the most claustrophobic gym I’ve ever been in. Once on the treadmill a six footer like me is barely a foot from the ceiling. The flow of air wasn’t that great either making it the hardest experience I’ve ever had in a gym. So definitely not the normal gym environment. Luckily the gym was never that busy when I used it otherwise it would have felt very squished . The equipment was all good quality and none of if it looked very old. There was no major gym equipment missing so most people would be satisfied with what’s on offer. The laundry was next to the gym and had several washing machines and dryers and only cost a few dollars to complete your laundry. On the ground floor there was a concierge which was very useful for booking tours all over the island. From pearl harbour to boat trips there was plenty of choice. Overall this was a very cool place to stay for a weeks vacation. The surrounding area and all the facilities at the embassy suites meant you could always be easily occupied. Even though the rooms were small it didn’t really matter as we didn’t come on vacation to stay in our hotel room. I would recommend to all those on vacation in this area as it has an excellent location. I will definitely consider embassy suites next time I’m in Waikiki but would opt for a larger room.
user_name:
Edwin V
Auckland Central, New Zealand

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We recently stayed at the Embassy suites with our two young kids. We had a 2 bedroom ocean view room which was nice because we also had a living room to hang out in once the kids were asleep. The free breakfast is pretty good. It’s not as comprehensive or luxurious as a buffet you’d see at the Fairmont or anything but it’s included with your stay so it’s hard to complain about that. There are made to order omelettes available which are good, and always bacon, sausage, fruit etc. The evening happy hour was nice and there is a good live band a few days a week so we enjoyed that. We found the beds really comfortable and the location of the hotel is excellent and in close proximity to the beach, many good restaurants and lots of shopping. Recommend this hotel for family stays!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is in the middle of downtown Waikiki where the beach, shopping & restaurants are all within walking distance. We arrived in Honolulu on an early morning flight & got to the hotel around 7:30 am. The hotel check-in is not until 3:00 pm & the hotel was happy to securely store our luggage until our room was ready. Although the hotel rates include complimentary buffet breakfast, our free breakfast does not really commence until the next morning but they gave us extra breakfast that morning. After breakfast, we strolled down Fort DeRussy beach & park which is across the road. A beautiful beach & park! We also walked around Kalakaua Road & downtown Waikiki while waiting for our room to be ready. Kalakaua Road is the main shopping road in the heart of waikiki is around the corner from the hotel, around 3-5 minutes walk from Waikiki Beach Walk which is where the hotel is. We stayed at the Aloha tower so our hotel room view was the Waikiki Beach Walk side and our balconies are directly over the Beach walk shows & performance area.They called me on my mobile phone & had our room ready at 2 pm. I requested the hotel to provide us with two queen beds after I booked a room with a king bed. They didn’t disappoint & gave us what we requested.The complimentary buffet breakfast is a great plus with the hotel. There is an omelette station where the chef will cook it on the spot. There’s a good assortment of bread, streaky bacon & alternates of french toast, pancakes, sausages & chorizo patties. For a family with two grown big boys, the buffet breakfast most definitely saved us money & the boys had satisfied full tummy before we go on our daily hawaiian adventures. The daily managers reception happy hour is a wonderful touch, with good complimentary cocktails & snacks. There is a band performing at happy hour monday, wednesday & friday. The complimentary Wi-fi is fantastic & there is no resort fees.There are a lot of restaurants to choose within a minute going downstairs or a few more minutes walking downtown. There were some nights we stayed in after a full tiring day so we bought poke’ bowls, chicken soup & hotdogs from the big ABC store across the road at Waikiki beachwalk. This ABC store actually have a good range of food/dishes they cook on site.Our room/suite was spacious, the beds are comfortable. Bathroom is clean & housekeeping are done daily & well. Housekeeping provided us with generous toiletries. Any requests were done immediately. I could not really fault this hotel at all and is very satisfied & happy with both the location & services! The hotel staff are always happy to help. Even the tours I booked separately have their pick up location at the Outrigger Hotel across the road which was really convenient! Oh, the guava juice they serve at check in to welcome us was a nice touch!There is a trolley stop we go to to get to Ala Moana Centre at Trump hotel & the Post Office at Saratoga road which is a street away from the Reception side street of the Embassy Suites. I’m happy to recommend this hotel to anyone who wants be in the heart of downtown Waikiki where the beach, shopping & restaurants are conveniently handy within minutes! Happy to stay in this hotel again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel was amazing. I feel we really got our worth out of what we paid with the free breakfast and free happy hour. The staff are really friendly and the room was clean and large. The balcony was huge. The pool was lovely, perfect temperature and clean. The hot tub was even better. We loved this place!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent stay. Gracious and professional. Assisted in all requests. Rooms and amenities were excellent. Stones throw away from the beach. Walking distance to all venues in Waikiki. Recommend this for those on business or pleasure.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Nice location, convenient to shopping, food, and Waikiki beach, no need to have a car everything is in walking distance from here. As with any embassy suites, they have the 2 room suites but also have some 3 room suites, and breakfast is awesome. They also have live music on Monday Wednesday and Friday. The only think keeping it from a 5 Star is the lack of ocean views from the room.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family of four stayed at this hotel for 8 nights. Overall, we would rate it as excellent. We booked a 1 bedroom suite and upon check-in they "upgraded" us to a corner suite on a high floor which was great. The room had really good views of the city and also looked out towards the ocean from some windows. The room was well equipped with a mini fridge, living room area, multiple TVs and a dining table. We especially liked that it had 2 full bathrooms. As well, it was quite spacious compared to other placed we've stayed at in Waikiki. We thought the included daily breakfast was quite good, with a decent assortment of choices as well as the made-to-order omelette stations. The location of the hotel is also very good as it is close to basically everything in Waikiki and located on a nice and safe street (Beachwalk).What really stood out at this hotel was the quality of the staff. Everyone from the valet parking staff, to the front desk, breakfast staff and housekeeping were excellent and friendly. In just over a week at the hotel, we literally did not come across a single employee who was not friendly and wanting to help.The only suggestion we have for improvement would be the cleanliness of the outside of the windows in the hotel room. As noted, we had an excellent view but the outside of the windows were really in need of cleaning which distracted from the view somewhat (mainly during the day). To be clear, the cleanliness of our room itself was great and there was no issue whatsoever with even the inside of the windows - it was purely the sides of the windows which face outside.We would 100% stay here again on future visits to Hawaii.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at four hotels on our Amefican vacation and this was by far the best. Upon arrival we were given an upgade from a single room to a two room suite, we were a family of four. Although perhaps a little dated, the suite was perfect and a good size.We were offered a room in the tower closest to the beach too but opted instead for the Aloha tower as it was ready immediately..The hotel facitlites were of a high standard and the loacation is probably one of the best in Waikiki IMO. The only let down was the relatively slow lifts , there never seems to be enough..The breakfast was extravagant and the free manager's reception was pretty good too... We had to wait for a late night flight but couldn't get a late check out. The place was busy so totally understand, they did offer us a complimentary room for half an hour or so before our transfer arrived...It was great to freshen up and everybody seemed to go out of their way to make our stay comofrtable and fun. We will definitely be back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Reception hours had the best bartenders of any of the embassy suites I have stayed at. Breakfast was wonderful and hotel was in a great location to Waikiki. The hot tub was down and the manger at the time was very unkind when I asked for some kind of refund. Said you can go over to another hotel down the street.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I’ve stayed at pretty much all the Hilton hotels in Waikiki and this one is by far my favorite. Location is perfect. Walking distance to everything I need. Only wish the internet and tv service was a little better. Lots of times I just had to turn my WiFi off and just use my cell service. Tv signal was also in and out. But other than that everything else was perfect for my stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Linda Honma Lacaran Reservations is excellent, Lacy Light runs Resturant and Bars with Dennis and Kieo bartenders the most personable and efficient I have seen. They cannot help you enough. I love this hotel

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a Great location for shopping, buses to Ala Moana mall and Diamond Head and meals. Love the breakfast especially the made-to-order omelettes.Very friendly and accommodating staff. Clean and well run. Spotty wifi was the only issue.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I booked two , one bedroom suites for 8 days. We arrived at 6.30 am and assumed our rooms would not be ready but we were pleasantly surprised to be told that we would be able to go straight to our rooms and we had also been upgraded to a two bedroom suite. We were also informed that we could make use of the breakfast facilities.The hotel was clean all the staff we friendly and helpful, the rooms are a good size and the beds are very comfortable.Breakfast was good with lots of choices and the free happy hour is just a added bonus. The hotel is central to everything and the beach is just across the road.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed for eight nights - first time in Honolulu. We chose this hotel because we love Embassy. The only staff we had the most contact with was the Bell Hop and Valet staff. They were awesome. Parking was valet-only and $38 a night, which is way to expensive. The room was perfect. We loved having separate sleeping quarters. The complimentary breakfast was just awful. Wish there were more options for people that don't eat pork and a lot of the other options. We got tired of eating eggs. I'm diabetic so I can't have a lot of starch. The evening reception was awesome. Wish there were frozen drink options available. Loved the proximity to Waikiki Beach. There was tons of shopping and plenty to do. Can't wait to visit again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: A great place to stay if you have afamily. The staff are very friendly and attentive. The breakfast and Managers Reception is well worth it. We used them everyday as they save you time and money. The hotel is only 2 mins walk to the beach as well, right in the heart of Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: It’s so nice to come back to this place where the staff are so helpful and friendly. We love Hawaii and coming back from the mainland USA and stopping by here for some Hawaiian hospitality is always tempting.We love this place as it gives us exactly what we need which is 2 bedroom 2 bathrooms separated by a lounge perfect for us and our 3 daughters for our family vacation. Complimentary breakfast has a great omelette station and different food each day including pastries and I’m seeing more Japanese food and also fresh fruit. The managers reception has complimentary drinks and snacks each night between 530-730pm poolside.we normally have a city view suite but we were lucky this time and got upgraded to but we a gorgeous partial ocean view what a treat! It can get a bit noisy on the lower floors I’m told .On Waikiki Beach walk and the Kalakaua ave literally 2 mins away as well as 2 mins from the beach as well. The bell staff can organise you a shuttle to Waikele outlets, aloha markets and your trip to the airport for reasonable prices. Yep this is a great location with very friendly bell and waiting staff who are very helpful. Thinking of coming back again next year!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was a great choice from the moment we arrived we felt welcomed . The hotel is central to everything yet surprisingly quiet and family oriented . We enjoyed the wonderful breakfast with omelettes cooked to order and the free drinks and snacks of an afternoon. The atmosphere was friendly and welcoming . Ross at the concierge desk was just wonderful a real plus for his warmth and professionalism. He organised a car, tour tickets etc and had a wealth of helpful advice to help us make the most of our few days .We would definitely stay here again -nothing was too much trouble. The location is fantastic and the staff extend genuine hospitality .

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We loved everything about Embassy Suites. We were upgraded to a beautiful two bedroom suite on the 4th floor near the pool, breakfast and managers reception. The rooms are large, the breakfast is delicious and includes many items including homemade omelettes. The managers reception each night with complimentary alcohol beverages and snacks is quite enjoyable especially on the evenings that included live music. The location is fantastic, next to the Waikiki Beach Walk and extremely close to the stores and restaurants. Embassy Suites all over are a great deal and the one in Waikiki is sensational.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Spent three nights at the Embassy Suites in order to do some shopping for items we can't find on Kauai. As we were going to be doing a lot of errands we did rent a car, and finding the property the first time was an experience. There are a lot of one-way roads around the hotel, and the entrance isn't that well marked off the street. Parking was valet-only and $38 a night, which seemed a little steep. However, the valet staff was wonderful and we never spent more than a couple minutes waiting for the car.Our room was on the 10th floor of the Hula wing, and offered a partial ocean view from both lanais. The location was a little noisy in the mornings with garbage trucks and other industrial vehicles down on the road, but we had no issue with evening noise and never heard our neighbors. Could hear kids down at the pool during the day, but usually quieted down by 8pm. Everything in the room worked well, and enjoyed having the refrigerator in the room to provide cold beverages after long days out of the room. The bathroom felt a little dated, but no issues with cleanliness or mold. Plenty of towels provided for both the shower and the pool / beach.Breakfast offered a good selection of hot and cold offerings, including cooked to order eggs and omelettes. There were also a few Asian offerings to cater to different tastes, including rice and miso soup. The only thing we found disappointing was the fresh fruit offerings - other than pineapple there were no local products, and much of it looked like it had been out for several hours. Drinks and snacks at the managers evening reception were pretty tasty, and a much better selection than I have seen at other Embassy Suites. Both breakfast and the reception were well attended, but seating was never a problem.As this was a working trip we did not get any use of the pool, but it looked pretty nice and well maintained. There were not a lot of seats around the pool, and they were all taken whenever we would look down from our room. Guessing the area is relatively small as Waikiki is just a 5-minute walk away, but given the size of the hotel a little bit more pool seating might be called for.Overall our stay was fine, and we will consider the hotel again if we return to Oahu.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We first stayed here just after it opened with our then young daughters and returned with them as young women. The two bedroom suites are expensive but very spacious, we selected a King bed in one room and two Queen beds in the other. The suite had 2 bathrooms, a kitchenette, a living room and 2 lanai with ocean views. We were in a high floor, the glazing cuts out all street noise.The complimentary breakfasts are excellent with something to suit everyone. Take note of the recommended less busy times if you are in a hurry.The complimentary evening reception is also good with a wide range of free beverages and some snacks. The first night we had a great Hawaiian band (father and 3 sons) who had many people singing along to well known songs and later up and dancing. Great fun.The hotel has an excellent pool and large sun deck but it is only minutes to the beach. Turn right to DeRussy Beach for less crowds. There is a huge range of shops and restaurants within a 1-10 minute walk.One Small complaint - the WiFi was slow and you had to log back on frequently. The daily room rate is high but there are no resort fees like many other hotels and you get all the benefits of an apartment with daily room service and the breakfast and reception. Cheaper advance purchase non refundable rates are available.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our second stay at Embassy Suites, our previous being 11 years ago, shortly after it opened. We are glad we went back. With an older family, we took a two bedroom suite, which is two bedrooms, two bathrooms, a living area and kitchenette and balconies off each room. We did not pay for a view but had a pretty good one, being able to see the ocean from the balconies. Evidently the rooms have been refreshed/renewed fairly recently as everything was in very good condition, with an absence of the scrapes, scratches and marks common in family oriented hotels. The rooms are very good sizes and we never felt cramped for space.Our flight from Australia meant we arrived over three hours before checkin was due but we were still immediately given our room. The checkin process was friendly and efficient.Location wise, the Embassy is conveniently located. The Derussy Park beach is a couple of minutes away, Kalakaua Avenue at the end of the street and an enormous number of shops, restaurants and bars in the surrounding areas. Its about 10 minutes by Uber from Ala Moana and 35 minutes from the airport, subject to traffic.The Embassy has a Grand Lanai on the 4th level which is a large pool, bar and eating area. The included buffet breakfast is served here each morning. It is justly popular and it is wise to avoid the peak times if you're inclined to get up a little earlier. Made to order omelets are popular but there is plenty else to choose. Managers drinks are also served here for 2 hours each evening from 5:30, with free drinks from a limited menu but including cocktails. This is also popular and features live music three nights a week. On the Friday night, the band playing was fantastic and by the end of their session had people up dancing and singing along. A great night - and free!Staff are consistently friendly and helpful and maid service was good.My only criticism is the quality of the wifi. Apparently there was a repairman there on the last day we stayed and it did improve after that but before that, it was a weak signal, required constant re logging in and was basically unreliable. Hopefully it was only a temporary problem but should have been fixed earlier.Overall, if you are visiting Waikiki with a family, either young or old, then this is a very good option in Waikiki

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family and I have stayed here twice now and i can not fault it. The rooms are spacious and clean. The distance to everything is just great not too far from the beach, shops or transport options. I have stayed in both a standard suite and then a larger one with the lounge room and kitchenette. I would highly recommend this to couples or families. The pool area is good, a very generous breakfast menu and they have happy hour from 5 to 7 each day with drinks and nibbles. The staff are friendly and helpful. We were able to book tours with ease and navigate our way around without any problems. I couldnt recommend it more.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here with my family and thoroughly enjoyed the accommodation and location of the Embassy Suites. I understand that they are only requests but I did request by sending an email prior to arriving and following it up again at check in that could we have a room away from the lift area and was told by the check in staff member that this room was in fact NOT near the lift. To my surprise and after a long flight our room was the closest room you could possibly get to the lift. This is only my personal experience but I found that the happy hour cocktails (alcohol) was watered down and the same with the breakfast juice of a morning.Over all I really enjoyed my stay with Embassy Suites and would return again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have stayed at this hotel at least 10 times. Last time I stayed I wrote a bad review and told myself I would never stay again. I made the mistake of lifting my boycott this week. The front desk is rude. Because of the employee attitude I am trying to avoid all Hilton properties.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here with my family for my birthday celebration. The receptionist was very nice and accommodating upon check in. We all had a free POG juice in a fancy glass. Very refreshing. Since we were celebrating my birthday, we got a room upgrade to a 2 bedroom suite. We had a few issues with housekeeping but Manager Tammy’s service recovery was just outstanding. I would definitely go back and do another staycation here. It’s so convenient to Ruth Chris Steakhouse, which is where I had my birthday dinner at. Across the street is a large ABC store that even has a deli in the back for made to order sandwiches. If you walk towards Kalakaua Ave. on Beach Walk, you’ll be right There On the main street with Louis Vuitton across the street, Victoria Secret and Sephora also very close. It’s about a 5 min walk to the International Market Place, which had some really good restaurants and shopping. Breakfast was pretty crowded, long lines for the omelette station. That was the best part of the breakfast, everything else was mediocre. Thank you Tammy! Because of you taking the time to listen to me and your follow up. As well as how you handled my concern, I would definitely come back for another stay.Mahalo Nui Loa!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: great place to stay. friendly staff. 2 bedroom suite very adequate for family of 5. short walk to beach. lots of restaurants nearby. managers reception is awesome! breakfast to suit all tastes. short trip from airport

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We loved Embassy Suites. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was perfect for family of 4 with 2 queen beds and a fold out couch. With breakfast included and free drinks (including an amazing array of cocktails) & snacks between 5.30 & 7.30 every day what’s not to love about this place! It had a great vibe and the pool/spa a hit with the whole family. I would definitely recommend. Centrally located, close to shops and restaurants are at your doorstep.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We throughly enjoyed our short stay at Embassy Suites. The property and rooms are immaculately maintained. Definitely recommend this to anyone wanting to stay in a prime location in Waikiki! Don’t pass up this gem!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great property, highly recommended for families. Fantastic location and facilities. Close to the beach, restaurants, cafes, bars and shopping. Our family had a wonderful time and we would go back again in a heartbeat!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: With a large clean 1 bedroom suite, a location close to the beach and best areas of Waikiki, a great breakfast, and festive pool and fun atmosphere, this stay was better than home. In fact it was better than most other hotel stays we have had in Waikiki. We hated to leave.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We visited recently for the first time and thoroughly enjoyed our visit. The hotel is about 20 minutes from the airport. Check in was a breeze and the front desk agent gave us juice and candies. Very quick and easy check in. We had made a request and the manager was able to accommodate us.Our room was on the 16th floor and had a small balcony with a table and chairs. The room was clean and comfortable. The room includes a sitting area and separate bedroom. There is a wet bar and small fridge. The property is located one block from the beach in Waikiki and it is very easy to walk to the beach. There is a walkway across the street from the hotel and you can easily walk to the beach in less than 5 minutes.Guests enjoy a bountiful breakfast buffet with cooked to order eggs, fruit, pastries and meats. The evening managers reception has beer, wine and mixed drinks. The bartenders are friendly and entertaining. They have two bars and the one past the pool usually has a smaller line. They also have music a couple nights each week.Every staff person we encountered was friendly and helpful. This is a well run property and clean. The room was very nice and clean. The beds were comfortable and large. The bathroom was large enough for two people and the shower had good water pressure.Lots of restaurants nearby and ABC stores where you can find many convenience items and souvenirs. The area appeared to be safe and we did not encounter any issues while walking in the area. We are looking forward to returning soon. Thanks again Mr S for your help!
user_name:
freddy t
Louisiana’s Cajun Bayou, Louisiana

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Fantastic people food location friendly delicious perfect when we arrived the staff were helpful during our stay the rooms were comfortable The beach in the shops are all right there great pool Beautiful Lenai I would recommend this hotel to everybody

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We arrived after midnight at this hotel, at a crowded time, and were given a room by the elevator, which was all that was available, since the hotel was completely booked. It was very noisy - avoid elevator rooms if you can. We had paid for an ocean view room, and went to talk to the manager, Garrick Otsuka, in the morning. He was extremely nice and accommodating, and gave us a room on the top floor with a terrific ocean view, as well as a box of Honolulu Cookie Company cookies. Wonderful service!The breakfast is fine, and the location is great, across the street from the beach. The rooms have a nice amount of space. Our only complaint is that the bed is fairly uncomfortable.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family has stayed at Waikiki a number of times over the years and this hotel will definitely be our new go to. The staff was friendly and very helpful. Breakfast was delicious. Room was great for our family of 5.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I realize it has been 4 years since I was last year, but oh my god, what happened? The hotel is showing its age. Towels are paper thin, exercise equipment not well maintained (touch screens on cardio equipment non-reactive), and not clean.Let me start with the rude desk staff. Asked for help with an issue - just blank stares. Oh, let me back up to the fact that as a Hilton Honors member, I always get a room far away from the elevator. Not this time - we are right next to it. All night long, I get to hear people coming and going -LOUDLY.The manager was not helpful.Now, I know Hawaii has a homeless problem. But my husband tells me for the last 30 minutes (while I was out), a man was screaming at the top of his lungs. So much so that other guests at the Embassy Suites were yelling at him to shut up. Can’t staff hear it? We are 7 stories up and we can hear it.Very disappointing!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: As a family of 10, we recently spent over a week at the Embassy Suites and it was perfect! The complimentary hot breakfast in the morning (not to mention made-to-order omelettes), the location, and the excellent hospitality all contributed to a wonderful family vacation. Would highly recommend to anyone considering!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great rooms for family. Bedroom and seperate living room. Cean and everyone is so helpful. A little bit of a walk to Waikiki. You have to walk quite a bit to get a spot on another part of the beach. Bring a stroller if you have small kids....Enjoy it was Great

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embasst Suites Beachwalk is the place to stay in Waikiki. Super amenities, close to everything, outstanding staff who are ready to assist at any time. The evening reception in the grand lanai was a fun time. Got to meet new people and share the days events. The complimentary breakfast is the best I have ever seen. A full hot/cold buffet with an omelet station second to none. Danny at the Bell desk was extremely helpful in getting daily transportation needs figured out. The limo ride on day 1 was a nice touch.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location. 5 minute walk to the beach. Pleasant walking distance to one of the main shopping districts, the zoo and aquarium. Pink Tour bus line pickup located the next street over from the hotel. Complimentary all-you-can-eat breakfast, but I suggest they add chicken or turkey to their breakfast meats selections. Complimentary "Manager's Reception" where alcoholic drinks are free and great live musical entertainmant is provided every evening.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Although the hotel is large (two towers of rooms) they are work to make you feel welcome. At the concierge desk Ross Asato was very helpful with advice and helping me plan a surprise for my family. We had a family reunion and it was nice for each family to have their own space. The breakfast is extensive and tasty. The evening happy hour (free drinks!) is a nice time to regroup. The hotel is centrally located for shopping and the beach.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our first stop in Hawaii! The rooms are a great size. Having a seperate bedroom and lounge area was perfect for our family! And the view was beautiful! Easy access to everything. The breakfast was nice, easy and convenient to get the day started. Would stay agin.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is situated in the front of the famous “Halekulani “. And only 3minutes walks leads to the famous restaurants , “Aranchino”, “Shingen”.Clean, staffs are friendly and kind, including happy hours and breakfast.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Breakfast and managers reception made for a fun stay, and so unexpected. Have not experienced this before. We stayed once at a Mexico all inclusive that was similar but not as good as the Embassy Suites Waikiki. We always found ourselves at breakfast and the managers reception because it was so much fun and cost effective. The staff has a lot to do with this and we hoped we tipped them enough, they deserved it in every way.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites Waikiki did not disappoint! The breakfast crew was warm, engaging and felt like family while the housekeeping staff was friendly as well. The value was in the breakfast; efficiently run, tasty and diverse selection of choices. What an excellent way to start the day! Our family enjoyed the happy hour with live music and snacks as well. Waikiki Beach is a close walk and the shopping around this hotel is amazing. We stayed at a Marriott Hotel during our vacation on another island and I would give the prize to Hilton. The only suggestion I would offer is adult only hot tub/pool.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I review base on my experience Hotel is good front desk is dull on floor staff was good and smiling and happy breakfast was good enjoyed it also happy hours idea are good but quality of drinks are very low

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This place is a very relaxing place not on the beach but an easy walking distance to it. The pool bar food service is pretty darn good. Lots of families enjoy the openess and ease of amenities and safe feeling it provides.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed for one week - first time at this hotel. We visit Waikiki every year and have tried several other hotels before. Pros - suited rooms so you have some privacy from kids, breakfast, afternoon reception, friendly staff and great beds. Hilton beds are the best! Cons - not right on the beach, traffic/busy street surrounding the hotel. Complimentary breakfast is very good with made to order eggs station - the omelette guys are awesome!!! Always two choices of meat, miso soup, some fruit and rice. The juice is watered down and the pop is flat. Afternoon reception always included a carb (chips, pretzels..) and a veggie (carrots, broccoli..) and beverages. Same alcoholic drinks daily - would have liked to seen a frozen drink at reception. Both breakfast and reception can get busy with long lines but the staff do try their best to clear and replenish as quick as possible. We tried chicken strips, wings and calamari - DO NOT get the calamari. Absolutely dreadful! Great place to stay and we hope to return next year!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Had a two night stay and was provided a superb room on the 17th floor. The breakfast is great and the evening managers special is okay. Recommend they provide more substantial things to snack on, but it is free so why complain I guess.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We (2 adults, 1 teen) had an excellent stay at Embassy Suites. We had a one-bedroomed unit which had two double beds and a sofa bed in the lounge. The unit was fairly spacious with a good-size bathroom. The property is very well-run and efficient, with friendly staff, especially housekeeping staff. The room comes with a free breakfast which is adequate, with a fair amount of choice, although usually pretty busy. A tip - sit outside because the ventilation isn't great and if you sit indoors you smell of frying oil when you leave. The best thing about Embassy Suites is the location - it is a short walking distance to beaches, shops, restaurants and bus stops. You feel like you are in the centre of the buzz, which is great. The public bus system is excellent (download 'Da Bus' app), cheap and easy to use. One tip - we thought we would be clever and take a public bus to the airport - $7.50 for 3 people as opposed to at least $40 for a cab, and there are loads of buses that go to the airport. After dragging our luggage up the street to the bus stop we were told by the first bus driver that you cannot take suitcases on the buses. So we dragged them back to the hotel and caught a cab instead - it turned out that the next cab in line was a limo, which cost exactly the same as a regular cab but was way more fun. But it's useful to know this about the buses and I never noticed that anywhere online when I was doing my research.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed 11 nights. Can not understand why other reviewers whine about the breakfast. Go to breakfast at 6:30am for fastest service. Close to the beach. Close to many food locations. Kind helpful staff. Easy check in. Easy checkout.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a great choice if you are traveling with family. Spacious room, great location, and excellent breakfast with made to order omelette. It’s close to all the actions on Kalakaua Avenue, but a bit in a quieter corner. Easy access to Waikiki beach. One small complain is the Aloha Tower facing Trump Tower side can be noisy in early morning. Garbage truck comes to collect trash from that side of the street early in the morning and can make lots of noise.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Very happy with my Embassy Suites stay. Location was great, two minute walk to the beach, near many restaurants and ABC stores. The rooms are big which is perfect for families or large groups. Nice to have a separate living room with a fridge and sink. Decor was nice and rooms were clean. My first room faced the alley way and I was woken up the first 2 nights early by the garbage trucks as the glass doors were not very sound proof as well as the elevator was basically in my room. I asked the front desk if they could change this and they did! I was moved to an ocean front room with no noise in the mornings! Very happy with them. The breakfasts each morning were perfect, wonderful omelet station and lots of other hot and cold foods to choose from. The evening happy hour I didn't feel was really worth it. Yes free drinks but the food was zucchini and dip or chips and salty nuts/mix. I think stepping up a notch with the evening snacks would make this place an absolute #1 in my books! Pool area is OK, lots of chairs, good sized hot tub but a fairly small pool, not a big deal though. I did leave my battery bank when I left and returned a week later and they had it in lost & found! Very happy about that, however an email would have been a nice courtesy. The one thing that was frustrating was that the TV channel guide did not match up with what was on TV. Normally on a vacation this shouldn't matter, but I was a bit sick and the weather wasn't good, so I did spend time watching TV and correct channel info would have been nice.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: A excellent family friendly hotel. This is our second time at this hotel and it is our favourite hotel. Great staff, location, free buffet breakfast and evening drinks. The rooms are spacious with seperate lounge rooms. Highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Room was great...you have the additional lounge room.....the location is the best!...Swimming pool was not over crowded, heated and a good size. Friends stayed at a well known hotel close by - and complained the amenities were over crowded, even though they had an adult only pool and a children's pool-which was attributed to an ear infection to one of the youngsters that used it. My pet hate is the ludicrous "resort" fee that most hotels charge - and will not stay in one of these properties. The amenities were there long before the resort fees being charged.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was my 4th stay at this location and it never disappoints. I have stayed at other hotels in the area and the Embassy just stands apart. 1 block off he beach but in the heart of many great restaurants and high end shopping. Rooms are spacious and comfortable. Staff is always among the best, professional, polite and always helpful. Great complimentary breakfast and an awesome managers reception in the evening with some great local entertainment. My first choice of places to stay when I can get the government rate. . I look forward to my next visit.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Traveling with two teenagers we booked two rooms.On arrival received a complimentary guava juice as we checked in. We arrived long before check in completed all our paperwork and had our bags stored.The best bit when we returned the system actually worked our rooms were ready and bags set to go.There are no interconnecting rooms we had rooms with ocean views opposite each other over the hallway. It was cheaper for us to get two rooms than a two bedroom room.Check in was seamless.Room was well set out with lounge and separate bedroom and bathroom. A narrow balcony.Room was well equipped and anything not there was easily received with a call to house keeping.Complementary breakfast was an absolute winner with great selection. Lots of people and the buffet does get busy, the omelette station too. Staff do a great job keeping all stations well stocked, in the 7 days we were there we never had to wait for anything to be refilled.5pm - 7pm happy hour we visited twice. Yes free drinks, two per person, per visit to the bar. So drink as much as you want two at a time. Snack food was plentiful and you could order more substantial food through the pool restaurant, a your cost. Not as packed as we thought it would be. Nice addition especially for families with young kids, grab a snack before dinner or the snack can become dinner.We had a hire car for last few days, very easy access to our car less than 5 mins each time we went to pick it up.Check out again seamless.One last thing this hotel is in a great location 2 minute walk to the beach and even less to a huge variety of shops and restaurants, you are really in amongst it.Would be the hotel we stay at next time we are in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Always my go to place to stay whenever there is an event I need to attend in Honolulu or Waikiki. From check-in to check-out my stay is always enjoyable. The complimentary breakfast is terrific, especially the made to order omelettes. The manager's reception is also a great way to start the evening as the bartenders are entertaining and quick with the drinks.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here twice within our 2 week break in Hawaii. Great location- shops and restaurants at your door step.Beach is just about 10-15 mins walk.But the pool is just as good! Buffet breakfast the same everyday,though!Tip; Book tours outside the hotel.Overall great!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great hotel in an excellent location in Waikiki beach. From room to beach its a 10 min walk. so you are not ON the beach, but accross the street. the proximity to stores/ shopping, is excellent. I enjoyed the pool on numerous days and it was aways very clean which I'm a stickler for. The room was clean, I didn't feel the need to wear socks while in the room like I do with most hotels which was nice. the balcony is small, you can fit two-3 ppl there max but its very narrow so if you are afraid of heights and need depth to a balcony, this isn't the ideal place if you are on a high floor. the elevators were probably the most frustrating of the experience because they were slow, but otherwise the hotel and staff are excellent. they have a filtered water refiller (like the airports) in the lobby, so we rarely needed to buy water which was great if you bring your own bottle.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is our second stay at The Embassy Suites. The service was great, the location is excellent - walking distance to most main attractions and if you can't walk then access to public transport or transfers is at your doorstep. Highly recommended and great value for money.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Second time staying here and love it.Value and best location. The staff are friendly and rooms are spacious, clean and complimentary breakfast is awesome.Would return again without hesitation and entirely enjoyable

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel staff is amazing and really wants to make sure every aspect of your journey is a positive one. Cooked to order breakfast coupled with a evening happy hour saved me upwards of $100 per day! My room was clean, quit and comfortable. Located one block off the beach I really found this hotel to be one of the best values in all of Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was a birthday trip to celebrate my 29th stay in Hawaii. I wanted to stay at Embassy Suites Hotel ever since the beach walk property was built, but never thought I could afford the rooms. I needed a suite with 2 bedrooms and this was the perfect fit. The price was about the same as the cost of 2 individual rooms From the time of check-in to the day of check out, the staff has been wonderful. Very friendly and attentive to my requests.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I was here for a week for work. To beat traffic we left every morning before breakfast started. About 65 of us. Yet every morning at 0600 they opened for us, to include the omelette station! If that wasn't awesome enough one morning we left at 0445 and the hotel said they would provide some "cold-bar items". The chef came out, not only with fruit and yogurt, but warm muffins, pastries and croissants!!! That set the tone for the rest of the long day. The hotel is in a great location with easy access to many restaurants and I think an ABC store on every side...and a way too convenient Starbucks. The bell hop handled us all leaving multiple pieces of luggage with him like a champ! All of the staff were kind and considerate. One tower had an elevator that seemed to always be broken, but they just planned for it to take longer or took stairs.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I arrived at the hotel earlier than expected and was immediately made to feel at home! In fact the staff provided me a wonderful fruity juice drink to start me off, then they upgraded my room to a king suite with a ocean view. The hotel is located near numerous restaurants and shops. The staff is very helpful with ideas of delicious local food and spots to visit. Awesome visit!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Beachwalk is in a very good location and convenient to everything Waikiki has to offer and the Hotel staff do whatever they can to assist and help. Most all is within walking distance and if a rental car is needed for a run to the north shore for a day it can be arranged at the Hotel.
user_name:
Walter C
Cave Creek, United States

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hilton commitment to customer service+Aloha= Superb experience. Great location, excellent service, best breakfast of All Embassy Suites, awesome entertainment during manager’s reception= Nirvana. How can one not want that in the Aloha State?

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great Location; shops and restaurants, short walk to the beach, ticks all the boxes, Highly recommended, service by bell hops, valet, housekeeping and front desk was excellent. The complimentary drinks, nibbles and band was great. They even offered the services of a pay as you use washing machine etc . Parking on site was reasonably priced.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My second time staying at this property. The location is excellent - a very short walk to the beach. Restaurants galore in the area. The facility is clean, comfortable and well maintained. The staff, in its entirety, is outstanding. I highly recommend this property and will continue to stay here whenever I am fortunate enough to get back to the island.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Clean hotel but suite was a bit dated(90's era). Buffet breakfast was great & complimentary drinks is great in the evening by the pool. Positioned in good part of Waikiki, close to restaurants & shopping.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Larry Mantanona, our Motorcoach Operator was the best.... very funny and very friendly. He was so engaging and full of great information about the history of the Island and It's People. Thank You so much Larry for a GREAT TIME!!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites Waikiki is our favorite hotel on Oahu. Everything from the weekend live entertainment to the poolside food and drink service to the complimentary breakfast and managers special is always outstanding. Our 2 bedroom partial ocean view room 1 king bed and 2 queen beds were perfect for our large group. All of the staff is always friendly and helpful. We travel to Waikiki 2-3 Times a year and we always choose this hotel. Highly recommend it.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent service. The Staff are amazing but the experience didn’t feel very Hilton at all. The complimentary breakfast is an embarrassment to the Hilton name. I would rather have paid extra and got a better experience.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great for large family vacation! Rooms were perfect for kids. Hotel had a family centered feeling. Hotel was very convenient to beach, shopping and restaurants. Parking at hotel made it easy to have rental cars to drive around the island.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Loved our stay here.Great for families and a great location.Not too far from the beach and the daily breakfast is fantastic.All the staff went above and beyond except for the one lady we complained to about the construction next door waking us up at 5am everyday.Apart from that I cannot complain and would definitely stay here again

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were a family of 5 people, so the apartment style suites were a good option for us. They were clean and well appointed. There were two king sized bed and a pull out in the lounge area. The appartments are located one street back from the beach, we didn't have any views, but this was a good location to enjoy our journey from. The breakfasts were great, especially as they were included with our stay as where the very generous nightly cocktails by the pool. We had a wonderful stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites as a party of 10 with 3 kids. They were great, They put us all in rooms next to each other. Mind you the walls are very thin and you can hear everything from the adjacent rooms. The free breakfast was great with heaps of options. The evening cocktail hour was fabulous with great entertainment and great service. It never took that long to get a drink so it was fine.The pool is perfect for little kids as they have a kids area where out almost 2 year olds could stand up. The extra living area is also great for families.I would like to make a special mention of Ashley the concierge. I dealt with her a lot prior to arriving at the hotel and she was great. She went above and beyond and made our trip very enjoyable and easy. I would stay here again and the location is perfect as well.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I had a wonderful stay the staff was so friendly and helpful never had that kind of feeling at other places I stayed at. Room was clean and nice, the staff was always helpful. At breakfast all the staff there was nice.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: For the location (1 block from Waikiki Beach), you can't beat the price, amenities, breakfast buffet, manager's open house event each evening and friendliness of the staff. Everything was super clean and Christmas decorations were going up adding even more festive feel. I traveled with my daughter and granddaughter and it isn't easy finding affordable lodging with 3 beds. Embassy Suites Beachwalk fit the bill completely. We felt like royalty.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: we have stayed at the Embassy suites, several times now, with Family, and also Friends, I think i can say, with out doubt , one of the Best Value hotels on the Island, The hotel is Brilliant.
