review_body: An excellent place to stay , for a very relaxing holiday. We used the disabled room and it was very well equiped for a disabled person to stay. Room service was done twice a day. Staff were very helpful with anything that we asked for, or about.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: As a Hilton Honors Diamond member for many years, my wife and I were disappointed with the overall hotel. Don't get me wrong, the staff was friendly but again, as a Diamond member I feel we could have stayed at another Hilton property on Waikiki or probably another brand and received equal to or possibly better service. Bathroom area was not clean upon arrival. Hair in tub and toilet area. Crumbs left on table and living area which lends to not wiping off tables not vacuuming. Room smelled musty. Wife and I sneezed every time we entered room. Breakfast good however could have offered more variety. Complimentary managers reception was very nice but could have had better choices for snacks. Entertainment was extremely good.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great bartenders. Front desk staff were very efficient and helpful. Room was slightly small,but we were there to only sleep at night. Breakfast was good! It filled the kids up. The location was a good. It was a block away from Waikiki Beach, but you have to walked through another hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This Embassy Suites is pretty much like most other Embassy Suites, but its location across the street from an entrance to the beach and with a 1-2 block walk to the city buses which will take you everywhere in the areas along with a very good American-style (eggs, toast, cereal, fruit) breakfast make it an excellent base for seeing the Honolulu area. The breakfast, which received mixed reviews here, really was quite decent, with plenty to choose from and a pleasant place to sit and eat, although it did become a mob scene by 9am. So, if you want to partake of the breakfast, plan to get a fairly early start. The rooms were standard hotel, but clean and comfortable and the hotel is nearly attached on one side to a long arcade of shops and restaurants which runs along Kalakaua Ave. Getting to Honolulu proper and its museums and other sights will cost you a fortune in cab rides, so take the city bus which is both reasonable and convenient from here. The concierge desk can arrange transportation to Pearl Harbor on a common van service which stops at all the area hotels. Car rental for day trips is also available at a desk in a hotel a few doors down. This is a quiet and convenient place to stay in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed 5 nights. Have stayed in Embassy suites across the US. This experience was no different. All staff are very pleasant and welcoming. Not completely happy with our first room and asked to be moved. They were very abliging and nothing was a problem. The second room was fantastic. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. The staff who organised our tours were unbelievably pleasant and helpful. My wife and I will continue to stay in this hotel chain.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: As a Diamond member I chose this hotel for my 50th wedding anniversary and was treated as a customer and not guest. No welcome to Hawaii. No congrats on my anniversary, and I did notify them prior to arrival. No Hilton Honors reward benefits.
user_name:
Danny H
York SC, United States

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at Embassy Suites. The hotel is conveniently located near numerous shops and restaurants and is a short walking distance to Waikiki beach. The hotel is family friendly and serves a high quality breakfast to guests. Our room was spacious and clean and the hotel staff were friendly, helpful, and quick to serve.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have stayed here several times. The Embassy remains, in my opinion, the best hotel in Waikiki based on two reasons:1) Location, Location, Location2) First Class Quality ServiceWe are gold Hilton members and Hilton Grand Vacation Club owners. We are used to their quality and this Embassy is the pinnacle of quality achievement for the brand, and I have stayed at many. The breakfast and managers reception excel over all others we have been to. The rooms are good, not ultra luxury, but clean and nicely appointed. The lanais are a bit small (narrow) which is annoying. But how much time do you want to spend in your room when you are in Waikiki ? !The staff (especially reception and bellhops) are wonderful friendly people, true aloha.But best of all is the location. Below the hotel, Beachwalk area. One of the best parts of Waikiki. Easy walk to beach. Easy walk to Kalakaua Ave (stores, restaurants, fun). I love the place and will always look forward to the staff saying "welcome back".

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The General Manager, Garrick, was very helpful, courteous,and facilitating since we arrived at 12 noon; He recognized me after we had returned and cordially informed us that our 2BR, 2BA rooms were ready earlier than the 3:00pm standard check-in (which was much appreciated).Our housekeeper was very flexible with cleaning our rooms later in the day, which was very appreciated since 3 people in my family like to sleep in late.The breakfast crew: Rose, Aldrin, and Riki were very welcoming, helpful... and recognized us all when we returned daily for breakfast.Dominic (omelet chef) was spectacular, hospitable and skilled!The Bartender at evening reception, (main station/Filipino) was wonderful, very skilled, and a great sense of humor...he remembered us Oregonians...he is definitely an asset to the hospitality team!Anthony & Ruby Taitano, room 1924 (July 4-10, 2017). Mahalo!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Experience from start to finish was amazing! Staff and the room was great! The complimentary breakfast had many options to choose . Fresh omelette secret morning, too! At night the manager's special was something we looked forward to.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: After having a disaster at check in due to the booking agent, this hotel bent over backwards to make us feel heard and to accommodate our requests. Very pleasant atmosphere and in the middle of all the shops and dining you could want. Only a block from the beaches! Helped make up for some serious mistakes made on a final all family vacation.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We finished our family trip to Hawaii with a four night stay at the Embassy Suites Waikiki. It was during the July Fourth holiday so Waikiki was very crowded, but nothing was too much trouble at the Embassy Suites. Its central location meant we could walk everywhere, and the Ala Moana Centre is easily reached by trolley, bus or cab. We stayed in a two bedroom suite which, while a little on the small size for a family of 5 (with teenagers), was comfortable, clean and quiet. The free buffet breakfast and evening drinks was very much appreciated and a great idea. We will definitely return.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We spent a week at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki. The hotel room itself is not fancy, although amenities are adequate. We did have to wait past a normal check in time to get into our room. BUT, the included breakfast, pool, manager's happy hour with free drinks, and close proximity to the beach were awesome. Closing bedroom door with two queens meant we could put the kids to sleep and stay up without keeping them up (we binge-watched Game of Thrones :-)). The kids loved the pool which was old, small, and shallow, lol. We could sit there and watch them while sipping a cocktail and eating some snacks--the pool area was fun and full of kids for our kids to play with. The bottom of the pool was all cracked and buckled--definitely needs reno. We rented a car, but should not have. We were able to Uber everywhere we wanted ($38/day parking fee, plus rental, so that really wasn't worth it) and it was easier to not look for parking in Honolulu. Would recommend for a family vacation in Waikiki, you don't need to cook or clean and it's moderate (as far as HI prices go).

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is the second time we have stayed here and it didn't disappoint. Everything is walkable and the views that we had were great. The price is not cheap but since it was our last time to Hawaii, we splurged! The cook to order breakfast was very good and never crowded, which we thought it would be. The staff was very friendly. Again, the location is great, you can go to any shopping area, mall, ABC store or restaurant on the beach easily. The only issue was that the maid service was marginal. Beyond that if we do return, we would absolutely stay again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: You can't go wrong if you stay here especially with kids. Very clean and friendly service! We stayed for 10 nights and enjoyed the breakfast every morning. The suite was big enough for a family of six. Valet parking $38 daily was a bit steep.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Good place to stay with dining, shopping and the beach near by. Breakfast was good and the gentlemen flipping omelets was great. Not much choice is ingredients for the omelets but they were still good.Evening Manager's Reception could have offered more variety for finger food, after 8 days the pretzels, gold fish and peanuts were getting pretty repetitive. Ok, one night they had chips and salsa...Live entertainment a night or two during the reception was fun.Rooms were clean and the visit went very smoothly.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed there 4 nights. Staff was so friendly and helpful. Good size rooms. More than adequate electrical outlets and USBs. Not on beach but shirt walk to it. Lots of shopping nearby. Free breakfast was very good including cook to order omelette. Also free Happy Hour every night.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suite Waikiki was a great hotel with a great location, before arriving we thought we needed to rent a car but everything was right at our fingertips and if we needed a cab/shuttle the bellman made all of the arrangements. I highly recommend this hotel for your beach vacation.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The location of Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk is fabulous. You can walk to so many sights right outside your door!The Manager has a nightly reception poolside. The staff is very welcoming and congenial, and the suite was well tended every day. The business center is very convenient and should one want (after a day of nature hiking) their laundry room is very well maintained and a real convenience.Breakfast can be made to order and all of the wait staff, without exception are phenomenal, helpful and with great suggestions on local sights. Embassy Suites Beach Walk is hard to beat: great staff, roomy accommodations, superb location, near shops and restaurants, and many activities right outside the hotel.I enjoyed my stay so much in October I returned in December and spent Christmas there!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family of 4 (two teen boys) recently stayed at the Embassy Suites. It was one of the few (only?) hotels we could find with 3 different beds (2 beds, 1 sofa bed) which worked out so well for us! Although not quite as comfortable, my older son slept on the sofa bed in the main room which gave him his own space & allowed him to stay up later without bothering anyone. Our balconies viewed Waikiki Beach and Diamond Head which we loved!The hotel breakfast was good & plentiful each day and the manager's happy hour was well attended. A few times, we brought lunch back to the hotel (the ABC across the street makes good sandwiches & has lots of snacks) and were able to eat at the tables in the breakfast area which was convenient! The gym was small but had a good variety of equipment and was not really busy. The pool was nice as well ~ pool deck area was big and generally not crowded though it got pretty hectic during happy hour. Bring sandals, though - it was really hot during the daytime!The hotel location worked out well although it is not as centrally located as some of the other hotels. It is an easy 1 1/2 block walk to the beach and we could easily walk to shops & restaurants as well. Would definitely recommend, particularly if your family needs a little more space!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a great stay at the Embassy Suites. They were able to get us in early from our long flight which meant the world to us as we were so tired. Through out our stay the staff were friendly and very helpful.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I would recommend this hotel to anyone. it's a beautiful hotel the staff are friendly. The kids loved the pool and free breakfast. It's walking distance to the shops and beach. We love it so much we are going back again this year!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Had the best time ever at Embassy Suites. Location perfect... Checking in very friendly and a Welcome drink to welcome you as well. Had the best room 1009 on tenth floor. Family room was good & room service every day. Happy Hour is a MUST as 5.30pm for 2 hours... yes drinks & nibbles. walked everywhere and Staff all very helpful.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites was a great place to stay...complementary breakfast was good with plenty of variety. The cocktails and nibbles at night were good also, but some Sauvignon wine would have made it perfect. Our suite was ideal for two couples. Bedrooms were very spacious as were the bathrooms. Living area was smaller but fine. No cooking facilities but not needed really. Staff were all extremely helpful.Only thing that could be improved on is having room ready earlier for those that arrive on early after an overnight flight. Overall though it was a great place to stay and would definitely stay here again. Close to everything.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is about our third visit to this hotel and we couldn't wish for anything better - the room was always immaculate, and all the staff couldn't do enough for you.However I was very sad to see how some cultures abuse the 'free breakfast' - it was appalling to see them fill their table with loaded plates of food, not touch it and then see the poor waiters have to clear it - this type of behaviour is disgusting and it would be sad to see it stopped for just a few not just having what they can eat there at the breakfast - some even bring a plastic bag and fill that or fill yet another plate to take it to their rooms.In saying that, the food and selections are just wonderful and there are even chefs there to cook for omelette to orderAnother service provided from the hotel was a room of a few computers, printing etc and all of this a free to guests.... Now that's a really good service when you need to check in for your flight and can then print your boarding pass....keep up the good work we will be back again in the near future.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We enjoyed our stay. We had breakfast overload and my kids enjoyed the swimming in the pool and we enjoyed also the complimentary drinks at the poolside, the place is accessible to all shops and restaurants and the view of the beach is amazing. I'll probably recommend to my relatives and friends. Mahalo

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Spent 7 nights here in June. Chosen because of free breakfast, proximity to Waikiki beach. Very close to restaurant and shopping. Staff vet friendly. Hotel is very secure. Rooms are large with fridge and microwave. I highly recommend it!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We ended our 12 night stay with two nights at the Embassy Waikiki. We always love staying at this specific property because the breakfast has a nice Asian flair and the location is great in downtown Waikiki with quick access to the beach.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: From Dean on the bell desk, to Lorena at check in to our wonderful housekeeping lady, we were made to feel welcome and no request was too much to ask.The pool was a great temperature. Keola on drinks was fantastic and the band always the best.Our room had a gorgeous view of the beach and had all the amenities we needed. We had room 1907.My recommendation is to ask for a Hula Tower room if you plan on spending lots of time at the pool or beach but stay in the Aloha Tower if you are heading to the awesome restaurants and shops nearby.Breakfast is good with lots of healthy options.Looking forward to heading back after a short visit to Kapolei.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel located conveniently in Waikiki, closed to everything (the beach, shopping, restaurants, farmer market) This hote likely to be a family hotel...lots of kids occupied the pool most of the time. The best part is breakfast and manager hours in the evening....saving lot of money for that.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hotel and staff were great and very welcoming. ...parking is pretty expensive at $38 a day with only valet service....breakfast was very good but host were exceptionaly great......good location for beach.... food and shopping.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Family of 7 traveling to Hawaii. Staying at Embassy suites made the entire vacation worth while. The breakfast was exceptional we were so pleased with so much variety. The evening managers reception was not only great for my husband's and I's evenings but they also provided snacks for everyone including the children. The rooms were always cleaned and the service was also very quick and great. We will be returning and and making Embassy suites our stay. Thank you!:

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had 4 nights here in mid June, and overall had a great experience. Having the extra room for kids (one bedroom suite, kids sleep on the fold out sofa) was invaluable. The rooms are not big overall but def easier than a standard hotel room. Having breakfast included for free as well as nightly free drinks and snacks was so great! Especially as almost no other Hawaiian hotels include breakfast for a whole family. Free drinks and snacks are served by the pool so kids can keep swimming which was a big plus.Location is great for shopping, beach etc (one street back from the beach, worth walking up further to where the Royal Hawaiian (pink hotel) is as there are no rocks or coral. Not really any downsides other than pool which is a little small (but prob not by Waikiki standards). Overall we thought better than paying a higher price to stay ocean front (a LOT higher if you want an actual ocean front room) where you'll all be crowded in together).

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed in suite 607 aloha tower (building one) for last three days of trip in june 2017 for business. great hotel, quiet room, good internet, good water pressure. Suite 607 faces over the outdoor performance park so can be noisy from about 400 to 700 afternoons. Great location in the middle of a lot of services and retail and food. this hotel is not beach front. parking Valet you cannot call from room but car retrieval was very fast

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hotel was convenient walking distance to Waikiki Beach, Luau Parties, Shopping,Restaurants,etc The complmentary Breakfast buffet every morning was great too. It had an omelette stations,pastries,etc. No need to rent a car. The tours were offered by the hotel as well. Great tours too.
user_location: Staten Island, New York, United States
user_name:
littlenlo
Staten Island, New York, United States

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: 19 th floor behind the elevator in the Hula tower. Before the stay I read a few reviews about elevator noise in rooms near it, I however had zero sound issues. Good view of the ocean. Breakfast items changed daily with tofu soup, salad and rice to accommodate the Japanese guests. The pool gets crowded with lots of children. Don't forget to head to the beach on Friday for fireworks at the Hilton about 7:45 pm in June,

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I could go on forever about Embassy Suites Waikiki so here are my highlights; - Clean, Luxury Rooms- Close to the beach - Lovely Pool and Spa- Fantastic Band that plays every few days (During Happy Hour)- Scrumptious breakfast buffet as well as a self serve drinks machine, (Sorry non-alcoholic that is) - Happy Hour (also accommodates mock tails for the youngsters)- Very close to shopping centres and mainstream outlets - Easy to organise Day trips and hire cars - Exemplary views over Ocean and city from both end of top floor, just take the elevator up- Walking Distance from Diamond Head- Friendly Staff Choose Embassy Suites in Hawaii for an unforgettable stay!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki on our first family trip to Hawaii. The hotel was great. The rooms clean and spacious and the staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is just minutes away from the beach which we walked to almost everyday. There's a ton of great food places surrounding the hotel and a very convenient ABC store with a late night grill directly across. And of course the complementary cook to order breakfast in the morning makes life so much easier. I would definitely recommend the Embassy Suites especially for families. Aloha!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We enjoyed our stay here, the location is perfect for shopping and dining. The beach across the street was very narrow. We enjoyed the breakfast and managers reception as well. Bartender was super friendly and helpful. The bell service wasn't available in the early morning and valets were less than enthusiastic in the early morning for our flight home.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel offers so much more than you would find with any other hotel. The staff is extremely attentive and accommodating. The morning breakfast had a ton of variety and was accessible throughout the morning. The evening reception offered many different options for cocktails and light snacks which was a perfect way to end the evening. There was also entertainment on some evenings which was enjoyable and family friendly! Would recommend this hotel to anyone!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We chose this Embassy mainly because of its location and because it’s Embassy. Check in was a delight. It was my birthday vaca so we got a nice box of chocolate cover macadamia nuts and a few other gifts. The room was very clean and the location was great. Breakfast was good and evening reception was ok. A very special thank you to Aldrin; he took great care of my spouse and me on our entire stay there for breakfast. Once we were seated, we didn’t have to get back up for anything. He always had a smile on his face and it just made my day to see him every morning. This location is within walking distance from the beach, shopping and food. However, if you want to go other places, catch the bus. It’s only $5 for 2 people, there and back. If you want to go other places the bus doesn’t travel, get an Uber. It is much less expensive than a taxi. We caught the bus to go to Wal-Mart, Walgreens and Ross (they are all beside each other) and the mall just to experience it. The prices in Hawaii and very expensive so don’t be alarmed. A gallon of milk is $8. The cost of living is extremely high. A 1,500 sq ft house, 3 bd, 2 ba is about $700,000.00 (learned this from Aldrin.) The post office is right up the street. We mailed ourselves post cards back home. They have food trucks right outside the hotel too but they also have restaurants like Ruth Chris and others less expensive. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Highly recommended for family vacation. Unlike with many hotels in Waikiki area, the room is relatively wide and the beds are comfortable. The location is very convenient for beach activities, shopping and dining. Also, a quality of free breakfast is nice with choices of western and Asian foods. It's not a cheap hotel, but the total value is very high.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel may well be the best service hotel we have ever stayed in! Right from check in with the complimentary juice to Victor checking us in. He got us into our room early and with a smile. Thank you! Our housekeeper was the best ever and every single person working the breakfast buffet said hello and offered to help with absolutely anything. Awesome breakfast, I had an omelet everyday made just the way I wanted it! I would stay here every single time we come back to the island. This was our third visit in 4 years. Oh, and the first time we came down with our teenage daughters to go to dinner, we ordered a cab. The valets said we could get a ride in the stretch white limo! Wow! That's the way they roll! Great price for the room and breakfast. The frig and microwave came in very handy. Just incredible, I can't say enough.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have stayed here six times. It is always great!!!! Love the music!! Rooms are great!! Everyone who works there is so nice. We lived in Hawaii for many years and we always stay here to staycation and whenever we move on and off the Island.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Right from check in to check out the staff were very friendly and helpful. Our party was 2 adults and 3 kids and the 2 bedroom suite was perfect - clean, fab views (20th floor) and we all had enough space. Housekeeping was daily - Nena you did a fantastic job and it was nice coming back to a clean and tidy room at the end of the day. The complimentary breakfast is a great start to the day with a good selection of choices. Fantastic omelette skills by Dominic - I don't think I'll try flipping the omelette up into the air!! At the end of the day there is nothing better than lounging pool side with a cocktail and nibbles during the cocktail hour the pool is very kiddie friendly and no shortage of pool loungers.Short walk to Waikiki beach, fantastic restaurants and shopping.Definitely recommend this place for families

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great place, friendly, helpful staff. Breakfast included and very filling! Evening receptions with live music - spectacular. Close to beach, easy in and out for driving; no need to worry about the true "downtown" parking! Parking valets were great about recommending places to go and easier ways to get there!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed for six days and were extremely satisfied. From the breakfast selection at the buffet to the evening reception, you really can't go wrong. The location is great for easy access to the beach, restaurants or just walking around. The staff was friendly and always able to assist if needed.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites with our family of 6 in June and had a wonderful stay. Check in/out was easy. Our room decor was current & functional for our large family, beds and pillows were very comfortable, free wifi, amazing continental breakfast, and managers reception with snacks & drinks every evening is a bonus. The location is excellent to shopping, restaurants and only a short walk to the amazing Waikiki beach. The other thing I'd like to point out is our excellent experience with Ross, in concierge service. I reached out to him a couple months before our trip and he helped us plan not only our activities on Oahu but for Maui too. He was extremely professional, knowledgeable, quick to reply and very kind and cordial. We would not hesitate to stay here again. Mahalo Nui Loa

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great place to stay in Wakaii. Short walk to the Main Street where you can shop all night. Close to public transport to all the local shopping centres. 5 minute walk to Wakaii beach to watch the beautiful sunset. Rooms are all clean and tidied each day, staff are polite and helpful. Cocktail hour each night by the pool. Breakfast was included in out stay

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great 2 bed unit number 802, 3 individual a/c controls. 2 large bedrooms for our family of 5. 1 with a king bed and 1 with 2 queen beds. 2 bathrooms, loads of towels. Fair sized lounge a shortage of comfy seats though. A small kitchenette with sink and microwave. There's breakfast buffet provided as much or little as you want plenty of choices from drinks and cereal to Asian continental or American style. Toast, pastries and fruit. Happy 2 hours, is from 5.30 to 7.30 all drinks from beer to cocktails and spirits free and nibbles. Don't go for the 4th floor that's where everything happens and the pool is there, the lifts too are super busy. We had a small problem with bin collections every morning at 5am onwards but we had the end unit. Would stay again as the location for shopping restaurants and beach is brilliant. Try the Honolulu coffee company for good Australian style coffee. The Cheesecake Factory is a must try for meals and cheesecake. Ross is the best shopping for designer label at best & less prices. Be warned if you don't already know Hawaii is not cheap.
user_name:
zigzagMandurah
Mandurah and Peel Region, Australia

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is located very near the beach, the staff was kind and welcoming. The breakfast and afternoon reception was very good, with music sometimes at the reception, we loved that. The pool was nice with large umbrellas for shade if you wanted shade.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: nice hotel good location quick walk to beach restaurants and shopping friendly courteous staff. family oriented hotel. (if you are looking for an adult get away this may not be the place for you). lots of children. complimentary breakfast A+ evening reception had good entertainment and drinks were amazing! ocean view from the room was awesome..

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have included my comments in the survey. I am a loyal Hilton Honors member, but this hotel fell a little below my expectations due to my experience during check in and the quality of the elevator. See other comments attached.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: 1st time in Hawaii experience was great! It was our 20th anniversary and we enjoyed. My only set back as a cigar smoker was I had no where to enjoy my cigars. If there was a patio or area that could added for that purpose, that would be awesome!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Having stayed at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki is a wonderful experience if you want to be treated like Royalty. Everyone on the staff, from the valet, to the bellman, to the front desk, to the housekeeper to the cafe personnel (busboys) to the Omelet maker.....Everyone, barring none, always had a smile on their faces and continually offered to help in any situation. My grandchildren were treated in the same manner which makes them feel confident and wanting to go there more often

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I've used the one and two bedroom suites with my family at this property. Thoughtful layout for family vacations. Pool, buffet, evening entertainment, easy room access make managing children's need very easy. Valet parking, is more than many other properties, but the staff is very quick. Great location to Waikiki beaches, and shopping/dining.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a wonderful stay at Embassy Suites Waikiki. Close to shops and restaurants. Easy beach access. Enjoyed the complimentary breakfast every morning we were there and the lovely evening gathering with drinks and snacks.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The service by friendly staff was second to none. The room was comfortable clean and well serviced. Supplied services second to none eg. food and drinks.The location just surrounded by amenities. The beach one block away.The tours and places of interest were more than covered by a tour desk within the hotel.Everywhere within the hotel all of the staff are so friendly and helpful

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I stayed overnight at this hotel prior to our once- in- a- lifetime visit to Pearl Harbor on May 21. Their contracted valet service LOST THE KEYS TO OUR RENTAL CAR!! This hotel is near Waikiki Beach and we were REQUIRED to use this service.....they do not allow self park. We were checking out and needed to be at Pearl Harbor in a timely manner for 9am tickets to the USS Arizona memorial which my husband had secured in March (there are a limited number of tickets available for the Arizona each day). There was no valet manager on duty, no urgency regarding our situation, and NO CONCERN FROM EMBASSY SUITES!! We had to become visibly upset and angry with the valet service in order to get their attention. We hassled to get our car and luggage back throughout the day and not a word from the hotel --- no offer to comp the room ($400/night), or any acknowledgment of our extreme inconvenience. They didn't even offer to refund the valet fee!! UNACCEPTABLE!!!! DO NOT STAY HERE UNLESS YOU WANT A NIGHTMARE.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: All staff and amenities were exceptional. Will definitely be back. Previous stays were at Outrigger Reef which is very good, but four our family of five Embassy was better value. We had a partial ocean view, 21st floor, and it was excellent. Room size was very adequate.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is in an excellent location virtually in the centre of the CBD and within easy reach of all restaurants, bars and shopping. Also tours are easily arranged from the tour desk. The staff are friendly and helpful and we were well looked after.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites is a great place to stay; convenient to a huge selection of shops, as well as the beach. Unfortunately our room was right next to the lift shaft, which meant that we could hear people going up and down all the time. However, the free breakfast and free cocktails that the hotel gives to all guests, more than made up for the slight inconvenience of the lift shaft. I'd stay at Embassy Suites again for sure.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy suites is in a top location just one block back from Waikiki Beach. The staff were very friendly, always smiling and happy to assist at any time.The bed was very comfortable, in a large 2 room suite with adequate fittings and furnishings. The outlook from our 7th floor apartment was over a small open space on Lewers Street where many small open air performances, dances etc occurred.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hotel was great !!! STAFF WAS SO FRIENDLY !!!! Mangers reception a must we went on a Wednesday and the BAND so so GREAT !!!! They had snacks for the family we were able to enjoy with our kids . Breakfast was also so good best breakfast we ever had at a hotel and the staff there are so nice and friendly asking if you need anything or how is your vacation telling us stories and history I really can't say enough about this place... we will be back here...

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Wonderful hotel. The complimentary breakfast and evening reception are first rate - one of the best I've ever encountered in a hotel chain. The rooms were clean and spacious and the location is near great shopping in the heart of Waikiki

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I really enjoyed our stay here. There were 3 adults so the apartment style room was perfect for us. And while it was a little dated a lot of places are in Hawaii! The room was perfectly clean. The bedroom was average size and while the living area was a little smaller than I expected it was still great having the separate bedroom where you could close a door when someone else was sleeping. The bathroom was really big!Having the mini fridge was really helpful. There was no cutlery though which was fine for us because we didn't use the microwave at all. The breakfast was nice. Nothing fancy but heaps of options and always plenty of food. Most hotels I looked at didn't include breakfast so it as great that it was included. The breakfast area was nice to sit in each morning and night at the manager drink. The managers drinks were amazing!!! I'm not a big drinker but even so it was a great way to get a little entertainment. Seriously such a point of difference and a super nice touch. Especially with the band on a few of the nights and they were great! All the staff were lovely. Saying aloha ever time we saw them. The young girl who checked us in was particularly lovely. Location! It was right in the heart of everything. Big ABC store out the front for everything you need. Only a few blocks to all the major restaurants like Cheese Cake Factory and California Pizza Kitchen (this was my favourite meal!) and shopping like Ross Outlet! About a 5 min or so walk down to the beach which seemed a little bit quieter than the heart of Waikiki beach which I really liked. All in all I would recommend this to anyone. Especially anyone looking for a separate room style hotel which is hard to find in Hawaii.Oh and free wifi is always good! Thanks Embassy Suites for the great stay!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This place really made our stay in Hawaii so much better. We've stayed at other hotels, but the Embassy Suites by far was the best due to the set up and location. We've previously stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village and Marriott Waikiki Beach. Since we were traveling with our 16 month old baby, we needed the option of having the bedroom and living area be separated since we had already sleep trained her. Plus my husband is a snorer, and would've woken her up multiple times. Our room was beautiful and overlooked the pool, and you could see glimpses of the ocean. We loved the amount of space we had which is very rare for a hotel in the center of Waikiki. The free breakfast buffet was a huge plus since we had our baby with us. The food was always the same, but the buffet saved us some extra dollars to spend elsewhere. All of the staff (front desk, cleaning, valet) were really friendly, except for a few that would bus the buffet tables. You could tell that they definitely did not want to be there.The pool was nice too, and had a separate area for smaller babies and toddlers that was probably only 1 foot deep. I would definitely give this place 5 stars, if it weren't for the elevators. This hotel only had two elevators located by the front desk. There was one that was constantly breaking down, so that would only leave one for the mass numbers of people getting on and off. There would be swarms of people lining up for that one elevator. They were always super packed mostly with the morning rush, so we'd have to wait for a few of them to pass before we could actually get into one. There were times the staff would be nice enough to open up the service elevator for us though. Other than that one annoyance, we loved everything else about it from the service to the location and to the family-friendly nature of the place. We will be staying here again this November for our wedding! Excited to go back!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites hotel in Waikiki is a great hotel for families. The have two bedroom suites you can get and have a wonder pool and other amenities for families. This is usually our go-to hotel whenever my family travels to Oahu. One of the best features of this hotel is that it is located near The Beachwalk Shopping area which is attached to the hotel via a tunnel. There are great restaurants and shopping options nearby. Our kids love the gelato shop and my wife is a big fan of the Starbucks which is also nearby for you coffee lovers. Access to the rest of Waikiki is also a breeze since the hotel is pretty centrally located. I'd recommend trying some of the local eateries that are within walking distance such as Arancino (italian food) or Giovanni Pastrami's (for sandwiches and breakfast). Rooms are spacious and clean. The only tip I would tell travelers is to stay in the Aloha tower on a high floor so you avoid some of the noise from the streets below. Also beware of the Trump hotel next door. In the afternoons, the tower can block some of the sun from the hotel's pool.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My friend and I stayed at this great hotel on May 6 and 7, 2017. We enjoyed ourstay. The room was fantastic. We were surrounded by lots of shopping andrestaurants. The free breakfast buffet and the happy hour were a plus.The price was fantastic. We were going on a cruise around the Hawaiian Islands and this was theperfect place to start our vacation. I would definitely recommend stayinghere at least a day after the cruise is over. Otherwise, you will sit at the airportall day while waiting for your afternoon flight to the mainland.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I am a Hilton member and love staying at embassy suites. The mangers social was great two bars and right by the pool. Lots of kids but you can hang out to the side and everyone was having a blast. Breakfast was outstanding. The staff was beyond helpful and the one gentleman who's name began with an A was so happy to greet you every morning Room was nice. Was on a lower level so not a great view, but they put me in a 3 bedroom suite. My only two complaints were parking cost 38$/ day and you can only valet. In fairness this is about average for the area. Parking in downtown is a nightmare. Just uber places. Second was the beaches directly across the street were small and really not that great. Enjoyed the North shore and east coast beaches must more Would definitely stay here again

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Again, We would like to compliment Rose (breakfast hostess) , Keola (bartender, eve reception), Aldin (wait staff complimentary breakfast) On and above what their "jobs" require, friendly, happy, and welcoming!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Property was very clean. Staff was all very nice and helpful. Check in was very fast and during check all of our party was served delicious island juice called pog. The hotel is located within walking distance to the beach and lots of restaurants and shops. It is a bit pricey but very comparable to others in the area and you are able to enjoy free cook to order breakfast and free alcoholic beverages in the evening. Parking was an added cost that is not really necessary in this area. Lots of public transportation is available and when you do drive to other place you still need to pay to park, so you end up spending more for parking a car than what you actually pay for renting.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Highly recommended, stayed nearly 60 nights moving onto the island awaiting housing. Location, amenities, staff were all top shelf. Was a great value to myself and family. Would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great for families. We went with my elderly in laws and had a very good time. Location was perfect. Was able to get wheelchair as needed quickly from a long day of fun when mother in law was tired. Suites were convenient with kids. The best part is the complimentary breakfast and happy hour that made it easy to get a bite and start the day. The breakfast was generally the same every morning but good enough and hassle free. Same with the afternoon happy hour where some drinks are free. The valet parking was pricey but they were very quick in getting the car. Keep in mind our trip was late May so it's not peak season yet so there was typically space around the pool and also during breakfast. We were facing the street and thought there would be lots of noise but it turned out well. We also requested to be away from the elevator as it can get noisy because the hotel is very well suited for family.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a 2- bedroom suite for 5 of us; and there was plenty of room to spread out. The hotel has a great location and was near pick-up points for Oahu tours and events. The breakfast is downright lavish. The pool area is not over-run with kids. We loved staying here.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Wonderful hotel, staff very friendly and helpful. Close to numerous restaurants and gift shopping. Best part of trip was contacting Concierge Ross before we left home. Ross arranged three fabulous day tours for us. Day trip to Pearl harbor thru Discover Hawaii tours, Helicopter tour of volcano on the big island thru Blue Hawaiian Air, serviced by Discover Hawaii tours, and a day tour of the Polynesian Cultural center that included a beautiful show and a luau. Ross made our trip very enjoyable and interesting.
user_name:
alan s
St. Pete Beach, Florida

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was worse Hilton I have ever stayed in throughout the world. The receptionStaff on arrival said your rooms not ready till 3 pm go and have some lunchIt was 11 am we had just got off a 19 day cruise. We got our suite at 2.50pmVery dated microwave kettle coffee machine no Crockery or cutlery just 2 take awayCups . When we requested some crockery we were sent 3 paper plates !!!!Pool area not very clean. Very old and dated hotel would not stay again over priced .

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites provided great service during our stay. The hotel is conveniently located in Waikiki and only across the road to the beach. Happy hour around the pool brings the guests together and the entertainment is quite good. Staff are lovely

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here just one night to be close to friends who had booked 4 nights. we stayed in a one bedroom suite on the same level as the pool. It was easy to access the pool and the area where both the evening drinks and morning breakfast is. The location is great for access to shops and beach and the cost here is on par with other hotels in this location. The evening nibbles and drinks are lovely, we stayed a Friday night and there was also a band during the drinks which though good, was a little loud.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My parents just returned from a Hawaii and celebrated their "60th Wedding Anniversary" there. Their stay was at this Embassy Suites was wonderful in every way. They were treated like Royalty by all the staff members.They also especially appreciated all of the help and expertise of the Ross Asato, who was their Concierge. He planned wonderful events for them, that made their trip truly memorable. From the all of my siblings, we would like say "Thank you, Ross for treating our parents so wonderfully!"Makes me what to visit. :-)Steve Ares

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family and I had an excellent stay at Embassy Suites in Waikiki Beach. The hotel is located centrally to all activities on the island, and transportation was provided for all activities in which we engaged. The front desk attendant, Cindy, was incredibly sweet and welcoming. Her smile and personality were simply infectious. In addition, the concierge, Ross, was so kind and good at his job. He found the perfect activities for my family and continually checked in with us to ensure we were satisfied with our experiences. Both Cindy and Ross made our quick trip to Waikiki Beach one in which we will always remember!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have stayed here on previous occasions and will continue to in the future. Hotel & Suites are immaculate. Staff are friendly and will always greet you. Location is a few blocks from the International Market place in a quite section of Waikiki near Ft De Russy and across the road from the beach. Embassy Suites exceeds all your expectations which draws you back each time you return to Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family stayed here for one night prior to going to our resort timeshare. The hotel has a great location. The service was excellent. We arrived late evening around 10:00 pm. The staff offered us drinks and helped us check in efficiently. I had pre-ordered some food items for the room and they were nicely displayed in the room and the refrigerator. The rooms were nice, a bit smaller compared to other Embassy Suites but they were clean and well managed. I would definitely recommend this hotel for families traveling with kids who want to stay close to the beach and other attractions downtown. The staff was very helpful and even was able to accommodate a later check-out for me and my family. The breakfast was good and the food was fresh. The staff was friendly and very helpful.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The service here is amazing from the concierge to the room service. The rooms are very clean and spacious. Fit us perfectly for a family of 5. I love the fact that they don't charge a service fee when checking in and they provide free wifi throughout the hotel and complementary breakfast daily. A very generous hotel. Will be staying here again if I come back to Hawaii. Central to everything and very easy to access shopping, restaurants and beach.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We traveled to Waikiki for 16 days and stayed at this hotel. Usually we prefer to stay near the canal to avoid the busyness of Kalakahua Ave and surrounding area. However, the hotel was perfect in that we could not hear any outside noise once we were in our room. The air conditioning is loud and if you are a light sleeper you may want to consider ear plugs.The beds are comfortable though I would say the pillows could use an upgrade. I can sleep well regardless of pillows but the 8 pillows supplied in the room were getting old and felt lumpy. Location is very close to the beach and close to the shops and stores in Waikiki. My mother in law traveled with us and she does not wander far. However, because we were so close to restaurants and stores she was able to get out on her own and access the shops and stores she was interested in.Housekeeping was very good (Jin Un was the best) and with the exception of one day with a different individual cleaning our room we were very satisfied. A clean room is my number one priority when booking accommodation.We booked a one bedroom suite which suited us perfectly as either my husband or I had work to do some evenings. One of us would work in the sitting area while the other could relax or go to sleep in the separate bedroom. We chose Embassy Suites for two reasons: no resort fee and the complimentary breakfast. Breakfast was great! There was a very wide assortment of breakfast items which means that anyone from small children to adults can find something to eat. The only suggestion I would make is that there were no gluten free options for those who are celiac, though there was plenty of fruit, omelets made to order, and hard/soft boiled eggs could be requested. I would also love to see hotels offering whole grain breads, english muffins, etc., rather than the while breads that are always offered. The fitness centre had a good assortment of equipment (cardio and free weights). If there were more than 2 or 3 people working out at one time it became a bit crowded and hot! Despite a request to turn down the temperature, it was ignored and stayed at 72 degrees F. Whoever is in charge of the fitness centre should know that a cooler temperature is a must for a fitness room - especially with the small size and number of people who may be using it at one time. Each night free drinks and snacks were offered from 5:30 pm to 7:30 pm on the grand lanai. On M W F there was live entertainment which we thoroughly enjoyed. The snacks were basic but were much appreciated by everyone from the looks of all those guests who were present each evening.I would definitely recommend this hotel. It's not cheap but we felt that we definitely got our money's worth.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We loved this hotel. Good location, walking distance to beach, restaurants and shopping. Very attentive staff. Loved the daily happy hour. The live entertainment was also excellent. Great hot tub and pool area. Clean room. Good food from hotel restaurant. Terrific buffet breakfast included. Would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We loved the Embassy Suites. The room was perfect for us - with a separate bedroom so our 15 month baby girl could go to bed while we could sit in the lounge and watch TV and have a few drinks. The breakfast buffet each morning is really good - especially the omelettes. The managers reception from 5.30-7.30pm each night is awesome. Free drinks for 2 hours by the pool. Good selection of cocktails and beer and wine. We went every night and loved it ! The location is perfect - only 5 minutes walk to the beach and lots of restaurants all around the area. The hotel staff are really helpful. We will definitely be back !

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great place for the family vacation very central free brekky and free cocktails from 5.30 to 7.30 a bonus. Rooms are dated but clean. Great pool and it is surrounded by an abundance of resturants. One block from the beach. It ticks all the boxs

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is Fabulous! Staff is great, breakfast the best, cocktails at nite also. Stayed for a week, and was sad to leave. They treat you like family, which is so Hawaiian. Go for the Hula Tower and an ocean view. You won't be disappointed.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We arrived at the Embassy Suites Hotel near Waikiki at 11:30AM. Check in is at 3PM. Victor at the check in desk said he could get us into our room as early as 2:30PM. Ebassy Suites has many shops and restaurants adjacent to the hotel location. A nice walk to Waikiki Beach and lunch was a perfect start!We checked back at the Embassy Suites at 2:20PM as Victor was taking care of guest arriving. In a break of Victor's signing of paperwork with a guest, he came over to us with our room assignment and key cards. Efficient!The morning breakfast served from 6:30AM-10AM has a wide range of choices and will save you time so you can enjoy your Aloha time instead of looking for a meal. Hotel staff is pleasant and helpful.We will return to Embassy Suites, Honolulu!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have been staying in this hotel during our visits to Waikiki for many years. It's not the cheapest around but it's always clean and comfortable. The manager's reception every night is great and cook to order breakfast is fantastic. Rooms are spacious and well maintained.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have stayed at various Hotels in Waikiki since our first visit in 1984. Without question this hotel rates at the top of the list. It is in a great location, breakfast is included which is of a very good standard and there is a nightly Managers Reception for two hour which excellent. I highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Friendly, engaging staff who went above and beyond in making us feel welcome and comfortable. Hotel is very clean, beds were comfy and had great sleeps. Pool was fabulous! Continental breakfast was fantastic, always stocked in food and tonnes of seating. A short walk to the beach, shopping and great restaurants. Never had to wait for a taxi as the staff were very quick in assisting you.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The check-in was super quick--less than 10 minutes and guests are seated and given a refreshing beverage as they are checked in. Every part of this facility and all its staff exude hospitality.Everyone whom we encountered greeted us and offered to help us in any way they could. There are many highlights but the complimentary breakfast and manager's reception were exceptional. The breakfast offered a full buffet of traditional American and, what I supposed was Asian, fare as well as made to order omelet stations. The staffing was ample and they assisted in finding a table and offers to get anything else one might need. The evening reception was held in the same area as the breakfast. I fully expected complimentary drinks to be watered down. NOT!! I had to order a second "virgin" drink to mix the two. The barman was a stand-up comedian who actually remembered his customers from one day to the next. They had a nice selection of snacks for the health conscious and the junk food lover. I have nothing negative to say about this hotel, its, staff , or our stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here end of April with our two kids (12 and 5). This is a very family friendly hotel. The room was spacious, we were in a 1 bedroom suite and it suited us perfectly. When we first checked in, we were put on the 2nd floor, with an unfortunate view of a carpark across the street with all the noise from the traffic making it's way into the room even with the doors closed. My husband spoke with the front desk and told them our kids were struggling to sleep and they were kind enough to move us the next day up to the 7th floor which was much quieter and gave us a glimpse of the ocean - we were very grateful for it! Afternoon drinks and nibbles was popular amongst the guests, as was the complimentary breakfast, but we found it was not really to our taste. There is a little store across the street where we would buy fresh fruit in the morning which was amazing. It is only a short stroll to the beach, and situated amongst the Royal Hawaiian Complex so easy access to plenty of fabulous restaurants. WiFi was free and fast. Overall a very comfortable and spacious hotel, recommended for families who need the space of a suite.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Loved everything about this hotel. Best breakfast and evening receptions I've ever attended. Breakfast has a great variety and delicious tastes. The evening reception had a variety of alcoholic and non alcoholic drinks. Snack were awesome too!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Pro's-Clean and tidy-Great location-Good breakfast and open bar between 5.30pm and 7.30pm. Included in room rate-Nice pool-Friendly staff-Good size room-Wi-Fi is included-No resort feeCon's-Just looking a little tired in parts. Could do with some painting and replacing some of the carpets-Was charged $50 USD (on my Credit card) when I checked in. I don't mind this but I was not told. I just don't like surprises.
user_name:
Jason B
Auckland Central, New Zealand

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at Embassy Suites. We've been to to Waikiki a few times and always wanted to give this hotel a try. Glad we did! Great location. Awesome breakfast and happy hour. The room was spacious. The bed was really comfortable. The bathroom was great, really loved the shower-excellent water pressure. We had a city view in the Hula tower and could see the ocean from our balcony. My only minor complaint would be the walls are thin. The neighbors seemed like they were in the room with us at times. Glad our neighbors weren't too noisy... The staff was excellent and our housekeeper was so nice. We love Waikiki. We'll be back and probably would stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: If you are reading this, you have already researched the location, the amenities of the suites and the complex. I had not, so was surprised and pleased about everything this hotel provided, and will definitely return. My original reservation was made six months ago via cashing in Airmiles points before they expired. That reservation was for a basic unit, but after I checked things out, including Trip Advisor, I realized I wanted a corner suite with an ocean view. Regretfully however, Air miles could not change that, and Hilton could not amend it either, as I did not book with them. A few days in advance I contacted the hotel directly and asked to pay for the upgrade and try to get the room I wanted, if one was available. On Check-in, they upgraded me for free, which was greatly appreciated. Stayed in Aloha Tower, Room #2008. The Aloha tower goes up to floor 21. Rooms that end with xx08 and xx09, are what you want. 10th floor and above for perfect ocean views from your living room, or your Lanai. Room service was prompt, reasonably priced and very good quality. Check in was a breeze, with sit down service and welcome juice. All sorts of shopping and dining out any of the exits. ABC Store across the street for all the staples you might need. You can stop doing your researching now. This hotel has everything you need.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is 2nd time we've stayed in the past year (we stop on our way from Australia to canada to see family with a toddler). 1. Separate bedroom layout is great with a kid.2. Hotel can arrange babysitting - it's about usd$15 p/hr plus a service fee. Having it booked through the hotel made us feel more comfortable with the service. We felt our babysitter was excellent! 3. Daily breakfast is super convenient! Love the omelette station.4. We haven't done much of the manager's drinks - but it's great with a little one - our toddler loved the music!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here for 6 nights and we have enjoyed our time. We checked in at 10 am thinking we would have to just leave our bags and come back after 2 pm but we were allocated a room immediately upgraded too which was fantastic. Breakfast could be a little better lots of food catering more for Asians than Australians. It it wasn't too bad just the same. I'd stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our first trip to Hawaii, and we stayed at this hotel April 16-21. We experienced perfection - wonderful room with great view of ocean and mountains, friendly and helpful staff and valet, great location and breakfast with a wide variety of selections. The Manager's Reception was an unexpected surprise - terrific bartender, staff and two good live bands! It was a great way to start each evening! Would definitely recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is in a great location and all the staff are super helpful and extremely nice. Breakfast is basic but plentiful and managers happy hour 5.30 - 7.30 daily is fantastic. Band plays on Wednesday & Friday nights and they are very good. Hotel is a little dated but clean with all amenities that you will need. It's right in the heart of the action, close to restaurants, shops and public transport. Trolley car is only round the corner. Beach is a very easy walk only a couple of minutes away. Would definitely recommend this to anyone who wants value for their dollar.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is moderately priced in Waikiki, but with so many extras the value can't be beat. It's not historic or on the water, but who cares? Happy hour, breakfast, wifi, and no resort fee. I challenge you to find that anywhere else in Waikiki. Service was impeccable, they went out of the way to assist our family.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We loved this hotel for many reasons. With the family the complimentary breakfast is a great bonus... Simple and easy, and the food was good enough for buffet style.The hotel was walking distance to beach, to shopping and of course Starbucks!The complimentary evening reception is great.The pool area is very nice as well.They just got a bike rental station right in the lobby... Which is great as well. The hotel staff are all so wonderful and very helpful.Only thing we could think of as a problem would be wait for elevators.... But even that wasn't too bad.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Spacious rooms (albeit dated decor). Breakfast included. Managers reception each evening by the pool. Staff could not be faulted. They are friendly and helpful. Check-in process is unusually long for some reason.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I've stayed at other Embassy Suites and this one is hands down the best. The complimentary breakfast is pretty extensive, I expected more of a "continental" but was pleasantly surprised by the made-to-order omelette station. The location, though not on the beach, is close, and right in the middle of everything in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I can't say enough good things about this location. From the staff, to the breakfast, to the central location, this is the place to stay in Waikiki. It is an easy walk to the beach, shopping, or restaurants.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed 7 nights this week and enjoyed it very much. Two families both with 2 year olds and the hotel was great, one on the 10th floor the other on the 18th both in one bedroom suites.Positives:Great location, walk to everythingComplimentary breakfast is the best I've had anywhere in the worldGreat pool and plenty of lounges for everyoneManagers reception every night With complimentary cocktails and other drinks with live musicBar area greatClean suites with plenty of roomFriendly and helpful staffNegativesWalls are thin but nothing too bad Wouldn't want to stay on a level below 6, poor views and too noisyWe would definitely stay again

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The rooms were comfortable and clean, the décor was stunning, unique modern. The hospitality of the employees was awesome, so friendly and always helpful and willing to please. The pool area was beautiful especially at night. The reception every night at 5-7pm with drinks and snacks was a great surprise we were not expecting along with an amazing band several nights a week. The breakfast was superb, tasty and a great variety. My kids and I were so pleased with the accommodations. The hotel was close to shopping, beach and dining. Everything was within walking distance. Would definitely return.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Good location. You can walk to anywhere around waikiki and many restaurant around the hotel. Partial ocean view was good view. The breakfast has many kinds and tasty. Poolside cocktail also free at evening time and you can drink anything. Totally this hotel is very good valued and I was satisfied.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I'm a neurotic clean-freak with sound anxiety. Needless to say I don't travel very well and am always anxious when vacationing. I notice everything - every stain on the sheets, every smudge on the walls - that sort of thing. I was extremely happy to stay at the Embassy Suites Waikiki for our April 25 - May 2 vacation. We stayed in a room by the elevators on the 15th floor. We booked a city view room but we could see the ocean to the left of our balcony, so I think we were upgraded to a partial ocean-view. I was worried it would be noisy when trying to sleep, but because each room is a suite, you can close a second door to the bedroom to block out any noise from the hallway. Not that there was much noise in the hallway - this hotel seems to be a somewhat sleepy refuge for families in the middle of bustling Waikiki. You could hear the elevator itself going up and down through the wall - this was a bit annoying but we were able to muffle the sound out with the AC fan and earplugs (plus it wasn't running much at night). You could sometimes hear faint music/singing once the live entertainment got going around 5:30pm because they keep the door at the end of each hallway open to the outdoors/pool area, but it was quite pleasant and just added to the feeling that you're in Hawaii :) I actually felt comfortable in the bed - the white sheets were very crisp and clean, towels were clean, shower was fairly clean (very slight mildew in the grout in some places, but better than many other places we've stayed). Also housekeeping kept missing the full length mirror behind the bedroom door, so it was super smudgy and kind of gross. Also there was a bit of sand and some hairs in the corners of the bathroom floor when we arrived that never went away, so I don't think they did a very thorough job sweeping. That was really the only "dirt" I noticed!Staff were very friendly and helpful. Allowed us to check in a bit early, schedule a late check out, and use a courtesy room after we checked out and went out for the day (our flight wasn't until 10pm that night). I think our favourite part about staying here was the breakfast. Even when it was "busy" we only had to wait in line for a minute at the buffet, and another couple minutes to find a table. Most days we were able to grab food and a seat immediately. And it was good food too! Hot eggs, pancakes, made-to-order omelettes, bagels, oatmeal, cereal, some japanese-fare like miso soup and rice. It changed a bit every day, and there was a lot to choose from so we never got bored - we ate all 7 breakfasts here and saved a ton of money! More fresh fruit would be nice though, we only saw pineapple and honeydew offered. Unfortunately we never made it to the Manager's reception for the complimentary drinks and entertainment. Hopefully we will be back, and will be able to take advantage of that great opportunity as well!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is the second year in a row that we stayed here. We love the location, rooms, and overall experience with the staff. For the price you can't beat the free breakfast, happy hour, and live entertainment. The location is great since you are on Beach Walk and there are tons of restaurants within walking distance. The beach is right across the street and walking to the Hilton for the fireworks on Friday is a breeze. This is great place for family's and everyone, including all the cute kids, enjoys dancing during the happy hour. The Saturday band is the best! We remembered them from last year and made it a point to see them this year. Thank-you Embassy Suites...see you next year!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were so happy with the size of our room and the service . The guys on the bell desk were fantastic .We stayed here for 11 nights and the position and beach were fantastic . We had a great holiday as a family .

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We couldn't have been happier with our stay. At first we felt the price was high but for what we got (suite, breakfast and fabulous service) we didn't feel hat way when we left. The location isn't ON the beach but it's only a short walk across the street.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family of five stayed comfortably in a suite. The accommodations were clean the location of this hotel can't be beat. We were half a block from Waikiki Beach and in the middle of all the action of Waikiki. One of the reasons we chose this hotel was because they offered breakfast and happy hour. For a family of five the breakfast alone was well worth it as it can get pricey if we were to eat outside of the hotel. They offered a great selection of food to please everyone's tastes. The happy hour can't be beat either! They definitely didn't offer watered down drinks! Great selection of snacks for the kids and live music on certain days was a plus! Staff at the hotel was excellent, as well. We would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have styed here at least three times when traveling to Hawaii. Consistently clean, well stocked rooms - courteous staff and great breakfast. Also offer free drinks in the evening - can't beat it!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is wonderful, great location and excellent staff. We made the most of the inclusive breakfast and spent a lot of time relaxing by the pool. Did not attend the happy hour as we had other plans. Comfy bed and the upgrade to 2 bed suite was extremely appreciated and unexpected. Thank you

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at Embassy Suites again this holiday as we had such a great experience last time and again it did not disappoint. Every single staff member who we came in contact with was helpful and nothing was ever too hard. Many, many thanks to all the staff but especially the Breakfast and the nightly poolside reception crews + band for another memorable stay. Special thanks to Dominic (Omelette Chef), Rose, Jay and Ads for helping our family navigate the Breakfast rush. Best things:- Clean - place looked like it was updated recently from our last visit a few years ago.Staff - every single one we came across was helpfulBreakfast - Omelettes + hot and cold food buffet offered more than enough choice for the picky eaters.Complimentary Poolside drinks and snacks (530pm-730pm) will give a kick start to the young ones before going out or let the oldies relax after a tough day shopping/sightseeing.Location - far enough away to give that family /friendly feel but close enough to walk everywhere. Gym - 24hr gym just the right size if you really want to keep in shape whilst on "holidays".We will be back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: From the check in to the check out we found all the staff to be really pleasant and helpful. The complimentary breakfast was good and the hotel was well located between the beach and a really good shopping area with a wide range of excellent dining choices

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: amazing! wonderful staff from bell man, to front desk, to bar tenders, all went above and beyond with a smile! beautiful property great location with the shopping basically connected to the property and beach across the street.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: One of the nicer embassy suites I've stayed at. Everything from checking in to out couldn't have been better! They allowed us to check in early, room was clean, room was quiet, nice facilities, great evening reception, breakfast, etc. Nicely situated as well.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We found our stay problem free, the staff courteous and helpful. We arrived early and where immediately granted access to our room which was spacious and well appointed. The breakfast service was fast and tasteful. A place we will stay at as often as we are in Hawaii in the future. Good Job.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Arrived at the hotel at 8am (normally too early) and was able to book in & obtain room key straight away. The one bedroom suite (level-6 with ocean views) was clean, comfortable & big enough. Breakfasts were great, eggs/omelettes cooked to order with other items at buffet. Managers evening cocktail reception was hard to leave, and the mai tai was the best I have had. Some reviews mention street noise, but though on level-6, barely noticed it. The location was ideal... Starbucks over the road, Royal Hawaiian shopping centre over the other road, the beach only a few minutes away. Expedia have a tour desk located near reception, and their local knowledge & pricing were hard to beat. Reading other reviews, I was surprised they were for the same hotel, as I couldn't find fault with the hotel, the staff, the food, the cleanliness, the noise, or the location. We will definitely return to the Embassy Suites by Hilton Waikiki Beach Walk.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Overall the stay was high 7+ rating. Great for families. The hotel cost per night is much more than other on-beach hotels perhaps due to the free breakfast and managers reception are included. Housekeeping was not as polite but if you call guest services for extra towels and toiletries the service is excellent. Unfortunately the front desk rep was not as courteous as the usually Hilton service I'm accustom to. She seemed to have seen one to many guest. Valet is accommodating and quick! Overall it's a solid stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
