review_body: Overall experience was very pleasant and the staff was excellent especially the restaurant staff. More omelette chefs required during the busy times. Our family has been staying at this hotel since 2012.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: After reading all the reviews I was confident this would be a good place to stay. I have to say that I was extremely relieved this hotel was as good as its reviews. With three kids we booked a 2bed/bath suite and it was perfect. Kids each had a bed and the second bathroom made everything easier. The added value with the full breakfast and happy hour were money savers for sure. Kids all enjoyed their breakfasts as did my husband and I. Staff are so helpful and friendly. Kids enjoyed the pool even though it's a pretty simple pool. The pool deck was never too busy and there was always a chair to sit on. If you're picky about shampoo/conditioner/shower gel, bring your own. Very comfy beds and pillows. Wifi was not so good, a bit spotty - kids did complain but hey, you're on vacation. My son could get free wifi courtesy of the Trump Hotel next door on the pool deck. The location is very good. Felt safe letting kids go downstairs and across street to ABC Store. Good restaurant choices all within close walking range. Can rent a car at hotel 1/2 block away and return it right to Embassy (extra $5 when returning to hotel, but so convenient). We booked a tour and again, went outside hotel 1/2 block for pick up. We were in the Hula tower and did not have an ocean view but we were rarely in the room or looking to sit on our deck. Honolulu hotels are expensive but the added value at this hotel with the room size, free breakfast and happy hour, it makes a family vacation more economical and less stressful. Mahalo Embassy Suites Beachwalk.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Having stayed here years ago we were disappointed by how Hilton has let this hotel become shabby and worn out. The decor is brown, orange and dated. Of the 3 elevators only one was working and for a high tower one elevator led to long waits to board a smallish elevator. At one point the housekeeping staff tried to push a large laundry cart onto the elevator which led to protests. The pool area is only ok with a number of broken chairs that should be removed. The included breakfast is a bonus for families. The extra room is convenient for a family. The proximity to the beach is about 200 metres. It is now a reasonably priced family hotel and for Asian travellers it is best for big families.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I picked this hotel based on the many positive reviews here on Trip Advisor.I was so happy to find all of those positive reviews were spot on. Thank you so much, without those very accurate reviews I never would have found this wonderful Hotel for my family to enjoy.Check in very quick and easy (a cold tropical drink was a lovely start)Rooms clean and quiet, beds comfy.(We were near elevators and heard nothing).No resort fees (my friends got a nasty surprise when they checked into Hawaiian Village and had to pay over $200 for things that are complimentary here, and I paid less than them)Complimentary Buffet breakfast daily was awesome. Special mention for Aldrin (I think that's his name), he was always smiling as he cleared away and cleaned tables, folks please tip these guys as it's not as obvious to tip them as waiters in a restaurant but they do appreciate tips.Nightly Manager's Cocktail evening was a fav with our family. Just loved it and found it a great time to mingle and meet other guests from around the world.Lovely pool areaGood WiFiVery short walk to beach - walk another 5 mins past all the beachfront resorts to get to the main part of Waikiki Beach (Highly recommend DUKES, great service, food, prices and views - Try the Hula Pie).I highly recommend this property if you don't need to be beachfront. I will definitely stay here again when I come back to Waikiki and will recommend it to my friend's and family. Polynesian Cultural Center is awesome and worth every cent (pay extra for the Ambassador Package and take the bbq lunch that's offered on the shuttle ride there).We also enjoyed Yard House and Cheesecake Factory for lunch.Enjoy Hawaii...we can't wait to go again in a few years.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Amazing place to stay . Staff were so friendly and helpful . Happy hour was great with complementary drinks and food between 5.30 & 7.30pm. Only one block from beach and in a great spot in Waikiki. Will definitely be back .

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Had a fantastic time. All the staff we met were very friendly and helpful, especially the reception staff who helped with phone calls when we realised we had left something in the seat pocket on the flight into Honolulu which we did manage to get back. As a family of 4 with kids aged 12 and 17 a suite was better than paying for 2 rooms in other hotels. We had a city room view, although it did have a great view of the ocean from the balcony!, with 2 queen beds in the bedroom and a sofa bed in the lounge area. My eldest had the sofa bed and he found it comfortable (and he is just under 6ft tall). having the extra living space along with a small kitchen area with fridge, microwave, tea/coffee facilities was great. The only drawback was that although there was loads of storage space with a wardrobe and many drawers once the suitcases had been emptied there wasn't really anywhere to put them.The free breakfast and managers reception in the evening were very good and definitely an added bonus. Another attraction of this hotel is that there are no resort charges. As a Hilton Honours member I looked at all their hotels in the area and this can out the best.Although not on the beach it is very close. We found that the nearest beach was a bit rocky once you were in the water but if you walk around 15 mins along the beach in either direction you'll find areas without rocks. I recommend the Ala Moana beach which is great for younger children. If you don't want to walk there take the pink line shopping trolley to the Ala Moana Centre for $2 per person which is close to the beach.It is also very close to the main shopping area and the zoo (around 20 Min walk) the aquarium is also around 30 min walk and gives a great view of Diamond Head.The hotel does not have a shuttle that runs to the airport but a taxi from the airport cost us $45 and slightly more going back as we went during rush hour so it took longer. Alaine on the bell desk was great at helping out work out the best time to leave and storing out luggage.Internet is free but does require re-logging on occasionally. There are plenty of sockets in the room for charging phones and the alarm clock also has an iPhone dock.Thoroughly recommend this hotel and if I am ever lucky enough to be able to go back to Hawaii this will be my first choice

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Close to beach and shops. Nice breakfast. Great Happy Two Hours each night with free drinks and snacks and music. Pool always clean. Be careful of the surrounds as they are very slippery in parts and our grandson had a fall, and we had several near misses. We had great views from our room in Hula tower.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed for 6 nights with our 15, 13 and 10 year old children and were very impressed. Rooms were spacious and clean. The breakfasts were terrific and the breakfast staff (Domenic, Rusty and Aldrin) were terrific. Very convenient location to the beach and to Beach Walk shops. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Really cant go past the price and value for money, the included buffet breakfast and happy hour are so unique and well worth it.Rooms are tidy and well serviced, once again we booked a City View and got upgraded to Partial Ocean View on Level 15.The location is ideal being right near shops and restaurants and a short walk to the beach. We also used the gym which was well equipped and included towels and a water cooler.Can not really fault this hotel, will keep recommending it to all of our friends and planning to return in December.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed with our family of five (kids: 14, 11 and 10) in April 2017 for 11 days and had an amazing holiday. We arrived at 9.30am and our room wasn't ready as check in was at 3pm, however Lorena was very accommodating and asked that if we wouldn't mind changing rooms we could check in straight away which was great after a long flight without much sleep.We had a two-bedroom suite with a king bed in one room and two queens (requested) in the other bedroom. Each bedroom had a bathroom as well which was very useful, especially in the morning. The lounge had a pull out sofa bed and there is also a microwave and coffee machine. The hotel also offered a complimentary buffet breakfast each morning which also included made to order omelettes which was nice. We only learned half way through our stay that there is a happy hour from 5.30-7.30pm each night where the drinks are free (including alcohol), and entertainment is provided several nights a week.The location is very central being close to the beach, main street shopping and restaurants. Ala Moana, the main shopping mall is a 10 minute bus ride.We made use of Ross on the Expedia Concierge desk who was fantastic. He was extremely knowledgeable about the excursions that we booked and was always forthcoming with good suggestions. We actually changed a tour based on his recommendation and we didn't regret it.We will definitely be back to Hawaii and will stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hotel was very nice in a great location with shops and food. Embassy was very clean, and the staff was so nice. From taking our bags out the car to taking them to our room. We didn't like our view, and they gave us another room with a better view. The rooms were spacious with balconies in the living and bedroom. I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for nice people and cleanliness.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Room is clean, housekeeping did a very good job for our 6 nights stay. Our room is assigned next to the elevator but it did not bother us. Slept well. The breakfast will fill you up and staffs are very friendly, accommodating and helpful. The pool is nice. Managers reception, happy hour, is also nice especially when there is band playing. Totally recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: It's my number one choice for my lodging selection when I travel for both work and leisure. Everything from gym, breakfasts, cocktail receptions, and bedroom accommodations are always above board and a huge help to my needs while traveling.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel was phenomenal! I have stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village, Royal Hawaiian, Moana Surfrider, Marriott Ko'olina and Aulani, hands down this place had the best service. It's insane to think that, but the service at this resort is top notch. I'm saying all of that and we had the worst view the hotel provides, but I would still come back! Clean, efficient, excellent value, service and accommodations. The breakfast was excellent, better then any other Embassy Suite or Hilton Diamond Lounge anywhere on the planet. In the end its still an Embassy Suites, but it easily competes with the 5 star resorts. Not sure who manages this place, but they do an outstanding job leading the friendliest hotel staff I've ever come across. The location is also perfect! The only thing I can say against it, would be that when searching for rates, I few nights were in excess of $300 and I believe for that type of money I would have to be on the beach. We were able to get a much better rate and we're completely satisfied. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have to say the first night was not a reflection of the great time we eventually had. Arriving late we were given a queen room on the top floor next to the lifts. I was awake all night due to the noise and after a while at the front desk the next morning we were moved to a fab two bed room with a twin aspect of the beach and city. There was no noise at all and the room was spacious and light. The Managers evening reception is excellent and the free entertainment sets your evening off to a great start in this vibrant city. The breakfasts are brilliant if a little busy at times. My only criticism and this is nothing that the hotel can do anything about is the number of children staying here. I like to swim but this was impossible as the pool was like soup, full to the top of kids! It is a shame as the pool area is very nice but with the fabulous beach just across the street this wasn't a major concern. An excellent location and excellent value for money. I will return!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We arrived at approximately 930 and we were offered a buffet breakfast at no extra charge which was a great welcome. Lorena also gave our family of five a nice cold refreshing drink upon arrival and a room earlier than we expected (we decided not to take this up as it meant a differently located room than booked)! So great initial service. Decor is a little dated though the 2 room suite was very functional for our family of five. Would have been helpful if there were bowls/utensils and an extra chair. Breakfast normally quite busy (though we tended to go between 8-1030 -it's quieter prior). Pool size is small for a hotel of this size. Location is great -close to walk to restaurants/food court/shopping. The trolley buses and buses were located on the next road (Saratoga Rd) though uber and taxis are available. Also close walk to the beach!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here for 7 nights this month (April 17). Cannot complain about his hotel. Staff are very helpful. rooms very clean. We stayed in a suite with 2 queen beds and separate with mini kitchenette and sofa bed couch, Balconies in both sides. great amenities and location is perfect. Right on Beach Walk, just opposite the beach. Breakfast which is included in the price is amazing. Everything you can want from continental to fully cooked with a chef cooking omelettes made to order plus eggs cooked sunny side up or over easy. So. Duh to choose from. Then there is the happy (2) hours every night with band every second night, nibbles and a two bars open around the pool with cocktails, beer, wine...ALL FREE and included in your accommodation price and no resort tax on departure. Big plus.We didn't arrange any tours from the hotel. We used Affordable tours which had a lot more brochures to chose from and prices were a lot cheaper. That is my only negative from the hotel. I like to collect different tour brochures and go through them and decide, the hotel offers a service but you tell them wheee you want to go and they then select the tour. Probably suit some but prices were a higher we found.Overall would definitely stay again and highly recommend hotel to anyone wanting to stay in Honolulu

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here over the easter weekend. The location is very central, just slightly off the Main Street so was quiet but very handy to everything.From the moment we arrived, we were greeted by the friendly staff. Lorena offered us breakfast as we arrived 7am and she made every effort to have our room ready early.We left our bags with the bell desk and they were very nice and helpful as we needed to get something from our bags.During our stay everyone was so friendly and we felt as though the staff went that extra mile.During managers reception, Denis and Shaun we friendly and fun and made conversation with us, as well as making the yummy cocktails.The omelette bar at breakfast we made to order and consistently perfect.Lleuellym was our beautiful housekeeper. She always made the room perfect, but it was her chatty, happy nature that made us feel like family. I can't speak highly enough of all the staff, the accomodation and facilities. I will definately recommend this beautiful place and hoping I will return next easter.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great Hilton property, roomy and great breakfast, it's not on the beach but has beach access for guest, we were very comfortable there and it is convenient to everything in Waikiki give it a try you'll like it.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We only had the opportunity to stay a few days but will be sure to come again for a longer one. The location is great, just a short distance to the beach. Premier shopping along with restaurants, activities and entertainment close by. The staff was professional and more than accommodating. Out suite room was comfy and clean. Overall enjoyable and relaxing visit thanks to this hotel!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Having been a Diamond / Gold HHonors member for several years, I can certainly confirm the other 5-star reviews of this property! I would not have previously thought of staying here before, but my family and I got stuck for one night (worse paces to get stuck, right;-) after we were unable to make our flight connection. From the time we stepped out of the taxi we were greeted with warmth and hospitality. The checkin process was effortless (thanks Cindy!), the room was clean, quiet, spacious, and even had a view of the ocean one block away. The manager's reception off the rooftop pool area was fantastic. All in all we wished for more days here and will certainly book our next trip to Honolulu at the Embassy Suites Waikiki!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Embassy Suites near Waikiki Beach again! Our rooms were clean and comfortable. The complimentary breakfasts started each day off with a good meal. The staff were all amazingly friendly and courteous. Special kudos to Ross Asato at the Expedia Concierge desk for arranging several fantastic excursions that our whole family loved! Ask Ross about the Chief's Luau excursion for great family entertainment!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We come here every year. Love this trip with my family. The breakfast is awesome. The staff is amazing. Can't wait to come back next year. Very close to the beach. The manager's special is always fun and we always meet other families during our stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We loved the Embassy Suites.Location is perfect, just a couple of minutes walk to the beach and the main restaurant and shopping area.The room was clean and perfect for our family of three with the pullout sofa in the lounge room.We had a city view room but did also have ocean glimpses from the balcony. The view was lovely, right back to the mountains.The staff were all super friendly and very helpful. Nothing was ever too much trouble.The included breakfast was great, including the freshly made omelettes, bacon, eggs and for something lighter, bagels or cereal.The afternoon cocktail reception was lovely, be careful of the Mai Tais though, they creep up on you!! The food included nachos, potato chips, verges and dip, pretzels etc.We are already planning our next visit and intend to go back to the Embassy Suites.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were so pleased that we chose to stay here. The staff was so helpful and friendly. Everyday the cleaning staff did an awesome job on our room. Awesome location. We chose a city view room and were not disappointed. The complimentary breakfast is so convenient. A great way to begin each day. The hotel is clean and you really get the feeling that the staff cares about the hotel and your experience. Only negative feedback I could give would be that the wifi didn't work that great in the bedroom, a Keurig would be better than the in room coffee maker they have and the rooms look bigger in the pictures on the website than they actually are but they are still plenty big.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: What? Embassy Suites in Waikiki? Look no further for an incredible vacation package. We bought a week vacation package at Costco and the property, service, amenities and location couldn't be better. Way to go Costco and Embassy Suites. The hotel is ideally located across from the ocean front Outrigger Reef hotel (the beach sucks in front of their hotel so don't worry). Our lovely 2 bedroom suite (2 bedrooms and one central room) was quiet, on a high ocean view floor. Honestly, it was perfect. The room(s) were large, small compact kitchenette, excellent maid service, high powered aircon in each of the three rooms. I cannot think of any better accommodation for the $ in this area. Free breakfast, which included omelet bar and also free afternoon cocktails and chips, etc., at the pool. The pièce de résistance to all of this was ROSS at the concierge desk. This guy was unbelieveable. When I first emailed him about some activities (a week or so we arrived) he followed up constantly with me via email and phone. Never pushy but informative, I absolutely loved his PR and customer service. He arranged an H2 tour of Pearl Harbor and an hour long heli trip around the island. Both were amazing. Ross, seriously, you were awesome.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Loved the check in where you sit at a desk with a cocktail. Great idea for all resort hotels. Corner Room was fantastic- high with two balconies facing towards the water. Room was perfect with nice bedroom and front room. Pool was a decent size for Waikiki. Location right near all the shops and entertainment was perfect. They have a huge buffet style breakfast- nothing gourmet but decent with fruit choices. In the evening there is a two hour happy hour. Staff everywhere could not do enough. The condition of the hotel is great. Would definitely return even thought it is an Embassy Suites.
user_name:
luischable
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This stay was for my family's first vacation to Hawaii. And this hotel was a fantastic part of that vacation experience. We had originally booked a king suite (city view) for our family of 4, along with arranging for use of one of their pack-and-plays for our 1 year old. That meant we would have the nearly 4 year old sharing our bed. So when we arrived at the hotel reception desk, we asked if it would be possible to switch to a 2-bed suite so that the oldest kiddo could have her own room. Cindy, a fantastic lady at the front desk, arranged for our new room with 2 beds. In fact, Cindy had given us a much better room, which turned out to be a corner room (extra windows) with an ocean view (room 1208). This was a fantastic surprise that really made our stay extra special.The room had a great view of the ocean, it was large, it was packed with extra towels for us as well as towels for the beach. There was a nice eating area (table and chairs) by the kitchenette. It was easy to close the door to the bedroom for the tired kids to sleep while we enjoyed the evening views.The hotel is quite near the beach (just across the street and down a short path). We had no trouble going back and forth. The hotel has a great pool (with a separated kids pool at 18 inches deep that both our kids loved even more than the ocean). The food was excellent. Part of our choice to stay at the Embassy Suites was due to their fantastic breakfasts. But we also got a very reasonable amount of food at the evening receptions as well (significantly cutting down on food expenses while there). Our only complaint is that the evening entertainment (live music) was often quite loud, which required sitting as far away from the music as possible for the sake of the kids.I would absolutely recommend this hotel and would use this hotel again on a future trip to the Waikiki area.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I encourage you not to take the time to researching hotels, pricing, amenities etc. You've got everything and then some here at the Embassy Suites. Great for business, family and friends! Excellent location, great staff and extremely clean and safe for that matter. Highly recommend!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Not sure why this hotel is getting rave reviews....PROS:1) Great location; right across from the beach2) Clean sparkling rooms; beds are fantastic3) Front desk staff wonderful4) Breakfast is world-classCONS:1) Carpeted lobby makes it very hard to roll your luggage2) VERY NOISY - I was woken up by the Harley Bikers who gun their bikes at 2 a.m. You have to be mentally-ill to do this or extremely insecure about yourself which I believe these bikers are in both categories. The mayor and the city council must do more.3) Walls are paper thin - very unusual for an Embassy Suites4) MAIDS are extremely loud - at 7:30 am, they're shouting, "Good Morning, Sir!" "Do you need anything sir?" The GM must take these maids into a hotel room and shout outside the door to explain to them not to shout - why can't these simple things be done? What is our country coming to?5) NIGHT LIGHT - why on earth does the Hilton staff think everyone can sleep with a bright alarm clock that you can't unhook from the wall and an even brighter fire alarm right across the bed? It's like having a FLASHLIGHT in your face all night. 6) No fitted sheets - so if you're over 6 feet and like to pull the sheets out, you're out of luck - everything unravels. Wasn't the case 20 years ago, but now no hotel has fitted sheets anymore. Sad world we live in - no one want cares about anything anymore.
user_name:
mark g
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Nice Place to stay. Views from room were amazing and service was outstanding from The Embassy staff. The valet parking and bell service were simply outstanding as was the service from all staff! Bartenders, Shane and Lewis were the best I have ever had, anywhere! Hats off to them for such outstanding customer service!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel staff was amazing. Very personable and accommodating. Each morning the breakfast greeted you with a smile and weee more than happy to get anything you might need. Hotel is in a great place in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: When you are thousands of miles from home and missing the pieces of family you left behind, this is the type of place you want to stay at. From the moment we pulled up for valet parking, we felt like part of the hotel family. Our bellman, Dean, greeted us with a warmth I've never experienced at a major hotel chain and helped us navigate the tourist traps and busy waters of Honolulu. He even went so far as to lend us his own drink cooler for our many day trips and outings. The warmth continued when we met Pi'ilani at the "all you can drink" manager's reception. She ensured we were comfortable, treated us like long lost friends, and talked to us about everything under the sun. At breakfast time we were met by more friendly faces and one in particular stood out, Gerald. On our first morning there he was kind enough to give us leis made of dried kukui seeds. As with Dean and Pi'ilani, he made us feel at home. The hotel itself is very clean, beds are comfortable, and there are too many amenities to mention. The food is delicious and the drinks are strong. The pool area is a fantastic place to rest one's weary head after a day out and about. On our second to last day we were told by a local man that this hotel wins customer service awards year after year. Given our experience here, I can see why. I'd never stay anywhere else in Honolulu after experiencing the service at Embassy Suites Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: If you are looking for a reasonably priced suite for your family in Waikiki (reasonably priced is obviously relative to the Waikiki area), this hotel is for you. The suite configuration made it perfect for a family with one young child and one teenager. The balcony overlooking Waikiki was an added bonus that we all enjoyed. This hotel was the perfect spring break tropical getaway for my family. The only minor criticisms I had were the pool can get a little wild with a lot of kids; so if your kids are more the quiet type, make sure to use the pool first thing in the morning; and the breakfast buffet lacked imagination, the food was just so-so. Don't let those minor criticisms hold you back. We'd go back in a heartbeat if we decide to return to Waikiki on a family vacation.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was a great stay! Was upgraded to a 2 br/2 ba suite which was awesome since I had two 16 year old boys with me. Breakfast was huge, and one of the best for an Embassy Suites. Quick walk thru Outrigger to the beach. Guava juice at reception-nice touch. Staff was always friendly. I'd stay here again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great spacious clean rooms with comfy beds! Breakfast was a huge bonus for our family and we looked forward to it each morning. The manager's reception served full size quality drinks and snacks. Location to the beach was good but the people at this hotel are what makes it tick!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have been to a LOT of hotels, but I can say I have never experienced a staff sooo amazing. Every single person we came into contact with was very friendly and caring. Always asking us if we needed anything and how are trip was so far. They gave us ideas on things to do also.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We came to celebrate my birthday and attend a family wedding over this weekend. It was relaxing and one of the best weekends. My 2 daughters enjoyed them selves as usual. They always want to come back and stay. They love the breakfast and the lounging by the pool all day long.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I visit this property for business several times a year. It's a great place to stay for business. The staff is efficient, very friendly and helpful. There's a lot going on at Waikiki. I find that even with the traffic I can relax at this property too. This experience was great too. I'll definitely return to the property.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: 3rd time here with family of 5. Always great value and great fun. Perfect location. Rooms clean and good size. Breakfast and afternoon managers drinks are a real bonus. Pool a little small and quite busy but who needs that when the beach is so close.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family of 5 (2 adults and 3 kids) enjoyed our stay at Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach! It has a great location, walk across the street and to the right behind the Army Museum, and you will arrive at a great, family friendly beach! My kids loved the pool, hot tub, and breakfast each morning! Staff was friendly and courteous. Our only complaint was 2 nights in a row we were woken- the first night there was a false alarm/fire drill where we were all asleep but had to wake up and walk down 10 flights of stairs. The next night, the smoke alarm in our room was low on batteries and we awoke to a loud, annoying chirping. We had to call down to the front desk twice before they sent someone to fix it/change the battery. Besides those two things, we were very pleased. I had hoped hotel management would adjust our room price for one night, or give us free parking for one night, but we were offered neither.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The stay along with our trip will be most memorable. We always stay at the Embassy no matter where we travel. This was one the best of the brand. We could see the ocean from the balcony and the city from the other balcony. If we should return we would stay at this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Call and speak to someone at the hotel about the best rooms. We had a corner room closest to the ocean on the 16th floor and had a great time. The rooms are large and televisions are large. Beds are comfortable and rooms clean and well kept. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I found a bag of marijuana in my room on the balcony of my room. It was alarming and frankly quite scary because I did not know how it got there. No member of management showed up to my room and it took them a while to respond with a member of the security team to respond. Illegal narcotics is a felony and could have cost me my job and for the hotel staff to be so relaxed about the entire situation blew my mind. Upon check, I had to request to speak with the manager on Duty and all he did was deny responsibility and quiz me on how the narcotics ended up on my balcony. I did not appreciate that at all and he made no attempt to make any sort of amends or good faith gesture for the inconvenience. It was not my responsibility as a paying patron and a member of the Armed Forces to figure out how marijuana was smuggled into the hotel. That was/is his job and that would have been the appropriate time to take action. Take ownership of any situation. It is easy to pass responsibility on to the next party. The right answer is always “how can I correct this or make it better!” All I heard was it was another guest or other conspiracy theories on how this bag of marijuana magically appeared on my balcony. The details aren’t important but the experience is. The situation was handled poorly and unfortunately I will not be returning to this hotel. The ramifications of that situation could have cost me so much had it been found by someone other than myself and I don’t think the employees at your hotel understood that, which leads me to believe that illegal drugs being found in this location are common practice and that is unacceptable. The poor wifi internet connection is not conducive to business travelers.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is the second time I've stayed at this hotel. It can't be beat! Location, location, location, it is close to the beach, restaurants and shops. Waikiki Beach Walk is on your doorstep! The rooms are clean and spacious and front desk are very courteous and extremely helpful. It has a great happy hour and lovely pool. Thoroughly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: If you want oceanview then request the HULA tower not the ALOHA tower. We had a corner room with a very nice view of the beach and Rainbow Tower at the Hilton. Free breakfast buffet and manager's brunch in the evening was nice. Next to Denny's, close to all the shopping and the beachwalk. Wonderful location. Beach access was just across the street...short walk. Pool needs to be heated and the jacuzzi/hottub was too hot and children should not be allowed in it because it is not healthy for them. Room was very spacious and two balconies because it was a corner room. Bed was heavenly. Large Televisions but not many channels. Staff was helpful and courteous. Valet parking only.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed for 4 nights on the way home to Australia. Suites are big and clean. We had a poolside room which was very quiet despite having lots of people around most of the time. Breakfast was included as well as a two hour free cocktail reception every night. Close to everything and only a short distance from airport. We had a great time.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had previously stayed at an Embassy Suites Hotel in Orlando and really appreciated the value of the the complimentary breakfast buffet and evening drinks reception. We arrived at 9am and were delighted that we were able to check into our room straightaway. We were also invited to have breakfast that day if we wanted. Our suite was clean and spacious. The location of the hotel is very central. Although there was a queue for the drinks reception in the evening the barman was very fast and entertaining. the live music was also a pleasant surprise.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed 7 nights with two 12 yr old girls. Very good value in an expensive city. Rooms very good size, good breakfast ( have certainly had better but when included was more than adequate) Great happy hour with free cocktails - watch the cocktails - super strong. Really lovely having happy hour around the pool, kids could swim and we could enjoy a drink. The house band that plays 3 times a week were fantastic. Great location and very pleasant staff.Would stay again

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is our 2nd stay at this hotel and it was just as great as the first time. <5 minute walk to Waikiki beach, excellent free breakfast, nightly manager reception with open bar, great Waikiki location and very welcoming and attentive staff make this a great value for Oahu vacations.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Best Embassy Suites ever and I've stayed in a lot. We would stay at this hotel any time we are in Honalulu HI. Walk to beach, shopping and great resturants. Staff was very pleasant and helpful in every way. Wonderful welcome when we arrived.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The embassy suites is a solid option in Oahu. If your going to Waikiki Beach I would remommend it. It is close to everything and the customer service is great. Food is expensive on the island but the free breakfast and cocktail hour are exceptional. The only downside I see now with Embassy Suitr chain is they time to get you to buy into there time share gig.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites Waikiki Beachwalk is the best hotel experience I have ever had.I have travelled all over Asia, Australia, Europe and the U.S. and stayed in many, many 5 star hotels and condos but never have I received such a welcome as when I arrived at Embassy Suites. A special thank you to Rika, her customer service skills are outstanding and need to be rewarded.I arrived at 9am and my room was ready, able to check-in straight away which was welcomed after a long flight. Suites are roomy, very clean and smelled fresh. All the staff were friendly, cleanliness was very well maintained. Top score for the cooked breakfast and happy hour. This is my second time at Embassy Suites, loved it the first time and loved it again no doubt I will be back.The location couldn't be betterIf ever I could recommend a place to stay in Waikiki this would be it. Do yourself a favour and don't stay anywhere else.Thank you to the management and staff I'll see you next time.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites Waikiki Beachwalk is the best place to stay while in Waikiki for couples, family, friends, solo or for business! It provides everything you'll need and exceed your expectations! The Staff are so helpful and friendly and the suites are spacious and comfortable! You'll really enjoy their Buffet Breakfast and the Manager's Reception! The facilities are fantastic and it's in a perfect location! You'll for sure enjoy and have a wonderful stay!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family stayed during spring break and we had a super nice relaxing time. The overall resort experience was amazing and the staff was incredibly helpful. We especially enjoyed the breakfast and the happy hour. I left 3 nights of happy hours, "Happy, Happy, Happy!" The pool staff were friendly... And I noticed that Daniel came on his off day to feed the goldfish in the pond. The fish was a nice touch because my kids loved looking at them. I found my new "Staycation" resort and I will definitely be staying there again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My stay at the Embassy suites was enjoyable. The staff gave passion fruit juice upon our arrival. To the housekeeper asking us about our stay. Only negative was that there was a line for the breakfast at 6 30, which was unusual

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was an excellent choice for us-mom, dad, kids ages 12 and 15. Check in was efficient and friendly. We lived the welcome drink. We had upgraded from city view to ocean view and are so glad we did. Our room was 2030, which had a 180 degree view of the beach. Absolutely stunning. The rooms are spacious and having a separate bedroom/living area was perfect for our family. The fridge and microwave were great touches. We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast every morning and found that the quality and selection were very good. We attended the free happy hour two of the four evenings we were there. Keiko the bartender was funny and efficient. The housekeeping staff were very friendly and did a wonderful job. The hotel is well situated with lots of amenities nearby and easy access to the beach. Can't imagine better service or a better value in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our second stay at Embassy Suites Waikiki was as good as our first; this hotel has a good location, good facilities, friendly staff, and was clean and welcoming. good access to beaches, shopping, and local dining. Next time in Waikiki, we'll be booking Embassy suites again. Complimentary buffet breakfast and evening receptions are great added benefits.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: If you're travelling with children who will be using the sofa bed than be prepared for uncomfortable sleep, these sofa bed springs and mattresses are totally outdated, hotel must make an effort to replace sofa beds

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a 2-room suite= King room for my husband and I, a couch in the living room, and another bedroom with 2 queen beds for our kids. Super!!! Oh, and there was a bathroom off each bedroom!! 2 bathrooms for our family of 5= awesome!! The breakfast buffet was delicious and easily accessible! The location is nearby ABC stores and a shopping/dining area behind the hotel- very handy! Very friendly staff, too! I Highly recommend this hotel!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is such a fabulous hotel. It is right in the heart of Waikiki, smack in the middle of all kinds of shopping -- from upscale, to touristy shops, to restaurants. Like a mini-, much more relaxed, Aloha-infused NYC. Asian fusion ABOUNDS at the little food truck plaza directly across the street. This was a lifesaver when we were tired after a long day sightseeing and didn't want to trek out in the car again for food. Ramen, Korean BBQ, sushi, delicious fresh fish... but, I digress. The free breakfast was the best I've ever experienced. Free breakfast is one of my favorite things about staying at hotels, so this says a lot! There were scrambled eggs and white rice daily, rotating tater tots and diced potatoes, several rotating meats from 2 types of sausage (links and round), to bacon, melon and pineapple, a made-to-order(!) omelette station, oatmeal with more toppings than I've seen offered anywhere, and of course. Steal and breads -- even salad and a miso dispenser. Love the Asian flair. Best of all, a real taste of island paradise was the Manager's Reception 5:30-7:30pm, nightly. There is live entertainment with a great ukulele band 3x/week, plus FREE drinks to put you in a tropical mood, while you watch the sunset from the rooftop pool area. Ugh, can you tell I want to go back? Complimentary newspaper is also delivered daily to your door. The only downsides: 1) $38/night valet parking, which was worth it to us to stay right in Waikiki and walk rather than struggling to find parking, at which we've failed at other vacations in the past. 2) We were in the Aloha Tower and the CONSTANTLY dinging elevators were really noisy, along with the banging from 6am deliveries on the street below (blessing/curse of "downtown"), but they accommodated us and we switched rooms to a higher floor (20th), further from the elevator. PS- Roy's restaurant is next door and REALLY good -- not your typical "screw it, let's just eat in the hotel" place. Pro tip: Roy's has a Yelp deal to get a free SINFUL chocolate lava dessert if you check in! Pro tip #2: Ocean view is sooo worth it -- our 2nd room was a free upgrade and it was just bomb. (Pics made all our snowed-in friends jealous.) Thanks, Embassy Suites, for the memories, free music CD, cute fruity drinks at check-in.... All in all, I'll be trying to find a place to top this one for a long time to come.
user_location: New York City, New York, Usa
user_name:
SCMPH
New York City, New York, Usa

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: On arrival, we were surprised that the reception was just in the shaded open area nearby the taxi stand. We were given a "welcome" drink while checking in. Very friendly and warm - felt comfortable straight away. Our room was at the end of the corridor on one of the higher floors with ocean views and overlooking the swimming pool.As we had just checked in, we were also provided with a free drink of our choice on a kiosk near the swimming pool - the bartender was very friendly with a welcoming smile and deserves a good tip.In the dining area, there was this band which consists of a father with 3 of his sons - what a fantastic band that plays a mix variety of songs - some oldies and some current ones. Extremely talented musicians. The hotel suite was very comfortable with a little kitchenette and microwave oven which came in handy.The hotel is very conveniently located near all the main shopping centres and eateries - all within walking distance.There is also a convenient store across the road - ABC - which sells everything that you would need including some pharmacy stuff. They can even make up a fresh hamburger of your choice if you so wish.The hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating. The hotel has a Business Centre (Room) with a number of computers which I had the benefit to utilise. There was a waiter in the dining area - so friendly & greets you all the time - and would always come up and asked whether he can help us with coffee or tea, etc., and with a big smile and always happy and jolly - pity that I didn't get his name.Overall, a marvelous hotel and lovely stay. We will definitely come again. Recommended.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great rooms, breakfast, and reception. Location near beach (one hotel away) and shopping. Nice ABC store with good ready food next door. Great restaurants next to hotel, good food trucks across the street (shrimp and steak combo is good).

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We recently relocated to Hawaii & had the pleasure of a LONG stay. The entire staff is extremely customer service oriented. From the time you pull in valet, bell service, front desk staff, housekeeping, cooks, waitress & especially the bartenders are so well trained. Pi' Lani & Kehau kept me informed on the island I will call home for the next 3 years & while they are all great my favorite bartender is Keola. That man made me feel like I was getting Ritz Carlton treatment in this amazing deal. They offer a great complimentary breakfast & the manager host a reception every evening from 1730-1930 where there's live entertainment, snacks & cocktails all included with your stay. By far the best value, this location is amazing, located near everything. Only downfall would be the cost of parking is high.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Had a wonderful stay at the Embassy Suites. Great location-easy access to all things along Wikiki beach. The breakfast and evening receptions are a great asset. We toured all sides of the island. Love the north shore and the eastern side of the island. Less populated and the scenery is beautiful.
user_name:
Laura H
Fort Myers, United States

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed a week, good location in Waikiki, easy walk to beach and right in the middle of the shops. Hotel is great for a family oriented comfortable stay. Breakfast was good, not much gluten free though, no gf cereal,just frozen bread, too hard to eat. Nice freshly made omelets. The evening reception was good and there was even live music on some nights. Created a nice atmosphere. Nice to be close to everything and Denny"s is straight across the road for cheap meals including lots gluten free options.. Fridge in the room but no freezer bit hard with a large family. Really nice friendly staff, especially our cleaning lady on the 20th floor, she had many helpful tips.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our first stay and we were surprised by the amenities and great location. It is easy to walk to many places; if not transportation is nearby and concierge is helpful. Check-in was smooth and no wait. The breakfast buffet as well as the cocktail reception were excellent; however there are lines during peak time at 8AM.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed in the two room suite with a common living room and two bathrooms, which was very spacious and very comfortable. There are several television sets and couches and chair in the living room to relax, definitely enough space to fit server all people comfortably.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We returned to the Embassy Suites having stayed here a couple of years ago and we were met with the same great service and excellent experiences. The reason we returned was because of the amazing included breakfast buffet and the nightly manager's reception (read: free booze (wine, beer, spirits, cocktails!) and plenty of it over a 2 hour period every night - with snacks!). A cold juice on arrival is a nice touch and all the staff are exceptionally friendly. A very special mention to Aldrin who works around the dining area at breakfast. I remember him specifically from our first visit and was so happy to see him and be served by him again. He is a credit to the company but also just a damn good person, heart of gold, keen to help and even once walked my wife and baby to the bathroom holding an umbrella because it was raining - and it was probably less than 10 steps in the rain! Champion human, hopefully his boss reads this and lets him know! For the keen gym goers the gym is actually pretty good for a hotel gym. Bikes, eliptical machines and 3 treadmills, swiss balls and ab machines, a cable station with 2 weights stacks which includes a pullup bar, 3 adjustable benches and dumbbells from baby weights to 55lb - not that heavy but good enough for a quick workout. The hotel is also in a great location - on the beachwalk with all of the shops and restaurants, adjacent to the Yardhouse, has an ABC (all purpose food/drink/supplies store) store directly opposite and is a tiny walk across the road to the beach. I would recommend staying here to anyone wanting to stay in Waikiki, and I'd stay here again next time we end up in this part of the world.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Center of all the great restaurants and night life. Local bus and sight seeing pick-ups close. Price for size of room, view and hotel accommodations very reasonable. Hotel staff was very friendly. Most likely will stay again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here pre and post our Hawaiian cruise on the Pride of America. We could not have made a better choice! It exemplifies the Aloha spirit.The staff (reception, Bell Desk, room, breakfast and pool) were always courteous, friendly and helpful. They regularly asked if we needed anything if they could do anything for us and as we left, all the various staff thanked us for staying with them. Their caring and attentiveness seemed genuine.The complimentary breakfast has many choices, including an omelette station where they will also prepare eggs any way you would like. The food is plentiful and we found that we could have a big breakfast and not need to eat again until dinner.The pool is very nice with an attached hot tub and wading area for small children. There are steps into the pool as well which makes entry easy for children and the elderly.The complimentary Happy Hour is nice. There is music, the drinks are free but the snacks are as advertised; "light". The light snacks consist of goldfish, chips, vegetables and dip, taco chips and salsa and similar items. Do not expect to have this be your light dinner. This is not a complaint but a clarification.Our room was plenty big enough. We had a bedroom with 2 queen size beds and a sitting area and bathroom. There was a fridge, microwave, coffeemaker and kettle. The room was very clean and we lacked for nothing.We had a partial ocean view room and it was great. We did not wish we had opted for the full ocean view. We could sit on our couch and look at the ocean; perfect! There was also a small balcony with a table and 2 chairs. We were on the 20th floor and didn't want to sit out there but it was nice to open the door and get a breeze.The hotel location was also very good. There are no resort fees because the hotel is not on the ocean, which is great, yet it is within easy walking distance to the beach. It is also very close to many restaurants and the Waikiki main shopping strip.There is an ABC store across the street which we frequented regularly for snacks, drinks, fruit, wine, etc. You could probably get almost anything that you might have forgotten at home here (sunblock, socks, ibuprofen....). It has lots of souvenirs too.On the day we checked out, our flight was at 10:00pm. We were able to get late checkout (1:00pm). They stored our bags for us and provided us with a courtesy room to shower and change in before we left for the airport. This allowed us to enjoy the afternoon at the pool and have a meal before leaving. We spoke to others who were doing the same thing. Another bonus for staying here.Overall, our experience at this hotel was excellent and we would definitely stay here again. I highly recommend it for all the reasons stated above. It is an excellent value!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here with our 2 kids (10&13) in a 2x queen bed for 6 nights in September. We arrived early and were let into our room straight away but, on entering our room, realised that the main bedroom had the lift on the other side of the wall and, I am a light sleeper so that just wasn't going to work. Back down to reception we went and they changed the room with no hassles at all. The room décor would be the only thing I would say wasn't to my liking in this hotel, but that's a personal thing! It was very clean which is top of my priorities. The hotel is in a great position, surrounded by shops and restaurants. An ABC shop just outside the front door and the beach is only a short walk away. Public transport and the Waikiki trolley is only a block away. The concierge staff and wait staff were extremely accommodating, one waiter even tracked down some candles for us to put in a muffin for our sons birthday. The concierge desk was extremely helpful when booking our tours or giving directions. Breakfast was delicious with everything you can imagine from cereals, pastries, fruit, bacon and plenty of eggs cooked on the spot to your liking. Happy hour with free beer, spirits and nibbles drew a crowd to the pool area. There are vending machines, ice machines and a laundry with easy to use machines and dryers (don't stay on that floor though because the door bangs) There is a restaurant downstairs but we never ate there, I think it was Japanese and two ATMs in the lobby also. I would highly recommend this hotel, they even give you a CD of Hawaiian music when you leave

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed in a king suite and it was amazing, the beds were so comfortable and the room had everything that we could want. The only downside was the king suites are located next to the elevator shafts which mean overnight it's like sleeping in a subway station.After the 1st night we complained about the noise and were upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite - we didn't need the 2 bedrooms but the suite again was amazing, the bed was awesome and we really enjoyed our stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: From the location, to the appearance, to the STAFF!!! and not to mention the COMPLIMENTARY BREAKFAST: Best experience ever. We spent 10 days in the hotel and couldn't have asked for a better time. started each morning with the breakfast buffet, took a short walk to the beach and shops, then spent time at the pool and hottub, followed by dinner to a multitude of restaurants close by. GREAT TIME!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were so happy with this hotel. It's not exactly a one bdrm unit but definitely 2 good size rooms with a kitchenette (small fridge, microwave, sink, coffee maker and kettle) and even the entry level rooms are super nice. The morning breakfast was superb and held us til dinner time. The managers reception was nice but we only went once. If you have a late flight ask about their day rate. $150 U.S and we kept our room til 8:00pm. Made all the difference on a red eye flight.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a great hotel to stay at. There is a wonderful breakfast every morning. Pool is beautiful, staff were great, very helpful and friendly. Wonderful location. Hotel is very close to the beach and shopping.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Upon arrival the bellhop helped us with our bags to our rooms and the receptionist Cindy did an excellent job in accommodating a room for my family in a short notice. The staff make you feel welcome and offer guava juice upon checking in. The complimentary breakfast was delicious to include made to order omelette station. During the weekdays they offer evening reception of free alcoholic drinks and snacks from 5:30-7:30. They offer 24hr gym, laundry room and business center with free printing. The hotel is in a walking distance to some restaurants and the beach. Great customer service the whole time we stayed there.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Room Hula 1930 looks out on the ocean between Halekulani and the Waikiki Outrigger, a great view at a good price. We thought our suite was wonderful: spotless, well-furnished, with an excellent bed. We appreciated the included breakfast and the evening cocktail reception. The pool is beautifully designed and kept very clean. There are many pleasant features: live music during the free cocktail hour and a koi pond by the pool. The staff were friendly and personable and great to be around. A shout-out to Resty of the breakfast crew! He was awesome!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Third time staying at Embassy Suites. Previous two times, we booked directly (recommended). This time, we booked as part of WestJet vacations package (OK but, despite some savings, I would book hotel directly). On arrival, we were assigned a room on the 4th floor adjacent to the Grand Lanai (package deal with WestJet) which was dark and could have been noisy, being adjacent to the elevator, the access to the lanai and the lanai itself. We immediately requested a change, identifying ourselves as return clients and Hilton Honors members. I expected to pay for any change, given we had paid a package price, presumably, at a discounted rate. However, we were graciously offered an upgrade to a partial sea-view room on the 6th floor. Wonderful and completely unexpected! As experienced with previous stays: the housekeeping, breakfasts, manager's reception, live entertainment, service from everyone we encountered, internet access and gym were great. We like everything about the Embassy Suites Waikiki. As a side note, it's good to see that some US military get to stay here (thank you for your service).

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I can't say enough about this hotel. We've been coming back every two years (except for a cancelation last year with a sick child) and we love it. The location is excellent being at the far end and newer end of Waikiki.The staff have always been friendly and accommodating and the breakfast buffet and manager's reception make it feel like a mini all-inclusive. The entertainment during the reception was a lot of fun and the kids love it.It's a minor detail but while the pool isn't deep, it does the trick. I also like that it's high above the street so it's very quiet and relaxing compared with the higher end but much busier hotels like the Sheraton.And of course it being a suite means you actually have some space.This was our experience in the past and I'm hoping for the same when we arrive this week.G AllenVancouver

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family and I stayed here for almost a week. Everyday the staff was friendly, warm, and welcoming. This was a great place for family. During the reception we were given live music from local bands and it was awesome. I could've stayed here forever. Other Embassy hotels could learn what true customer service is from this hotel alone!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hotel was lovely and with the suite room could hold our family of 5. They serve you a delicious fruit drink called POG upon arrival. The breakfast is plentiful and included but because of the larger groups/families does have crowded peak hours. The hotel does post signs with recommendations on how to avoid those busy times. Same with the manager's happy hour.It is a short walk to Waikiki beach and right along the Waikiki shopping area. Also has a Starbucks across the street. We grabbed dinner at the food trucks about 200 ft away - was loads of fun.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a great hotel if you want plenty of space. The suites are great with comfy beds and a good lounge area with kitchenette. Love the included breakfast. Valet parking, great staff and awesome cocktail hour.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suite Waikiki is everything that you expect from an Embassy Suite minus the decent sized kitchen. My most important requisites for a hotel are 1) a comfortable bed; 2) a powerful shower and 3) minimal outside noise. This hotel gets an A+ on 1 and 2 and our room location across from the Trump gives them a B because of the chirping noise made any time someone drove out of the garage ... probably an aid for the vision impaired. We were on the northern half of the north tower and still had a decent look at the ocean from our lanai/balcony. Housekeeping was discreet, excellent and efficient. We were always supplied with both bath and beach towels while additional towels were available from the pool. The breakfast was pure Embassy Suites with two of the best omelet makers around. With a large Japanese clientele there was a wide variety of choices, but always fresh fruit and healthy greens to go along with more traditional American and Japanese choices. Pastries were a little weak.The location could not have been better except that we were not on the beach. The walk to the beach was short however. Restaurants galore were out our front and back doors and all along the beachfront, both chains and local specialties. We were only a short walk from the arcade that allows you to stay out the rain and away from the vehicle traffic while walking a good portion of WaikikiActivities/Concierge desk was handled by Expedia. Ross and the team are top notch and well-versed on the activities on Oahu. Outsourcing to Expedia allows Embassy Suites the ability to bring a consistent higher level on skills to the desk and a big plus. The only big negative was the cost of parking .... $38 per night. Fortunately there are a number of car rental offices nearby.The Embassy Suites will be high on my list whenever I return to Oahu

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Trip was vacation to see Pearl Harbor and other historic sites. Hotel is centrally located to the busy Waikiki area. Many close restaurants and stores, all within walking distance. Breakfast and evening reception are a nice benefit to start and end your day.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Par excellence services from check-in, bell services, breakfast, manager's reception, housekeeping and check-out, True Hawaiian hospitality - service always with a smile and helping hand. Specially to the chef at the omelette station where he serve us made to order eggs and omelette with a smile despite the never-ending queue. Well Done ! Excellent hotel location with shops, convenient stores and eateries. Transportation to various sites are also within walking distance.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We spent a week at The Embassy Suites and would definitely go back. Polite and helpful staff, laundry facilities, free 2 hour reception poolside every evening, breakfast included and we had a very comfortable suite with two balconies and ocean views. Close to everything. Only thing to note is to be clear about valet parking, they charged us another night of parking because they did not return the car for us on time like we had paid them to do.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: What a great value this Embassy Suites Waikiki is. Staff, facilities and service were fantastic! Although it's not directly on the beach, access is easy and quick. The only issue is the street noise early morning can be a bit much.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: When I travel outside of a Disney destination, I usually go to Hilton properties; this one did not disappoint. We were there for 2 nights and we rented a 2 bedroom as we were 3. We had enough room for everyone! The place offers free breakfast and it is honestly the best breakfast buffet I experienced at an Embassy Suites. It was walking distance to shops and Waikiki beach. The staff was nice and we were welcome with juice. We were aware of the parking fee, which was really not bad if you looked around in Waikiki and it is valet. We did not use the pool but it looked very decent. We went to the Manager's Reception and alcohol was flowing - although not a big drinker, it was enjoyable. To me there was 2 minus: 1 - The price, but it is Honolulu and if I looked at comparables it was cheaper at some other hotels but smaller rooms and resort fees and no free breakfast. So I guess it is ok for Honolulu. 2 - The noise from the other rooms. We heard a baby crying many times, people screaming at each other, heavy walking... So I have to come to the conclusion it is not well soundproofed.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hotel is in a wonderful location with comfortable rooms and very happy, helpful staff. Complimentary breakfast makes this a much more affordable trip. Complimentary Manager's Reception is a bonus in the afternoon.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I could not fault the quality, value and service of the Embassy Suites Waikiki. The location is convenient to all options i.e. sight seeing, shopping, surfing and the staff are extremely helpful. My highlight was happy hour. Cocktails, Music, Dancing, Social.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Location was fine; service by employees was superb! Room was clean and constant attention was the order of the day. The value was inexcusably expensive for an Embassy Suites! We stayed at the Hyatt Regency Waikiki just down the road and there was no comparison! Hyatt hands over heels for our wonderful week long stay there! Would not stay at Embassy Suites again based of excessive cost!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: An adequate facility in a good location. We are a large family, so the two bedroom suite was our option. The bedrooms were large enough, though the common area was very small. One bath featured shower only, while the other had a tub-shower combo, which was exactly what we needed. We can't say enough favorable things about the staff. They went above and beyond to accommodate. Though small, the pool was a nice break in the action for our tiny folks and we especially appreciated that it was heated. What made this hotel an absolute win for us was the fabulous complimentary breakfast. Simply excellent. Hats off to the Hilton conglomerate... another top notch facility.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: A great hotel with he perfect location. Very friendly and accommodating staff. This hotel offers a full complimentary breakfast and a two hour complimentary bar and snacks daily. The accommodations are Suites with a refrigerator, sink and microwave-- separate bedroom, 2 balconies. The hotel offers a hospitality suite for late flights. We did not leave until 8:00 pm, the hotel offered a late check out-- we were able to lounge around the pool and then use the hospitality suite to shower, change and repack for our flight.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Lovely hotel only a block back from Waikiki Beach and part of the beachwalk with lots of shopping, nightlife and restaurants. Staff were friendly upon check in and tour desk helped us book son activities. Nightly managers reception was good fun and a great inclusion as was not having to pay additional resort fee's and having wifi and calls included. Suites have lots of room and are very conformation. Buffet breakfast includes daily lots of yummy food well worth the price

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: very pleasant room and a nice pool, hot tub, lounge area; managers reception with live music was a bonus; breakfast was quite nice; location is as good as it gets unless you are right on the beach; comfortable bed; access to Waikiki and Beach Walk

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: From beginning to end, we received outstanding service. The room we got 1909 was beautiful with the amazing view over seeing the ocean. I love it that it's convenient and easy access to shopping centers, Starbucks and restaurants. We didn't know there was a back entrance /short cut until our last day. Bummer! We will definitely be back and stay again. Thank you for the awesome experience on my son's first trip to hawaii.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Spent a week at this Hilton Hotel. Enjoyed the room, location, breakfast and social hour ever day. You could not ask for a finer staff and everyone goes out of the way to help you in anyway they can. They even work with me to get a better room when we checked in on February 12th. I looked at other places to stay but for the price and location and the breakfast, you will not find a better place to spend time in Hawaii. Hope this helps everyone looking for a place to stay in Hawaii.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites is not on the beach, but it's only a block away. You are very close to the center of Waikiki without all of the traffic noise. The included breakfast has a nice variety and is filling. Also included is a nightly, yes nightly manager's reception with drinks and light snacks. The rooms are spacious, comfortable and clean. There are plenty more reasons to recommend this hotel and we will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We are a couple in our 60's. We traveled with my adult daughter and granddaughter soon to be 4 years old. The lobby area was somewhat lacking as it is basically a carport entrance. Not safe for kids to be around unattended. Such is the only negative.Our room consisted of two bedrooms, one with a king sized bed and bath. The other had two queen beds and its own bath. In between is a living room with a sink, fridge and microwave. An ideal set up for us.I feared the 5:30pm managers reception (drinks and snacks are complimentary) would be difficult with my active granddaughter. No problem. It is in the breakfast/pool area with numerous tykes running around. Perfect family ambience. The complimentary breakfast is also in the same location, again a family friendly vibe. The breakfast was outstanding and included two separated cooked to order stations, two serve yourself bars and a cereal bar. Drinks were again separated thus no long lines.Although the beach is several blocks away there are numerous restaurants within a block. A Denny's and an ABC store are across the street. We even walked about 1/2 mile with a stroller to the zoo.A great family vacation.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My 5 night stay was very satisfactory. To my eye, this is 3+ star hotel, but with a good value for the money compared to other Waikiki establishments and other hotels I stayed at during my Hawaii vacation. A word for European tourists, you probably will not find another hotel with complementary breakfast in Hawaii in this price and star range. As others have already mentioned, complementary breakfast + evening reception make this hotel stand out among all Waikiki hotels. We stayed at 16th floor ocean view suite, which was big enough, although needs some refreshing as its resembled the 90's style. There were two balconies at the suite, quite small though. Our bedroom was literally next to the elevator, but we didn't hear any noise neither from elevators nor from the neighboring rooms, which was a positive surpise. The only minor issue was a shower gel and a tea spoon. I know, it is silly! But I couldnt understand why the housekeeping was providing soap bars (so 90's...again), but seemed to be missing shower gels; this was; however, fixed after 2 days of asking. I didnt get the tea spoon for my entire stay though; I had to bring it from the breakfast to stir a coffee. Dear Management, please fix this. You provide a coffee maker and hot water kettle in the room along with different flavored teas and cofees with sugar and milk, but nothing to stir it with. Additionally, I liked that I was not bother by anyone; my privacy was sacred and i didn't feel I was nickled and dimed.The hotel is very well located with many restaurants just a step away and the beach not far away.There is a small gym, laundry room. If I were ever come back to Waikiki, I would probably stay at this establishment again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location The beds and pillows are unbelievable. Breakfast and managers reception number 1 of all Embassey Suites. Great entertainment during managers reception. The staff makes it a great stay. The only place to stay

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We enjoyed our stay in this hotel. Reception organized for us yearly check in with no extra cost. The hotel has amazing location it is close to everything on Waikiki.Free breakfast is also good bonus also free snacks and drinks at 5:30pm is just what you need at 5:30 in lazy day near the pool.Nice pool with fresh towels, our kids just loved it.Friend personal are always happy to help you. Recently renovated rooms but who is designer of them. Interior is outdated and all items does not match each other. But it is small thing.The only thing which is slightly annoying it is elevator.It works with strange way something you have to wait it for 10 minutes and swipe card doesn't works always properly.After all I really recommend this hotel for stay and if I will go next time to Waikiki I will chose this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We returned to The Embassy Suites-Waikiki Beach Walk, after 5 years and were impressed with the newly decorated rooms, the renovated pool & the always wonderful breakfast buffet, manager's evening reception and the extremely welcoming & friendly staff!! We always enjoy our stay here & will definitely return in the future!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My parents brother and I stayed here from 9 February to 24 February and had a total blast. I have been to Hawaii before in 2009 before but my family had not and I would highly recommend this hotel for families, couples, location and service. We had a two bedroom two bathroom apartment on the 12th floor with a balcony overlooking Beach Walk Rd and a view towards Fort Derussy Beach park and the water. Whilst we were not directly on the beach it was in easy walking distance to Grays Beach and Waikiki Beach and the main Waikiki area. Our apartment was fantastic and quiet with amazing beds. The breakfast every morning from 630am to 10am by the pool on level 4 was just beautiful with spectacular custom made omelettes and Buffett. A big shout out to the staff as well who really made my family and I feel so welcome every morning at breakfast - Dominic who made my omelettes just about every day, Rose who kept making sure my mum and dad were looked after and a big big thank you to Aldrin who was always checking we had plenty of tea coffee and water! The hotel was also in a great location for a great variety of restaurants with special mention to Shore Bird Restaurant across the road in the Outrigger Hotel on the beach, Bills for great coffee on Beach Walk Rd, Arancino Italian on beach walk Rd, Ocean House again on the beach in the Outrigger, Cheeseburger Beachwalk under the hotel and Denny's on Lewers street which is open late and does great comfort food.
