The hotel also does a fabulous free happy hour every night from 530pm to 730pm with complimentary nibbles by the pool. There is also a fantastic band which plays Friday, Saturday, Monday and Wednesday. This was definitely a memorable highlight of the hotel as you met so many different people staying at the hotel and a great way to unwind at the end of the day. Again a big shout out to Piilani who looked after us every night!Also another fantastic service was having an Expedia concierge in the foyer. I would highly recommend using Ross Asato who was in constant contact with me from Hong Kong and whilst I was staying at the hotel and was very patient and responsive to my millions of questions! Ross went above and beyond in helping me organise fantastic tours to Pearl Harbour, The Big Island, sunset cruise and Rockahula Dinner Show.All up I would highly recommend staying here and can't wait to go back!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites hotel is in a good location and close to the beach, restaurants, shopping and the city bus. We stayed here for 6 nights and were pleased with the breakfast and overall the facility. My only concern, which was noted in an other review, is related to the hotel concierge staff. Expedia staffs the concierge desk and their job is to sell tours not to help guests with travel information. I do not think that it is in the best interest of the hotel to have the concierge staff be so pushy in selling tours. As a Hilton Honors member, I don't think that the concierge service is in keeping with the customer service I expect from the Hilton Brand.
user_name:
Meridan437
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed here for 3 weeks and even though it was for work, I still had a blast. The front desk staff was great, I had a lot of work schedule issues that they resolved, the Valet guys and girls were great, and the pool staff was great as well. You can walk to any type of restaurant or shop you could need and there is always something going on. You wont go wrong with this hotel. Valet parking is alittle steep and a bottle of water would be nice but thats it.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: As a Hilton Diamond member, I've stayed at almost every brand of Hilton and other Embassy's and this one was excellent. Although not beachfront, it's only a short walk away and some rooms do have a nice oceanfront view. have stayed at the Embassy Suites, Hilton Hawaiian village, Hilton Waikiki Beach and the Holiday inn Beachcomber and The Embassy had the nicest rooms, best breakfast and the most convenient valet service. The staff was great as well.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This Embassy Suites is probably one of the best in the world. It is very expensive, but I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here. The rooms are very nice and roomy. The beds are very comfortable affording a good nights sleep. The Manager's reception is excellent with a good variety of snacks and live Hawaiian music. The fitness center is very nice and well equipped. The staff was very accommodating. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family and I stayed here for 6 nights and we had an amazing time. We were very pleased with the exceptional staff service, perfect location in Waikiki. Only a 2 min walk to the beach. Never stayed at a hotel that appreciated their guest as much as this place did. I would highly recommend stayed here and will definitely book this hotel again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I did not stay at this hotel, but I am writing a review specifically for the service that one of the managers, Garrick, provided.I planned a trip to Hawaii in early February and decided to stay at a nearby sister Hilton hotel due to the pricing of the Embassy Suites. I forgot to cancel my booking with Embassy on a night when the hotel was full. Garrick could have easily charged me the full room rate since they lost a 2 bedroom for one night, but he patiently worked with me to reduce the price.I would welcome the chance to stay at this hotel, just for the service.Thanks again Garrick!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was the first time to travel to Hawaii for 3 in our party and we all had a very memorable and GREAT trip. From the minute we arrived at the hotel the customer service was superb. The staff was so helpful and we felt like family there. Ross at the concierge desk was very helpful in setting up our tours of Pearl Harbor and the Missouri. We can't wait to return and would highly recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Aloha spirit is everywhere, from the complimentary chilled punch drink upon arrival to the view from my room I found paradise. Great location just steps to the beach and amazing shopping and dining options all within walking distance.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Once we got over the Hawaii pricing shock, we thoroughly enjoyed this hotel. The room, location, breakfast & cocktail hour were excellent. Our only tip is to shop around before booking your tours with the Hotel Concierge desk (Expedia). We found them to be a bit high pressure and didn't like their business practices of having no brochures (limited options) and simply steering you to whatever they wanted to.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Buffet Breakfast comes with the meal and it is super plus you have a Manager's Special which is free drinks for 2 hours in the evening plus snacks. The staff is great, pleasant and informative. Well appointed hotel and I must remark on Cindy (one of the clerks at Reception) who goes above and beyond to try and solve your problem. Beautiful resort, within a block to the ocean. Thank You

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: everything is good except the internet need log on everyday 1 or 2 times. and have a good swim pool and kindly service. however the breakfast is too simple to select and make it difference everyday. So the breakfast is pretty poor

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites is located within easy walking distance to the beach. The made to order breakfast omlette is a great start to the day and the evening reception a great way to start the evening. Keola is a great bartender and host. Many sites of Waikiki are within walking distance and driving access to the rest of the island is easy.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Due to delays in VISA processing my Hawaii trip has been cancelled at short notice (9 days to be exact). I contacted the hotel promptly and to my delight was given a full refund. Thank you! Thank you! Thank you! Words cannot express my gratitude. Guaranteed I will be staying at the Embassy Suites when I do gain VISA entry into the USA.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great staff and facilities but the outside noise of the garbage trucks and refer trucks wake you up at 5 in the morning, This woke up most of the west side of the building. Even with the patio doors closed you could still hear them. They are very loud with all the crashing and

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is great and has a really nice location. One thing that is fantastic is the breakfast, which included with made-to-order omelettes, rice, fish, miso soup, seaweed, and the general eggs, bacon and morning goodies. Each room is a suite and the location is very convenient being in the heart of Waikiki. The staff was very nice and the rooms were clean. Parking is a bit expensive but then again it's all like that in Waikiki. I would recommend this place.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a great stay at Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk. The staff is friendly and hard working. The breakfast was delicious with made to order eggs, fresh fruit, hot breakfast items and more. Every evening there is a free happy hour with a large selection of drink options. It is a short walk to Fort DeRussy and Waikiki beaches. Surrounded by a variety of shopping and restaurants. Within walking distance of the zoo.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy suites is a hidden gem in Waikiki... What a marvellous place to stay. We have had the best experience in Hawaii, enhanced by the excellent guidance and assistance provided by Micah at the tour desk. He organised our excursions most efficiently and took the extra steps to ensure that everything was co ordinated perfectly. This young man is to be commended for his lovely manner with clients and his dedication in providing outstanding service.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I really love the staff,( with the exception of 2 people() The breakfast employees are wonderful, friendly, hard working, and competent. The prices for the rooms seem to be going up, but the food and beverage is a great extra to consider when paying so much. It is nice to have music 4 nights a week, even though it can get very loud. They are very talented. I can not imagine staying in anything other than a suite because it seems so much like being home, except it is warm and sunny! I do think they should allow reasonable opportunities to use Hilton Honors Points.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We loved our stay at this hotel !!! The breakfast was amazing: cook to order omelets, fresh fruits, rice, potatoes and salad in addition to most delicious pastries daily. They have a limo cab too, which was fun to ride, for the same price as the regular taxis. Hotel's location is perfect - in the heart of Waikiki. Every Friday they have fireworks on the beach and there are weekly dancing and singing shows on the green behind the hotel. The only thing I want to mention is that this part of Waikiki beach closest to the hotel has a very thin strip of sand with a very rocky bottom. If you walk 10-15 min further - there is a much better beach for kids and family. That is what we ended up doing. Overall, I would recommend this hotel very highly. We had amazing time and would stay there again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: AMAZING! I just walked downstairs to let the manager on duty know that we are so impressed by ALL of the staff here. Each person greeted us warmly. The breakfast staff is wonderful. Each morning it felt like we were joining an extended family. They were helpful, attentive, gracious, and friendly. At breakfast Cary was so helpful!!! He took the time to share about some beaches and hikes to visit around the island. His help made our day and we are so thankful that he took the time to make us feel so at home on this island. It is staff like this that will bring us back here. We look forward to recommending this hotel because of the staff. The rooms and pool are great. Our girls loved the nightly music and snacks. It is such a fun environment. It is a very quick walk to the beach and there is a lot to do in walking distance. We have stayed at a few different places in Hawaii and the staff here is by far the best! We are so thankful we had the opportunity to stay here. Please give all of the breakfast staff, and especially Cary, a big thank you. Job Well Done! We have never stayed at a place with such friendly and helpful staff.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent breakfast, free evening drinks/reception, great location, but be sure to avoid room next to elevator due to noise. Very close to beach, lots of restaurants. If you have rental car expect 38/night to park it here. Expedia staff helpful in selecting tours.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Perfect. The hotel is perfectly located, extremely clean, amenities first class, staff very professional and courteous, thus , creating a perfect vacation. I would highly recommend to everyone and will stay there every time I visit Hawaii.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Have stayed at this hotel many times and keep coming back because of the exceptional staff and great location. Employees really go above and beyond to accommodate needs and wants of guests! Quality and quantity of breakfast offerings are very good as well. One area for improvement is cleanliness of rooms. There was some trash in the room upon arrival along with hair in several locations in the bathroom.
user_name:
Ingemar G
San Francisco, United States

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here a few night within one year. We enjoyed our staycation. Wish we could have late checkout, like 1pm especially if we live here. Offer a Kamaaina discount. Let us enjoy the pool, hotel after breakfast. We had to clean up, pack, and check out. We checked in late around 5:30pm. It was too quick for a $400 night stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: There were 3 couples in our group. Same price, three styles of suites. Breakfast, reception and staff were great. 2 suites close to elevators and disruptive to sleep. One couple was moved without problem, the other stayed. Avoid the Expedia concierge desk, very high pressure and expensive.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had an excellent stay at this hotel. It is very well positioned, provided friendly evening reception with one of the best ukelele players we've ever seen and great breakfast omelettes. The staff were knowledgable and friendly. We would definitely stay here again. Jo

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: No upgrade for honeymoon or gifts which was disappointing. Breakfast buffet is pretty basic and ordinary. Rooms and service overall was pretty good. Beware or pushy staff at the travel and tour desks who are always trying to sell you something or push you into deals. Plenty of restaurants around and shopping all in walking distance. Beach 100m away. Overall pretty good.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is terrific for Famillies. The only issue I had was that there was not much room for luggage storage for 5 people - so maybe suggest to upgrade to a 2bedroom suite if there is more than 3 people.Breakfast was great - good variety and saved us money on at least one meal.Loved the managers reception in the evening. Very generous pours - so be careful! Had to ask them to half the alcohol (which they happily accommodated) and then it was perfect. Nice complimentary snacks to go with, but don't go overboard as it can ruin your dinner.The only other issue I had was that I saw many people eating and drinking in the spa and pool, and the staff did not do anything to stop it. Did not give a good look, with leftovers floating in the water and rubbish left around. Left the spa or pool when this was happening.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites for 11 nights in total. We were very happy with level of service and standard of accommodation. While we didn't have an ocean view (nor did we request one) - the outlook was pleasant an we could see the water if we stood on the balcony and turned our head around. The evening reception was great fun and we met some really nice people during the happy hour service. Cocktails were amazing & food was great for kids to snack on prior to dinner. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is located centrally in waikiki... in the middle of all the fun activities and hustle-bustle, without being disturbed in your room at night.. The breakfast was cooked to order, very tasty, changed everyday. Loved every day of our 10 day stay here.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: A great hotel for families. Very busy during our stay due to the Lunar New Year festivities. We have stayed at several Embassy Suites on the mainland, and were disappointed to find our King size bed was a Queen-I ended up sleeping on the pullout in the living room because of the limited space. Ample breakfast buffet and enjoyable evening reception with a local band was a bonus. Appreciated the security measures, staff was pleasant and location was in the heart of Waikiki beach walk. The beach and shopping were really close by, as was public transportation.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: What an excellent space and location. Located on the Beach Walk with entry right onto the Beach Walks, as the rooms would suggest, they are all suites, separate bedroom, living room, there's a kitchenette and a separate bathroom as well as a balcony. It's worth every cent you spend, buffet breakfast is included as well as 5-7pm happy hour and the staff is just great. Cool pool area on the roof near the bar and the dining area, so all very convenient

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: To be honest, Embassy Suites wasn't really on our radar, but the location and price made us choose it to stay with our brand. So glad we did! It was a Great Choice and now this will be a Go To Hotel! The Location was Fabulous for staying in Waikiki, right in the center of everything, the staff was Awesome and all the amenities were excellent! My family all were taken care of and the Breakfast saved us so much money on food everyday! Stay here YOU WILL NOT BE DIAPPOINTED!!!
user_name:
elainet147
El Segundo, CA, United States

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed in the Embassy Suites during January. Our family of four had a brilliant time. Amenities were as described on their website. The two room suite met our needs perfectly. Inclusive breakfast and manager's reception ( happy hour )a bonus to our stay at this wonderful hotel. Terry, the tour and events organiser did a great job booking our trips and tours. He is very knowledgeable and booked us into tours which were well organised and fun to be on. Staff are friendly and we felt welcome from the moment we arrived. The hotel location cannot be faulted since it is very central to the beach, restaurants, cafes and shops. We would love to return.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Love the suite layout that is Embassy Suites - good if one member of the party has to leave early. Complementary evening refreshments for kids and adults, and a REAL complementary breakfast. I look for Embassy Suites in my travels.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Just a super super super place to stay Bring your family ,. bring your friends You will enjoy. We did and we found lots of things to do around the Embassy Suites and your will do too. We were very happy with this location
user_name:
Ronald Z
River Falls, United States

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel it's self is excellent the only complain is we used Expedia in their hotel they were not truthful about the tours they sold us. We told her that the second tour we wonted to go to the Arizona Memorial. Found out today she sold us that Plus USS Missouri, and the punchbowl military cemetery. We were gone from 8 till 5 pm, made for a long day.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hotel over-rated.... no place to eat lunch or dinner, as the nearest hotel Roy's was always fully booked.....(no fault of the hotel).... Location is great. Suites are spacious, Great for family vacation....

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hotel looking tired and old. Breakfast very average food, a very outdated dining and pool area. We paid over $1,000 USD a night for a 2 bedroom suite and I dont feel that we got value for money, yes it was high season but I think there are better options in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: As a frequent global traveler, our stay this past 10 days was the best experience we've ever had. Quality hotel, friendly and inviting staff. Truly incredible stay. Top quality service, incredible value for the $$, clean quality rooms, and best of all - and incredible staff. Whatever they're doing here should be taken notice of by the Hilton Brand and serve as a "Best Practice" in the hotel industry!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy, in January only for 1 night, We extend our trip and our timeshare which is just across the street was booked solid. The Embassy Suites staff were amazing we got an early check in, so we were happy to be able to move just across the street so easily. The room was great, as big as our timeshare, with better views. We joined the reception in the evening, every staff person is attentive and friendly. The breakfast in the morning was great and again those amazing staff make you feel welcome. We were able to get a late check out and they arranged our transportation to the airport in a limo. Nice touch and we would definitely recommend this site. We had stayed here many years ago when we brought our kids and nice to see it's still a great choice for families and couples.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent property, good location, nice rooms, service of staff was very helpful and friendly. Great view from our room and a very family friendly hotel. Ample food available at all complimentary meals and a good variety of Gluten Free food.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Location is great just one block from the beach right next to the Trump WaikikiIt is a family hotel so expect kids- not a romantic destination. We had done that in MauiBreakfast was well done with two Serving stations for omelettes and pancakes. Staff were efficient. This is an embassy suites so expect large portions not gourmet.We were lucky to get a corner room on a high floor facing the sea which we could see from our front room and bedroom. The sofa is great for a third guest- I can confirm after an argument with my partner!One of the nicest parts of the stay is check in- you sit down and are given a cocktail. All hotels should learn that trick. Room itself is typical embassy suites with a few Hawaiian touches. Everything worked and it was spotless and very roomy. Value is great especially for Waikiki in early Jan. Would happily stay there again especially as their happy hour lasts 2 hours and you can drink a lot of mai tai in that time.For food recommend The Eating House on top of the International market Place - owned by Roys but more contemporary and a few dollars cheaper

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Family of 4 stayed for 2 nights. Complimentary drinks and nibblies by pool nightly an added bonus... good selection of cocktails all included and very strong. Great selection of food at Breakfast. Lighting in room could be better with lamps only lighting in bedrooms.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We visited Honolulu for the first time in January 2017. I selected the Embassy Suites for the value and the location.It was perfect for our stay with 2 teens. The walk to the beach was short. We enjoyed the breakfast early in the a.m. and found we were located close-by to many food places for lunch & dinner (a necessity for the hungry teens). Bell hop staff helped us with baggage and finding transportation (we had no car) to Pearl Harbor and airport. Great experience for first time visitors!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We loved it so much that we came back -only being here this time last year. We love the helpful Bell desk and the waiters at the Grand Lanai. Great complimentary breakfast and happy hour in early evening from 530-730pm daily with complimentary snacks.Right on beach walk- great location-ABC store across the road, on Waikiki beach walk, Ala Moana centre is a$2 trolley ride on the pink line from the post office just a 5 min walk away.Great restaurants nearby and Kalakaua Ave with all the great stores both high end as well as a small Macy's alongside smaller shops just a few mins walk away. Ross outlet and Nordstrom rack are just a 10 min walk away at a leisurely pace.Will be back for sure. Great value for 2 bedroom 2 bathroom place with its amenities and complimentary breakfast and happy hour. It's comfortable and convenient and the service is great here.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed 8 nights in a 1 bedroom suite with 2 Adults & 2 Teenagers. Lounge/dining area was spacious with a kitchenette, small table and chairs. Bedroom was small with not really anywhere to put suitcases. Beds were very comfortable, but the sofabed mattress very thin.Buffet breakfast is included in the roomrate which saved us a lot of money. Selection was good - toast, cereal, limited fruit, yoghurt, bacon, omelettes, pancakes, and free drinks too.Our one complaint is that the walls are very thin. We could hear every noise made by our neighbours & the room above. Chairs scraping, bathroom & main doors constantly opening & closing, babies crying etc. We had to go & buy earplugs. Great location for shopping! The back entrance leads out to Lewers Street then 1 minutes walk and you're on the main street. Shops open until very late (11pm I think) so we shopped every night.Access to the beach is through a path by the Sheraton then a few minutes walk to get to the actual sand (past the Sheraton boardwalk). About 5 mins.Recommend buying a beach umbrella from ABC store rather than paying the extortionate prices to hire one on the beach. Would stay here again purely because of the location and free breakfast.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Free-drinkspupu'sentertainmentbreakfastpool towels Need I say more.....comfortable beds, great location, staff was friendly, big space, & great Aloha spirit. I'm going again in March for my 35th birthday and I know I won't be disappointed.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Perfectly located a block from the ocean-fantastic food and shops all around. Great breakfast each day and the music made the manager reception outstanding and so enjoyable with the ocean breeze and a cocktail

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I've stayed at this hotel for both business and leisure. Check is nice and comfortable as they bring you guava nectar in the process. They explain everything. One time, I had 2 itineraries (one paid and one with points) and asked if I could keep the same room during the entire stay. They graciously made it happen even though it took them some time moving other guests around.Parking is a bit expensive, but the area is quite large and able to fit quite a few cars. Usually getting the car is pretty fast if it's not too busy. The pool area is nice but a bit small for the number of guests. The larger pool is attached to the smaller kiddie pool. Towels are available and complimentary. Location is also great. It's on the northern end so you don't have to fight through Waikiki traffic to go anywhere. It's next to the Hilton Hawaiian Village which are nice grounds to walk on. They also have a small man made lagoon there. The beach is also a bit less crowded than Waikiki. Ala Moana Center is close too.Breakfast is the thing you cannot miss here. They have a made to order omlet station, fresh fruit, miso soup, eggs, sausage, coffee, juice, soda, and lots of other stuff. Make sure someone guards your food or the birds will come get it. I heard the birds are endangered so they cannot get rid of them. The staff is also pretty good at clearing away used plates. Make sure to come early as it can get busy. At night they offer some limited beer and (non watered down) tropical drinks. There also light snacks like pub mix or nacho cheese. Some nights have live bands also. Both breakfast and happy hour are complimentary.The rooms themselves are large and spacious. Ours usually have 2 balconies, a bedroom with 2 queens or 1 king and pull out sofa bed in the other room. There are 2 TV's. The bathroom is also quite spacious. This is my go to hotel in Waikiki if I can get it for a reasonable price.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent hotel for families with great breakfast. It close to the beach and near shopping and diners. The rooms are good and clean. They also have evening happy hour. The pool is Ok. The staff is very courteous and helpful. Definitely recommended and would come back again to this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at Embassy Suites for 9 nights in early November 2016. Enjoyed having a suite as opposed to the usual hotel room - nice to have a "living room" besides the bedroom. Breakfast buffet was certainly adequate for us - didn't try the omelette station but good choice of hot and cold items. Nightly happy hour was lots of fun. After drinks and snacks we hardly needed an evening meal! Appreciated having some vegetables as snacks, along with chips etc. Bar tenders were fantastic and very friendly. We really enjoyed the musical groups entertaining - the group of all male family members was our favourite! Nothing nicer than sitting back poolside on a balmy night with a margarita listening to some good tunes. Location of the hotel was great - handy to beach and shopping. Only down side was that we found the beds too firm for our liking.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We celebrate our upcoming 40th with island hopping in Jan. 2017: Maui, Hawaii, Oahu & Kauai. Our recent Jan. 13-15th weekend at the Embassy Waikiki turned out to be a nightmare. Returning to our 18-floor suite after dining out at Hotel Kohala we were disgusted to find our K-bed visibly stained with gross brown spots. The toilet had leaked deep yucky water all over the bathroom floor. We used all towels to soak it up & called Front Desk immediately. Housekeeking staff came with 4 extra bath towels!. Since it was 1:30 a.m. & we were exhausted after a long day in transition, we delayed engineering service till the next morning. Our suite was still soaking wet, so we had to walk around in our shoes. It was quite disturbing that Front Desk staff & Hotel Manager NEVER check back with us about the issues encountered or offer a change of suite. Upon checking out we had to request to talk directly to the on-site manager about our extremely BAD experience. She apologized but told us she was not aware of anything because she just returned after being out sick the last few days!We've been travelling the world for decades and NEVER had such a situation, especially with the Hilton!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Good was the hotel's central location (but it's not beachfront and and room had views of the high rise next door and only a sliver of ocean if you craned your neck). I was able to get reasonable rates by booking months in advance via Hiltons honours program - but no upgrade or other acknowledgement of loyalty program membership. The bad was the onion smell from nearby restaurants which was noticeable in the evenings ( I know not the hotel's fault but just so you know - it's not the ocean breezes I was hoping for) and the sofa bed which was truly awful to sleep on. It gave me lower back pain which persisted for several days and made my 9 hour flight home agony. The ugly was the tour desk's invitation to attend Hilton's timeshare presentation for 90 minutes in return for $150 off our parasailing trip. I know, I know, I shouldn't have fallen for it, but it was a waste of a couple of hours of our precious holiday time. I have a sneaking suspicion that the tour was sold to us at an inflated rate, but it was great, by the way. Hawaiian Parasailing - highly recommend them. I wouldn't return to Embassy suites - just too many little disappointing aspects to truly enjoy our stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We loved our stay at the Embassy Suites. The location of the hotel is great, close to everything but not in the middle of all the hustle and bustle, which we liked. Very helpful staff. It was great to have breakfast sorted, with great variety and good food. The pool area was awesome and perfect water temperature. Complimentary pool reception was amazing. We'll definitely go back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Can't be the location, plenty of activities within walking distance. Staff overall very helpful and remember you during your stay. Best bartender on the island works at the evening happy hour. I would recommend it to anyone

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our 4th visit to the Embassy Suites at Waikiki and as always we were made to feel welcome from the moment we arrived. I will admit that we were keen to try a different hotel for this stay, however we were unable to come up with something that could offer us the space and location we needed. There were other hotels nearby that had rooms available, but not suites, and we weren't prepared to stay in a shoe box for our stay.The hotel itself may not be 5 star or ritzy, but it's the location and staff who make it special every time we stay here. There are so many staff who have been working at the hotel for a number of years, and it's lovely to see familiar faces who remember us. Aldrin in particular is exceptional, and goes out of his way every morning to make our breakfast experience a positive one. The bar staff by the pool and the bell desk guys are all fabulous. The manager's drinks each night are wonderful, as are the family band who play a few nights a week.I keep saying we'll stay somewhere different for our next visit, but I wouldn't be surprised if we ended up back at the Embassy Suites.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here a couple of times as a pit stop before flight or waiting to check into a resort. We stay at Embassy Suites quite frequently for the suites as well as the benefit of filling up the kids with a hearty breakfast before trekking out and about. This hotel is typical in that sense, but it's definitely a little shabby and the suites are quite small. The breakfast is extremely busy, but the hotel has a system to make sure tables are cleared quickly and there is a hostess who directs the guests to open tables or gets bussers to put tables together. Omelet lines are quite long (as it is at many ES). A smattering of Asian offerings because of the high census of guests from Japan, etc. Miso soup and rice offered in addition to high volume bacon, eggs, and sausage. I wouldn't call it haute cusine, but it's included in the hotel rate so can't complain too much.Location is ideal if you want to be in the middle of Waikiki, which may or may not interest you. It is quite touristy. Housekeeping staff was friendly and accommodating. Wouldn't stay here for a long trip, but a great place to start or end your vacation.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Fabulous stay as always, this is the 3rd visit in 2016. As soon as you arrive you receive the Ohana feeling. Thanks to Sandra, Shantel, Lacy, Keola, Daniel, Pillani, Lewis and Dennis for making our return a family reunion. The fabulous entertainment of Roland and his sons Monday, Wednesday and Friday nights plus the alternate night groups for making this holiday full of beautiful memories. From the lady who serviced our room ,who left us a beautiful note to say goodbye on our last day ,to Aldram always finding us a breakfast table the management should be very thankful for having such an amazing group of people working for them. Once again Mahalo to a very well run hotel and look forward to our next visit.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is close to everything. It is nice to be able to have a relaxed family American breakfast everyday. The food was good the staff were exceptionally nice and helpful. The rooms were clean and plenty of linen was always provided. I did not have one staff member not willing to help or go out of their way for us. i never felt their hand was out for a gratuity.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Nothing spectacular except location. Lots todo d pricey shopping nearby. Close to beach, lots of restaurants, and more.Rooms very small for Embassy suites. Free reception was also sub par for embassy suites. The breakfast (free) was excellent each day and had good quality and variety.A little rundown in rooms, otherwise property was clean and well kept. All employee interactions were positive.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a terrific property in Waikiki. The suites are spacious, the property is very centrally located and the service is delightful. Everyone from the check in at the reception to housekeeping staff were very lovely. The young lady Aida at check in was very engaging and lovely. The evening reception is entertaining, could be bettered with some nicer short eats at the happy hour. The breakfast was very nice, the only issue here are the pigeons that come and swoop in, right in the middle of your meal. I have a phobia and it was tormenting.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The 2 bedroom apartment is very spacious and great for 4 people. The managers drinks every night are free and plentiful and the entertainment alone is worth staying for. It is central and easy to travel from with very helpful staff. Evert so slightly dated the only problem was the air con didn't seem to cool the rooms down at night. A very good place to enjoy Waikiki from without spending a fortune.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Fantastic hotel! We were upgraded to an ocean view suite and had an amazing experience. Perfect location for beach, shopping or dining and a seamless check-in process. We really enjoyed the POG they served, so much so that we sought it out everywhere we went, but found none that compared. The suite was large, clean and perfectly located to see the Hilton's Friday night fireworks. The ocean view was also amazing. Breakfast, as always, was filling, tasty and offered some of the best coffee I've had and the lomi omlette was a nice island touch. The bottom line is that you generally can't go wrong with Embassy Suites, and this hotel is no exception. It actually stands out above the rest, with nice touches like dining room coffee service and seating help and an excellent bell staff. When I needed to return to the airport to retrieve a bag, they actually called me a limo, which got me there in no time, for the same price as a cab. Can't beat that for service. There's no better place to stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Spacious suite for five of us. Two queen beds and a pull out sofa bed. Complimentary breakfast and afternoon reception with free drinks was great. We stayed during Christmas and New Year and it was very busy during breakfast time but the staff were fantastic at helping us get a table and making sure our coffee cups were topped up. Just across the road from the beach and bus stop to all sight seeing and shopping malls. We took the local bus no. 42 to Pearl Harbor for US $2.50 each way. The Pink Line trolley will transport you around Waikiki and main shopping centre. The hotel is situated on Lewers St which has many eateries both high end and casual. This is our second stay at the Embassy Suites and it won't be our last.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Location is good , hotel amenities are great , has laundry , gym etc. breakfast is great , eating is expensive in Hawaii , so filling your boots at a buffet breakfast with omelette chefs is nice. The managers reception each night from 5.30-7.30 is great , no limitations on drinks at all , just a unwritten rule to tip the barman. No problem doing that when they free pour generously.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family of 5 went to Hawaii for Christmas and New Years. This hotel gives us lots of room and the staff is amazing. We love the complimentary breakfast, there is so much to chose from. We love everything about this hotel and we can't wait to go back!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We Love Embassy Suites! Every chance we get we always choose this place. The rooms are the most spacious, clean, very comfortable with all amenities. The breakfast was buffet style with made to order omelets. The happy hour with free drinks are the best! For the money , the space , the breakfast and happy hour with a live band , dancing you cant beat the price.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here after being recommended by friends and loved the location, so central to everything. We should have probably discussed it with them further as they have 2 young kids (we don't) and it's no doubt fantastic for families with kids, but a little crazy for us. No fault of the hotel though, just us needing more research.Did love the happy hour each day with drinks and snacks and we made the most of itPool was hard to enjoy as it was incredibly full of kids. Again, not the hotels faultThe rooms were starting to show their age a bit though. Not bad, and nothing to fault, just probably in need of a freshen up soon

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The timing was perfect to rekindle with the person you've missed an desired for years. It was our first trip to Hawaii an we both experience it together. Many people would love to experience the romantic feel of Hawaii. I'm grateful we had the chance.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hotel location, amenities and staff personnel is outstanding. Visitors traveling with family would benefit from staying at Embassy Suites. Free Breakfast and Cocktails during evening reception. There is a daily valet parking fee, a bit pricey.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great place to stay on Waikiki. Close to beach with free breakfast and evening drinks. Breakfast has great omelets made on site. Free Wi-Fi. Stayed there because they have wonderful double room suites at reasonable price. Pool and hot tub are nicely located on fourth floor limiting access to non-guests from the street. Very clean place. Friendly staff.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Fabulous stay as always . Love the Ohana feeling you receive. Thanks to Sandra, Lacy, Keola , Daniel , Lewis, Dennis, Shantel and the fabulous entertainment of Roland and his sons for once again making this the return holiday to remember with beautiful memories. Looking forward to the next visit

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites Waikiki is a great business travel/vacation hotel. This property is my favorite Hilton branded hotel in Waikiki. I've stayed there about a dozen times over the past 14 years. Best Feature: No Resort Fee!! (A major reason why I started staying here. I hope this policy never changes)Location: Heart of Waikiki. Literally across the street from Waikiki Beach. Walking distance to world class shopping and restaurants. Service: This is THE REASON why I keep coming back. Front desk is always friendly and accommodating if I have a special request. Because of flight schedules I often arrive at 10AM-11AM but they always find me a room if my original one isn't ready.Check-in: always very easy. Front desk staff is fast, efficient and friendly. My pre-arrival requests were honored without any problems. I always look forward to the complementary welcome beverage at check-in, puts me in an Island state-of-mind!Hotel: I would classify this hotel as upscale business travel or high turnover vacationer so expect crowds and wait lines, especially at breakfast time. It has a modern feel with a contemporary Hawaiian design. The Grand Lanai area, pool and bar are very nice with a relaxed atmosphere and the staff is always friendly.The hotel and facilities are well maintained. Some minor issues associated with normal wear/tear you would expect but nothing I found worth giving a negative review. Room: all rooms are two or three-room suites, very spacious. I got upgraded to a corner suite with ocean view so had about 200 degree arc of view. Rooms facing poolside can be a little noisy but quiet down after 10pm. Not many rooms face the Blvd so not much traffic noise. The bed was very comfortable and linens were clean and crisp. Four pillows on each bed is nice. No problems with cleanliness. Plenty of extra power outlets conveniently placed about rooms; two on desk, each side of bed, table lamps, wet bar, etc. Only one USB outlet available which was on the clock radio by bed. Free WiFi available. Wet bar, coffee/tea maker, small safe, microwave oven and small refrigerator in room. Bathroom: slightly larger than the average hotel size. Two people could use it simultaneously and move around with ease. No issues with cleanliness. Nice selection of complementary toiletries. Three complete sets of towels. Good restaurant and bar on property. Prices were typical Waikiki hotel prices but not outrageous. At night the Grand Lanai area hosts the Evening Poolside Reception with complimentary drinks, appetizers, and live entertainment.Nice gym facility with good cardio equipment (treadmills, elliptical etc.) and free weights, open 24hrs.Valet parking only, $38 per day. Coin operated laundry machines available for those on an extended trip away from home

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My girlfriends and I stayed here for six nights and, on the whole, enjoyed it. The rooms had everything we needed but it all felt like it needed modernising. Beds were comfortable and bathrooms well equipped. The balcony was miniature, the living room really wasn't large enough for a room that accommodates between 4 to 6 adults and it could have benefited from more wardrobe space. These things aren't major issues though given it is Waikiki and you don't spend a great deal of time in your room anyway.The wifi was very average as it didn't seem to like us all logging in at the same time. Breakfast is included in the room rate here but, to be honest, if it weren't for a couple of girls watching their money, I would have preferred to go somewhere else. There's something about buffets where different people of different cultures with different hygiene standards congregating around the open food, touching, coughing, sneezing, poking and prodding that puts me off eating. I also hate lining up for half an hour for an omelette. The service here is good and the location is great. Last time I stayed in Waikiki I stayed on the beachfront whereas this place is one street back but significantly cheaper and it really doesn't matter. When you go to the beach, I would recommend swimming out the front of the military base to the right, it's very calm, not many rocks, fewer people and heaps of turtles.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family of grandmother, aunt, single daughter and daughter, son- in -law and three sons, all met in Honolulu to celebrate our daughter's significant birthday.Embassy Suites by Hilton suited all our needs and we enjoyed our stay there very much. We had made some last minute changes for two of us and our room was not available.We were instead accommodated in a lovely suite for the extra night and the staff were most helpful and courteous and friendly.Thank you Sandra and Ray and all who helped us with information and advice.The included breakfast was a lovely start to the day and our pre-dinner fun time at Happy Hour very enjoyable.The pool was never crowded and our grandsons spent a lot of time there.The fact there was no amenities tax made the whole financial side of things a lot smoother and hassle -free. Our rooms were very comfortable and a small housekeeping problem was attended to swiftly and competently.We decorated our daughter's door for her birthday and the staff were very tolerant of these.(We did take them down before we left!!)The location is excellent and the location,of an ABC store ,great shops and food outlets nearby an added bonus. The beach is very close and this hotel had it all.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our room had a terrible bathroom odor. We asked to be moved because re-cleaning the bathroom didn't help, and we were going to be staying for 7 days. After a bit of resistance and no apology from the front desk, we were moved to another room the next day, but had to check out before 11 and could not get into the new room till after 3. So we were without a room for several hours, and the front desk forgot to expedite the cleaning of our new room. The rest of our stay was pleasant, but it the first day was pretty bad. Breakfasts were outstanding, and the rooms are otherwise comfortable. The room rate has gotten very high during the holidays--over $600 with taxes and parking!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: As a diamond member of Hilton and Grand Vacation owner, I found the front desk, grand vacation and Hilton toll free number reservation employees difficult and lack common sense . I requested to see what type of breakfast buffet was served. I was denied by all, saying only guests could go to the floor to look or eat. The front desk manager finally agreed to let me look at the food selection. I was told to look at the pictures on the brochure. Not the type of service I expected or have ever received from a Hilton property. Worst service ever.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was great for my family of 5. The food was good. The rooms were sufficient. The location was great. We truly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The happy hour was great for its light snack and free alcoholic beverages.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I really like the Embassy Suites. Very nice location and very nice accommodations. The staff was ver gracious and we will be sure to return on our next trip. There is a lot of competition on the area but we like it here.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Complimentary breakfasts are usually pretty bad - not here. Instead, an omelette bar, fresh fruit, great coffee. Expected watered down Sangria at Manager's reception. I was wrong again. Full bar with good wine and mixed drinks, live music, good and ample snacks. Great staff, great central location, spacious suites. We got lucky. This hotel exceeded expectations at every turn.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The rooms are amazing and the staff never disappoints! I recommend this hotel when staying in Waikiki. My family was very please with the accommodations and amenities at this hotel. There is plenty to do in the area.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: $2200 for 3 rooms for one night was gouging. Great location. Beautiful facility. Advice of travel agent put us at this location for ease of getting to cruise ship the next day. Embassy Suite took advantage of tourist.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was one of our rare family vacations since I was living overseas and didn't have time for family vacations in the US like we used to have yearly in the past.As such, I was so looking forward to this trip as I hadn't been to Honolulu in more than 30 years!I flew in from the mainland and met my father here, but my brother and his family and friends would only join us at a later date. So, since there were going to be so many of us, we really wanted to stay as close to each other as possible....I contacted reservations weeks before and they were so friendly and helpful on the phone, and promised to try their best to accommodate our request, but due to the extremely busy holiday season they couldn't make any promises.I arrived at the hotel after about a 20 minute cab ride from the airport.....the cab fare was pretty hefty and I'd suggest taking Uber if you can....the fare is almost half. As we drove into the hotel driveway I was immediately greeted by the hotel staff who welcomed me and offered to help with my bags, but I didn't have much and could handle it myself. The hotel lobby is totally open....no windows separating the driveway from the lobby, and no AC.....just nice fresh Hawaiian air.Check in was a breeze.....Victor was really nice and friendly and took care of me, and apparently he also attended to my father earlier, but his room wasn't ready yet. Unfortunately, only my room was ready and my father's would have to wait till 3pm. I went up to my room and ohoh.....this is not what the room looked like on the website! I got a room facing the back...not a bad view....but the room had small windows, no balcony, and just dark and dingy like a dated motel room.....at first I thought no big deal, but then after a few minutes I started to feel really claustrophobic....I had to change rooms. I went all the way back down to the reception and spoke to Victor about this....he was really understanding and fixed me up with another room, but it wouldn't be ready till after 3pm.....no problem, I said.3pm passed and we had been sitting in the lobby for an hour or so...finally we were called that our rooms were finally ready! Yay! OMG! This room was so much better!!! The bedroom and living room both had sliding doors to balconies, and there was actually a very nice partial view of the beach and ocean! My father got the same room, but on a much lower floor and his view was even more awesome!....with a view of the pool too. The room still looked a bit dated, but it was much brighter so the dated look wasn't so obvious.....it was still very comfortable, clean, and well kept. I liked that they had flat screen TVs in both rooms, a low light bedside digital clock,, iron and ironing board in the cupboard, hot water kettle, coffee maker, a couple of glasses, a mini fridge, and some basic bathroom amenities. The bedroom and living room have separate AC controls, which is nice if you have someone sleeping on the sofa bed in the living room and prefers a different room temperature or fresh air by keeping the sliding door open. There is plenty of lighting in the room and what I found neat was that the lamps had 2 prong electrical outlets at their bases. And yes, there is a room safe for your valuables.About the location of the hotel, it just doesn't get much better. There is a mini market located just at the lifts at the Hula Tower (closer to the beach)....there's also an ABC mini mart across the road, and pretty much every corner of every block. But other than that, there are tons of all kinds of shops right at the hotel's doorsteps and within walking distance to the main happening street of Kalakaua Ave where you have tons of shopping, street entertainment, great restaurants, etc..... there seemed to be a at least a dozen Japanese restaurant at every block in Waikiki!Buffet breakfast was included and the quality and selection was quite good...I particularly enjoyed the fresh local pineapple and melons.....there's an egg station for omelets, but the line was always too long so I never got to try it. I stuck with the regular hot breakfast which included scrambled egg, breakfast potatoes, and the mix up offerings of French toast or waffles, or pancakes and sausages or bacon, etc....I liked the chicken sausages, but they aren't offered every day. The drinks station is located separately, and this was a good idea to relieve the crowding at the food area. The dining next to the pool, but it can get really packed depending on the time you come down for breakfast....a card is is provided in the rooms to tell you at what times are peak and what times are less crowded.There's also a small gym in the Aloha Tower which I used as much as I could....it had a bike, a few steppers/elliptical trainers, treadmills, a cable rack, dumbbells and benches, etc. There are a couple of wall mounted TVs in case you get bored on the machines.....the machines look quite new and are well maintained, but the personal screens are not hooked up to cable tv. There is a water dispenser and towels also provided.Wonderful experience, but I think this hotel is better geared to toward families with kids. My brother's family had a great time!Oh, consider the room you get as anything facing the pool you'll here the live band playing at happy hour.....with free alcoholic drinks and snacks.....nice touch.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We ended up with a great room overlooking the pool. The hotel is perfectly located and free breakfast is great with drinks at the happy hour. The hotel staff is great. The welcome could have been better as our room reserved was given away as our flights were delayed even though we paid for the full stay in advance.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a wonderful hotel with great suits if you have more than 2 travellers. Facilities are very good- breakfast is very good as are all the staff. Honolulu is expensive and this place adds extra value you can easily appreciate. Hotels are getting harder to get great personal service but these guys achieved this in spades. Highly recommended

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: An excellent property! Stayed for three nights in December. Initially booked a City View room but got free upgrade to a Partial Ocean View. Check in was easy with kind staff. Did valet parking which was prompt and reasonably priced for Waikiki. Room was very large with plenty of space (2 queens not 2 doubles, nice when traveling with 4 people). Bathroom was big enough and living room had enough space including couch, movable recliner chair, desk with computer chair plus two smaller chairs. Small fridge, microwave included. Had enough storage space.Took advantage of full breakfast each morning which was quite generous. Evening reception had plenty of drinks and people appeared to be enjoying themselves. Smaller spread at dinner with chips/nacho cheese or pretzels and dip. Fountain drinks and fruit juices along with flavored waters available. Fitness room was good size. Pool looked nice but we didn't try it.Was really close to everything - immediately downstairs are plenty of shops including a large grocery/convenience store (not part of the hotel) that carries drinks, snacks, souvenirs, etc. We used that for bottled water and soda for our room along with sundries. Loved the staff - very helpful. Housekeeping staff looked after us and asked multiples times if we needed anything. Extremely friendly. Would definitely stay here again when we return to Honolulu

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Even though we arrived at 0600, well before the 3pm check-in time, we were greeted warmly, our room was ready and we were invited to breakfast. A great first impression made for wonderful experience for our 11 nights. The location for us was perfect - close enough to the Kalakaua Avenue (plenty of shops and restaurants), a 15 minute walk to Ala Moana, a solid walk to Diamond Head, and only a block away from the beach - perfect! The breakfasts were always a good start to the day and the evening reception was a must-do. Suites were nice and clean, service was friendly. The internet access was little flakey but that was it. Will definitely be back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy suites is an older hotel but well maintained and well managed. The rooms have microwaves and small fridges. It is located at the center of Waikiki Beach Walk. Several excellent steak houses are attached as well as many other restaurants within a short walk. Embassy provides a very nice buffet breakfast around the pool area each morning. They have a well staffed concierge desk which i found very helpful during my visit on three different occassions. Lots of quality shopping areas within walking distance.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here for 13 nights and had a great time here. It's a 2 min walk to beach and 5 min walk from the main shopping area of Waikiki. Heaps of restaurants around and the complimentary breakfast and happy hour reception each night was really good as well. Topping it all off we found all the staff so nice and helpful our entire stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: fabulous for a family stay. We loved our two bedroom two bathroom apartment with living space to meet in the middle. We have two daughters (20 and 17) and we could have all our privacy and still enjoy a family holiday

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We went to the Embassy Suites after staying five days at the Outrigger Waikiki Beach. Check in was smooth and pleasant enough. We were upgraded to a two bedroom, two bathroom suite which had lots of room and we had a bathroom each. The suite had recently been upgraded and was perfect with comfortable mattresses and good linen. We were on the 11th floor which quite a long balcony overlooking Beach Walk but no ocean views. It is a block back from the beach so not as easy to get to beach. It seems the trade off is the size of the suites. The inclusive breakfast was good and the evening cocktail reception was nice if you took your drinks around the pool. Very generous with beer and cocktails. Pool snacks were also good and the size of pool and amount of loungers was also good.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotels staff is very well trained. I always receive excellent service from both the check in staff as well as the breakfast buffet staff. Individuals like Jaymar @ check in and Lucy Demi and Aldrin @ the breakfast buffet always exceed my expectations. I will continue to highly recommend this property for both business and family stays.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Staying at the Embassy Suites. Rooms are nice! Breakfast is free and omelets are cooked to order. Staff is friendly. One block from Waikiki beach. Free happy hour in the afternoon. Has a nice pool also.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have stayed here about 5 times now but I think we might look for something more modern and updated. The place is in a great position close to everything but the rooms need a complete makeover. The beds are excellent but the furniture needs some work.This is a full suite hotel so plenty of room to move. Managers complimentary bar drinks and snacks everynight from 5.30pm to 7.30pm.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a 1 bedroom suite which had plenty of room for my husband and I and our 17 year old son. The location is perfect close to the beach, restaurants, shopping and buses. The breakfast and evening cocktails are a fantastic bonus. Pool area is great. All the staff were very helpful and friendly, we would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Lovely and clean. Free WiFi great help organising our days. In house tour desk helpful but has dearer options, the tour shop next door was better value. Only hitch we had was our agent apparently did not pass on preferred bed set up so they had to search for a suitable room for 4 of us. Not a coversation you want to have after a 9 hour flight! So may be better booking directly. Windy on level 4 for hapoy hour but was weather in general.
user_name:
Sonia B
Gold Coast, Queensland, Australia

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Husband and I stayed one week at this location. Located within walking distance to the beach. Great breakfast and happy hour with live band. The room had a long but narrow balcony but we were able to sit there and enjoy the city view. The room décor felt dated and a bit crowded with large pieces of furniture. However, the room was fine, the typical embassy's one bedroom suite. The staff was excellent! everyone that we encountered was friendly and helpful. This is a pricey hotel compared to other embassy suites- wish they would change their décor to a more modern upscale looking so I can feel that the price is more justified. Overall, this is a great location and hotel. They do charge for parking about $35 per day and it is strictly valet.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel has the best management reception I've ever been to, ever. They have free alcohol with a great drink selection, snacks, a beautiful pool and a great band playing. This alone makes this hotel better than all the others in the area, I just wish it lasted longer! Breakfast is really nice too. Compare to the Marriot properties where you don't get diddly squat and it's no contest (coming from a platinum Marriott guy). Location is awesome as well.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I try to stay at Hilton Properties when I travel and I'm happy that we stayed at this one. The rooms/suites are very nice. The pool is very nice (begins receiving sun around 10am). We love the complimentary breakfast buffet with made to order omlettes. The cofee is disappointing (Duwe Egberts). It truly is a fabulous buffet but the problem is that dining is in a large open air room with birds flying around scarfing up food. I don't know how the Board of Health allows this to happen. For a solution we ate on the terrace outside. We also enjoyed the Managers reception with free beer and cocktails, and very good entertainment on certain nights. It is a wonderful time. Caution; if you rent a car the full day parking is $38. The Conciege (local expert) was very helpful in lining up our tours. Public transportation is near by and we will use it today to visit Diamond Head. The bus cost is $2.50. As I write this commentary I'm sitting on my 9th floor balcony overlooking the pool. Also, across the street is an ABC Store in case you need food/beer/personal items. The prices are reasonable and so I filled my fridge with beer and snacks. Our room was next to the elevator and we never heard a sound. The rooms were very quiet. I have not checked out the fitness center yet because my wife and I have been walking the beach for exercise. I hope that my words are helful to you because I really like this place and would consider it for future stays if I return to Oahu.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel was wonderful! Great staff, huge breakfast with many options, great location!! The hotel is an easy walk across the street to the beach which was very convenient! The area around the hotel was beautiful-lots of shops and high end stores. We were able to walk to many places which was nice since parking can be an issue. The breakfast sitting area is very big, we never had to wait for a spot to sit with our large party and the breakfast food options were amazing! If you are considering a visit to Wakiki, stay here!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Family of 5 stayed there for 6 nights in a 1-bedroom suite. Comfortable enough if you're on a budget (rather than getting a 2-bedroom suite). The sofa bed was standard. Room service was great value for money - decent serving. All hotel staff were friendly and always willing to help. Location is great, on a side strip off the main street so only a few minutes walk. Free daily breakfast and evening reception is a fantastic bonus to the great rates we got. Bit noisy as we had a room next to the linen closet so you can hear house-keeping, but overall it was a great hotel experience.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Awesome location. Very friendly staff. Excellent breakfast and evening reception. We would totally stay here again. You can walk across street to beach and if you go out the side door there is more shopping than you could possibly want and lots of restaurants.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have stayed at Embassy Suites three times now. We love it's location and most of all the happy hour drinks. It's so nice to sit down and relax of an evening with complimentary drinks and snacks whilst listening to the music play. The pool is also nice at the hotel and caters for the little kids too. Being a family of 5 we like the large rooms. One of the largest ABC stores is right across the road where you can pick up healthy snacks and meals. Beachwalk is at your doorstep and everything is so close. Our housekeepers have always been so lovely and pleasant to deal with. We would return again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The property is awesome!! Great location and the staff at the hotel are so helpful. The rooms are very spacious and what a great view I had of the blue pacific. If your there on a Friday you can enjoy the fireworks from your room.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have stayed at this locations for several years, in early December. A great weekend with family. The rooms are great, quite and comfortable. Nice to be walking distance to the beach and a variety of dining options. The evenings we follow up dinner with a walk down strip of shops to walk off dinner. The hotel is best location for little of everything.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites Waikiki is an outstanding Hotel. It is my hotel of choice when I visit Hawaii. Always extremely satisfied with all the amenities of this hotel!! The location is also convenient, as it is close to the beach, restaurants and shopping. I highly recommend the Embassy Suites Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed with my MIL in the week leading up to Thanksgiving for a total of 6 nights in a one-bedroom full ocean view apartment with the two queen beds. Suggest not to go below Level 9 (which was our level) which has quite pleasant views through the buildings ahead (there are 21 levels in the Hula Tower), but any lower and I would think you would be missing out on some higher view aspects. The biggest down-side for me, was after you opened one of the two sliding balcony doors and stepped outside, you experienced that dreadful oil/fat cooking smell from the variety of restaurants located below. Complete gag material.The apartment itself was quite reasonable but not outstanding in any specific way. Smallish TVs, basic amenities in the bathroom with a tiny bathtub, and no cutlery or crockery in the kitchen. The bathroom could do with the addition of a magnifying mirror and fog-proof glass. Towels and linen were fine.Relaxed/coastal style furniture which looked somewhat aged in style, but in clean condition. Beds were pretty comfy and housekeeping came daily with no complaints - I accidentally left the safe open one morning and they left a kind message and nothing was amiss, which was very good of housekeeping and management.The breakfasts were o-k-a-y but not amazing as I found the eggs completely tasteless no matter which way they were cooked (fresh-egg omelettes or two fried eggs) but the setup was lean and orderly despite being relatively busy at most times of the service, except first thing in the morning. The hot buffet food is barely luke warm (never hot) so dont expect the food to taste great when it's sitting around for a while.Cant fault the location and this gets a 5 out of 5 - barely 2 mins walk across to the beach (go early to reserve your spot of sand unless you want to pay $20/hr for a sunbed (take your turkish towel as some of these looked a bit worn). Take your reef shoes if your feet are sensitive to shells/small rocks of any type.Hotel is right on the Beach Walk which was very handy and you can go through almost completely undercover walking through to Cheesecake Factory in the event of rainy weather.We spent some time at the Level 4 pool and I only wish there was a completely separate area for adults as the Kiddy-times which start promptly from 9am and finish well after the Managers drinks in the evenings, got rather tedious, as I would've liked some quieter times by the pool/spa without being splashed and the constant squealing. The other annoying pool-side quirk was the three oversize round lounge beds are alwasy taken - please make them have have a 2-hour limit that you can pre-reserve, as every day we arrived early and other pool-goers just stay on the beds continually all day long, without letting anyone else enjoy these great lounges. Half the time, the other guets we witnessed hogging these beds were sleeping completely covered up with towels all over the bodies, so not much sun-bathing going on in any case. All in all, a great stay and I would recommend families and others than dont mind kiddies all day long in the pool.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The location, accomadations and staff at this facility were excellent. The hotel is convenient to the beach, restaurants and shopping. For us it was perfect. The staff at the breakfast buffet were especially upbeat and helpful.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites on Waikiki beach is a very short walk to the beach (took us a few minutes). It's a very nice hotel and super friendly staff. Loved our room! The free breakfast and happy hour is great! Shopping all around too. We will be back!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Had a wonderful experience @ Embassy Suites. Staff was very friendly & attentive. Rooms were spacious & clean. Housekeeping friendly. Only concern would be that we work with American Airlines & fly Standby. When checked if they would Honor our Rate in case had to stay another Night they said No. Rate was substantially higher. We would have to choose a different Hotel. Thankfully we made our departure flight. May want to reconsider this issue...

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed in a deluxe ocean room on 14th floor and we were very happy with the room.Complimentary drinks at happy hours and live music added to a great stayPool depth is only 3 or 4 ft which is family friendlyBreakfast was included and no resort fees chargedLocated next to a large abc store which you can buy hot food & saladsVery near beach and the main shops it seems

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed here a few days ago and yes! 5+ all the way! Excellent price and no resort fees, just remember there is a charge for valet parking, nothing you can do about the high prices all over Waikiki. There is also room taxes and other taxes, approx. $30 extra to the room rate. I think this is the best deal compared to other hotels that charge a hefty resort fee. With this hotel you get a bedroom and living room, not just a basic room. I am not sure if it is a luxury type hotel, possibly mid-range but worth every penny. Eriko was pleasant and checked us in, we were given the refreshing tropical drinks. Yummy, what a nice touch, great first impression of things to come. I like how you can sit down when you check in instead of stand in a queue.There's also complimentary infused fruit and herb water in the lobby every day. We stayed in room 1101, Aloha tower. Our room overlooked the food trucks area below, Ft. DeRussy park and all the high rises. We were next to the elevator and it is a one bedroom suite. Spacious, comfortable, sofa bed and TVs in the bedroom and living room. I usually bring my power strip because other hotels lacked outlets to plug in all my electronics. This hotel had outlets on every lamp and the alarm clock was easy to use. The room was very clean and had a mini fridge to put in refreshments and snacks. Room also comes with a microwave. We put the AC on during our stay because even though it was super windy, it was a bit humid. I also sleep with ear plugs so I really didn't notice the noise of the elevator. I rarely heard the elevator come up to the 11th floor after 11pm. There was a local newspaper outside my room every day, a nice touch to read about what's going on in the islands. The best part of staying here is the breakfast buffet every day (included with room rate). Every morning the servers and bussers were very friendly and helpful in asking if everything was ok, did we need our water or juice refilled, etc... The omelette guy was very talented, flipping the omelettes and cooking them really good. Nice touch to have some sriracha on the side. I was also wowed every day when there were different breakfast items to choose from. Again, refreshing tropical drinks, hot tea, coffee you can make and take to go, flavored sparkling water. Everyone was helpful. Since we are 2 hours ahead of Hawaii, we were at the buffet at 7am every day and there was never a big line for the omelette station or the other breakfast selections. Lots of seating as well. Yes, the earlier you go to the buffet, the faster you can eat and get on with sightseeing or whatever. The manager's reception for drinks and entertainment on Mondays, Wednesdays, Fridays and Saturdays from 5:30pm to 7:30pm. Keola the bartender was hustling, making few drinks at a time, very good drinks, kept everyone entertained. When his line got a bit too long, we walked past the pool to the other bar. No line at that one to get drinks, shhh! Maybe other guests didn't want to walk all the way to the other side but I didn't want to wait in line. I liked how the entertainment changed as well and kids were allowed, making it a fun family atmosphere. The buffet and reception are located on the 4th floor in Aloha tower, so I am glad we stayed in this one as it was a quick walk down the hallway. Pack light because there is a laundry room on the 3rd floor, at the end of the hallway past the gym. The wash is $3.25 and the dryers cost $3.50? Bring quarters or pay with debit or credit card.
