Great amenities - yummy breakfast (go early to avoid lines!) awesome pool, happy hour every day, and they give you a nice Hawaiian CD when you leave. Less than one block away from the beach and also one block away from Lewers street which is the main shopping street in Waikiki. Everything felt really high quality and my stay at the embassy suites was amazing!
user_name:
Meghan O
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We booked a 2 room suite and it was spacious, but pricey for not being waterfront. Property is generally clean and up to date. Best part was the free breakfast. All staff were very courteous and friendly. Would probably rate higher if it was a better value or on Waikiki beach (it is across the street).

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent location, convenient to the beach and to shopping in Waikiki. Excellent staff, very friendly service. The free breakfast buffet was a great way to start each day and the manager's reception was a great way to start each evening.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Location is excellent. The facilities are excellent and even better they all work.(TV, A/C, shower, radio). Nothing worse than entering a room with all the right facilities but they don't work. Suites are a good size and the beds are really comfortable. Breakfast is great and managers evening happy hour is a great way to end the day. This was our fourth visit. Cost is getting expensive but we will still find the money to come back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I liked my room has two rooms separating a bedroom and a living room with reasonable price. Each has a TV. We have a 8 y old daughter, then it was good to have a separate bed room, allowing her to sleep well. My room seems to have been kept in good condition and daily room cleaning was also good. The breakfast was cafeteria style and a little busy but providing good fruits. The pool has also enough size as a hotel pool in this area, although again a little busy with families. This may because many families like this pool and there was a free reception serving nice cocktail and snacks. Lastly, coming back to our arrival, the receptionist was very helpful, though we had to wait a little bit before checking-in. Check-in process itself was rather smooth and check-out was in a flash. We had good impression on the staffs there overall.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at the Embassy Suites. The location was good, close walk to the beach, restuarants, bus etc. We were in room 1911 and had partial ocean views. The hotel has some decent inclusions, such as free breakfast and happy hour cocktails. A bonus is definitely the coin operated laundry. The pool is really quite shallow and not that big. We had a room near the lift, so it was quite noisy at night/early morning but I still slept fine (although this being the first child free holiday in several years may have contributed). I would definitely stay here again, I think it's a good option for families.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our son graduated from high school and we wanted to treat him to a memorable vacation before he headed off to college. With the whirlwind of graduation, getting him ready for college and everything in between, this review is long overdue (since we stayed earlier in June), but the service at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk was by far the BEST all around service we have ever experienced and they deserve an EXCELLENT review.When I began looking for a hotel in Waikiki, I soon realized there are very few that offered the amenities we were looking for. This Embassy Suites seemed to have everything we wanted: two queen size beds (difficult to find in Waikiki) in a separate room; a sofa bed in the living room; an ocean view (this means we were able to sit on our sofa and see the ocean through our window); not one, but two lanais; a pool; a complimentary full breakfast buffet with a wonderful omelet station; an evening reception with snacks and drinks (including alcohol); centrally located to everything; and no resort fees. The Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk is well-appointed and an outstanding value for your money.The amenities are wonderful, but the hospitality is even more superior. From the first time I called to make the reservation (with Malia Espinda, Guest Experience Manager) to the moment we were departing the property, we were treated with the essence of the Aloha spirit and felt like family the entire stay. Malia did not announce herself on our call as a manager (I only learned that later when we arrived), she simply took great care to answer all of my questions in a friendly way and did not make me feel like I was bothering her at all. Based on that call alone, I was even more excited about our upcoming trip. In addition to Malia, all the staff persons we encountered were fantastic. However, there are some I would like to recognize by name because, like Malia, they took extra good care of us. A special thank you to Jay and Cindy at the front desk for the regular aloha greetings and laughs; to our housekeeper Angela who made sure our room was tidy and well stocked; to Aldrin and Cary for welcoming us to breakfast and offering island tips for ways to spend our days; to Bryan for happily making great omelets and eggs to order; and to Keoni at the Bell Desk for sharing great tips for Pearl Harbor, including transportation. In fact, Keoni went the extra mile to have breakfast-to-go meals ready for our family one morning because we had to leave extra early for an excursion and did not have time to enjoy the breakfast buffet.It’s the exceptional service at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk that made this family vacation exceed our expectations; it’s not very often that you arrive not knowing anyone and leave feeling special like you’re family. The next time we return to Waikiki, we will only stay here. Mahalo to all of you, especially Malia, we miss you all! - The Samoy Family

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Hawaii Embassy Suites is a family oriented hotel. We enjoy bringing our grandchildren and their families with us as it's not always convenient to bring everyone together because their schedules are so dynamic. It's a wonderful way to get a way from it all and not leave the islands. My husband has a fear of flying to its very convenient.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We booked through Priceline which defaults to double occupancy. When we checked in as a party of three we were upgraded from a one bedroom to a two bedroom suite! Location was central. Rooms were clean, and staff friendly. Enjoyed the breakfast buffet and manager's reception. Would have liked to see spam in their breakfast since that's such a big thing in Hawaii. Parking is expensive at $35/day. Stayed at various Embassy Suites and by far this one is the best. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel location is very strategic, although not at the beach side but it is very close to it. This hotel also located very near to shopping place and many good restaurant and also to access to public transportation. The manager reception at the evening is very impressive

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I travel quite a bit - well all the time so I know when I get a good property. I have been visiting Hawaii for more than 35 years and have to admit for convenience and value the Embassy Suites is the best deal. It is in the middle of everything and close to the beach - go a grab a chair outside the Outrigger and plus it has a bar with 160 beers on tap underneath - the Yard House. Enough said. Gym is good hotel gym - laundry (important) and great staff. Business, pleasure and particularly family - great place to stay.If you are here also go to BUHO mexican and real surprise.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a nice property in a great location, close to everything. Staff was friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the usual Embassy Suites perks, and our roomy suite was perfect for our group of 5. Would stay again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach offers all a traveler is looking for...I could not have asked for better accommodations and was very pleased...I will be back next year and plan on staying at this Hotel Again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were room moved here for a night due to an overbooking at our original hotel. Plus points for our room being ready despite our very early arrival so we could check-in immediately (Jay at Reception made it all happen) and enjoy the breakfast buffet too though it is run-of-the-mill, cafeteria style - understandable, considering the big hotel operation. Suite was very spacious with a separate living room and two TVs. Amenities complete with a microwave to boot. Appreciated the complimentary gift bag which was useful for our shopping. View was nothing to shout about. But, the Manager's Cocktail Reception was something else. Literally open bar every evening and the barman with the ponytail totally did not hold back on the booze. At. All. It was like his personal mission to make sure everyone is high (what a job!). Seriously, how they make money out of this is beyond me. Was granted late check-out the next day as well. Thanks, Jay!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites is in a good location to shopping and restaurants. It is not beach front, nor does it have a great pool, but the complimentary buffet breakfast and happy hour are great benefits! Rooms are clean.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Loved the one bedroom apartments here. Travelling with a toddler we could put him to sleep for nap/evening in the bedroom and enjoy the view/tv in the separate living space.We had a big window with an ocean view that helped with keeping my toddler occupied and not wanting to go on balcony (which wasn't very large and we were on 18th floor).The room had lots of spots to recharge devices. Also included in price was a Breakfast buffet (which was convenient and I loved the omelette chefs) and managers drinks at pool each night was a nice touch.Our flight back to Aus left before breakfast and they arranged a takeaway for us which was appreciated!! The only negative thing I found was that there was no cutlery, dishes, wine glasses etc to use in the room which was a bit inconvenient.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Rusty, Mike, Dominic, Aldrin, Alma were awesome at the dining hall. Room upgrade was not offered until I asked and there was non available. Oswald can use a little smile-It's free At the Hilton honors counter. Valet Parkers- respectful. Although we opted to not have the room cleaned, the housekeeping department made themselves "very" available. The operators should learn how to utilize pen and paper when we ask for certain small necessities in the room, like toilet paper, shampoo et al. The requests comes with one or two items missing. The ice machine has been "out of order" beside room 1705, I reported since September 3, three days later and reported daily, still not working, same with the water dispenser in the exercise room, I reported as well.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Booked a one night stay for my wife and I in Waikiki.Paid extra for an "ocean view" which in my opinion was not worth the additional cost. Like all Embassy Suites, free booze at Manager's Reception and free breakfast. Parking is $35/night.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is excellent, despite the high volume of guests. Rooms are well furnished and clean. The quality that gets my excellent rating though, is the superb staff. They are friendly, and very helpful, which helped to make our stay very comfortable.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The location of the hotel is convenient! It takes 5 minutes walking to beach, 10minutes walking to DFS. Staff members are great! Suite is extremely clean. If I return to Hawaii, this hotel will be my only choice! Excellent hotel! Bravo!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Where ever I travel in the United States (and I've done my fair share of traveling), I try to stay at an Embassy Suites. I love the breakfast offerings in the morning. It's so quick, convenient, and great quality with a wide selection. The Waikiki location is surrounded by awesome restaurants like BLT, Nobu, Arancino's, and Roy's to name a few. Not to mention all the shopping available in walking distance and the beach is right across the street. The hotel itself is consistently clean, welcoming, and very comfortable. The staff are so friendly and helpful. They do their very best to accommodate and anticipate your every need. We've been to the Waikiki Embassy Suites many times and we have always been pleased. Not to mention the fact that the staff already call us by name and recognize us right away when we arrive.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great hotel, awesome staff, excellent location close to everything- plenty of shopping(every name brand you can think of) restaurants every where Yard house, cheeseburger beach walk, Ruth Chris and of course all the ABC stores . Too many time share begging for your time.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have come to the Embassy Suites two years in a row now, and I have to say, it's a nice hotel.Excellent service. Checkin is actually an enjoyable experience, staff are attentive and friendly and actually care about their job. One nice feature about the checkin in the tropical feel of the checkin area and the complimentary tropical drink that is served to all guests. (Non alcoholic - sorry booze hounds :P) The bell boy doesn't ask for a tip, even with a family of massive and heavy bags. (you still should give him a few $ anyway though)The rooms are nice with a balcony (Which is the first thing to be barricaded off from my infant and 6 year old. The rooms include a decent bathroom with an empty vanity, hairdryer, and a shaver? The shower/bath has a nice little system to alternate between the systems which can be a bit finicky (the water can come from the bath tap instead of the shower head.) but overall, it was pretty nice, temperature can be adjusted precisely, (I like very, very hot showers and occasionally freezing showers and both can be achieved.) the water pressure however, isn't really anything to rave about. Pressure can drop a massive amount if all the taps are on in the double room (two rooms join to make one massive one.) but it is usually manageable. The room layout we had is called the "Grand Lanai" (with balcony and double rooms) which includes a living room/kitchenette and balcony, flanked by a bedroom on either side. I HIGHLY recommend that you dead-lock the bedroom doors if you like to sleep late (until 10 or 11 or so) as the maids can come in accidentally and that isn't a fun way to spend your holiday. I don't sleep in so I really don't have anything to worry about, just a heads up. One gripe I had about this hotel is the elevators, there is two of them for everyone in the hotel. (theres a staff one, but you cannot get into that too easily ;) Wait times at the elevators can be a few minutes as they aren't rockets. Just plan your elevator trip carefully! ;PThe dining area offers a full buffet breakfast with a two chef's manning the omelette stations. The food includes breakfast staples - all of them, fresh fruit, spreads, (please have Vegemite, I'm Aussie and NEED Vegemite - it's also fun to see people who aren't used to the taste, go and try a big dollop of the black Aussie delicacy and spit it out in disgust - you would know how funny it is if you're an Aussie) and a variety of juices, water, ice, soft drinks and tea/coffee in a separate booth. The hall where you eat has a MAJOR PROBLEM, though, if you take your eye off the food for even a second, it gets commandeered and eaten by the birds instantly. There is a area for families the is separated by a door but that is small and I don't really like it! This area as well as the pool area mentioned below has a live band playing there every night.The pool/spa area is usually quite empty (why would you like to go to a pool when you are at the Surfing and beach capital of the world?) and has a bar/cafe right next to it. Food is nice overall. If you go to reception and go down the corridor out of the building, you will be on the main drag, with shops, food courts and everything else around you.Overall, it is a great hotel and has many nice features, a few area that need improvement but I would recommend it to anyone without thinking twice!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was a great staycation spot. Its in a very good location, close by to many things available in Waikiki. The managers reception was amazing and there was a great view of fireworks from the room. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Valet Parking is steep of $35 a night, but valet service was excellent. They were nice enough to retrieve some items from our vehicle after we got into our room twice. During check-in, we were welcomed with a refreshing cold glass of passion juice. They have complimentary hot breakfast and happy hour. For a large family, breakfast alone would cost more if you had to go outside. Plus who'd say no to free alcohol? On a Friday night, a live band played during happy hour and you could see glimpse of the fireworks show from the other hotel. Near to restaurants, clubs, stores and beach that your really didn't need a car if you're just hanging in Waikiki. Watched football at Giovanni Pastrami and they had free pizza during happy hour. Beach is across the street, an easy walk away to the ocean. Want a lesson on Hawaii? Nearby is Fort DeRussey and the army museum there is free and its air conditioned. Our room faced the city and its okay. Balcony kind of small but really spent our time outside our suite exploring Waikiki. Our room had a mini fridge, sink, microwave and coffee pot. Enough to store our drinks and leftovers. Pool is okay, but rather be on the beach anyways. Slept like a baby even if our room was next to the elevator. Didn't hear much foot traffic but could hear the elevator open and close. It wasn't' an issue for our family but if your group has a light sleeper, request to not be near the elevator. Also complimentary internet! Great bang for our buck!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel was wonderful with a great staff. We all loved the breakfast buffet with something for everyone. Everything was very fresh. Cold fruit infused water in the lobby when you got back from the beach. Beach towels in room. Right across from the beach. Close the restaurants & shopping. Very commercial area so if you are wanting secluded - this is not it. FYI - you have to pay to park if you rent a car but you have to pay anywhere !

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were greeted with a fresh fruit drink in cute little glasses. So refreshing! The Staff was super friendly! The Best Valet service ever! Very quick and efficient. Service with a smile :) Great location. Close to the beach and an ABC store across the street for all the little extras that you need. Cute shops and food close by. I loved the fact that I could look out my window and see the Shrimp trucks and the unique mixture of food and people that came and went. Bonus free breakfast buffet with something for everyone! Did I mention that it's free??? Beds & pillows just right! Aloha and Mahalo!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The welcome at arrival was warm and the staff were always courteous and helpful. It was a blessing to not have to go looking for where to have breakfast. We will definitely stay here again and highly recommend it.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I stayed 3 nights at the Embassy Suites and were very pleased with our choice of hotels this trip. We usually stay across the street at the Outrigger but decided to spend less money and get the bonus free hot breakfast as well. We stayed in an ocean view room on the 8th floor. It was the corner room and we had 2 lanai areas to enjoy. One side overlooks the pool area and the other Waikiki Beach. You can see the ocean but this is an ocean view, not ocean front. We were aware of this and didn't mind. You are looking between tall buildings for your ocean view. The staff were all very friendly and parking especially was not nearly as obvious about expecting a tip as other hotels we have stayed at. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have slept in on vacation. Breakfast was made to order omelets, fruit, sweet potato tots, bacon...plenty of choices for a free breakfast. The location is awesome, steps away from shopping and restaurants as well as the beach. An added bonus, if you are there on Friday night, you can watch the Hilton Hawaiian Village fireworks show from your balcony and have an unobstructed view of it. We would stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We've stayed at this hotel before and the experience was just a good as the last time. One thing that we noticed was the pool liner needs to be repaired. The complimentary breakfast was good with the cook to order eggs and the fresh fruits. It's expensive to stay here but if you can find a promo rate it's worth the extra cost. You should take into consideration that they do not charge resort fees and provide a hearty breakfast every morning.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is located in the heart of Waikiki, walking distance to most places. The pool and entertainment area at the centre of the hotel are a great and economical spot for breakfast and evening meals. The generous happy hour (2 hours) was much appreciated.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent location. Not located on the beach, but it's really just steps to the beach. Great shopping and restaurants attached to the hotel and along the street. Terrific breakfast buffet included with the stay as well and an evening manager's reception happy hour. Perfect room sizes for our family of 5 (kids ages 14, 12 and 10). Very high end shopping just a few blocks away. Pool was very nice as well. We used this as our home base while we toured some parts of Oahu like Pearl Harbor, Polynesian Cultural Center and the north shore. We did also go to the beach most afternoons. Kids loved the waves as we rented boogie boards at the beach. Waikiki is very built up, so expect lots of people and high rise resorts. However, we really enjoyed our stay here. The staff was very friendly as well.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family arrived at 11.00 am and were able to be accommodated with out much wait the breakfast was well above average. Unfortunately the cleanliness let the property down it was not great the room had plenty of chemicals used but a little more care and attention to detail would have been great.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location with free drinks & snacks every afternoon and an amazing breakfast selection thrown in. What Aussie doesn't love a free happy hour x 2! We arrived early -well before check in but they realized we needed a room after long flight so re-arranged to accommodate.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a two bedroom suite. It is a bit smaller than the photos make it look but was perfect for our stay with six of us. Having two bathrooms was a godsend with that many people getting ready each morning. Staff were fabulous. Property clean and tidy. Having complimentary cocktails and breakfast made our stay extra fabulous.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Enjoyed staying at this hotel a lot. It is family oriented. It provides a buffet breakfast every morning. There is a station for fresh made omelettes. There is bacon, sausages, ham, potatoes, fresh fruits like mango, watermelon, honey dew, and sweet pineapple! The scrambled eggs are available but you can get them to order in the omelette line. There is an assortment of breads like bagel, English muffins, and assorted pastry. There is parking for a fee--they park it and retrieve the car on demand. There is fresh, cold water provided during the day in the lobby. The hotel is located in Waikiki so it is convenient for shopping. The ABC Stores are all around, and Long Drugs Pharmacy is around the corner. It is opened around the clock. The hotel is close to the beach. You can bus it to Ala Moana Shopping Center down the street. Love this place.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Pros - rooms were comfortable, shuttle service available for a fee to some places, good location, close to beach, nice views, nicely maintainedCons - Some of the staff was a bit moody Overall is was nice and comfortable

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family runs away from the hustle and bustle of everyday life to Staycation at Embassy Suites Waikiki.It's perfect for our entire family! Like a cruise ship that doesn't sail. It has a heated pool for my school age children and jacuzzi for the adults to unwind in while we are in arms length of our kids.The Manager's Reception is enjoyed during sunset.. Snacks, fountain drinks and live music while we sip on cocktails at poolside.Close to fine dining, ABC stores, upscale boutiques, or Denny's for that comfort food you might crave at any hour of the day.Waking up to the hot breakfast buffet tops our stay at the Embassy.Worth every penny for priceless memories with my family... Take a break from life and live it up at the Embassy Suites Waikiki!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: A great stay made all together better by the great staff at the Embassy. Room was comfortable and had good views after a little bump at the start as my hhonors preferences were not loaded on reservation it was all sorted and the vacation could start. Breakfast was hectic in the mornings (summer peak to be expected) look out for the hungry birds in the outside deck areas they will take their chances to grab a bite off your plate if they are not tended well. Pool was great got our two young boys but pool side deck chairs were in hot demand early on. The staff were great to reset deck chairs when they are not being used. Makes it easy to get to a good spot to keep an eye on the kids. Valet and concierge was excellent proactive and eager to help with all rhe shopping and give advice for excursions. First time to Hawaii and a great vacation- well done Embassy.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: nice basic hotel but clean and walking distance to anything you need.the daily breakfast is nice and variable. just go early. after 830,some people act as if they've never had a free breakfast before.1. aloha tower. pool facing. if above 7 floor you have a nice view of ocean2. do not get room next to elevator.3. sad but few shade tables/chairs at pool. ppl go out at 7 am to "save" the 5-6 umbrellas. pool opens at 9. kinda blows.4. service is good5. very helpful if yo uwish to do excursions at concierge and in helping you get a rental if needed.6. great for families. be warned. pool is kid madhouse in the evening.7. bummer. no real areas for adults
user_name:
Jeremy W
Los Angeles, California, United States

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at Embassy Suites at other States, it has been a very comfortable family friendly place. This Waikiki Beach Walk proved this again. We spend three nights at a two bed room ocean view suite for family of four. It’s spacious and comfortable, enjoyed the ocean view from our balcony. The air conditioner at one bedroom wasn’t working properly but sorted quickly. It’s a very big hotel, breakfast was OK, service around breakfast tables made the experience better. The ABC store downstairs is really convenient. Lobby travel agent is great, but the queue can be quite long for such a big hotel. All in all, nothing special, but it’s a convenient hotel for family.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I would give a 4.5 rating if I could. The 0.5 point off is b/c at the breakfast, their fresh cut fruit, either melon or cantaloupe, went sour every morning, and their peach tasted blend. I can understand this, as most of the fruit was "imported". Their local pineapple tasted great!And that's all my complaints. Great location. In the middle of everything. Very short walk to the beach. Hotel gift shop, a large ABC store, and a food truck yard right down stairs. Royal Hawaiian Center and Aloha Landing , a tour bus pick up center, and the post office were within 3 minutes walk. Farmer's Market is held outside hotel on Thursday afternoon/evenings. Like I said, in the middle of everything.We stayed on 14th floor in Hula tower, facing Imperial Hotel. Although it is a City View room, you will see the ocean from the balcony. Separate climate control in the living room and the bedroom. Very quiet and spacious. If you happened to be awake at 6 am, you would hear the truck backing in, but it was not loud enough to wake you up. With the water sink in the kitchen I got to do dishes without interrupting my son's nap, and while have swimming suites soak in the facial sink in the bathroom at the same time. Unlike other Embassy Suites, there was a electric kettle in the kitchen! I liked it very much. If you do the on-line check-in, the map shown during the process is misleading. It shows as if the elevators were next to room **26, but they are actually located next to room **21 and **32. Don't pick those rooms. Every hotel asks you to save the Earth by reusing the towel, but this Embassy Suites had more than that. It has a simple robe hook next to the bath tub! That's all it takes! I reused my towel for the entire week. No, I don't use fresh towel very day at home, I put them in the washer every one or two weeks. But I got to hang them dry properly at home. Most hotels expect you to do the same at their property, but don't offer you the hooks! In fact, the more hooks you put in the bathroom, the less towel you will see on the floor. I like the effort ES made. Although I do hope there were places to hang the wet swimming suites, especially you know people will get in the ocean or the pool every single day. My son loved the salt water pool. There was a area just for babies. The water was only 1 and 1/2 feet. Anyone can sit up properly should be safe in there. The free breakfast was great other than the fruit, the evening snack was good. Bell and valet services were fast. Overall, great place and I will stay there again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Pool & rooms are perfect. Lots of space to spread out in each suite. Hot tub & Pool are clean & well taken care of. Breakfast Buffet is adequate but same every day, gets boring. Manager's Reception each evening is great, staff very friendly & efficient.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Waikiki Embassy Suites is similar to others we've stayed at in the US with the added bonus of a double lanai. As always the extra room is welcome with two teens. Breakfast was better than others with the addition of local touches and access to higher quality produce. Afternoon reception benefits from the open setting adjacent to pool area and live entertainment. Other reviews mentioned long waits for elevators, but we experienced no issues from the 15th floor. Hotel has 20+ floors; higher levels offer better views. Pool is on 4th so I'd avoid floors 4-6 of aloha tower. Other tower is further away from pool so noise unlikeliy to be a problem.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites is a great hotel. Staff are polite and helpful. Breakfast here was awesome. So many choices of food and it's free. Then the awesome entertainment during Managers reception and the food was filling.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our first trip to Oahu with our entire family and we were looking for a great priced hotel while still staying in a nice location. We found both and some with the Embassy Suites, I use ES when I travel for work which is why I selected the hotel but the stay was MUCH more than expected. The hotel is BEAUTIFUL and very clean, we were greeted with welcome drinks upon arrival--not to mention I completed the digital check in the night before and selected the room we were going to stay in. The room was very spacious, for six of us we had room! It is located right on Beach Walk where the beach is right across the street and the hotel is surrounded by restaurants on both sides. All around the best stay we have had with the family!! We would even return for a couples stay as well. Great job, Embassy Suites!
user_name:
Crystal B
Yuba City, United States

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Best value for the money! Breakfast is covered, welcome drinks in the evening! Pay the valet($35/night). It's definitely worth it. That way you don't have to worry about looking for free parking. Mahalo!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We chose this hotel for a 4 day stopover in January enroute as it was recommended to us as good value for a family of 5. That said, yes it was good value for money but it didn't have much else to offer. Breakfast was horrible and very run of the mill. We ate out for breakfast after our first encounter with it. Pool was very ordinary and didn't have much of ambience to it. However the lounges around the pool were comfy.Concierge was helpful but watch out for the discount sell pitch when you are given the option to go to a 2 hour talk at the other Hilton for buying into upcoming properties for a tempting discount on your tour packages - regretfully we lost 1/2 a day for the discount....never again will we fall for that one Hilton!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at the Embassy Suites. We have been long-time Hilton users, but this was the first time we had stayed at an Embassy Suites. Hilton perks, pool, jacuzzi, room with a partial ocean view, although it indicated city view. We could see much of Waikiki, the Ko`olau mountains, the ocean from the lanai in two directions. The stay included a full breakfast buffet, with made to order omelets, breakfast pastries, meats, potatoes, fruit, toast, and other goodies. Eat breakfast, and you may not need lunch! The manager's evening cocktail and snack time is great. Sometimes the snacks are not fancy, but there are vegetables, chips, pretzels, dips, sometimes nachos. All in all pretty good, and the bar is an open bar, and non-alchoholic are included: juice, sodas etc. All in all a good value. The beach is steps away, and Fort DeRussey is literally across the street, with the Army museum (free) good for a few hours of exploration. There are plenty of restaurants nearby

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our room was not great had view of garbage dumpsters and food trucks. Location and breakfast is the advantage of this hotel. The pull out sofa bed was awful. When we talked to front desk all they said was sorry-did nothing about it. We even tried to upgrade our room. Our room was not cleaned until 3 pm and asked if we even wanted it cleaned! Highlight was going to breakfast staff there was extremely friendly and helpful and food was good. Inquired about our Hilton honours number and front desk very rude. They need to read room key-"they will make it right"

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We chose Embassy Suites based on many recommendations and a previous stay in Embassy Suites Miami.The location was great, nothing was too far to walk to - a lot of ABC Stores and many choices for lunch, dinner and shopping. The beach was a few minutes walk but would recommend walking down towards Ala Moana, Outrigger Beach etc for a less rock experience.Our room and bathroom were spacious and made up daily. We were on the 18th floor and had partial ocean views. The best things about staying here were that breakfast was included, there was a large choice but it did get busy and also the Reception (Happy Hour) free 2 hours of drinks and snacks in the evening.A big thanks to Uncle Dean at the Concierge desk for all his tips - especially the fresh fruit ice cream from Henry's across the road.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We could see the ocean from our room. It was spacious and very clean. The breakfast was great and managers coctail hour was great. My only complaint would be concierge it is staffed with only one person. After going back three times for some questions I gave up and went else where.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I am a "local", was having a Staycation with my daughter and 2 grandchildren. We were treated like Royalty, everyone from the valet, to the bellman, reception, housekeeping and food servers/bus boys. If these locals can treat us like this (and we live in their back yards), can you imagine how wonderfully well they would treat our tourists…..We can't wait to have another Staycation here…..

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were expecting a suite similar to other Embassy Suites, however, our room was more like a regular size room that had been cut in half, very "cozy". This hotel had the worst house keeping service that I've ever experienced. She didn't clean the bathroom sink or floors even during our nine day stay. On one occasion the house keeper left our balcony door opened and unlocked after cleaning. Basically, we would have gotten the same or better quality service staying at a$100/night hotel, but we paid $350/night. Our view was great and the hotel is centrally located and just two blocks from the beach.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel exceeded all expectations by far. We were booked for a total of 7 nights, it didn't seem long enough when we were checking out. Great location right at the Beachwalk...shopping, restaurants, and within walking distance to the Waikiki Beach. The rooms were very well kept and housekeeping did an awesome job making sure our room was clean. Not to mention the beautiful partial view. There are 3 elevators in the hula tower so you were never waiting very long for a ride. Their breakfast staff did an amazing job keeping the food well stocked and tables cleaned. Their selection of food was great and they tried to switch up their selection from day to day. Look for Aldrin. This guy makes working look fun. He always greeted us with a "Good Morning" and made sure tables were cleaned for the next group right away. He never stopped working and always had a smile on his face. He is a great asset to this hotel. I was a little hesitant on the valet parking, but their parking staff was great. We never waited more than 5 minutes for our vehicle, even during peak time. The only disappointment I had was with the rate. I booked the AAA family fun rate because of the faster internet that they advertised only to find out at check-in was there was no faster internet. I could have saved $85 or so if I knew there was no difference. I did let the staff know about this issue upon check-in and check-out and they said they would let management know. Hoping I can get a credit or even some Hilton Points. This stay was not cheap, but definitely worth it.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suite was an incredible experience. We had 4 adults, stayed on the 12th floor, and had a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom room. The furniture modern and nice, the bathroom was spacious with lots of counter space, although the "kitchen" was a small counter, small sink, and mini fridge. The breakfast was delicious; they served a nice variety of food from traditional hotel breakfast food to rice, miso soup, an omelette bar, and guava juice. The pool is nice, but not so great if you're looking for a quiet adult option. The free drinks and snacks every night were a great feature, and helped to kill some time before heading out to dinner. The valet parking is great and really convenient. The best thing I loved about the hotel was how close is was to everything. It is right across the street from the beach, has a few Starbucks close by, and is in the heart of a great strips of shops and restaurants. The surrounding shops are incredible and range from luxury brands to a quick convenient store. What also was great was the fact that Embassy gives you a little booklet of discounts to surrounding shops and restaurants. I loved this hotel, definitely would recommend, and want to go back soon!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: There were (10) of us that ended up staying here for a family vacation. It ended up being a great location for our family, and the size of the rooms are nicely sized for families. While the hotel is not on the beach, and we had a nice view. It's also conveniently located to entertainment and shopping. Checking in was a breeze and the front desk personnel were very helpful and professional. The property and rooms were clean. Everyone enjoyed breakfast time and the food that were offered. Breakfast alone, is probably the main reason why we selected the Embassy Suites. The Evening Poolside Reception was nice too, because we enjoyed complimentary drinks, snacks and entertainment. All of the personnel that waited on the guests were always professional and very accommodating. The pool area was always clean and it never felt crowded. I would recommend staying here; and if I'm in Waikiki again, I'd definitely stay at the Embassy Suites, Waikiki again. (I didn't take pictures, because the pictures on their website are very true to what you experience).

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Very convenient location. Pleasant staff. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Although not ocean front, we had a nice view of the ocean looking between the other buildings. Highly recommend. Breakfast buffet was good, but gets crowded as the morning progresses.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Just got back from a week at this hotel. The room was great! We asked for a partial ocean view and it was definitely delivered. From the girl who checked us in, the valet's who parked and retrieved our car, the housekeeping staff, the concierge desk, the wait staff at breakfast, you are all the greatest. So attentive and so nice and friendly, made for a great experience. The free breakfast every morning was the best. So many offerings and absolutely delicious!! This hotel is right on Waikiki beachwalk which was great for shopping and dining. We couldn't have asked for more. Hope to make it back someday. Sylvia Z

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The room was nice and clean but smaller than I think other embassy suites. Breakfast was pretty standard with good selection... Cereal, omelet station, yogurt, bacon etc. manager happy hour wasn't every day but they offered the most variety of drinks I have ever seen such as Mai Tai, Hawaiian Punch, gin, vodka, wine, beer, etc and they were not skippy with their pours. Pool was nice but always had tons of kids in it. The beach was just a quick walk across the street. I loved the location because it was close to a lot of shopping, restaurants and beach. One complaint is that our room wasn't made up until 3 pm every day.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have stayed here every year or 7 years. We absolutely love staying there. Everyone is so friendly and laid back. The breakfast is awesome. Cocktails with snacks poolside watching the sunset it to die for.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Not directly on the beach, but not very far either. You won't be disappointed with beach access. This hotel is great and offers an expansive free breakfast. Also, free are evening drinks and sometimes live entertainment. That was a great touch with the expenses of being in a place like Hawaii. Oustanding service and spacious suites with balconies and updated bathrooms.
user_name:
KateTnyc
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here on the 21st floor. Fantastic location. Easy access to the beach, shops etc. The suite was perfect. Spotlessly clean and well serviced. The evening happy hour was fun. Open bar and music. Breakfast is excellent. Lots to choose from. Staff are helpful and friendly. Stayed here for 4 nights and would definitely return. This hotel is everything you would expect from being a first class hotel, yet it is friendly and relaxing. Stay here – you won’t be disappointed.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were traveling with a small baby and toddler and the embassy suites was perfect for our need to be at the hotel more then usual needs. Poolside snacks, drinks and food options and a palatial breakfast buffet. I'm not a huge fan of Waikiki but I would definitely stay there again. All staff was so friendly and accommodating.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Oh my goodness, this hotel is amazing and it sooo rocks!!! The lobby is heavenly with the natural foliage and the live royal swans Bach and Beethoven. The staff was stellar and so polite!! Every room is a beautiful suite and we had a two bedroom suite which was amazing!!! Shout outs to the entire front desk staff (Mariah especially) and also John Comeu, bartender extraordinaire at the Verdea wine bar.Klara, the rsvp manager was imperative to make our wedding home base happen and be so flawless. Thanks again so much for everything that you and your staff did to make our weekend and special day so wonderful!!!Always love, Mrs. & Mrs. Kontos

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed 5 nights at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beachwalk to celebrate our 50th wedding anniversary. It was my 1st time in Hawaii and as a traveler with disabilities, I was concerned about any special needs/assistance I might have. No worries! All of the staff was extremely helpful and kind, and from our wonderful welcome drink to all of the special attention given to us to make our stay so memorable, we cannot thank everyone for helping to make our celebration so wonderful! The daily breakfasts were spectacular, and my husband really enjoyed the custom omelette station! The evening reception was just as great, and the entertainment on certain evenings was so enjoyable! We certainly recommend this hotel, and can' wait to return!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We first stayed at the the Hilton Hawaiian Village and went here for 3 days. Good call! Not a circus and right in the heart of things. The Beachwalk has a food truck area and also Tommy Bahama , both have great food. There is also a little store across from the entrance just before the food trucks which has great ice cream. you will see the people mulling about.Great breakfast and happy hour, we only made it to these once, but, worth going to.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: If ever I'm going back to Hawaii, I would definitely stay at this Hotel again. The staff are really personable and attentive. The Hotel is centrally located in the town with a few sea view rooms. The breakfast program is very good along with the managers evening cocktails. The heated pool within the normal swimming makes it easy to transition. The gym could be fitted with a few more work out machines but overall the Hotel was perfect. Be prepared to spend on parking though.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great place to stay only thing I didn't like was the 35 dollars a night to park after spending so much on the trip overall had a great time we stayed six nights after the first night never had to ask for extra towels or anything. Stay on higher floors get a better view

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I am very critical about hotels and was worried staying anywhere for 8 days but the reviews did not lie. My wife and I stayed in a one bedroom suite with our 2 sons (13 and 5)The rooms were amazingly clean. Even the vents were spotless. Bathroom is hugeBeds are super comfortable. Breakfast was great. It had so many options and kept us full until early evening so we saved money!! Some reviews complain about a line but even during the busiest times I had my food and was sitting in less than 10 minutes. Evening reception was great and live entertainment played well. The snacks were mostly pretzels and chex mix. They have free drinks and soda.Staff is very pleasant and always helpful. Definitely meant for families. Tons of kids in the pool which is not ideal for me to swim in but the kids always had someone to play with. The pool also has a soft bottom which does feel odd. It could use an update.About Waikiki:The best beach area we found was in front of Dukes. No rocks and had huge sandbar. Nice waves to body surf but also great for little kids too. It is like a wave pool. We had our 5 year old wear life jacket which have us piece of mind. You can rent rafts, body boards and umbrellas. There are plenty of places on the beach so take a look around for the best price. If your going to eat out anywhere do so early. By 8p it was over an hour wait anywhere we went.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our stay at the Embassy Suites was nothing short of awesome. Check in was smooth and even though it was peak time and they were extremely busy they managed to get us into our room a little earlier which was much appreciated after a long flight. Rooms were clean, spacious and fully serviced every day. Perfect for 2 Adults and 2 teenagers. Bell desk was helpful and friendly, they booked shuttles for us and were extremely helpful. Breakfast was great and the service from the staff was wonderful, particularly Resty and Aldrin. Happy hour was family friendly and great value. Keloa was our favourite staff person. Pool area was clean and there was always deck chairs available. Lifts were super-fast. We checked out lots of other hotels whilst in Hawaii and nothing compared to the Embassy Suites for value for money. Its located central to everything makes it the perfect location. We will be revisiting again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Breakfast was so tasty. Coffee was great. Servers we're so attentive. Make sure you grab the papaya coz that's the best papaya and pineapple you'll ever have! The room was spacious. Beds were confortable

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great value!! Close to the beach. Close to the beachwalk. Very friendly staff. Valet parking that's not too crazy expensive. Decent breakfast every morning with a staff that remembered us each morning among hundreds of guests. Room was comfortable with 5 people (including 3 teenage girls who had to primp before going anywhere). Overall great experience!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our second visit to Honolulu and the Embassy Suites. When we booked the trip one thing we were sold on: go back to Embassy Suites. Room was great - two bedroom suite. Location not quite what we wanted; would have preferred being in the building closer to the beach. But still a great experience. Best breakfast of any Embassy anywhere. Sticky rice for breakfast!! Best happy hour with a great bartender that made the experience even better. My son just turned 21 and he and the bartender laughed and joked each time he returned for a drink. Ocean views, mountain views, and rainbows that pop up anytime to remind you just how lucky you are to be here. No where else I want to stay in Honolulu. Walk or drive to get anywhere you're going and then come back and relax at this jewel. Outstanding in every way.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hubby here on business, me for pleasure. The room was nice and clean. Bed was comfortable. The breakfast buffet was top notch. Plenty of choices for all tastes. Bartenders at the bar were courteous. We would stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family stayed here during summer break for 10 days. Hawaii is busy but it didn't feel too busy at embassy suites. We made use of the free breakfast which was extremely good, lots of variety and continually replenished.we noted that the quiter time for breakfast was 9-10 which was a surprise. I have to say the staff without exception were genuinely interested in making sure your time with them was awesome. They were genuinely lovely people and nothing was a problem for them. The managers drink were extremely popular and a great way to finish the day. The nibbles were appreciated as well. The location was spot on. To catch the pink line shuttle to ala Moana shopping centre you simply cross the road through the trump building, there's a pathway down the side, and walk down to the post office where the punk line bus/shuttle picks you up. It's $2 per person but well worth it. The separate lounge and bedroom was a great combination as we could put out 7 year old to bed then have parent time in the lounge. We'll be back !

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We booked for four nights when there was a special promotion and saved a lot of money. You can't beat the free breakfast you get! I had a custom omelet every morning. The evening happy hour is good too with live entertainment. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. No complaints! Everything is top notch.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our extended family of seven stayed several nights in two suites at the Embassy suites by Hilton. It is perfectly situated a block from the Beach Walk and right in the heart of many restaurants, shops, and excitement. The rooms were nice but by no means extravagant. However, there was a great pool and hot tub that we took advantage of. The pool can get a bit crowded during peak times. The included breakfast was incredible for the price, Fresh omelet station, fresh fruit, breads, and more lunch-like items. There was an abundance of food and choices. While this is not a 5 diamond level resort, it is the PERFECT spot and a very good value for a base of operations in Honolulu.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great hotel in convenient location. Enjoyed the free yoga. Everything was good except our room was next to the lift well which was noisy all night. It was like torture. This is the first time ever I have want to come home from a holiday just because I needed sleep. I would stay here again but only if I was guaranteed a room away from the lift

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is our last day at this hotel and I would fully recommend it. We have stayed at numerous hotels in Waikiki but think we would now come back here.The breakfast buffet provided has many choices and we always managed to get a table, even during very busy time of 9-10am. Staff provide you with a warning for final drinks / food before they start closing. The buffet provides a good start to the day, then at 5.30 we enjoyed the complimentary snacks, drinks and good live music. Never stayed anywhere that provided all that as part of the room rate.We liked the great location. Previously stayed at Ilikai hotel which was good for walking to Ala Moana mall but this hotel much more central to restaurants. We regularly walked though Trump hotel to Saratoga Road to get the $2 Pink line trolley bus to the mall and back. This is very handy.The pool is great for kids and adults, would recommend going in morning as later in day gets very busy, however always seemed to be seats available. Spa nice as well and staff regularly walk round to provide drinks and food. We were on top floor level 21 and enjoyed a wee view of sea/mountain, and handy as we could always get in the lift down! I did a tour to Shangri-La (Doris Dukes museum which I'd recommend as change from sun/sea) and when I asked for taxi they provide the hotel taxi- a stretch limo which was a bit of fun.The staff are very friendly and have just provided a CD of Hawaiian music as a goodbye gift.If I could request one thing it would be a few mugs, plates in the wee kitchen. We usually bring food from the foodlands supermarket a couple of nights which is fantastic (unfortunately they are reloading in Ala Moana so currently closed). Free wifi was good and we felt the suite size was excellent and met our needs with comfortable beds, 2 TVs, and efficient air con. We enjoyed our stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed 7 days and enjoyed a very nice room, with good restaurants overlooking the sea in easy walking distance. Good complimentary hot breakfast each morning, served cafeteria style with the option of a made to order omelet. Very nice staff made us feel at home.
user_name:
Richard F
Portland, Oregon, United States

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My saty at the hotel is summed up in obne word. Paradise. the staff had such a positive attitude and the rooms were clean, neat, and well kept everyday. The location was perfect and there so much to do near Beachwalk Waikiki that I would recomend this hotel for the value.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had the best experience at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk. It was centrally located - the two tours we took both left from within a few blocks of the hotel. It has a handy snack and gift shop located in the hotel. The valet staff are quick and efficient. Our room was beautiful and perfectly cleaned each day. I love the self-check feature on the Hilton App and was able to choose a corner room - 529. It has a lanai on each side of the hotel so we could see the ocean and see the activities going on down on the Beach Walk. The breakfast and evening reception were great and the staff very helpful and friendly. We would highly recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed one night before cruise ship departed the next day. No complaints, nice location. Would definitely book this hotel again. Daily complimentary breakfast and evening reception were definitely a plus!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Free breakfast, free dinks, great staff. Very expensive for some of the smallest rooms in Waikiki. Wonderful location. Very expensive parking. Concierge service was fantastic, security was also very good. Pool and hot tub were over-brominated, gave our kids rashes and dry skin.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Found the facility to be really dull and needing urgent love. Staff did their job but that was it. Reception staff avoid eye contact. Breakfast buffet was rough at best, mass produced with no health or flavour considered. Make sure you eat before going to the pool as the wait staff around the pool like to vanish.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent rooms for a couple and family. Drinks at night were great as was the breakfast. Great location near shops and a short walk down to the main Waikiki beach, but not a noisy area and we were on the second floor. Will definitely stay again.
user_name:
KerriSCS
San Pedro de Atacama, Chile

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel staff very helpful, arrived at 6.30am check in was not until 3pm but they found a room for us enabling us to catch some sleep after an overnight flight.Room clean but in need of updating. Downside was it was right next to lifts which you hear all night going up and down with constant dinging as it reaches floors. We did manage to get use to it after 15 nights.Breakfast very ordinary with omelette stations overly busy, can take up to 20 mins for eggs.Cereals mainly sweet with exception of oats.Kids running around with trays and no idea of surroundings with potential accidents just waiting to happen and eating area like a canteen. Good luck finding a table at times.Expedia reps in lobby very helpful and we booked some great trips.Great location.Pool area and pool bar very good, beds well spaced out so you didnt feel ontop of others.Pool service for drinks and food EXCELLENT with high standard of quality.Big downside to the trip was the excessive queues for bars and restaurants but we were there for 4th july and RIMPAC.Generally great hotel and location if you dont mind crowds

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The staff were friendly and efficient! The breakfast was unbeatable and the evening reception was good (some vegetables, along with the usual chips and salsa). The suite was clean and had everything we needed. The bed was very comfortable. We were close to the beach and shopping. We were able to get a super deal on the price, which helped!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I was looking for a hotel with rooms that would fit a family of 5, and surprisingly didnt find many options in Honolulu, and even fewer in Waikiki where we wanted to stay. The Embassy Suites was one of the only 'hits' that came up, and I am really glad we ended up choosing it.One thing to realize is that food is very expensive in Hawaii, as so much (75%?) is imported from elsewhere. Thus having a complimentary breakfast for 5 daily is worth at least $75 on every room's price. We knew this and were glad we factored that into the decision.We were amazed by the friendliness and outgoing helpfulness of everyone on the staff. The manager at registration (Ray) was great and made us feel very welcome. The breakfast staff was also very friendly - even offering to get us drinks when they were 10 feet away from us. Resty stands out as one of these great staff.We also had a very nice extended conversation with a female manager on staff (Selema?) when we were just relaxing. All in all we found the staff extremely friendly.The location is nice - its a block away from the beach, and above the beachwalk, which is an urban strip-mall and entertainment space. Lots of things going on and tons of restaurant options nearby. Also a great nest of 5 ethnic food trucks that we went to twice.The only staff complaint we have is that it was very difficult to communicate and coordinate with our housekeeper on when she would be able to clean our room. We would leave at 7am or so each day, return around 1pm for our 4-year old to nap, and somehow she wouldnt try to clean our room until 1pm. After the second day, we started making a point of explicitly telling her when we were leaving and expecting to return in the hopes it could be done by then, but it wasn't helping. One day our room wasn't cleaned at all, and another we had to leave at 2pm while she cleaned. This is a relatively minor issue, but it was frustrating (likely just a communication issue - she was very nice).The other small suggestion we had was that there were only 2 hooks in the bathroom to hang towels and clothes for 5 people! This might be something to consider given that its a beach hotel (with a big pool).Overall, we had a great stay and would come back tomorrow if it were possible. Our comments above are just suggestions. Congratulations on a great property and for attracting and retaining such great staff.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here for six nights in a two-bed roomed suite. I felt the Embassy Suites did not represent good value for us. The rooms while clean were small and dated. There were often queues for the lifts. Drinks in the evening consisted of wine sloshed into plastic cups. The location however was good and the staff helpful.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites was better than what I thought it would be. It was my third time visiting Hawaii but my first time staying at the Embassy. I had travelled at the end of June early July. It offers many great qualities including the cocktail happy hour that is free drinks both alcoholic and non-alcoholic for approx 2 hours alongside with some snacks which is particularly great for the kids. It has a large pool, baby pool and spa with shaded and non-shaded lounge chairs near the bar. They have live bands every second night, which is enjoyable and family friendly. The buffet for breakfast was amazing, including a variety of food from range of cereals and juices, to pancakes, eggs and bacon and different pastries alongside fresh fruit and much more. The rooms were great as they were large with a balcony and clean. It has great location for shopping and walking distance to the beach and main street. It is across and near many restaurants, and at night has a lovely view of the city and area lit up. I would recommend this hotel for anyone who stays in Hawaii.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Clean spacious rooms with all the facilities you could need/want whilst on holiday.Walking distance to all the nightlife, restaurants and shops.Great breakfast and fabulous evening reception with free drinks (including cocktails!) and snacks.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Pros:- Our 2 bedroom suite for 5 adults was very comfortable and clean. The pool was great to hang around and the cabanas were free. Bar at the pool was also great. The hotel is in a great location in Lewers Street. 2 years ago we stayed at the Outrigger on the Beach (with an ocean front room) and the location of Embassy Suites was much better.House keeping was very good.Trolly for Ala Moana just around the corner too.Cons:- Although the breakfast is free, it's fairly ordinary/cheap and the queues for the egg omelettes are long.The nightly drinks are just ok.Slight view of the ocean but really didn't care as not in the room that much.We only stayed 3 nights, I think if we stayed more theses things would start to annoy me.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Had not been to Waikiki for 30 years. Lots changed. Loved our stay at the Embassy Suites. Five minute or less walk to the beach. Location is awesome! In the middle of everything. Free breakfast is really good. Stayed in a suite with my husband and our two sons. Plenty of room. Beach bag included with fresh beach towels everyday. Ice machine near room. Great view of Diamond Head and Beach Walk below. I will stay here again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Ocean view suite only has partial view. Only 1 corner room on higher floors have ocean view as advertised. Breakfast is average. Free drinks in the evenings are cheap red & white plonk served in plastic cups! We had 2 sips for all of our 8 nights!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The location is great .. Walk through lobby to Lewers St .. Yard house .. Roy's .. Ruth's Chris .. PF Changs .. Starbucks all right there along w being steps from the beach. To have a room with a seperate living room area is very comfortable and the huge balcony overlooking beach walk avenue offered great nights views of the city. Highly recommend this hotel

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We actually went to Hawaii in May 2015. I'm just submitting this review a little later. Also see me review of Maui Coast Hotel with information of my stay on maui.The room (had a balcony), breakfast and the location was excellent. Our room looked over the main lanai and the pool. The room is clean. We went running every other morning. There were parks nearby to run to. I'm never psyched with a forced valet service ($30/day). But in this area, it's worth it if you rented a car. I couldn't imagine finding parking everyday and worrying about parking rules and meters.It was nice to have breakfast within the hotel. It's a hot breakfast (omlette station, eggs, waffle maker, pancakes, home fries, toast station, bagels) with cold breakfast options (fruit, yogurt, salad). There is an acai berry juice that is soooo good. Breakfast is great to say the least.The hotel is not on the beach but it's a short walk to the beach. Waikiki beach is rocky. It's ideal to get a car rental and drive to the north shore. It's also less hustle and bustle on the Noth shore.The pool was peaceful-not too many people and not too many kids.We went to Pearl Harbor and hiked at Olomana trail. Pearl Harbor is entirely free but you do have to go to the window to get a ticket for the boat ride to the Arizona Memorial. The ticket is free but you need the ticket to reserve a seat. Check the website for peak times and peak seasons where they run out of tickets. When you get on the boat, sit on the right side of the boat brcause you can get a nice photo as you're approaching the memorial. When you get off the boat, linger behind everyone because when everyone gets off, they all rush to the wall of names in the back of the memorial. You can get a nice picture of the wall of names when a boat is arriving to take people back. When you're leaving, sit at the back of the boat because you can get a nice photo of the memorial with the wake of the boat in the foreground. The hike at Olomana was difficult for me (I have short legs). I'm also not an experienced hiker. Just remember you have to decend wherever you ascend. The views were gorgeous and worth the effort.We rented a car and drove all around the island. Once you get away from the main Honolulu area, the views are beautiful. I'm not a big picture taker but everywhere you turn, you just have to take one because it's so breathtaking.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Good location close to everything in Waikiki, very family friendly feel, clean rooms, friendly and helpful staff. Quality of breakfast could be improved with a little care and the pool needs some TLC.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: When: July 7, 2016 Room 1521Postives: Central Waikiki Location, Valet Parking and Roomy 2-Room SuiteNegatives: Breakfast Buffett can get crowded and located in a very incovenient location on the 4th floor level. Elevator ride can get tedious because of guests going to the pool and breakfast. Service staff is cordial, but could use a little more geniune "from the heart" service, rather than just doing their job.This was a quick overnight stay for the wife and I to celebrate an wedding anniversary. We stayed at this property before and knew what to expect. As stated above, we like the central Waikiki location of this property, because of its closeness to shopping, restaurants and the beach.While a good value, the breakfast buffett can be a challenge to get to its 4th floor Grand Lanai location. Besides the location of the breakfast buffett and evening reception, the hotel pool is located on this level as well. So, in the morning hours, you have to contend with the pool guests and the breakfast guests. The Service staff that we came across was adequate, but lacked any geniune "from the heart" service.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were in an ocean view suite 1731. We were pleased with the view but definitely would have like to be on a higher floor to loose the one hotel that partially blocked an expansive view. The breakfast and managers reception are great. More healthy snack options at the evening reception would be nice, but the free drinks are outstanding so we really can't complain! It's steps away from the beach and the kids really enjoy the pool! We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the Waikiki area!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I really appreciate having cooked to order omelets each morning, as well as quality salad and fresh fruit. There are lots of choices at the complimentary breakfast buffet, and it is quality and plenty for the varied interests of each family member.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here with our 18mth old son in June 2014 as it was one of the rare places with a real separate bedroom. Our son slept in a cot in e living area & we slept in the bedroom.. that way when he napped during the day we could still watch TV in the bedroom & not disturb him. It also had a kitchenette. The manager's reception by the pool with free cocktails & pups (snacks) was fantastic. Entertainment was great. Breakfast buffet was good. Great location, handy to beach and shopping.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were there the end of June, 10 people, 3 families, ages 7 to 72. We had three different types of rooms. All were spacious and comfortable. Staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast exceeded all expectations as well as the evening reception. Plenty of room to gather with everyone. Pool was adequate, very short walk to the beach, shopping was right around the corner. We too had a room near the elevator, but was not a great problem. Would stay there again.
user_name:
Carol Ann P
Pinehurst, North Carolina, United States

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I spent 5 days and 4 nights here and loved every moment of it! My whole family was there (over 40 ppl) for my cousin's wedding and the staff at the Embassy Suites couldn't have been more welcoming and accommodating! I definitely look forward to going back and staying here again! Mahalo to everyone at the Embassy Suites!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Very, very friendly staff. The breakfast buffet and complimentary bar/snacks at night were awesome. The property is very close to the beach with numerous activities at different locations on the beach. There are numerous shops right across the street in a large mall. Several restaurants to choose from within walking distance. The room was very clean and the staff made sure our family had everything necessary to make sure we enjoyed the trip.
user_name:
Richard C
Twain Harte, United States

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here for a week in June and had a great time. The hotel itself is good, the pool and gym facilities are adequate and the short walk to the beach is a plus. Our room (2101, One Bedroom Suite One King Bed City View) was a little small but very clean. Whilst I am a light sleeper, the room was right next to the lifts and I found the noise unsettling. Also, we found the air-conditioning to be highly unusual - sounded like there was a storm happening!Pro's:- Excellent staff (all extremely friendly and helpful).- Buffet breakfast included (make your own omelette, basic fruit and hot breakfast, cereal and drip coffee).- Swimming pool is great for little ones (not too deep), though very busy with the many families staying at the hotel.- Rooms are very clean and well stocked.- Gym is adequate (i.e. 3 treadmills, 2 bikes, elliptical, free weights, cable and pulley machine and other small weight machines).- On-site washing/drying machines (look at cons below).- No resort fees.- Good internet coverage.Cons:- Washing machines are only credit card operated. Can be costly as our fee per card transaction was $8.00. - Our room was very noisy (between the lift operation and air conditioning sounds, I had to buy ear plugs).- LOTS of families with young children. This makes the buffet breakfast and pool outings an "adventure".Overall, our experience with the hotel was good. However, with the many accommodation choices in Waikiki, I will be visiting another location (with a quieter room).

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed 5/29/16 to 6/4/16 traveling as a family with 2 teenagers. We were very pleased with the room, updated and clean, the staff was friendly with excellent service. The breakfast was outstanding, fresh fruit, hot food selection, cooked to order eggs or ommlets. They switched it up. The evening reception with free drinks and snacks was also nice. There was live entertainment a few nights. The locations is great, steps to many restaurants and shopping, 1/2 block to the beach. When we go back to Waikiki, we will definitely go back to this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I was there with my daughter in 2012 and nothing had changed. Am I am so pleased about that. My previous stay made me want to go back this time with my husband.This time we booked through the airline and our stay with the Aussie dollar was $500 AU per night actually about the same it was back in 2012. I did not book through the hotel itself as I said but next time as a Hilton Honor member I would see what the price was and check with hotel first.Our Jetstar arrive 6am and we knew very well check in time was 3pm. Because of hitch in another matter I sat in the foyer as I was completely spent till around midday. During that time others were being place in their rooms. In fairness we were given voucher for breakfast and lift to 4th floor only, a very nice move by the manager. I think we arrived in our room around 1pm on 21st floor. We looked over the street below front entrance. Quite and very nice. A few rooms up from lifts.Breakfast for us was I would say, catering for Asian and US patrons. As well travelled Europe travellers we do enjoy the healthier options more that are offered there. But saying that we did not go hungry. There were great self-serving drink stations, juice, water.
